description:
Ontario Trillium Scholarship is an initiative by the Ontario government to help international students pursue a Ph.D. degree at one of the top universities in Ontario. The scholarships is renewable for up to 4 years and is awarded in a 2:3 to 2:1 ratio from government to institutions. A total of 15 types of scaholarships are available in this program for eligible doctoral students. The universities in Ontario select candidates and award scholarships on the basis of program criteria and candidates’ merit supporting their education and academic development in the Canadian province.

All eligible students will be awarded an scholarship worth 40,000 CAD annually while pursuing the doctoral degree. Each university’s unit of graduate studies administers the distribution of these scholarships. Applications are received and evaluated by the universities and students are selected accordingly.

The Application deadlines for the scholarships typically varies from university to university. Most universities begins nominations for scholarships from September.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The eligibility criteria may differ based on scholarship type and the university it is offered with. Suitable candidates are nominated in the winter session for getting admitted to the following fall, spring or winter terms.

To be eligible for receiving OTS, an applicant must:

  • be an international student with a valid Canadian student visa.
  • be proficient in English by the time of application.
  • intend to enroll in a doctoral-level, full-time degree-granting graduate program.
  • Applicants Must Current not Hold other Canadian Scholarships including but not limited to the Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship in Science and Technology (QEII-GSST), UW Provost Graduate Scholarship.
  • Must be willing to enroll in a doctoral program at a university in Ontario.
  • Have achieved a minimum average of 8.0 on 10.0 scale in the full-time master’s degree which is equivalent to 80% in Ontario. 
  • The candidates not have completed a ug or pg degree at any university or college in Ontario immediately after applying for admission to the doctoral program under the OTS. 
  • not be a current student at a post-secondary institution in Ontario at the graduate or undergraduate level.

application_process.description: Each eligible university’s unit of graduate studies oversees the application and selection processes for the Ontario Trillium Scholarship. Every institution has its own application process for the OTS program.Following are the documents required to apply for the Ontario Trillium Scholarship:Appropriately filled application formA copy of all the university transcriptsA valid Canadian study permitA copy of the applicant’s average calculationProof ofstandardized tests like IELTS, SAT,etc.Candidate’s letters of recommendationA list of the applicant’s research contributionsA list of awards and scholarships received by the applicantApplicant’s CVCandidate’s plan of studiesThe OTS letter of support from an authorized supervisorProof of good healthMost universities like theUniversity of Toronto,University of Ottawa,York University, etc. automatically nominate eligible high-performing students who have applied for admission.
application_process.html_content:
Each eligible university’s unit of graduate studies oversees the application and selection processes for the Ontario Trillium Scholarship. Every institution has its own application process for the OTS program.

Following are the documents required to apply for the Ontario Trillium Scholarship:

  • Appropriately filled application form
  • A copy of all the university transcripts
  • A valid Canadian study permit
  • A copy of the applicant’s average calculation
  • Proof of standardized tests like IELTS, SAT, etc.
  • Candidate’s letters of recommendation
  • A list of the applicant’s research contributions
  • A list of awards and scholarships received by the applicant
  • Applicant’s CV
  • Candidate’s plan of studies
  • The OTS letter of support from an authorized supervisor
  • Proof of good health

Most universities like the University of Toronto, University of Ottawa, York University, etc. automatically nominate eligible high-performing students who have applied for admission.

Students are selected on the basis of their merit and program criteria.Terms and ConditionsA candidate can request for an interruption of a Trillium by getting approval for up to a year’s leave. The interruption of a Trillium cannot exceed12 consecutive monthsand can be approved in case of:Maternity or parental leaveImmigration processCompassionate leave (example: bereavement)Medical or family leaveA recipient will have to repay the award received if he/she:Transfers to another institutionCompletes the program prior to the scholarship’s natural endWithdraws from the programCould not maintain acceptable academic standingLoses full-time statusLoses eligibility for the renewal of OTS
selection_process.html_content:
A selection committee, chosen by the Vice-Provost, Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies (OGPS), is charged with evaluation of the files and selection of the recipients of the Ontario Trillium Scholarship. Students are selected on the basis of their merit and program criteria.

Terms and Conditions

A candidate can request for an interruption of a Trillium by getting approval for up to a year’s leave. The interruption of a Trillium cannot exceed 12 consecutive months and can be approved in case of:

  • Maternity or parental leave
  • Immigration process
  • Compassionate leave (example: bereavement)
  • Medical or family leave

A recipient will have to repay the award received if he/she:

  • Transfers to another institution
  • Completes the program prior to the scholarship’s natural end
  • Withdraws from the program
  • Could not maintain acceptable academic standing
  • Loses full-time status
  • Loses eligibility for the renewal of OTS

grant_details.html_content:
The Ontarioa Trillium Scholarships was introduced by the government of Ontario in November 2010 as an initiative to admit highly qualified students to pursue the doctoral degree in the region. Various prestigious universities in Ontario combinw their funds with the ones provided by the government to assist and host meritorious international students for doctoral studies.

International students looking for research opportunities in Canada and wish to pursue a Ph.D. program in any discipline at one of the top universities in Ontario, can apply for the OTS program as long as they meet the set eligibility criteria.

Terms and Conditions

  • In case an OTS recipient gets a permanent residency in Canada after the starting of the first term, he/she will continue to be eligible for the renewal OTS for the remaining three years.
  • Applicants must not hold any additional scholarship/ funding from:
    • Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (SSHRC),
    • Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR)
    • Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC)
    • Vanier Graduate Scholarship
    • Ontario Graduate Scholarship (OGS), etc.
  • Recipients who withdraw, fail to complete the term or transfer to part-time status without consulting with Graduate Studies and Postdoctoral Affairs (GSPA) will have to repay the received funds.

Each Ontario Trillium Scholarship is worth 40,000 CAD annually and is automatically renewed for up to four years, provided the recipients maintain their academic standing and continue to meet the scholarship eligibility criteria. Funding for this program is dependent on the provincial government’s annual confirmation of support.

FAQs

Ques. What is Ontario Trillium Scholarship Program?

Ans. Ontario Trillium Scholarship Program is a funding opportunity provided to international students who want to pursue a research doctoral program in one of the top universities in Ontario.

Ques. Who funds the Ontario Trillium Scholarship?

Ans. The funding for the OTS program is shared by the Ontario government and eligible institutions in Ontario in a ratio of 2:1. 26,666 CAD are contributed by the government and 13,333 CAD by the institution.

Ques. Who can apply for the OTS Program?

Ans. Students who do not hold a Canadian Residency and have a valid study permit to Canada are eligible for an offer. Additionally, applicant must:

  • be proficient in English
  • enroll in a full-time doctoral degree program
  • hold an 8.0/10 or A - average in both the years of full-time study

Ques. What is the closing deadline for the 2023 Ontario Trillium Scholarship?

Ans. The closing deadlines or the application deadline varies with the university or college a student enrolls in. Applicants must visit the university website for the details.

Ques. When will the results for the OTS Program be available?

Ans. Since the application deadlines vary with the university, suitable applicants are nominated in winter for the following fall, spring or winter term.

Ques. What is the award amount under the Ontario Trillium Scholarship?

Ans. An award amount of 40,000 USD is awarded each year to doctoral students.

Ques. Is the Ontario Trillium Scholarship renewable?

Ans. Yes. The OTS award is renewable for up to four years depending on the recipients maintaining their academic standing.

Ques. Who selects the eligible candidates for the Ontario Trillium Scholarship?

Ans. Each eligible university in Ontario selects and awards scholarship candidates based on merit and program criteria.

description:
Tata Scholarship Cornell University is awarded by the Tata Education and Development Trust. The firm majorly focuses to reduce the financial burden of the students who are academically elite and preparing for bright future. An endowment worth of 25 million USD is available for undegraduate students from India through Cornell University Tata Scholarship.

The Cornell University Tata Scholarship program awards approximately 20 scholarships to deserving Indian students. Through this, the trust ensures that academically excellent students from India have access to Cornell University, regardless of their financial conditions. The Tata scholarship amount will be awarded annually for the four-year program. The scholarship amount covers the expense of tuition fees and annual course fees.

Checkout other Cornell University Scholarships for Indian Students

The Tata Cornell Scholarship program is applicable for all the Cornell Undergraduate degree programs. However, preference will be given to students accepted for the following undergraduate degree programs:

Bachelor of Science in Engineering Physics Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering
Bachelors of Science Electrical and Computer Engineering Bachelor of Science in Environmental Engineering
Bachelor of Science in Hotel Administration Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering Bachelor in Economics

For B.Arch students, the university only offers the scholarship for eight semesters. Moreover, scholarship funds are not applicable for dual-degree programs or additional semesters.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be considered for the UG Tata Scholarship at Cornell University, an applicant must fulfill the eligibility criteria given below:Nationality:Must an Indian citizen/resident.Be a pass out from any Indian senior secondary school.Financial Requirement:Must qualify for need-based financial aid.English Language Proficiency:Must submit eitherTOEFLor IELTS score.TOEFL-iBT:100IELTS:7.0Admission Status:Must have an admission offer fromCornell University for any undergraduate degree program.Prospective applicants must note that special preference will be given to students from art, engineering, agriculture, applied economics and management, biological science, life science, and other science students.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be considered for the UG Tata Scholarship at Cornell University, an applicant must fulfill the eligibility criteria given below:

  • Nationality: Must an Indian citizen/resident.
  • Be a pass out from any Indian senior secondary school.
  • Financial Requirement: Must qualify for need-based financial aid.
  • English Language Proficiency: Must submit either TOEFL or IELTS score.
    • TOEFL-iBT: 100
    • IELTS: 7.0
  • Admission Status: Must have an admission offer from Cornell University for any undergraduate degree program.

Prospective applicants must note that special preference will be given to students from art, engineering, agriculture, applied economics and management, biological science, life science, and other science students.

application_process.description: The students are supposed to complete the College Scholarship Service (CSS) profile to fulfill the requirements of the application process. As a part of the application process, students must completetwo application forms before January 2, 2024:Cornell University Tata Scholarship ApplicationNeed-based Financial Aid Form for International StudentsSome important details to be provided at the time of the application are:Self-income and parent’s incomeNoncustodial parent asset and incomeCitizenship documentsPhotocopy of the Passport
application_process.html_content:
The students are supposed to complete the College Scholarship Service (CSS) profile to fulfill the requirements of the application process. As a part of the application process, students must complete two application forms before January 2, 2024:

  • Cornell University Tata Scholarship Application
  • Need-based Financial Aid Form for International Students 

Some important details to be provided at the time of the application are:

  • Self-income and parent’s income
  • Noncustodial parent asset and income
  • Citizenship documents
  • Photocopy of the Passport

selection_process.description: Students need to fill the details in the application form carefully because the Cornell University Tata Scholarships is awarded purely based on the details and the documents that have been submitted during the application process. Some of the aspects that will be looked into for the selection are:Academic qualificationsFamily incomeCitizenshipEnglish Language Proficiency test ScoreThe shortlisted candidate list will be released on the official portal of Cornell University and hence the students after applying are suggested to have a consistent look at the portal for the results and any other important notices. Recipients of the scholarship will be funded for the duration of their Cornell undergraduate program.
selection_process.html_content:
Students need to fill the details in the application form carefully because the Cornell University Tata Scholarships is awarded purely based on the details and the documents that have been submitted during the application process. Some of the aspects that will be looked into for the selection are:

  • Academic qualifications
  • Family income
  • Citizenship
  • English Language Proficiency test Score

The shortlisted candidate list will be released on the official portal of Cornell University and hence the students after applying are suggested to have a consistent look at the portal for the results and any other important notices. Recipients of the scholarship will be funded for the duration of their Cornell undergraduate program.

The partnership between Cornell University and the Tata Trust provides the students with a wide scope to pursue a professional degree program at a globally recognized university. description:
Ontarioa Graduate Scholarships is awarded to graduate level students in Ontario region of Canada. The Ontario Graduate Scholarships is valued at 5,000 CAD per term. All high achieving students pursuing master’s and doctoral degrees in Canada are eligible to receive this scholarship. The OGS scholarships is awarded for 2 academic years of master’s and 3 years of doctoral degree. Universities having 2 terms per year offer a scholarships worth of 10,000 CAD while those with 3 terms per year offer 15,000 CAD annualy. 

Of the total scholarship amount of 15000 CAD per year, the Government of Ontario contributes two-thirds of the award value and the remaining one-third is provided by the university. The Ontario Graduate Scholarship award is non-transferable; it must be held at the institution that awarded it.

As per the guidelines, the applicant must be:A Canadian citizen or permanent resident at the time of the application;An international student studying in an Ontario university with a validCanadian study permit.Note: Students protected under subsection 95(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act(Canada)are also eligible to apply for this scholarship.Academic RequirementsTo be eligible for the Ontario Graduate Scholarship, applicants must fulfill the following academic requirements:Hold anA– Average (Ontario equivalent of 80%)in both the years of full-time study before being awarded the scholarship.International applicants must be proficient in English by the time of application.Applicant must be registered full-time in a graduate degree program, that is,60% or more of a full course load as defined by the university40% or more for students with disabilities.Eligibility Conditions for Ontario Graduate ScholarshipsMaster’s students are eligible to receive the scholarship for a maximum of 2 years. Whereas, doctoral students may receive the scholarship for 4 years.The lifetime maximum restriction for a government-funded scholarship is six years for any student.No single student can avail two government-funded scholarships concurrently. The restricted scholarships are listed below:Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship in Science and Technology (QEII-GSST) (formerly OGSST)Ontario Trillium Scholarships (OTS)Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC)Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC)Canadian Institute of Health Research (CIHR)Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships (Vanier CGS)
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Ontario Graduate Scholarship Program is jointly governed by the Ontario government and the participating Ontario universities. The deadline to apply for the scholarship is established by the Province but varies according to the university.

Citizenship

Both domestic and international students are eligible for the Ontario Graduate Scholarships. As per the guidelines, the applicant must be:

  • A Canadian citizen or permanent resident at the time of the application;
  • An international student studying in an Ontario university with a valid Canadian study permit.

Note: Students protected under subsection 95(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (Canada) are also eligible to apply for this scholarship.

Academic Requirements

To be eligible for the Ontario Graduate Scholarship, applicants must fulfill the following academic requirements:

  • Hold an A– Average (Ontario equivalent of 80%) in both the years of full-time study before being awarded the scholarship.
  • International applicants must be proficient in English by the time of application.
  • Applicant must be registered full-time in a graduate degree program, that is,
    • 60% or more of a full course load as defined by the university
    • 40% or more for students with disabilities.

Eligibility Conditions for Ontario Graduate Scholarships

  • Master’s students are eligible to receive the scholarship for a maximum of 2 years. Whereas, doctoral students may receive the scholarship for 4 years.
  • The lifetime maximum restriction for a government-funded scholarship is six years for any student.
  • No single student can avail two government-funded scholarships concurrently. The restricted scholarships are listed below:
    • Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship in Science and Technology (QEII-GSST) (formerly OGSST)
    • Ontario Trillium Scholarships (OTS)
    • Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC)
    • Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC)
    • Canadian Institute of Health Research (CIHR)
    • Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships (Vanier CGS)

However, while applying for the scholarship, students have to submit the following documents:Ontario Graduate Scholarship 2024 application formConfidential Academic Assessment Reports from two academic referees.Academic transcripts from previously attended post-secondary institutions.Copy of photocopy of the proof Canadian citizenship/ permanent resident status or copies of visa documentation.Plan of study (maximum of 3,950 characters including spaces)Previous awards/publications/research experienceUniversities Offering Ontario Graduate ScholarshipsThe universities offering OGS program are tabulated below:Brock UniversityWilfrid Laurier UniversityYork UniversityTrent UniversityCarleton UniversityUniversity of TorontoWestern UniversityUniversity of Ontario Institute of TechnologyQueen’s UniversityUniversity of WindsorLaurentian UniversityUniversity of WaterlooUniversity of OttawaMcMaster UniversityRyerson UniversityLakehead UniversityUniversity of GuelphNipissing UniversityStart date & payment scheduleAward Start DateRecommended Payment Activation Form Submission Deadline to Department1st Payment2nd Payment3rd Payment3-session Award Period2-session award PeriodSummer (May)Two weeks after SGS offer letterLate July at the earliestSeptemberJanuaryMay 1 to April 30May 1 to Dec 31Fall (September)August 1SeptemberJanuaryMaySept 1 to Aug 31Sept 1 to April 30Winter (January)December 1JanuaryMaySeptemberJan 1 to Dec 31Jan 1 to Aug 31
application_process.html_content:
The OGS program adjudication takes place at the program level, therefore deadlines and specific processes are determined by an individual master-level program at Canadian universities. However, while applying for the scholarship, students have to submit the following documents:

  • Ontario Graduate Scholarship 2024 application form
  • Confidential Academic Assessment Reports from two academic referees.
  • Academic transcripts from previously attended post-secondary institutions.
  • Copy of photocopy of the proof Canadian citizenship/ permanent resident status or copies of visa documentation.
  • Plan of study (maximum of 3,950 characters including spaces)
  • Previous awards/publications/research experience

Universities Offering Ontario Graduate Scholarships

The universities offering OGS program are tabulated below:

Brock University Wilfrid Laurier University York University
Trent University Carleton University University of Toronto
Western University University of Ontario Institute of Technology Queen’s University

Respective program departments and faculties determine the weight placed on each of the following criteria:OGS Selection Criteria for Masters level:CriteriaDescriptionWeightingAcademic ExcellenceTranscripts; Other academic achievements; Type of program; Course load; Duration of course; Prior scholarships and awards30%Research Potential and Statement of InterestStatement of Interest (motivation, creativity, communication skills); Relevance of work experience; Significance and merit of proposed research; Initiative and contribution to research and development30%Personal Characteristics/ Academic Assessment from RefereesWork experience; Leadership experience; Involvement in academic life; Project management20%OGS Selection Criteria forDoctoral level:CriteriaDescriptionWeightingAcademic ExcellenceAcademic records; Scholarships and awards received; Duration of the previous course30%Research PotentialPlan of study; Judgment and originality; Initiative and autonomy; Interaction with supervisors & peers; Ability to lead and complete projects within the allotted time.50%Personal Characteristics/ Academic Assessment from RefereesQuality of presentation; Publications; Professional relevant extracurricular interaction and mentoring20%Conditions for Acceptance and Continuance of OGSAn Ontario Graduate Scholarship recipient must:Not work for more than an average of 10 hours per week per academic session.Ensure their Social Insurance Number (SIN) is recorded in WebAdvisor as the award cannot be processed without a SIN on file. This requirement does not apply to international students.Not accept research assistantships, part-time teaching positions, or other paid employment that affect their status as a full-time graduate student.
selection_process.html_content:
There are three areas of evaluation under which each OGS 2026 application will be evaluated. Respective program departments and faculties determine the weight placed on each of the following criteria:

OGS Selection Criteria for Masters level:

Criteria Description Weighting
Academic Excellence Transcripts; Other academic achievements; Type of program; Course load; Duration of course; Prior scholarships and awards 30%
Research Potential and Statement of Interest Statement of Interest (motivation, creativity, communication skills); Relevance of work experience; Significance and merit of proposed research; Initiative and contribution to research and development 30%
Personal Characteristics/ Academic Assessment from Referees Work experience; Leadership experience; Involvement in academic life; Project management 20%

OGS Selection Criteria for Doctoral level:

Criteria Description Weighting
Academic Excellence Academic records; Scholarships and awards received; Duration of the previous course 30%
Research Potential Plan of study; Judgment and originality; Initiative and autonomy; Interaction with supervisors & peers; Ability to lead and complete projects within the allotted time. 50%
Personal Characteristics/ Academic Assessment from Referees Quality of presentation; Publications; Professional relevant extracurricular interaction and mentoring 20%

Conditions for Acceptance and Continuance of OGS

An Ontario Graduate Scholarship recipient must:

  • Not work for more than an average of 10 hours per week per academic session.
  • Ensure their Social Insurance Number (SIN) is recorded in WebAdvisor as the award cannot be processed without a SIN on file. This requirement does not apply to international students.
  • Not accept research assistantships, part-time teaching positions, or other paid employment that affect their status as a full-time graduate student.

description:
Rotary Foundation offers scholarships worth more than 7.5 million USD annually to develop leaders of the next generation and assist their philanthropic objectives. The Rotary Foundation Global Grants are on such a program.

What’s a Global Grant? Global Grants are offered to professionals and graduates studying abroad in one of Rotary’s six areas of focus, including the promotion of peace, providing sanitation, hygiene and clean water, saving children and mothers, fighting disease, growing local economies and supporting education. Clubs and districts reinforce the global collaborations by working together to cater to the needs of the community.

Rotary Foundation Global Grants can fund:

A global grant project has a minimum budget of 30,000 USD and a maximum World Fund Award of 400,000 USD. These are sometimes also funded with directed gifts and endowed earnings.

Applications are accepted throughout the year and are reviewed as they're received.

eligibility_criteria.description: Requirements for the Rotary Foundation Global Grants are quite straightforward and specific and are based on the applicant’s project.An eligible applicant’s project must:Have a long-term and sustainable impact on the societyAddress an essential area identified by the community.Includes activities that align with the foundations’ beliefsHave a minimum expenditure budget of 30,000 USDIn addition to these, candidates must meet the following academic requirements:Minimum academic qualification and performanceLanguage proficiency (the language of the study country or instruction)Strong public speaking and interpersonal communication skillsHigh ethical standards demonstrated in personal, academic, or professional lives
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Requirements for the Rotary Foundation Global Grants are quite straightforward and specific and are based on the applicant’s project.

An eligible applicant’s project must:

  • Have a long-term and sustainable impact on the society
    • Address an essential area identified by the community.
  • Includes activities that align with the foundations’ beliefs
  • Have a minimum expenditure budget of 30,000 USD

In addition to these, candidates must meet the following academic requirements:

  • Minimum academic qualification and performance
  • Language proficiency (the language of the study country or instruction)
  • Strong public speaking and interpersonal communication skills
  • High ethical standards demonstrated in personal, academic, or professional lives

application_process.description: Along with the application for the Rotary Foundation Scholarship- Global Grants, individual applications by the members of the vocational training team and scholars must also be submitted.Applicants must provide proof of admission in a university’s graduate-level program or a letter of invitation for conducting postgraduate-level research in their applications.Applicants must intend to receive education in a foreign country.Applications regarding travel for vocational training teams, scholars and volunteer travelers must be submitted 90 days before the travel dates.
application_process.html_content:
Along with the application for the Rotary Foundation Scholarship- Global Grants, individual applications by the members of the vocational training team and scholars must also be submitted.

  • Applicants must provide proof of admission in a university’s graduate-level program or a letter of invitation for conducting postgraduate-level research in their applications.
  • Applicants must intend to receive education in a foreign country.

Applications regarding travel for vocational training teams, scholars and volunteer travelers must be submitted 90 days before the travel dates.

selection_process.description: The Rotary Foundation Global Grants have their own panel of the selection committee:.Grant decisions are based on the application forms and the further interview sessions of the shortlisted candidates.Interview can take place in-person or via live video conference, which will be specified by the committee at the start of the process. The date and time are also confirmed then.Rotary Foundation consists of over 35,000 clubs that work together to address the world’s most challenging issues. It has members in almost every country and has headquarters in Evanston, Illinois, USA. It also has associate foundations in Brazil, Australia, Canada, India, Germany, United Kingdom, and Japan.
selection_process.html_content:
The Rotary Foundation Global Grants have their own panel of the selection committee:.

  • Grant decisions are based on the application forms and the further interview sessions of the shortlisted candidates.
  • Interview can take place in-person or via live video conference, which will be specified by the committee at the start of the process. The date and time are also confirmed then.

Rotary Foundation consists of over 35,000 clubs that work together to address the world’s most challenging issues. It has members in almost every country and has headquarters in Evanston, Illinois, USA. It also has associate foundations in Brazil, Australia, Canada, India, Germany, United Kingdom, and Japan.

description:
Australia Awards Scholarship offer students from developing countries to undertake full-time undergraduate or postgraduate study at the participating Australian universities and TAFE institutions. The scholarships are available in the majority of top-ranking universities like Australian National University, Macquarie University, University of Sydney, etc. Administered by the Department of Foreign afffairs and trade, the main motive of Australia Awards Scholarships is to fulfill the developing need of Australia’s partner countries. 

Features of Australia Awards Scholarship:

Subject to requirements and eligibility, the Australia Awards scholarship may also cover: pre-course English language training fees, supplementary academic support, fieldwork, and reunion airfare.

Things to keep in mind:

eligibility_criteria.description: To apply for Australia Awards Scholarship, applicants must fulfill the following eligibility requirements:Citizens and residents of a participating country like India, Bangladesh.Not a permanent resident of Australia or New Zealand.Overs 18 years of age on February 1 of the scholarship’s commencement.Proficiency in the English language, with a recent score of IELTS or TOEFL exam.IELTS: 6.5TOEFL-iBT: 78PTE: 58Satisfying the entry requirements of the chosen Australian university.Fulfilling the Australia visa requirements of the Department of Home Affairs.Candidates mustnothave previously been a recipient of Australia Awards unless they have lived outside Australia for double the time period of staying in Australia.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To apply for Australia Awards Scholarship, applicants must fulfill the following eligibility requirements:

  • Citizens and residents of a participating country like India, Bangladesh.
    • Not a permanent resident of Australia or New Zealand.
  • Overs 18 years of age on February 1 of the scholarship’s commencement.
  • Proficiency in the English language, with a recent score of IELTS or TOEFL exam.
    • IELTS: 6.5
    • TOEFL-iBT: 78
    • PTE: 58
  • Satisfying the entry requirements of the chosen Australian university.
  • Fulfilling the Australia visa requirements of the Department of Home Affairs.

Candidates must not have previously been a recipient of Australia Awards unless they have lived outside Australia for double the time period of staying in Australia.

application_process.description: To apply for the Australian Awards Scholarship, students must complete the following steps:Step 1:Choose home country and award type to check whether you are eligible for the award.Step 2:Once eligibility is established, review the course eligibility criteria.Step 3:Register and complete the online application form for Australian Awards.Documents RequiredCertified copies of following original documents along with their English translations (if required)graduation degree certificateFormal academic transcriptsBirth certificateCitizenship document’s certified copy (such as national identity card or passport).Resume concisely detailing work history, responsibilities and research experience.At least one academic referee report and one other referee report is required.Ph.D. or research-based master’s degree applicants must provide two academic referee reports.Copy of English language test (TOEFL, PTE orIELTS) result.The certificate must be valid till January 1 of the scholarship’s commencement year.For PhD candidates: Evidence (e-mail or letter communication) that a potential supervisor has granted in-principle support for the research topic.
application_process.html_content:
To apply for the Australian Awards Scholarship, students must complete the following steps:

Step 1: Choose home country and award type to check whether you are eligible for the award.
Step 2: Once eligibility is established, review the course eligibility criteria.
Step 3: Register and complete the online application form for Australian Awards.

Documents Required

  • Certified copies of following original documents along with their English translations (if required)
    • graduation degree certificate
    • Formal academic transcripts
    • Birth certificate
  • Citizenship document’s certified copy (such as national identity card or passport).
  • Resume concisely detailing work history, responsibilities and research experience.
  • At least one academic referee report and one other referee report is required.
    • Ph.D. or research-based master’s degree applicants must provide two academic referee reports.
  • Copy of English language test (TOEFL, PTE or IELTS) result.
    • The certificate must be valid till January 1 of the scholarship’s commencement year.
  • For PhD candidates: Evidence (e-mail or letter communication) that a potential supervisor has granted in-principle support for the research topic.

selection_process.description: All applications submitted for the Australia Awards Scholarship are considered on merit where every applicant is given equal opportunities. The scholarship selection process will be administered by Program Areas in various countries or regions. Therefore, the process varies according to the region/country.Factors affecting Australia Awards ScholarshipsAcademic competencepersonal and professional qualitiescapability to influence the home country’s development challengesBased on these factors and many others, each participating country produces a list of shortlisted candidates. The number of students depends on the Australia Awards Scholarships available to the region. Shortlisted students are interviewed and the selection process may include other activities like group participation sessions to measure the suitability of applicants.After that, each participating country produces a list of candidates, with their first preference course and institution. Placement requests are reviewed by theAustralian universitiesand based on the merit, they process a placement offer to applicants fulfilling the admission eligibility criteria. This includes obtaining anAustralian student visaas well.Australia Awards Scholarship decisions are announced/informed byAugust 1.
selection_process.html_content:
All applications submitted for the Australia Awards Scholarship are considered on merit where every applicant is given equal opportunities. The scholarship selection process will be administered by Program Areas in various countries or regions. Therefore, the process varies according to the region/country.

Factors affecting Australia Awards Scholarships

  • Academic competence
  • personal and professional qualities
  • capability to influence the home country’s development challenges

Based on these factors and many others, each participating country produces a list of shortlisted candidates. The number of students depends on the Australia Awards Scholarships available to the region. Shortlisted students are interviewed and the selection process may include other activities like group participation sessions to measure the suitability of applicants.

After that, each participating country produces a list of candidates, with their first preference course and institution. Placement requests are reviewed by the Australian universities and based on the merit, they process a placement offer to applicants fulfilling the admission eligibility criteria. This includes obtaining an Australian student visa as well.

Australia Awards Scholarship decisions are announced/informed by August 1.

grant_details.description: Australia Awards scholarship recipients will be required to sign a contract with theCommonwealth of Australiaagreeing to comply with the scholarship’s conditions. By signing the contract, the applicant will be agreeing to the following conditions:Scholars will have to leave Australia forat least two yearsafter completing the term of their scholarship.Failing to do so, will result in the repayment of the scholarship’s total accrued cost.Recipients will have to start the formal study in the year for which it is awarded unless the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) has agreed to delay the beginning of the scholarship until it is satisfied that the recipient is ready to start.Awardees will have to take part in the pre-departure briefing organized by the Program Area and attend the compulsory Introductory Academic Program arranged by the institution when they reach Australia.Scholars must undertake only the course for which the scholarship is awarded, adhere to the institution’s rules, sit examinations, submit all the required assessment items for the course and finish their course by the end date of the scholarship.Awardees must follow Australian laws and act in a way that will not harm the reputation of DFAT.Overall, the Australia Awards Scholarship is an excellent opportunity for students belonging to countries like India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, etc. They get tostudy in Australiaat a minimal cost.For any further queries, students and awardees are advised to contact the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade.
grant_details.html_content:
Australia Awards scholarship recipients will be required to sign a contract with the Commonwealth of Australia agreeing to comply with the scholarship’s conditions. By signing the contract, the applicant will be agreeing to the following conditions:

  • Scholars will have to leave Australia for at least two years after completing the term of their scholarship.
    • Failing to do so, will result in the repayment of the scholarship’s total accrued cost.
  • Recipients will have to start the formal study in the year for which it is awarded unless the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) has agreed to delay the beginning of the scholarship until it is satisfied that the recipient is ready to start.
  • Awardees will have to take part in the pre-departure briefing organized by the Program Area and attend the compulsory Introductory Academic Program arranged by the institution when they reach Australia.
  • Scholars must undertake only the course for which the scholarship is awarded, adhere to the institution’s rules, sit examinations, submit all the required assessment items for the course and finish their course by the end date of the scholarship.
  • Awardees must follow Australian laws and act in a way that will not harm the reputation of DFAT.

Overall, the Australia Awards Scholarship is an excellent opportunity for students belonging to countries like India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, etc. They get to study in Australia at a minimal cost.

For any further queries, students and awardees are advised to contact the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade.

description:
Stanford Reliance Dhirubhai Fellowship Program is an initiative by Reliance Industries Limited to provide financial support to Indian students who wish to pursue an MBA degree at Stanford Business School. The program chooses up to 50 candidates, among which only five are selected for the Dhirubhai Fellowship. The program pays the fees of the four semesters of the MBA degree program. However, students must commit to return and work at least 2 years in India after completion of the program.

Type of Funding Private
Scholarship Type Merit-based
Renewable Yes
Application Deadline May 1, 2026 
Establishment Year 2008
Eligible Candidates Bachelor's degree(equivalent to a US bachelor's degree in any field)
Scholarship Amount 150,000 USD
Participating countries The United States of America

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for this fellowship program, candidates must meet the admission requirements of the Stanford MBA program.Bachelor’s degree(in any field that is equivalent to a U.S. bachelor’s degree)SubmitGRE/ GMAT and IELTS/ PTE/ TOEFLscores. The minimum score requirements for the same are:TOEFL-iBT: 100IELTS: 7.0PTE: 68Submit letters of recommendation and statement of purposeOptional questions (200 words)Work experience (optional)ResumeApart from the above requirements, the students will also be evaluated based on the leadership role they have taken, and professional work experience. The student must demonstrate how they will contribute to the learning community of Stanford both on campus and off campus.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for this fellowship program, candidates must meet the admission requirements of the Stanford MBA program.

  • Bachelor’s degree(in any field that is equivalent to a U.S. bachelor’s degree)
  • Submit GRE/ GMAT and IELTS/ PTE/ TOEFL scores. The minimum score requirements for the same are:
    • TOEFL-iBT: 100
    • IELTS: 7.0
    • PTE: 68
  • Submit letters of recommendation and statement of purpose
  • Optional questions (200 words)
  • Work experience (optional)
  • Resume

Apart from the above requirements, the students will also be evaluated based on the leadership role they have taken, and professional work experience. The student must demonstrate how they will contribute to the learning community of Stanford both on campus and off campus.

application_process.description: To be considered for the Stanford Reliance Dhirubhai Fellowship Program, applicants are required to complete the scholarship form along with the Stanford MBA application form. Following documents will be required from students seeking fellowship for pursuing Stanford MBA:Mark sheets showing educational performance in class 10th, 12th, and graduationEssay of 250-Words (on a given topic)Resume or Curriculum Vitae(CV) [Should be of one-page]Awards, Certificates, and Recognition (both academic and social)Employment history (years of experience, name of the organization, and type of work)GMAT/ GRE Official ScoresFinancial and tax-related documentsFamily income (annual)Official transcriptsLetter of recommendation: Applicants are supposed to submit two LORs highlighting their professional careers.Note:This fellowshippre-applicationform does not require any fees.
application_process.html_content:
To be considered for the Stanford Reliance Dhirubhai Fellowship Program, applicants are required to complete the scholarship form along with the Stanford MBA application form. Following documents will be required from students seeking fellowship for pursuing Stanford MBA:

  • Mark sheets showing educational performance in class 10th, 12th, and graduation
  • Essay of 250-Words (on a given topic)
  • Resume or Curriculum Vitae(CV) [Should be of one-page]
  • Awards, Certificates, and Recognition (both academic and social)
  • Employment history (years of experience, name of the organization, and type of work)
  • GMAT/ GRE Official Scores
  • Financial and tax-related documents
  • Family income (annual)
  • Official transcripts
  • Letter of recommendation: Applicants are supposed to submit two LORs highlighting their professional careers.

Note: This fellowship pre-application form does not require any fees.

selection_process.description: A total of 50 candidates are shortlisted during the evaluation process for the fellowship program. The candidates are selected based on their academic standings, financial need and overall application profile. However the acceptance rate for scholarships is only 5.4% which makes it highly competitive to earn. Among the 50 shortlisted candidates, only 3 are selected for fellowship based on their leadership qualities, skills, work experience (if any), financial requirements and overall profile.The Standard Reliance Dhirubhai Fellowship program only considers those candidates who demonstrate strong academic standings and completed their senior secondary education in India.
selection_process.html_content:
A total of 50 candidates are shortlisted during the evaluation process for the fellowship program. The candidates are selected based on their academic standings, financial need and overall application profile. However the acceptance rate for scholarships is only 5.4% which makes it highly competitive to earn. Among the 50 shortlisted candidates, only 3 are selected for fellowship based on their leadership qualities, skills, work experience (if any), financial requirements and overall profile.

The Standard Reliance Dhirubhai Fellowship program only considers those candidates who demonstrate strong academic standings and completed their senior secondary education in India.

grant_details.description: This attempt by Reliance to support talented students financially by providing scholarships to study at Stanford Graduate School of Business is known to be a great initiative. The scholarship amount offered to Indian students tostudy in the USAis 150,000 USD. The amount covers over 80% of the cost of attendance at Stanford Graduate Business School that includes tuition fees, course fee (Annually), living expenses, medical expenses, and other miscellaneous fees related to the UniversityAs per the fellowship guidelines, the recipients must return to India after their course is completed. Moreover, they must work for two years in an organization in India. It is not necessary to work for Reliance Industries Limited. Students failing to do so will be asked to return the fellowship fees to the organization.
grant_details.html_content:
This attempt by Reliance to support talented students financially by providing scholarships to study at Stanford Graduate School of Business is known to be a great initiative. The scholarship amount offered to Indian students to study in the USA is 150,000 USD. The amount covers over 80% of the cost of attendance at Stanford Graduate Business School that includes tuition fees, course fee (Annually), living expenses, medical expenses, and other miscellaneous fees related to the University

As per the fellowship guidelines, the recipients must return to India after their course is completed. Moreover, they must work for two years in an organization in India. It is not necessary to work for Reliance Industries Limited. Students failing to do so will be asked to return the fellowship fees to the organization.

description:
Initiated in 1961, Hornby Scholarships are awarded to experienced English language professional including teachers, teacher-trainers, inspectors, and material writers who are not from the UK. The scholarship, offered by the University of Warwick, give such professionals a chance to study a one-year Masters in TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages)

It is a full-scholarship program and is provided every year to the international English Language teachers who have a graduate degree and work experience as a trainee or teacher. Since its establishment, the trust has provided over 500 English Teaching scholarships.

eligibility_criteria.description: Applicants for Hornby Scholarships must fulfill the following eligibility criteria:Have three-year full-time English Language teaching experience and a UG degreeUG degree should be equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in the United Kingdom.Have a minimum of5 yearsof experience as an English language teacher or trainer.Must be involved in some developmental work as a trainer or manager.Must be a citizen of the country from which they apply.Score well in theIELTS, TOEFL, orPTEexaminations.Minimum of6.5 GPAis required for the English language examinations.Must have supervised in the course of the English language.Note:The candidates who have applied for the English Language course in the United Kingdom for a master's degree program or diploma program are eligible to obtain financial support.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Applicants for Hornby Scholarships must fulfill the following eligibility criteria:

  • Have three-year full-time English Language teaching experience and a UG degree
    • UG degree should be equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in the United Kingdom.
  • Have a minimum of 5 years of experience as an English language teacher or trainer.
  • Must be involved in some developmental work as a trainer or manager.
  • Must be a citizen of the country from which they apply.
  • Score well in the IELTS, TOEFL, or PTE examinations.
  • Minimum of 6.5 GPA is required for the English language examinations.
  • Must have supervised in the course of the English language.

Note: The candidates who have applied for the English Language course in the United Kingdom for a master's degree program or diploma program are eligible to obtain financial support.

application_process.description: Applicants are required to submit the personal, academic, professional, referees details along with a supporting statement. The details required are mentioned below:Personal details:Full nameE-mail addressDate of birthGenderNationalityResidential addressContact informationAcademic details:Name of the institutionUndergraduate degree and specialization course10+12 mark sheetCertificatesAwardsInformation about the courses which were related to English mediumProfessional details:Name of organizationPosition in the companyType of workDates when the applicant was employedJoining dateResignation letterReferees:Details of at least two referees who can give the candidate’s reference, if shortlisted for the interviewReferee’s nameProfessional informationEmail addressReferee’s professional relation to the candidateSupport statement:The candidate is supposed to justify why he or she is applying for the Hornby Scholarship in about 1,500 words. In addition, the applicant has to answer several questions like:Describe the current English teaching duties and the training that one has delivered?Is the applicant a teacher or trainee?Why does the applicant wish to study for amaster's degree at the University of Warwick?What professional skills and experience would the applicant bring to the studies?If the applicant is awarded the Hornby scholarship, in what way does it benefit him/her?How would the applicant share their learning and knowledge with English language teachers after returning to their home country from the United Kingdom?
application_process.html_content:
Applicants are required to submit the personal, academic, professional, referees details along with a supporting statement. The details required are mentioned below:

Personal details:

  • Full name
  • E-mail address
  • Date of birth
  • Gender
  • Nationality
  • Residential address
  • Contact information

Academic details:

  • Name of the institution
  • Undergraduate degree and specialization course
  • 10+12 mark sheet
  • Certificates
  • Awards
  • Information about the courses which were related to English medium

Professional details:

  • Name of organization
  • Position in the company
  • Type of work
  • Dates when the applicant was employed
  • Joining date
  • Resignation letter

Referees:

  • Details of at least two referees who can give the candidate’s reference, if shortlisted for the interview
  • Referee’s name
  • Professional information
  • Email address
  • Referee’s professional relation to the candidate

Support statement:

The candidate is supposed to justify why he or she is applying for the Hornby Scholarship in about 1,500 words. In addition, the applicant has to answer several questions like:

  • Describe the current English teaching duties and the training that one has delivered?
  • Is the applicant a teacher or trainee?
  • Why does the applicant wish to study for a master's degree at the University of Warwick?
  • What professional skills and experience would the applicant bring to the studies?
  • If the applicant is awarded the Hornby scholarship, in what way does it benefit him/her?
  • How would the applicant share their learning and knowledge with English language teachers after returning to their home country from the United Kingdom?

selection_process.description: The scholarship features a four-stage selection process listed below:Online application form –The candidates submit the online application form for an initial assessment.Interview –The applicants who clear stage 1 are called for an interview round at the office of the British Council in their country of origin.Application to the University –If the applicant is selected in the interview, he or she will be invited to apply to the university for further consideration.University acceptance –The scholarship award is confirmed for the candidate and arrangements are made for him or her to arrive in the United Kingdom to join the classes.This is a significant process that needs to be completed after the submission of the application form.
selection_process.html_content:
The scholarship features a four-stage selection process listed below:

  • Online application form – The candidates submit the online application form for an initial assessment.
  • Interview – The applicants who clear stage 1 are called for an interview round at the office of the British Council in their country of origin.
  • Application to the University – If the applicant is selected in the interview, he or she will be invited to apply to the university for further consideration.
  • University acceptance – The scholarship award is confirmed for the candidate and arrangements are made for him or her to arrive in the United Kingdom to join the classes.

This is a significant process that needs to be completed after the submission of the application form.

description:
Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Fellowship can be availed by meritorious Indian students studying in universities in the UK, the US and in other European countries. The program provides grants, awards, and scholarships to students doing full-time Masters, M.Phil or Doctoral degree courses.

Note: The foundation has joint-partnership with Imperial College London, Royal College of Arts, the University of Cambridge, and Sciences Po.

eligibility_criteria.description: The candidate must be an Indian citizen, residingin India for at least six monthsat the time of application. In addition to this, all suitable candidates for Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarships must fulfill the following requirements:No candidate should be over the age of 30 yearsMust be an Indian passport holderMust not hold a postgraduate degree from abroadCandidates who are currently studying a postgraduate degree abroad are not eligible for this fellowshipEvidence of admission is mandatory before applying for fellowshipHold a first-class undergraduate degree from arecognized university in IndiaInternational university graduates must have stayed in India for two years before applying.Have fulfilled all the admission requirements of the chosen coursework.For Social Sciences, Humanities, Law, Fine Arts, Architecture and related subjects, applicants must have a minimum academic grade of 65%, CGPA 6.8/10, or GPA 2.6/4 from a recognized university/institution.For Mathematics, Sciences, Environment and related subjects, applicants must have a minimum academic grade of 70%, CGPA 7.2/10, or GPA 3/4 from a recognised university/institution.Also, the applicant must NOT hold a master’s degree from an international university. The applicant must also not have already begun a postgraduate degree course abroad at the time of application.Fellowship Specific Eligibility RequirementsEach fellowship has some specific eligibility criteria. The following section discusses the criteria of all the fellowships individually:Inlaks Fine Arts AwardsCompleted graduation or post-graduation from any esteemed Indian institution.Final year visual arts students are also eligible.If you don’t have a formal degree in visual arts, you must have prior experience in hosting art exhibitions.Inlaks Fellowship for Indian Classical MusicMust have some formal training in Indian classical music.Inlaks Theatre AwardsThe candidate must be below the age of 35.Completed graduate or postgraduate degree from any recognized Indian University.Candidates who do not have a formal degree will be considered based on their notable past achievements.Inlaks Research Travel GrantThe candidate must be below the age of 35.Must have either a first-class in Masters degree or a first-class in bachelors (honors) degree.Those who have attained a first-class in both graduation and postgraduation will be given preference.Must have a confirmed Ph.D. program registration in Humanities and Social Science at any recognized Indian institute for a minimum period of two years but not exceeding four years.Apart from the above-mentioned scholarships, the Foundations also gives internships, fellowships, grants, and awards under Inlaks Ravi Sankaran Programme, AAA Artist Grant, Film, and Television Awards, Sports Awards, etc.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The candidate must be an Indian citizen, residing in India for at least six months at the time of application. In addition to this, all suitable candidates for Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarships must fulfill the following requirements:

  • No candidate should be over the age of 30 years
  • Must be an Indian passport holder
  • Must not hold a postgraduate degree from abroad
  • Candidates who are currently studying a postgraduate degree abroad are not eligible for this fellowship
  • Evidence of admission is mandatory before applying for fellowship 
  • Hold a first-class undergraduate degree from a recognized university in India
    • International university graduates must have stayed in India for two years before applying.
  • Have fulfilled all the admission requirements of the chosen coursework.
  • For Social Sciences, Humanities, Law, Fine Arts, Architecture and related subjects, applicants must have a minimum academic grade of 65%, CGPA 6.8/10, or GPA 2.6/4 from a recognized university/institution.

  • For Mathematics, Sciences, Environment and related subjects, applicants must have a minimum academic grade of 70%, CGPA 7.2/10, or GPA 3/4 from a recognised university/institution.

Also, the applicant must NOT hold a master’s degree from an international university. The applicant must also not have already begun a postgraduate degree course abroad at the time of application.

Fellowship Specific Eligibility Requirements

Each fellowship has some specific eligibility criteria. The following section discusses the criteria of all the fellowships individually:

Inlaks Fine Arts Awards

  • Completed graduation or post-graduation from any esteemed Indian institution.
    • Final year visual arts students are also eligible.
  • If you don’t have a formal degree in visual arts, you must have prior experience in hosting art exhibitions.

Inlaks Fellowship for Indian Classical Music

  • Must have some formal training in Indian classical music.

Inlaks Theatre Awards

  • The candidate must be below the age of 35.
  • Completed graduate or postgraduate degree from any recognized Indian University.
    • Candidates who do not have a formal degree will be considered based on their notable past achievements.

Inlaks Research Travel Grant

  • The candidate must be below the age of 35.
  • Must have either a first-class in Masters degree or a first-class in bachelors (honors) degree.
    • Those who have attained a first-class in both graduation and postgraduation will be given preference.
  • Must have a confirmed Ph.D. program registration in Humanities and Social Science at any recognized Indian institute for a minimum period of two years but not exceeding four years.

Apart from the above-mentioned scholarships, the Foundations also gives internships, fellowships, grants, and awards under Inlaks Ravi Sankaran Programme, AAA Artist Grant, Film, and Television Awards, Sports Awards, etc.

application_process.description: Things to keep to keep in mind while applying for scholarship:Submit the online application for scholarshipMust hold a valid Indian passportOnly one submission per candidateThe applications that do not meet the minimum admission and financial requirement will not be considered for scholarship.It is mandatory to submit at least 2 letters of recommendation with one from the academic counselor or teacher.Documents Required for ApplicationThe following documents must be submitted along with the application form:Evidence of admission to a course or a universityFinancial requirements of the institute, written in detailPhotocopy of the first and last pages of passportAt least onereference letter- this can also be emailed directly to the institute atapplications@inlaksfoundation.org.The subject line of the email should be as follows: Reference Letter | Name of Applicant | Email Address of Applicant.Candidates applying in the field of architecture, fine and applied arts, film, dance, acting, and music, must upload their portfolio as a PDF file or share an online link.Candidates are to verify all the information before submitting the application. In case an error persists, candidates must email the same with a screenshot atapplications@inlaksfoundation.org.
application_process.html_content:
Things to keep to keep in mind while applying for scholarship:

  • Submit the online application for scholarship
  • Must hold a valid Indian passport
  • Only one submission per candidate 
  • The applications that do not meet the minimum admission and financial requirement will not be considered for scholarship.
  • It is mandatory to submit at least 2 letters of recommendation with one from the academic counselor or teacher. 

Documents Required for Application

The following documents must be submitted along with the application form:

  • Evidence of admission to a course or a university
  • Financial requirements of the institute, written in detail
  • Photocopy of the first and last pages of passport
  • At least one reference letter - this can also be emailed directly to the institute at applications@inlaksfoundation.org.
    • The subject line of the email should be as follows: Reference Letter | Name of Applicant | Email Address of Applicant.
  • Candidates applying in the field of architecture, fine and applied arts, film, dance, acting, and music, must upload their portfolio as a PDF file or share an online link.

Candidates are to verify all the information before submitting the application. In case an error persists, candidates must email the same with a screenshot at applications@inlaksfoundation.org.

selection_process.description: The selection of Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarship awardees is carried out by an independent Inlaks Selection Committee of the Foundation, who analyzes and evaluates all the applications, and calls promising candidates for the interviews. Applicants are not only evaluated based on their past and present performances but also on their potential as demonstrated in the application. The applicants applying to arts and design courses will be evaluated on the basis of their portfolios.The Foundation conducts scholarship interviews either in Delhi or Mumbai in May or June.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarship awardees is carried out by an independent Inlaks Selection Committee of the Foundation, who analyzes and evaluates all the applications, and calls promising candidates for the interviews. Applicants are not only evaluated based on their past and present performances but also on their potential as demonstrated in the application. The applicants applying to arts and design courses will be evaluated on the basis of their portfolios.

The Foundation conducts scholarship interviews either in Delhi or Mumbai in May or June.

grant_details.description: The Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarships offer endowment grants to young Indians in various specializations. grant_details.html_content:
The Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarships offer endowment grants to young Indians in various specializations. It allows recipients to develop and grow their scientific, artistic, cultural, and professional abilities, and showcase them both in India and abroad.

Over the years, approximately 600 scholars have received awards, and over 460 others have benefitted from the scholarships.

Scholarships: Eligibility and Benefits

Name of Scholarship Benefits Eligible Courses Award Duration
Inlaks Fine Art Award Full waiver of tuition fee, Adequate living expenses, One-way travel expense Master’s Degree, Master’s Diploma, Master’s Certificate in Fine Arts One year
Inlaks Fellowships for Indian Classical Music Full waiver of tuition fee, Adequate living expenses, One-way travel expense Master’s Degree, Master’s Diploma, Master’s Certificate in Indian Classical Music One year
Inlaks Theatre Award Full waiver of tuition fee, Adequate living expenses, One-way travel expense Master’s Degree, Master’s Diploma, Master’s Certificate in Theater Arts One year
Inlaks Research Travel Grant Reasonable maintenance expenses, Air-fare at a modest rate, Funds for buying material and books, and making copies of relevant literature. Humanities and Social Sciences Three months

Inlaks Shivdasani Foundations Terms & Conditions

  • Scholarships are not provided in the following subjects:
    1. Engineering
    2. Computer science
    3. Business studies
    4. Medicine. Dentistry, and related therapies
    5. Public health
    6. Fashion design
    7. Music
    8. Film and film animation
  • In the case of Imperial College London, scholarships will be given for Engineering and Natural Sciences. Indian Studies as a subject is considered, only if it has contemporary relevance. In the field of Music, only applications for degrees in Western Classical singing will be considered. For Film, only applications for Documentary Filmmaking will be considered.
  • If the total required funding (tuition fees + living expenses) exceeds 100,000 USD candidates must show evidence that they can cover the additional amount. The proof must be provided at the time of making the online application and must be shown at the time of the preliminary interviews.
  • Foundation does NOT restrict the candidate from accepting any other awards, assistantships, part-time job opportunities.
  • Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarships will not be provided to candidates whose course of study requires field trips back to India during their study tenure.
  • If the candidates have applied for another course, which is different from the one they want funding from Inlaks for, irrespective of the institution, they should inform the Inlaks Foundation about the same.

For the upcoming academic session, the Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation Scholarships applications are yet to open.

description:
Australian Government Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships are intended to support domestic and international students undertaking research master’s degrees and research doctorate degrees. It is valid for 42 prominent Australian universities and covers international tuition fees and a stipend.

No restrictions on applying for the Australian Government Research Training Program at more than one university and more than once at the same university.

eligibility_criteria.description: Following are the principal eligibility criteria for receiving financial assistance under an Australian Government Research Training Program:Student Type:International or a domestic student enrolled at an Australian university in an accredited HDR course.Applicants must satisfy the university’s academic requirements for the respective Masters and Doctorate program.Exam Requirements:International students must submit proof of English language proficiency (ELP).Test NameMinimum Score RequirementTOEFL79IELTS6.5PTE62
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Following are the principal eligibility criteria for receiving financial assistance under an Australian Government Research Training Program:

  • Student Type: International or a domestic student enrolled at an Australian university in an accredited HDR course.
  • Applicants must satisfy the university’s academic requirements for the respective Masters and Doctorate program.
  • Exam Requirements: International students must submit proof of English language proficiency (ELP).
Test Name Minimum Score Requirement
TOEFL 79
IELTS 6.5
PTE 62
