application_process.html_content:
Respective participating Australian universities are responsible for the Australian Government Research Training Program application process.

Australian Government Research Training Program Application

  • Applications for a new RTP tuition fee waiver, stipend, and allowance are to be made directly to the university.
    • In some universities, applicants just have to checkmark the ‘financial aid’ box in the admission application.
  • Applicants need to get in touch with the scholarship office or the postgraduate research office at the university for guidelines regarding the RTP application procedure.

Application Submission Deadline 

Since the participating universities manage the application process for the scholarships, the application deadline also varies from university to university.

Research Period 1 and 2, 2026

12 September 2025

21 November 2025

02 December 2025

Research Period 3 and 4, 2026

19 December 2025

February 2026 (Estimate)

March 2026 (Estimate)

Student Supporting Documentation

  • Summary of the intended research project, approximately 500 words.
  • List of published works with URL links and/or copy of each publication.
  • Copy of the thesis abstract.
  • Email evidence of the supervisor’s agreement to supervise.

Other supporting documents are mentioned in the following table:

Document Type Required (Yes or No)
Transcripts Yes
LOR Yes
SOP No
ELP score Yes
Resume No
Research Proposal Yes

selection_process.description: Like the application process, participating universities are in-charge of the selection process. Shortlisting and selection of recipients are quite competitive.Few common factors affecting the Australian Government Research Training Program Scholarship selection are:Previous courseworkAcademic meritWork experienceResearch publicationsReferee’s reportResearch experienceAustralian Government Research Training Program Support PeriodAustralian Government Research Training Program support duration varies from course-to-course. The details of the same are mentioned in the table below:Program CategoryScholarship SupportFull-time Research Doctorate Course3 years (can be extended up to 4 years)Part-time Research Doctorate Course6 years (can be extended up to 4 years)Full-time Master’s Course2 yearsPart-time Master’s Course4 years (maximum)*the extension of scholarship support is dependent on HEP’s discretion.**For a certain duration of leaves approved by the HEP, the recipient’s scholarship period increases.Termination of Australian Government Research Training Program ScholarshipThe institutions will have to terminate the Australian Government Research and Training program (AGRTP) scholarship of a recipient under the following conditions:Failing to fulfill the ongoing eligibilityOn the course’s completionIf the recipient has not adhered to an RTP Scholarship’s requirement
selection_process.html_content:
Like the application process, participating universities are in-charge of the selection process. Shortlisting and selection of recipients are quite competitive.

Few common factors affecting the Australian Government Research Training Program Scholarship selection are:

  • Previous coursework
  • Academic merit 
  • Work experience
  • Research publications
  • Referee’s report
  • Research experience

Australian Government Research Training Program Support Period

Australian Government Research Training Program support duration varies from course-to-course. The details of the same are mentioned in the table below:

Program Category Scholarship Support
Full-time Research Doctorate Course 3 years (can be extended up to 4 years)
Part-time Research Doctorate Course 6 years (can be extended up to 4 years)
Full-time Master’s Course 2 years
Part-time Master’s Course 4 years (maximum)

*the extension of scholarship support is dependent on HEP’s discretion.

**For a certain duration of leaves approved by the HEP, the recipient’s scholarship period increases.

Termination of Australian Government Research Training Program Scholarship

The institutions will have to terminate the Australian Government Research and Training program (AGRTP) scholarship of a recipient under the following conditions:

  • Failing to fulfill the ongoing eligibility
  • On the course’s completion
  • If the recipient has not adhered to an RTP Scholarship’s requirement

grant_details.description: FromJanuary 1, 2017, the Australian Government Research Training Program (AGRTP) replaced International Postgraduate Research Scholarships, Australian Postgraduate Awards, and the Research Training Scheme.Every year, qualified domestic and international students beginning research masters and doctorate programs at Australian universities are offered financial support under the Australian RTP scheme.In addition to the RTP scholarship stipend, recipients are free to any additional scholarship. However, the overall financial aid benefit should not be greater than 75% of their annual RTP stipend rate.A summary of the Australian Government Research Training Programsupport and benefitsare tabulated below:Type of Support/BenefitRTP Fee OffsetRTP StipendStudent TypeDomesticInternationalDomesticInternationalStipend--YesYesTuition Fee OffsetYesYes--Student Health Cover---YesRelocation Allowance--YesYesDependent Child Allowance---YesThesis Allowance--YesYesAdditional InformationStudents may appeal a decision made by the university with regards to the offer of a scholarship, allowances, suspension of scholarship, an extension of scholarship, or termination of scholarship.
grant_details.html_content:
From January 1, 2017, the Australian Government Research Training Program (AGRTP) replaced International Postgraduate Research Scholarships, Australian Postgraduate Awards, and the Research Training Scheme.

Every year, qualified domestic and international students beginning research masters and doctorate programs at Australian universities are offered financial support under the Australian RTP scheme.

In addition to the RTP scholarship stipend, recipients are free to any additional scholarship. However, the overall financial aid benefit should not be greater than 75% of their annual RTP stipend rate.

A summary of the Australian Government Research Training Program support and benefits are tabulated below:

Type of Support/Benefit RTP Fee Offset RTP Stipend
Student Type Domestic International Domestic International
Stipend - - Yes  Yes
Tuition Fee Offset Yes Yes - -
Student Health Cover - - - Yes
Relocation Allowance - - Yes Yes
Dependent Child Allowance - - - Yes
Thesis Allowance - - Yes Yes

Additional Information

Students may appeal a decision made by the university with regards to the offer of a scholarship, allowances, suspension of scholarship, an extension of scholarship, or termination of scholarship.

description:
The Deutschlandstipendium provides financial and non-material support to high-achieving and committed students from all over the world Deutschland Stipendium (German Scholarship) program provides financial and non-material support to talented and high performing students from across the length and breadth of the globe. In last 2 years, over 28,000 students from 130+ nationalities, studying in Germany, have been awarded under Deutschland Stipendium.

Scholarships are offered based on a student’s outstanding academic record, civic engagement, social commitment and personal achievements, such as a student overcoming challenges or obstacles in his or her social or family background.Approximately 31,500 students were awarded a Deutschlandstipendium in 2023.

The next application phase is expected to start in summer 2026. Exact dates will be announced on our website starting in spring 2026.

eligibility_criteria.description: Both International students as well as German students studying at Germany’s public or state-recognized university are eligible for the funding under Deutschland Stipendium.Studying or commencing studies at UG or PG-level degree any German institution.Part-time students and prospective students waiting for admission are also considered eligible.Proficiency certificate in English or German language.For more details students may refer to The Scholarship Program Ordinance (StipV) and the Scholarship Program Act (StipG).
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Both International students as well as German students studying at Germany’s public or state-recognized university are eligible for the funding under Deutschland Stipendium.

  • Studying or commencing studies at UG or PG-level degree any German institution.
  • Part-time students and prospective students waiting for admission are also considered eligible.
  • Proficiency certificate in English or German language.

For more details students may refer to The Scholarship Program Ordinance (StipV) and the Scholarship Program Act (StipG).

application_process.description: For details regarding the application process, deadline of application, admission requirement and supporting documents aspiring students must directly get in touch with the university they are enrolled in or in which they are seeking admission.First- and higher-semester students can apply directly to their university if they provide Deutschland Stipendium.Master’s program applicants need to include the certificate from their undergraduate degree.For matriculated students, they need to include a current transcript indicating their unweighted average grade (or evidence of their average grade/final grade on the last examination or degree completed).The application for Deutschland Stipendium or German Scholarship can be submitted online via the Deutschlandstipendium official website.Note:All supporting documents must be submitted in English or German. Documents issued in other languages need to be provided as both original copy and officially certificated translation. The application period may vary from university to university, hence it is advised to check the deadlines before applying for the scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
For details regarding the application process, deadline of application, admission requirement and supporting documents aspiring students must directly get in touch with the university they are enrolled in or in which they are seeking admission.

  • First- and higher-semester students can apply directly to their university if they provide Deutschland Stipendium.
  • Master’s program applicants need to include the certificate from their undergraduate degree.
  • For matriculated students, they need to include a current transcript indicating their unweighted average grade (or evidence of their average grade/final grade on the last examination or degree completed).
  • The application for Deutschland Stipendium or German Scholarship can be submitted online via the Deutschlandstipendium official website.

Note: All supporting documents must be submitted in English or German. Documents issued in other languages need to be provided as both original copy and officially certificated translation. The application period may vary from university to university, hence it is advised to check the deadlines before applying for the scholarship.

selection_process.description: An applicant’s entire personality is taken into account during the selection process. From academic excellence to personal achievements, everything is equally considered. As per majority oftop institutions in Germany, selections for Deutschland Stipendium are based on the following factors:Scholastic and professional recognitionsInvolvement in extra-curricular activitiesSpecial achievements, if anyVolunteer work, if anySelecting the successful candidates and approaching potential sponsors with financial assistance from the Federal Government - the entire process is conducted by the respective universities.Germany recognizes and appreciates the role played by young professionals in its development, so the government aims to promote education by providing scholarships and grants. More than 7,500 sponsors contributed to raising around 29 million euros along with the government last year. Students who are recipients of the Germany scholarship are allowed to have other sources of income as well, like the BAfoG.
selection_process.html_content:
An applicant’s entire personality is taken into account during the selection process. From academic excellence to personal achievements, everything is equally considered. As per majority of top institutions in Germany, selections for Deutschland Stipendium are based on the following factors:

  • Scholastic and professional recognitions
  • Involvement in extra-curricular activities
  • Special achievements, if any
  • Volunteer work, if any

Selecting the successful candidates and approaching potential sponsors with financial assistance from the Federal Government - the entire process is conducted by the respective universities.

Germany recognizes and appreciates the role played by young professionals in its development, so the government aims to promote education by providing scholarships and grants. More than 7,500 sponsors contributed to raising around 29 million euros along with the government last year. Students who are recipients of the Germany scholarship are allowed to have other sources of income as well, like the BAfoG.

description:
Each year, the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) provides support to over 100,000 students and researchers from Germany and around the world. Indian students can get a chance to pursue their master's, doctoral, and post-doctoral studies at a minimum cost. Recipients of DAAD scholarships for master's get a monthly allowance of at least EUR 934 (INR 94,000), while the doctoral and postdoctoral recipients get EUR 1,200 (INR 1.21L) and EUR 2,400 (INR 2.41L), for the duration of their studies in Germany.

The DAAD International Postgraduate Scholarship 2026 is now open for applications. With a €934 monthly stipend, travel allowance, insurance, and more, this program remains one of the most competitive and rewarding scholarships for international students in Germany.

Some of the important features of DAAD Scholarships are:

  • Eligible applicants must have completed their prior degree with a minimum aggregate of 85%.
  • Each candidate must have at least 2 years of work experience, be it in the field of research, employment, or graduate assistantship.
  • Payments for health insurance and travel expenses are also covered for all the recipients of DAAD scholarships.
  • Applicants must receive an invitation letter from their supervisors at an eligible German university.
  • Applications close on 24 September, 25 September, and 10 November 2025.
  • Eligible students are advised to apply early through the official DAAD portal to secure their chance.

DAAD Scholarships Benefits for Indian students

The section outlines the benefits of DAAD Scholarships for Indian students:

Note: Considering EUR 1 = INR 100.20 as of July 15, 2025.

eligibility_criteria.description: With over 100 scholarship programs available for international students, the eligibility criteria for each program can widely vary. However, applicants for DAAD Scholarships must meet the following essential requirements:Language Skills: Proficiency in English with a minimumIELTS band scoreof 6.5. While knowledge of the German language is not mandatory, it is highly recommended.Academic Grades: A minimum of 8.5 CGPA or 85% (or equivalent, depending on the degree being pursued) is required.No Objection Certificate (NOC): Applicants for exchange or short-term research programs must obtain a NOC from their home institution.Work Experience: A minimum of 2 years of work experience, which can include research, teaching, or graduate assistantship roles.Research Proposal/SOP: Submission of a 500-1000 word research proposal orStatement of Purpose (SOP) for Germany. In some cases, a CV may suffice.Note:Applicants must also provide proof of accommodation for visa insurance purposes as part of the application process.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
With over 100 scholarship programs available for international students, the eligibility criteria for each program can widely vary. However, applicants for DAAD Scholarships must meet the following essential requirements:
  • Language Skills: Proficiency in English with a minimum IELTS band score of 6.5. While knowledge of the German language is not mandatory, it is highly recommended.
  • Academic Grades: A minimum of 8.5 CGPA or 85% (or equivalent, depending on the degree being pursued) is required.
  • No Objection Certificate (NOC): Applicants for exchange or short-term research programs must obtain a NOC from their home institution.
  • Work Experience: A minimum of 2 years of work experience, which can include research, teaching, or graduate assistantship roles.
  • Research Proposal/SOP: Submission of a 500-1000 word research proposal or Statement of Purpose (SOP) for Germany. In some cases, a CV may suffice.

Note: Applicants must also provide proof of accommodation for visa insurance purposes as part of the application process.

application_process.description: The DAAD application process for most scholarship programs takes place in 2 steps:Complete the online application formand upload the documents.Send a copy of the application formto the DAAD office via post.STEP IBeginning with the online application process, it is simple, direct, andtakes about 30 minutes.Applications are to be made via theDAAD Portal, whichopens around 6 weeks before the scholarship application deadline(s).Once you have completed the application form, upload the following supplementary documents:Online Application FormCurriculum VitaeNo Objection Certificate filled in and stamped by the previous institutionInvitation Letter of German SupervisorUniversity Degree & CertificatesNote:The first and last names in the application form should be identical to the name in the applicant’s passport.STEP IIAfter submitting the form and uploading the supporting documents, candidates will be directed to another page, where they can verify their application package and download a PDF file. Mail the following documents to your nearest DAAD office:One copy of theApplication Summary,which is generated in the portal (PDF)Recent reference from a previous university teacherIndian students must post their application package for DAAD scholarships to the regional address mentioned below:Regional Office New Delhic/o DLTA Complex, R.K. Khanna Stadium, 1 Africa Avenue110029 New DelhiTelephone: +91 (11) 6646-5500Fax: +91 (11) 6646-5555E-mail: info.newdelhi@daad.de
application_process.html_content:
The DAAD application process for most scholarship programs takes place in 2 steps:
  • Complete the online application form and upload the documents.
  • Send a copy of the application form to the DAAD office via post.

STEP I

Beginning with the online application process, it is simple, direct, and takes about 30 minutes. Applications are to be made via the DAAD Portal, which opens around 6 weeks before the scholarship application deadline(s). Once you have completed the application form, upload the following supplementary documents:

  • Online Application Form
  • Curriculum Vitae
  • No Objection Certificate filled in and stamped by the previous institution
  • Invitation Letter of German Supervisor
  • University Degree & Certificates

Note: The first and last names in the application form should be identical to the name in the applicant’s passport.

STEP II

After submitting the form and uploading the supporting documents, candidates will be directed to another page, where they can verify their application package and download a PDF file. Mail the following documents to your nearest DAAD office:

  • One copy of the Application Summary, which is generated in the portal (PDF)
  • Recent reference from a previous university teacher

Indian students must post their application package for DAAD scholarships to the regional address mentioned below:

Regional Office New Delhi

c/o DLTA Complex, R.K. Khanna Stadium, 1 Africa Avenue

110029 New Delhi

Telephone: +91 (11) 6646-5500

Fax: +91 (11) 6646-5555

E-mail: info.newdelhi@daad.de

selection_process.description: Each DAAD scholarship has its selection committee responsible for thoroughly evaluating applications. These committees may be based locally, for instance,in India for Indian applicants, orGermany,depending on the specific scholarship program. The selection process primarily considers the following factors:Project QualityAcademic PerformanceDuration of Research/FieldworkResearch Proposal/Work ExperienceAlthough formal interviews are not conducted, some programs may require you to provide a personal introduction. This will depend on the scholarship type and your location.
selection_process.html_content:
Each DAAD scholarship has its selection committee responsible for thoroughly evaluating applications. These committees may be based locally, for instance, in India for Indian applicants, or Germany, depending on the specific scholarship program. The selection process primarily considers the following factors:
  • Project Quality
  • Academic Performance
  • Duration of Research/Fieldwork
  • Research Proposal/Work Experience

Although formal interviews are not conducted, some programs may require you to provide a personal introduction. This will depend on the scholarship type and your location.

In addition to DAAD scholarships, several other grant programs funded by DAAD are available to Indian students. These include the Helmut-Schmidt-Program, IIT Master Sandwich Scholarships, and Semester Scholarships for Students of Indian Institutes of Management (IIM). Other notable programs are the Study Scholarship for Foreign Graduates in Performing Arts and study visits for groups of foreign students to Germany.

description:
The Heinrich Boll Foundation offers around 1,500 scholarships every year to German and international undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral students studying any subject at a German higher education institution. Students interested in the Heinrich Boll Scholarships must have outstanding academic records, and be politically and socially engaged. Also, they should have a keen interest in the foundation’s basic values, including sustainability and ecology, human rights and democracy, and justice and self-determination.

Notably, the foundation awards scholarships as per the guidelines set by the Foreign Office and Germany’s Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF). Scholarships are offered for the regular period of study.

Type of Funding Private
Scholarship Type Merit-based
Eligible Candidates Undergraduate, graduate and doctoral students from any country studying any subject 
Approximate Number of Scholarships Granted Annually 1,500
Available To International Candidates Yes
Application Deadlines March 1 every year for the spring session and September 1 for the autumn session
Participating Countries All
Official Website www.boell.de/en/scholarships

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for applying to Heinrich Boll Scholarships, students must meet certain criteria. The eligibility requirements are different for students educated in Germany, students educated in one of the EU member states (excluding Germany) and the ones educated anywhere other than EU member states. Following are the eligibility requirements for various categories of students:

For Undergraduate and Graduate Students:

Requirements German/Foreign students (educated in Germany) EU nationals (not educated in Germany) Non-EU nationals (not educated in Germany)
Degree required to qualify for the scholarship First degree only (Diploma, Bachelors, and Staatsexamen) Master’s degree only (first professional qualification proof must be provided) Master’s degree only (first professional qualification proof must be provided)
Earliest application date Immediately before the start of studies Immediately before the start of studies Immediately before the start of studies
Latest application date During your degree course’s third semester (enclosed student registration
required)		 During your degree course’s first semester (enclosed student registration
required)		 During your degree course’s first semester (enclosed student registration
required)
Eligible courses All All All
Eligible host universities state or state-approved universities in Germany or other EU member states state or state-approved universities in Germany or other EU member states state or state-approved universities in Germany
German proficiency proof  - Level DSH 2 or B2 (certificate required) Level DSH 2 or B2 (certificate required)

For Doctoral Students:

Requirements German/Foreign students (educated in Germany) EU nationals (not educated in Germany) Non-EU nationals (not educated in Germany)
Doctoral studies Admission Proof of doctoral studies admission at a state or state-approved university must be attached to the application Proof of doctoral studies admission at a state or state-approved university must be attached to the application Proof of doctoral studies admission at a state or state-approved university must be attached to the application
Application date Preliminary work must have been finished and the submission of a valid timetable for completion is required Preliminary work must have been finished and the submission of a valid timetable for completion is required Preliminary work must have been finished and the submission of a valid timetable for completion is required
Eligible fields All (subjects related to the foundation’s basic values will be given priority) All (subjects related to the foundation’s basic values will be given priority) All (subjects related to the foundation’s basic values will be given priority)
Regular scholarship period Two years (maybe extended two times at the most by half a year) Two years (maybe extended two times at the most by half a year) Two years (maybe extended two times at the most by half a year)
German proficiency proof  – Level DSH 2 or B2 (certificate required) Level DSH 2 or B2 (certificate required)

application_process.html_content:
How to Apply for Heinrich Boll Scholarships?

The Heinrich Boll Foundation only accepts online applications. The online portal opens around six weeks prior to the deadline for applying. To apply for the scholarship:

  • Check the next deadline on the official website of the Heinrich Boll Foundation.
  • Access the form from the foundation’s online portal.
  • Fill the form completely and correctly.
  • Attach the required documents in PDF format to the online application.
  • Submit the completed application and all the necessary documents before the deadline.

Required Documents

Following are the documents applicants are required to submit while applying for the scholarship:

  • Completely and correctly filled application form along with the applicant’s personal data and CV, motivation for applying, motivation for studying the chosen subject, an outline of his/her political interests and social commitments, and an outline of the Ph.D. thesis project (for doctoral students only)
  • A copy of the applicant’s university entrance qualification, Abitur or baccalaureate. Attach an English or German translation by a certified translator, if required.
  • If an applicant has already commenced the studies, he/she is required to submit a list of study certificates to date.
  • Foreign applicants seeking to pursue a master’s degree must submit their first-degree certificate’s certified copy (with English or German translation if required). Applicants will also have to submit an explanation of the grading in case it is different from the German system.
  • Student enrolment certificate
  • A 1-2 page long reference on the applicant’s social commitment by a representative of an organization or an institution
  • A 1-2 page long expert reference by a university/college lecturer or a school teacher (in case of secondary-level students). Those applying for doctoral scholarships have to submit two expert references.
  • Doctoral students are also required to attach a detailed exposé of their research project.

selection_process.description: The selection process for granting the scholarship comprisesthree stages:Stage 1:Submission of written application along with the required documents that include an expert reference from a school teacher or a university lecturer and a personal reference on the applicant’s social commitment. Each application is reviewed based on the applicant’s academic record, his/her political interest, and social commitment, the reason for applying for the scholarship and the quality of research project (in case of doctoral students).Stage 2:After the application has been assessed, an hour-long interview is held with aliaison lecturerusually at the applicant’s university or near his/her residence. The interview can also be telephonic. After the interview, a report written by the liaison lecturer is attached to the application.Stage 3: Suitable applicants will have to attend a selection workshop held in Berlin that consists of a group discussion and personal interview.Only a few applicants are selected at the end of each stage. The decision taken at the selection procedure’s each stage is communicated to the applicants in writing. Students may reapply if they could not clear the first or the second stage. However, applicants who have participated in the selection workshop and were rejected arenotallowed to reapply.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process for granting the scholarship comprises three stages:

  • Stage 1: Submission of written application along with the required documents that include an expert reference from a school teacher or a university lecturer and a personal reference on the applicant’s social commitment. Each application is reviewed based on the applicant’s academic record, his/her political interest, and social commitment, the reason for applying for the scholarship and the quality of research project (in case of doctoral students).
  • Stage 2: After the application has been assessed, an hour-long interview is held with a liaison lecturer usually at the applicant’s university or near his/her residence. The interview can also be telephonic. After the interview, a report written by the liaison lecturer is attached to the application.
  • Stage 3: Suitable applicants will have to attend a selection workshop held in Berlin that consists of a group discussion and personal interview.

Only a few applicants are selected at the end of each stage. The decision taken at the selection procedure’s each stage is communicated to the applicants in writing. Students may reapply if they could not clear the first or the second stage. However, applicants who have participated in the selection workshop and were rejected are not allowed to reapply.

grant_details.description: The Heinrich Boll Foundation has its headquarters inBerlin-Mitteand supports around1,500students every year with scholarships tostudy at a German university. The foundation works with over 100 partner projects across 60 countries and has offices in 32 countries, including France, Turkey, India, the United States, China, Mexico, Russia, Ukraine, and the Middle East. Its main objective is to encourage political education across the world to promote socio-political commitment, democratic will, and international understanding.
grant_details.html_content: The Heinrich Boll Foundation has its headquarters in Berlin-Mitte and supports around 1,500 students every year with scholarships to study at a German university. The foundation works with over 100 partner projects across 60 countries and has offices in 32 countries, including France, Turkey, India, the United States, China, Mexico, Russia, Ukraine, and the Middle East. Its main objective is to encourage political education across the world to promote socio-political commitment, democratic will, and international understanding.

scholarship_name: Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships 2020
description:
In recognition of Dr. Kalam’s contribution to his profession as a scientist and aeronautical engineer, he was presented with an Honorary Doctorate of Engineering from the University of Sydney in 2011. In the same year, the university established Dr. Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships to celebrate his commitment to education.

Available to all eligible international students, the scholarships offers them a chance to pursue a master’s course at the faculty of Engineering and Information Technologies. The benefits of Dr. Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships are given in the table below:

Award Value 50% tuition fee
Eligible students All International Students
Duration One year; Renewable

Application for the Dr. Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship Program are available twice a year, once in September (1st semester) and mid-February (2nd semester). For Dr. Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships 2020, the deadlines for both semesters are January 12 and April 30 respectively.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship, an applicant must:Be an international studentPossess an admission offer for a Masters’s level program in theFaculty of Engineering at the University of Sydney.Have a minimum WAM (Weighted Average Marks) of 75 in undergraduate courseworkTerms and ConditionsApplicants must not hold any other primary scholarship offered by the University of Sydney.Students transferring from other PG programs or those who have already commenced their course are not eligible for this scholarship.The recipients must commence their degree in the same semester and year the scholarship is awarded.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship, an applicant must:

  • Be an international student
  • Possess an admission offer for a Masters’s level program in the Faculty of Engineering at the University of Sydney.
  • Have a minimum WAM (Weighted Average Marks) of 75 in undergraduate coursework

Terms and Conditions

  • Applicants must not hold any other primary scholarship offered by the University of Sydney.
  • Students transferring from other PG programs or those who have already commenced their course are not eligible for this scholarship.
  • The recipients must commence their degree in the same semester and year the scholarship is awarded.

application_process.description: Since the applications for Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships 2020 are currently open, applicants can access theonline application formon the university’s website.Along with the application form, all the applicants must upload their academic transcripts of previously attended institutions.Applicants must note that the deadline for Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship 2020 application is January 12, 2020.
application_process.html_content:
Since the applications for Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships 2020 are currently open, applicants can access the online application form on the university’s website.

Along with the application form, all the applicants must upload their academic transcripts of previously attended institutions.

Applicants must note that the deadline for Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship 2020 application is January 12, 2020.

selection_process.description: Academic achievements of applicants are the main criteria for awarding the Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship.The selection committee headed by the Associate Dean (Education) will select students for the scholarship program. After receiving the online applications, the committee will evaluate the applicants and based on their academic performance, compile a list of shortlisted candidates.Shortlisted applicants will be interviewed by the committee. Selected students will be notified through an official letter.Terms and ConditionsTo renew the scholarship, recipients must maintain WAM of 65 in each of the semesters.This scholarship offers only 50% of the total tuition fees. All other expenses are required to be borne by the student.Termination of Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate ScholarshipThis International Postgraduate Scholarship will be terminated if:The recipient withdraws from an eligible course or fails to enroll.The student status changes from international to domestic.The recipient does not resume study at the end of a period of approved leave.The student does not maintain satisfactory academic performance.The recipient is determined by the University to be guilty of serious misconduct.
selection_process.html_content:
Academic achievements of applicants are the main criteria for awarding the Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship.

The selection committee headed by the Associate Dean (Education) will select students for the scholarship program. After receiving the online applications, the committee will evaluate the applicants and based on their academic performance, compile a list of shortlisted candidates.

Shortlisted applicants will be interviewed by the committee. Selected students will be notified through an official letter.

Terms and Conditions

  • To renew the scholarship, recipients must maintain WAM of 65 in each of the semesters.
  • This scholarship offers only 50% of the total tuition fees. All other expenses are required to be borne by the student.

Termination of Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarship

This International Postgraduate Scholarship will be terminated if:

  • The recipient withdraws from an eligible course or fails to enroll.
  • The student status changes from international to domestic.
  • The recipient does not resume study at the end of a period of approved leave.
  • The student does not maintain satisfactory academic performance.
  • The recipient is determined by the University to be guilty of serious misconduct.

grant_details.description: Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships are offered to eligible international applicants with at least 75% at the UG level. Applications for the same are invited separately and form is available on the university’s official website.The scholarship contributes50% of the total tuition fees for the PG programat the Faculty of Engineering, University of Sydney. The tenure of the scholarship is for 1 year renewed semester wise. For the upcoming scholarship session, the deadline for application is January 12, 2020.
grant_details.html_content:
Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam International Postgraduate Scholarships are offered to eligible international applicants with at least 75% at the UG level. Applications for the same are invited separately and form is available on the university’s official website.

The scholarship contributes 50% of the total tuition fees for the PG program at the Faculty of Engineering, University of Sydney. The tenure of the scholarship is for 1 year renewed semester wise. For the upcoming scholarship session, the deadline for application is January 12, 2020.

description:
Felix Scholarships are designed for meritorious students who need financial aid to pursue postgraduate studies. The scholarships are awarded to students from India and other developing countries which have been categorized by the World Bank as low-income countries.

Felix scholarship applicants can apply for any masters/research-level program at the participating universities, except for medicine. Presently, the Felix Scholarship scheme offers 20 scholarships at three universities in the United Kingdom:

The Felix Scholarships cover tuition fees and provide a stipend or maintenance grant against living expenses. Given below is a table providing an estimated cost incurred by international students at each of the participating universities:

University Tuition & Fees (in USD) Cost of Living (in USD)
University of Oxford 37,200-42,100 17,500
University of Reading 20,600-24,800 18,000
SOAS 25,900-29,400 17,500

Felix Scholarships are distributed annually and are renewable for up to 3 years depending upon the course of study and financial need of the recipient.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for the Felix Scholarships, underprivileged applicants must opt for a full-time postgraduate program with any one of the partner universities. Also, scholarship applicants must be below the age of 30 years.In addition, forIndianscholarship, an applicant has to fulfill the following eligibility criteria:Must be an Indian nationalMust not be currently residing or studying outside India.Must have a first-class UG degree from arecognized Indian university.Fornon-Indianscholarship, an applicant must fulfill the following eligibility criteria:Must hold a first-class UG degree from a university of the applicant’s home country.Must not be currently residing outside the home country.Felix Scholarship Terms and ConditionsApplicants who already hold a master’s degree are not eligible for the Felix Scholarships.Applicants must return to work in their home country after the completion of studies.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for the Felix Scholarships, underprivileged applicants must opt for a full-time postgraduate program with any one of the partner universities. Also, scholarship applicants must be below the age of 30 years.

In addition, for Indian scholarship, an applicant has to fulfill the following eligibility criteria:

  • Must be an Indian national
  • Must not be currently residing or studying outside India.
  • Must have a first-class UG degree from a recognized Indian university.

For non-Indian scholarship, an applicant must fulfill the following eligibility criteria:

  • Must hold a first-class UG degree from a university of the applicant’s home country.
  • Must not be currently residing outside the home country.

Felix Scholarship Terms and Conditions

  • Applicants who already hold a master’s degree are not eligible for the Felix Scholarships.
  • Applicants must return to work in their home country after the completion of studies.

application_process.description: Prospective applicants should note that Felix Scholarship applications can be made to only one of the participating universities theUniversity of Oxford, School of Oriental and African Studies, and University of Reading). The application process for Felix Scholarships varies at each partner university.Application Process at the University of OxfordApplicants are not required to submit a separate application form. All they have to do is tick a box on their Oxford PG application form. The university officials use the details inserted by the applicant in necessary sections of the admission application.Application Process at the University of ReadingTo apply for the scholarship, the applicant must obtain the admission offer to the PG program at theUniversity of Reading. Upon receiving the offer, students need to complete the scholarship form at the me@reading applicant portal.Application Process at the School of Oriental and African StudiesApplicants are first required to apply for a Master’s or Research degree program atSOAS. After that, the students must complete the Felix Scholarship online application form.
application_process.html_content:
Prospective applicants should note that Felix Scholarship applications can be made to only one of the participating universities the University of Oxford, School of Oriental and African Studies, and University of Reading). The application process for Felix Scholarships varies at each partner university.

Application Process at the University of Oxford

Applicants are not required to submit a separate application form. All they have to do is tick a box on their Oxford PG application form. The university officials use the details inserted by the applicant in necessary sections of the admission application.

Application Process at the University of Reading

To apply for the scholarship, the applicant must obtain the admission offer to the PG program at the University of Reading. Upon receiving the offer, students need to complete the scholarship form at the me@reading applicant portal.

Application Process at the School of Oriental and African Studies

Applicants are first required to apply for a Master’s or Research degree program at SOAS. After that, the students must complete the Felix Scholarship online application form.

selection_process.description: Each university shortlists candidates on the basis of their academic excellence and financial need. The shortlisting process will take place in earlyMarch 2026.Shortlisted students have to complete ashort questionnaireand appear for aninterviewin India. The interview or questionnaire not only tests the academic abilities of the applicants, but also assesses their personality, financial need, and suitability for the Felix Scholarships.Candidates will be sent a letter setting out the date and venue of their interview. Each interview lasts around 30 minutes and will be held either in New Delhi or Bangalore. The decisions will be announced inMay 2026.Note:There is no interview for non-Indian students.
selection_process.html_content:
Each university shortlists candidates on the basis of their academic excellence and financial need. The shortlisting process will take place in early March 2026.

Shortlisted students have to complete a short questionnaire and appear for an interview in India. The interview or questionnaire not only tests the academic abilities of the applicants, but also assesses their personality, financial need, and suitability for the Felix Scholarships.

Candidates will be sent a letter setting out the date and venue of their interview. Each interview lasts around 30 minutes and will be held either in New Delhi or Bangalore. The decisions will be announced in May 2026.

Note: There is no interview for non-Indian students.

grant_details.description: Study-LevelMasters and DoctorateEligible CandidatesUnderprivileged students from India and other developing countriesNumber of Scholarships20Study-Length1-3 yearsScholarship Award100% Tuition Fees and StipendAward DistributedAnnuallyThe first six Felix Scholarships were awarded in 1991/1992. Over the years, the number of scholarships has now risen to 20 per academic year. Till now, the trust has awarded 428 scholarships, of which, 40 scholarships have been awarded to students from countries other than India.Since 2001, Felix scholarships have been awarded to gifted underprivileged students from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Ethiopia, Lebanon, Czech Republic, Kenya, South Africa, Egypt, Nepal, Hungary, and Lebanon.
grant_details.html_content:
Study-Level Masters and Doctorate
Eligible Candidates Underprivileged students from India and other developing countries
Number of Scholarships 20
Study-Length 1-3 years
Scholarship Award 100% Tuition Fees and Stipend
Award Distributed Annually

The first six Felix Scholarships were awarded in 1991/1992. Over the years, the number of scholarships has now risen to 20 per academic year. Till now, the trust has awarded 428 scholarships, of which, 40 scholarships have been awarded to students from countries other than India.
Since 2001, Felix scholarships have been awarded to gifted underprivileged students from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Ethiopia, Lebanon, Czech Republic, Kenya, South Africa, Egypt, Nepal, Hungary, and Lebanon.

description: The Charles Wallace India Trust Scholarships offers funding opportunities to Indians in the early to middle stages of their careers who are working/studying in arts, humanities or heritage conservation. These grants allow them to achieve academic, artistic, and professional ambitions by building connections while studying in the UK.

eligibility_criteria.description: A few eligibility guidelines are common for all Common Wallace India Trust Scholarships, grants and fellowships, however, there are some that might vary. The section below discusses various eligibility criteria established by CWIT.Common Eligibility GuidelinesCWIT grant applicants must fulfill the following criteria:The applicants should be studying in disciplines covered by CWITThey should be Indian citizens domiciled in IndiaApplicants must not have received any CWIT grant in the last five yearsGrant-Specific Eligibility GuidelinesIn addition to the common criteria listed above, candidates must also fulfil the specific eligibility criteria for their chosen grant.Grant NameAge BandOther Requirement (s)Grants for Doctoral Studies25-38 yearsreturn to India on completion of courseShort Research & Professional Visiting25-45 yearsProficiency in English; Completion of studies or 4+ years of experience; Project proposalLong Term Grants25-38 yearsDegree/diploma in a specialised course; Work experience (preferred)Visiting Fellowships25-45 yearsCompletion of studies or 4+ years of work experience; Project proposal
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
A few eligibility guidelines are common for all Common Wallace India Trust Scholarships, grants and fellowships, however, there are some that might vary. The section below discusses various eligibility criteria established by CWIT.

Common Eligibility Guidelines

CWIT grant applicants must fulfill the following criteria:

  • The applicants should be studying in disciplines covered by CWIT
  • They should be Indian citizens domiciled in India
  • Applicants must not have received any CWIT grant in the last five years

Grant-Specific Eligibility Guidelines

In addition to the common criteria listed above, candidates must also fulfil the specific eligibility criteria for their chosen grant.

Grant Name Age Band Other Requirement (s)
Grants for Doctoral Studies 25-38 years return to India on completion of course
Short Research & Professional Visiting 25-45 years Proficiency in English; Completion of studies or 4+ years of experience; Project proposal
Long Term Grants 25-38 years Degree/diploma in a specialised course; Work experience (preferred)
Visiting Fellowships 25-45 years Completion of studies or 4+ years of work experience; Project proposal

application_process.description: The application process varies for all the Common Wallace India Trust Scholarships:Grants for Doctoral Studies:Applicants must email their applications directly to CWIT in London.Short Research and Professional Visiting:Applications should be emailed directly to CWIT London by email cwit@btinternet.com.Long Term Grants:Applicants must apply through the nearest British Council.Visiting Fellowships:Applicants have to apply individually to each college/university.The following documents are to be provided with the application:Astatement of purpose/intentA brief CV which includes email, postal address, and photoEmergency name and contact details in IndiaAnIELTSCertificate (if applicable)Names and email addresses of two referees familiar with the work of the applicantPortfolio submission in either hard copy format or CD/DVD (if applicable)Applications are now closed for the current term and will reopen for the next in autumn 2023
application_process.html_content:
The application process varies for all the Common Wallace India Trust Scholarships:

  1. Grants for Doctoral Studies: Applicants must email their applications directly to CWIT in London.
  2. Short Research and Professional Visiting: Applications should be emailed directly to CWIT London by email cwit@btinternet.com.
  3. Long Term Grants: Applicants must apply through the nearest British Council.
  4. Visiting Fellowships: Applicants have to apply individually to each college/university.

The following documents are to be provided with the application:

  • A statement of purpose/intent
  • A brief CV which includes email, postal address, and photo
  • Emergency name and contact details in India
  • An IELTS Certificate (if applicable)
  • Names and email addresses of two referees familiar with the work of the applicant
  • Portfolio submission in either hard copy format or CD/DVD (if applicable)

Applications are now closed for the current term and will reopen for the next in autumn 2023

selection_process.description: There is a selection committee for each grant/fellowship and they evaluate the respective applications. Shortlisted students are invited for an interview, upon which the committee makes its final decision.
selection_process.html_content: There is a selection committee for each grant/fellowship and they evaluate the respective applications. Shortlisted students are invited for an interview, upon which the committee makes its final decision.

grant_details.description: The Charles Wallace India Trust covers the following fields of study:ArtsVisual ArtsCuratingPerformance (e.g. Dance, Drama, Music, Directing)PhotographyFilm Studies, which includes Script Writing and DirectionArt HistoryDesign (but not Architecture)Heritage ConservationConservation architectureManagement of museums and collectionsManagement of heritage sites or projectsConservation of materials like metal, stone, timber (including armor, artifacts, and metal), paintings, film, and photographsConservation of landscapeEngineering related to the conservation of heritage structuresThe eligibility, application and selection guidelines vary for each Charles Wallace India Trust Scholarships.
grant_details.html_content:
The Charles Wallace India Trust covers the following fields of study:

  • Arts
    • Visual Arts
    • Curating
    • Performance (e.g. Dance, Drama, Music, Directing)
    • Photography
    • Film Studies, which includes Script Writing and Direction
    • Art History
    • Design (but not Architecture)
  • Heritage Conservation
    • Conservation architecture
    • Management of museums and collections
    • Management of heritage sites or projects
    • Conservation of materials like metal, stone, timber (including armor, artifacts, and metal), paintings, film, and photographs
    • Conservation of landscape
    • Engineering related to the conservation of heritage structures

The eligibility, application and selection guidelines vary for each Charles Wallace India Trust Scholarships.

description:
Goa Education Trust Scholarships are awarded in participation with the British Council of India, offering Indian students an opportunity to pursue postgraduate level studies in the UK. Students can opt for various disciplines including Architecture, Journalism, Education, Business Management, and Communications.

Applicants of Goa Education Trust Scholarship should be below the age of 30 years with their graduation completed from an Indian university. Potential applicants must note that applications for 2024 are yet to be announced.

eligibility_criteria.description: To apply for the GET scholarship, you need to fulfill the following eligibility criteria:Age:Applicants should be under the age of 30 years at the time of applicationCitizenship:You need to be a resident of India with a valid passportMinimum Qualification:Should have completed graduation from a recognized Indian UniversityThe applicant should have an unexceptional academic record and extra-curricular achievementsAdmission Evidence:A proof of enrollment or an unconditional admission letter for any PG course from any of the recognized UK universities beginning in the fall semester (September/October)
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To apply for the GET scholarship, you need to fulfill the following eligibility criteria: 

  • Age: Applicants should be under the age of 30 years at the time of application 
  • Citizenship: You need to be a resident of India with a valid passport 
  • Minimum Qualification: Should have completed graduation from a recognized Indian University 
    • The applicant should have an unexceptional academic record and extra-curricular achievements 
  • Admission Evidence: A proof of enrollment or an unconditional admission letter for any PG course from any of the recognized UK universities beginning in the fall semester (September/October)

application_process.description: The application process of Goa Education Trust Scholarships is quite easy and straightforward. It is a simple four-step procedure that ensures that you have successfully submitted all the necessary documents before the set deadline.For your reference, thefour-step Goa Education Trust scholarship application processis given below:Step 1:Download the scholarship application from the official website of the British Council.Step 2:Complete the downloaded form in theword formatand insert a scanned copy of a recent passport-size photograph in the relevant section.Step 3:You are required to provide proof of certain aspects such as age, address, etc. Therefore, you have to gather the following documents:Copy of birth certificate to confirm your ageCopy of passport identification page to confirm your addressCopy of conditional/unconditional admission letter of aUK university.One academic and one professional reference letterStep 4:Once you have completed all the three steps listed above, you have to mail the entire application package (application form, supporting documents, photographs) to the British Council.You can mail your application package either via email or by post. Those who want to send an email must ensure that their scanned application package is not exceeding 10 MB.Email must be sent toget.scholarship@britishcouncil.org.The ones who are unable to send their application package via email can send the hardcopy at the followingaddress:FOA: Goa Education Trust Scholarship 2021 ApplicationBritish Council Division,British Deputy High Commission,901, Tower 1, One Indiabulls Centre,Elphinstone Road (West),Mumbai – 400 013,IndiaIt is important to note that any application submitted without supplementary document(s) will be automatically rejected. Moreover, you are requested not to send any additional reference letters or supplementary documents.
application_process.html_content:
The application process of Goa Education Trust Scholarships is quite easy and straightforward. It is a simple four-step procedure that ensures that you have successfully submitted all the necessary documents before the set deadline.

For your reference, the four-step Goa Education Trust scholarship application process is given below:

  • Step 1: Download the scholarship application from the official website of the British Council.
  • Step 2: Complete the downloaded form in the word format and insert a scanned copy of a recent passport-size photograph in the relevant section.
  • Step 3: You are required to provide proof of certain aspects such as age, address, etc. Therefore, you have to gather the following documents:
    • Copy of birth certificate to confirm your age
    • Copy of passport identification page to confirm your address
    • Copy of conditional/unconditional admission letter of a UK university.
    • One academic and one professional reference letter
  • Step 4: Once you have completed all the three steps listed above, you have to mail the entire application package (application form, supporting documents, photographs) to the British Council.

You can mail your application package either via email or by post. Those who want to send an email must ensure that their scanned application package is not exceeding 10 MB.

Email must be sent to get.scholarship@britishcouncil.org. 

The ones who are unable to send their application package via email can send the hardcopy at the following address:

FOA: Goa Education Trust Scholarship 2021 Application
British Council Division,
British Deputy High Commission,
901, Tower 1, One Indiabulls Centre,
Elphinstone Road (West),
Mumbai – 400 013,
India

It is important to note that any application submitted without supplementary document(s) will be automatically rejected. Moreover, you are requested not to send any additional reference letters or supplementary documents.

selection_process.description: Post application deadline, the selection panel from the British Council of India reviews each application on the basis of:Academic qualificationReferencesExtra-curricular achievementsOnce the application evaluation process is complete, a list of shortlisted students is compiled. Thereafter, if you are amongst the shortlisted students, you will be called for an interview session. Recipients are selected based on their interview and overall profile.All students must note that even though the scholarship scheme is open for all Indian students, preference is still given to Goan students.
selection_process.html_content:
Post application deadline, the selection panel from the British Council of India reviews each application on the basis of: 

  • Academic qualification 
  • References 
  • Extra-curricular achievements 

Once the application evaluation process is complete, a list of shortlisted students is compiled. Thereafter, if you are amongst the shortlisted students, you will be called for an interview session. Recipients are selected based on their interview and overall profile.

All students must note that even though the scholarship scheme is open for all Indian students, preference is still given to Goan students.

description:
To support and encourage international students to pursue higher studies in the UK, the British Council and UK universities have launched a GREAT Scholarship. This program allows the recipients to complete their postgraduate (taught) program in any one of the participating UK universities.

GREAT scholarship covers the full tuition fees for one-year postgraduate programs or the tuition fee for the first year of master’s degree programs with a duration of two years.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students wishing to study in the UK, with the help of the GREAT Scholarship, must fulfil the following criteria:Citizens and present residents of India, China, Indonesia, Turkey, Malaysia, or Thailand.Completed a UG degree in your home country.Applicants of the GREAT Scholarship - India must have done a UG degree fromanIndian college.Dedicated and academically excellent to pursue a master's/postgraduate (taught) program in the UK.Relevant work experience or proven interest in the chosen field of study.Fulfil the English language requirement of the interested UK university viaIELTSor equivalent test score.The chosen postgraduate program must begin in September.Applicants must be excited to explore the UK higher education experience and willing to actively engage in extra-curricular activities.GREAT Scholarship India: Participating UK Universities in 2025-26The list of participating UK universities varies according to the applicant’s home country. For Indian students seeking the GREAT Scholarship, the program is accepted at the universities given below:Cranfield UniversityBishop Grosseteste UniversityEdinburgh Napier UniversityFalmouth UniversityUniversity of ManchesterGoldsmith, University of LondonKeele UniversityQueen’s University BelfastRoyal Agricultural UniversityTrinity Laban Conservatoire Music and DanceUniversity of East AngliaUniversity of KentUniversity of EdinburghUniversity of PlymouthUniversity of St. AndrewsUniversity of SouthamptonStudents of other eligible countries must check the scholarship's official page for the list of participating universities.GREAT Scholarship 2025: Participating UK Universities for Justice and Law ScholarshipsGlasgow Caledonian UniversityKeele UniversityNewcastle UniversityUniversity of ManchesterUniversity of ReadingUniversity of SussexSheffield Hallam University-
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students wishing to study in the UK, with the help of the GREAT Scholarship, must fulfil the following criteria:

  • Citizens and present residents of India, China, Indonesia, Turkey, Malaysia, or Thailand.
  • Completed a UG degree in your home country.
    • Applicants of the GREAT Scholarship - India must have done a UG degree from an Indian college.
  • Dedicated and academically excellent to pursue a master's/postgraduate (taught) program in the UK.
    • Relevant work experience or proven interest in the chosen field of study.
  • Fulfil the English language requirement of the interested UK university via IELTS or equivalent test score.
  • The chosen postgraduate program must begin in September.

Applicants must be excited to explore the UK higher education experience and willing to actively engage in extra-curricular activities.

GREAT Scholarship India: Participating UK Universities in 2025-26

The list of participating UK universities varies according to the applicant’s home country. For Indian students seeking the GREAT Scholarship, the program is accepted at the universities given below:

Cranfield University Bishop Grosseteste University
Edinburgh Napier University Falmouth University
University of Manchester Goldsmith, University of London
Keele University Queen’s University Belfast
Royal Agricultural University Trinity Laban Conservatoire Music and Dance
University of East Anglia University of Kent
University of Edinburgh University of Plymouth
University of St. Andrews University of Southampton

Students of other eligible countries must check the scholarship's official page for the list of participating universities.

GREAT Scholarship 2025: Participating UK Universities for Justice and Law Scholarships

Glasgow Caledonian University Keele University
Newcastle University University of Manchester
University of Reading University of Sussex
Sheffield Hallam University -

application_process.html_content:
Before applying for the scholarship, it is significant for the students to obtain admission at their chosen (and eligible) UK university. On receiving the confirmation of admission, they must complete the GREAT Scholarship on the university’s website.

How to Apply for the GREAT Scholarship India Application?

  1. Check your eligibility
    1. Are you an Indian resident?
    2. Plan to pursue a full-time postgraduate program in the UK?
    3. Is the program beginning in September?
  2. Complete the online application form.
  3. Provide the required student supporting documents

Ensure that you complete the application form and then submit it. Incomplete applications will not be entertained.

Student Supporting Documentation

  • A valid passport and UK student visa
  • Graduation mark sheet and certificate
  • ELP certificate(Test scores like IELTS/TOEFL/CAE can be submitted)
  • All other requirements as laid out by the selected university.

description:
India First Year Excellence Scholarship is offered to all the Indian Students who take an undergraduate course at the University of Alberta. It is available to students beginning UG programs at the university.

India First Year Excellence Scholarship recipients are awarded 5,000 CAD, one-time payment, for their 4-year undergraduate study course. The scholarship covers tuition and fees, but not the cost of living in Canada.

eligibility_criteria.description: This scholarship is specially designed for Indian Students whostudy in Canada on a student visaand is given only to those students who have superior academic achievement and excellent high school grades.Must be an Indian nationalMust have completed high school education from an Indian institution.Must have an unconditional admission letter for a UG program at the University of Alberta.Must be commencing the chosen program in the same session and year as the scholarship.Must have less than 24 IB, AP, or A-Level credits, before joining the university.Eligibility for UG Admissions at the University of AlbertaTo secureadmission in UG program at the University of Alberta, an Indian student must fulfill the following requirements:Completion of five academic subjects in class X and XII.High school academic transcriptsEnglish proficiency scoreNote:The number of scholarship offered each year are only limited and transfer students are not eligible under this category of scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
This scholarship is specially designed for Indian Students who study in Canada on a student visa and is given only to those students who have superior academic achievement and excellent high school grades.

  • Must be an Indian national
  • Must have completed high school education from an Indian institution.
  • Must have an unconditional admission letter for a UG program at the University of Alberta.
  • Must be commencing the chosen program in the same session and year as the scholarship.
  • Must have less than 24 IB, AP, or A-Level credits, before joining the university.

Eligibility for UG Admissions at the University of Alberta

To secure admission in UG program at the University of Alberta, an Indian student must fulfill the following requirements:

  • Completion of five academic subjects in class X and XII.
  • High school academic transcripts
  • English proficiency score

Note: The number of scholarship offered each year are only limited and transfer students are not eligible under this category of scholarship.

application_process.description: The University of Alberta doesNOThave any separate application form for India First Year Excellence Scholarship.Indian students admitted to aUG program at the University of Albertawill be automatically considered for the scholarship program.Prospective students seeking financial aid through this scholarship program or any UAlberta Scholarship are advised to submit their admission applications as early as possible.
application_process.html_content:
The University of Alberta does NOT have any separate application form for India First Year Excellence Scholarship. 

Indian students admitted to a UG program at the University of Alberta will be automatically considered for the scholarship program. 

Prospective students seeking financial aid through this scholarship program or any UAlberta Scholarship are advised to submit their admission applications as early as possible.

selection_process.description: The University of Alberta’s scholarship selection committee will receive applications of the eligible students from the admission office.Selections for India First Year Excellence Scholarships are majorly based on an applicant’s high school standing. From academic grades to extracurricular achievements, each element is reviewed.Recipients of the First Year Excellence Scholarship are notified about the committee’s decision via email. Funds are directly dispersed to the recipient’s student account and are automatically deducted at the time of tuition fee payment.
selection_process.html_content:
The University of Alberta’s scholarship selection committee will receive applications of the eligible students from the admission office.

Selections for India First Year Excellence Scholarships are majorly based on an applicant’s high school standing. From academic grades to extracurricular achievements, each element is reviewed.

Recipients of the First Year Excellence Scholarship are notified about the committee’s decision via email. Funds are directly dispersed to the recipient’s student account and are automatically deducted at the time of tuition fee payment.
