description:
Every year, Aga Khan Academy provides one of its students a chance to pursue a UG degree program at the University of Victoria. This is made possible through the academy collaboration with the university to establish the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship.

The scholarship program has its eligibility criteria, the application process, selection criteria, and terms and conditions. Furthermore, not all the Aga Khan Academy Students are eligible to apply for the scholarship. Only those students can apply who are nominated by the Academy and have secured admission in a UG program at the University of Victoria.

eligibility_criteria.description: The scholarship program is designed for an academically exceptional student at the Aga Khan Academy. Therefore, only the students of the academy are eligible for the scholarship.Apart from this, students who fulfill the requirements given below are eligible for Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship:Admission in thefirst-year UG degree program at the University of VictoriaExcellent academic grades ("A" average, or 32 IB points at minimum)Satisfying the English Proficiency requirements of the University:ELP Test NameMinimum Score RequirementIELTS6.5 (no section below 6.0)CAEL70 (no section less than 60)MELAB90TOEFL-iBT90 (no section below 20)TOEFL-PBT575
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The scholarship program is designed for an academically exceptional student at the Aga Khan Academy. Therefore, only the students of the academy are eligible for the scholarship.

Apart from this, students who fulfill the requirements given below are eligible for Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship:

  • Admission in the first-year UG degree program at the University of Victoria
  • Excellent academic grades ("A" average, or 32 IB points at minimum)
  • Satisfying the English Proficiency requirements of the University:
ELP Test Name Minimum Score Requirement
IELTS 6.5 (no section below 6.0)
CAEL 70 (no section less than 60)
MELAB 90
TOEFL-iBT 90 (no section below 20)
TOEFL-PBT 575

application_process.description: Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship 2024 applications are accepted through an online process. As a prospective candidate, you have to complete the online Aga Khan Application and submit it at theUniversity of VictoriaScholarship website, along with all the documents.How to Apply for Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship 2024?The step-by-step procedure for Aga Khan Scholarship 2024 are given below:Step I:Create a NetLink ID and sign onto your UVic My Page using the same.Step II:Select “Student Services”. If you have not yet received admission confirmation, select “ Applicant Services”.Step III:Select “View and Apply for awards/scholarships”Step IV:On my page account, select the "Aga Khan Academy Scholarship Application" and 2024-25 as the study period.Step V:Complete the application form.Step VI:Send in the required student supporting documents. Also, ask your nominator to send in the required Nominator Documentation: Form B, reference letterStudent Supporting DocumentationAwards/ Recognition Statementlisting all your awards, prizes, and recognition of the last three years. The date and details of the awarding institutions should be mentioned as well.Answering theessay question in 500 words. Talking about your recent challenges and how you responded to them. Also, how that experience can help you transition to student life at the University of VictoriaActivities statementwhich includes a list of all extracurricular and volunteer activities of the last 3 years, with proper date and hours of involvementA community reference letterwhich is written by a person( other than a family member) including details of the name, contact email, and period in which they know you, properly attested should be sent to entrance@uvic.ca.Financial Need Assessment:For this, you need to complete theBudget Sheet.
application_process.html_content:
Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship 2024 applications are accepted through an online process. As a prospective candidate, you have to complete the online Aga Khan Application and submit it at the University of Victoria Scholarship website, along with all the documents.

How to Apply for Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship 2024?

The step-by-step procedure for Aga Khan Scholarship 2024 are given below:

Step I: Create a NetLink ID and sign onto your UVic My Page using the same.

Step II: Select “Student Services”. If you have not yet received admission confirmation, select “ Applicant Services”.

Step III: Select “View and Apply for awards/scholarships”

Step IV: On my page account, select the "Aga Khan Academy Scholarship Application" and 2024-25 as the study period.

Step V: Complete the application form.

Step VI: Send in the required student supporting documents. Also, ask your nominator to send in the required Nominator Documentation: Form B, reference letter

Student Supporting Documentation

  • Awards/ Recognition Statement listing all your awards, prizes, and recognition of the last three years. The date and details of the awarding institutions should be mentioned as well.
  • Answering the essay question in 500 words. Talking about your recent challenges and how you responded to them. Also, how that experience can help you transition to student life at the University of Victoria
  • Activities statement which includes a list of all extracurricular and volunteer activities of the last 3 years, with proper date and hours of involvement
  • A community reference letter which is written by a person( other than a family member) including details of the name, contact email, and period in which they know you, properly attested should be sent to entrance@uvic.ca.
  • Financial Need Assessment: For this, you need to complete the Budget Sheet.

selection_process.description: After the submission of the application form, candidates are selected by a panel of selectors. Mails are sent to the shortlisted candidates regarding the same.Factors Affecting the Scholarship Selection DecisionThe recipient of the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship is selected based on factors like,Academic ExcellenceLeadership QualityCommunity ServiceInvolvement in the school activitiesFinancial requirementCareer Objective
selection_process.html_content:
After the submission of the application form, candidates are selected by a panel of selectors. Mails are sent to the shortlisted candidates regarding the same.

Factors Affecting the Scholarship Selection Decision

The recipient of the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship is selected based on factors like,

  • Academic Excellence
  • Leadership Quality
  • Community Service
  • Involvement in the school activities
  • Financial requirement
  • Career Objective

grant_details.description: Each year, applications for the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship are invited in January or February. Students are nominated by the officials of the academy. However, the Scholarship application process has to be completed by the nominated students only.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship program:Study-LevelUndergraduateEligible CandidatesInternational students, studying at UG course at the University of VictoriaNumber of ScholarshipLimited numbersStudy-Length4 yearsScholarship Award65,980 USD (in 4 installments)Award DistributedAnnually( renewed for 3 years after the first year)Terms and Conditions of Aga Khan Academy Renewable ScholarshipAlong with knowing how to obtain the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship 2024 scholarship, it is significant for each applicant to know the scholarship’s terms and conditions. They are as follows:The applicant can collect the forms through the nearest Aga office in the residence’s country/current residence.The 2024-2025 cycle will open in January 2024.The applicant should be a 1st year UG student at the University and should be nominated by the Aga Khan Academy for a scholarship.Canadian residential students are not eligible for the scholarship.Prospective applicants who wish tostudy in Canadaare advised to regularly check the University’s official website for updates.
grant_details.html_content:
Each year, applications for the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship are invited in January or February. Students are nominated by the officials of the academy. However, the Scholarship application process has to be completed by the nominated students only.

The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship program:

Study-Level Undergraduate
Eligible Candidates International students, studying at UG course at the University of Victoria
Number of Scholarship Limited numbers
Study-Length 4 years
Scholarship Award 65,980 USD (in 4 installments)
Award Distributed Annually( renewed for 3 years after the first year)

Terms and Conditions of Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship

Along with knowing how to obtain the Aga Khan Academy Renewable Scholarship 2024 scholarship, it is significant for each applicant to know the scholarship’s terms and conditions. They are as follows:

  • The applicant can collect the forms through the nearest Aga office in the residence’s country/current residence.
  • The 2024-2025 cycle will open in January 2024.
  • The applicant should be a 1st year UG student at the University and should be nominated by the Aga Khan Academy for a scholarship.
  • Canadian residential students are not eligible for the scholarship.

Prospective applicants who wish to study in Canada are advised to regularly check the University’s official website for updates.

description:
Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship is a merit-based grant that is awarded to one Indian scholar each year. Funded by the Government of India, the grant offers the recipient a chance to study/research at St. Antony's College as a Junior Research Fellow.

The primary aim of the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship is to promote specialisation in modern Indian Studies in the field of History, Political Science and Economics. Initially, the scholarship is awarded for one year only. The tenure may be extended by one more year, depending upon the performance of the candidate at St. Antony’s College, Oxford (U.K.).

The fellowship covers tuition fees, administration charges, and travel allowances and provides a stipend against college lunches and six high table dinner. The table below gives an estimated cost of the fellowship amount for one year:

Purpose Amount
Stipend Amount 24,399 USD
Administration charges 4347 USD
Travel Allowance 984 USD
6 High Table Dinner 751 USD
College Lunches 2,662 USD
Total 33,143 USD

The recipient of the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship is also given a return Air travel allowance, in an Economy class. The travel allowance is also applicable for the scholar’s spouse, only if he/she stay in the UK along with the scholar for a continuous period of one year. However, if the spouse lives with the candidate, then the candidate will have to meet the expenses of the spouse by himself/herself, as the fellowship amount is given only for a single person.

The Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship award is distributed annually and is renewable for the next year, depending upon the performance of the student in the University and the financial need of the recipient.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship, each applicant needs to establish eligibility on several grounds.Academic QualificationsConsistent academic performanceMinimum 60% in post-graduationPh.D. degree with a specialisation in Economics, History, or Political Science.Apart from the academic qualifications listed above, the candidate must also fulfil the following requirements:Citizenship:Be an Indian national currently residing in India.Age:Must be within the age group of 30-40 years.Experience:Minimum of 3 years of teaching experience at the UG or PG level.Note:If the applicant has studied abroad for more than six months, it is then mandatory for them to live in India for at least three consecutive years. Only after fulfilling this condition, an applicant applies for the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship. Moreover, they must mention the specific dates indicating the period of their stay.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship, each applicant needs to establish eligibility on several grounds.

Academic Qualifications

  • Consistent academic performance
  • Minimum 60% in post-graduation
  • Ph.D. degree with a specialisation in Economics, History, or Political Science.

Apart from the academic qualifications listed above, the candidate must also fulfil the following requirements:

  • Citizenship: Be an Indian national currently residing in India.
  • Age: Must be within the age group of 30-40 years.
  • Experience: Minimum of 3 years of teaching experience at the UG or PG level.

Note: If the applicant has studied abroad for more than six months, it is then mandatory for them to live in India for at least three consecutive years. Only after fulfilling this condition, an applicant applies for the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship. Moreover, they must mention the specific dates indicating the period of their stay.

application_process.description: Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship applications are accepted through an online process. As a prospective applicant, they have to register at the officialMHRD website.Documents Required for Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial FellowshipAlong with the Ms. Agatha Harrision Memorial Fellowship 2025 applications, the following documents must also be uploaded:Self-attested degrees/ certificates of all previous examinations. The records must include the DOB.In the case of foreign degrees and diplomas, proof of equivalence should be furnished (Certified by the Competent Authority).Experience letter/certificate of EmploymentResearch Proposal:Precise program of study/research (at least 500 words) stating the justification of their research/study in the U.K.Photograph & Signature:Upload a recent passport-size photograph and signature. The dimensions and size of each should be 200x230 pixels and 530 KB, respectively.After the successful submission of the application form, along with the stated conditions, the names of the candidates for Interviews will be published on the website of the MHRD Ministry, and a confirmation mail will be sent to the shortlisted candidates.
application_process.html_content:
Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship applications are accepted through an online process. As a prospective applicant, they have to register at the official MHRD website.

Documents Required for Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship

Along with the Ms. Agatha Harrision Memorial Fellowship 2025 applications, the following documents must also be uploaded:

  • Self-attested degrees/ certificates of all previous examinations. The records must include the DOB.
  • In the case of foreign degrees and diplomas, proof of equivalence should be furnished (Certified by the Competent Authority).
  • Experience letter/certificate of Employment
  • Research Proposal: Precise program of study/research (at least 500 words) stating the justification of their research/ study in the U.K.
  • Photograph & Signature: Upload a recent passport-size photograph and signature. The dimensions and size of each should be 200x230 pixels and 530 KB, respectively.

After the successful submission of the application form, along with the stated conditions, the names of the candidates for Interviews will be published on the website of the MHRD Ministry, and a confirmation mail will be sent to the shortlisted candidates.

selection_process.description: Merely fulfillment of the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship eligibility and completion of the application does not guarantee selection. The MHRD selection committee scrutinizes each application based on which a list is compiled, shortlisting the selected candidates.These candidates are sent an invitation letter for an individual interview session. After the interview, the committee announces the selected name of the candidate for Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship. This name is displayed on the MHRD Ministry website. The decision of the committee is final and cannot be challenged.
selection_process.html_content:
Merely fulfillment of the Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship eligibility and completion of the application does not guarantee selection. The MHRD selection committee scrutinizes each application based on which a list is compiled, shortlisting the selected candidates.

These candidates are sent an invitation letter for an individual interview session. After the interview, the committee announces the selected name of the candidate for Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship. This name is displayed on the MHRD Ministry website. The decision of the committee is final and cannot be challenged.

grant_details.html_content:
Study-Level Research
Eligible Candidates Indian Students holding specialisation in History/ Political Science/ Economics with Ph.D. and 3 years of teaching experience
Number of Scholarships 1
Study-Length N/A
Scholarship Award 100% Tuition Fees and Stipend for the 1st year
Award Distributed Annually

*Note: The application process takes place in January. Regular updates for the application process, flash on the Ministry website. After the application submission, the interview is conducted in March each year.

Terms and Conditions of Ms. Agatha Harrison Memorial Fellowship 2025

  • The decision of the selection committee is final.
  • The applicant should carry out their study/ research in the UK.
  • Applications should be submitted in English only.
  • The application and documents once submitted, they will not be returned in any case.
  • Applicant should have completed his/her tertiary education in English medium only.
  • Applications will not be accepted after the deadline. There are chances of disqualification of the candidate if the application is not submitted in time.

Applicants must return to work in their home country after the completion of their studies.

description:
The Zutshi-Smith Scholarship program is established as a legacy of the late Dr. Derek Zutshi (MB ChB 1957, Hon LLD 1999). The program offers one Indian research student to pursue any Ph.D. program at the University of Bristol. 

While the scholarship program is offered to all the eligible Indian students, the preference will be given to the applicants belonging to Kashmir.

The latest deadline is yet to come, not available right now.

The University of Bristol fully funds the selected student’s 4 years of education at the university. The Zutshi-Smith Scholarship award amount covers the following expenses:

Expense Covered or not
Tuition and Fees Yes
Accommodation Yes
Living Cost Yes
Travel Cost (Air Fare) Yes
Application  No

Note: Accommodation is also provided at the University’s residence halls during the first year of study. If the student chooses to stay at the University’s residence halls then the stipend is reduced to cover up the Hall Fees.

eligibility_criteria.description: To qualify for the Zutshi-Smith Scholarship, prospective applicants have to fulfill the following requirements:Must be a resident in India. Preference will be given to Kashmiri applicants.Must have securedadmission at the University of Bristol.Must have enrolled for a Ph.D. program at the university.Since there aren’t any stringent eligibility requirements, only the students who fulfill the criteria given above will be considered for the award.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To qualify for the Zutshi-Smith Scholarship, prospective applicants have to fulfill the following requirements:

  • Must be a resident in India. Preference will be given to Kashmiri applicants.
  • Must have secured admission at the University of Bristol.
  • Must have enrolled for a Ph.D. program at the university.

Since there aren’t any stringent eligibility requirements, only the students who fulfill the criteria given above will be considered for the award.

application_process.description: The application process for the Zutshi-Smith Scholarship program is administered at the University of Bristol. Applicants are required to complete an online scholarship application form available on the university’s page.Note:- Applications are closed and may not reopen until 2027/28.
application_process.html_content:
The application process for the Zutshi-Smith Scholarship program is administered at the University of Bristol. Applicants are required to complete an online scholarship application form available on the university’s page.

Note:- Applications are closed and may not reopen until 2027/28.

selection_process.description: The Zutshi-Smith Scholarship selection process includes an evaluation of several elements included in scholarship application like,Academic gradesReferencesStatement of purposeWork experience, if anyResearch proposalBased on these elements, the selection committee finalizes a Zutshi-Smith Scholarship recipient.
selection_process.html_content:
The Zutshi-Smith Scholarship selection process includes an evaluation of several elements included in scholarship application like,

  • Academic grades
  • References
  • Statement of purpose
  • Work experience, if any
  • Research proposal

Based on these elements, the selection committee finalizes a Zutshi-Smith Scholarship recipient.

grant_details.description: The Zutshi-Smith scholarship was established to provide financial assistance to an Indian student pursuing a doctorate degree at the University of Bristol. The scholarship is named after Dr. Zutshi who was from Srinagar. He studied medicine at the University of Bristol and maintained close connections with the university after graduation.The scholarship program provides annual payments that are meant to cover the entire year’s tuition and fees. A stipend is also paid to cover the research costs the student would have to face. The total scholarship awards a total of 25,180.01 USD to the recipient.
grant_details.html_content:
The Zutshi-Smith scholarship was established to provide financial assistance to an Indian student pursuing a doctorate degree at the University of Bristol. The scholarship is named after Dr. Zutshi who was from Srinagar. He studied medicine at the University of Bristol and maintained close connections with the university after graduation.

The scholarship program provides annual payments that are meant to cover the entire year’s tuition and fees. A stipend is also paid to cover the research costs the student would have to face. The total scholarship awards a total of 25,180.01 USD to the recipient.

description:
The HASS Scholarship for Excellence offers a partial-grant to exceptionally intelligent undergraduates seeking admission in the Faculty of Humanities and Social science at the University of Queensland. Scholarship Grant up to 10,000 AUD (5,58,374 INR) p.a. is awarded to each selected candidate

The scholarship can be extended over two years under very special circumstances by writing to the Executive Dean of the Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for the HASS- Excellence Scholarships, applicants have to opt for a full-time graduate program at the University of Queensland’s Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences.In addition to this, an applicant must:be anIndian citizenwho is residing in India at the time of the application.have completed anundergraduate degree from an Indian institution.have received an unconditional admission offer for a postgraduate program at UQ.The academic session must be beginning in September 2020.not hold any other scholarships simultaneouslyThose who have already received financial aid must highlight it in their scholarship application.All scholarship applicants are required to submit necessary documents to back up their claims, in order to be eligible for the scholarship.Applicants can contact the association regarding any queries at the followingemail id:engagement@hass.uq.edu.au
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for the HASS- Excellence Scholarships, applicants have to opt for a full-time graduate program at the University of Queensland’s Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences.

In addition to this, an applicant must:

  • be an Indian citizen who is residing in India at the time of the application.
  • have completed an undergraduate degree from an Indian institution.
  • have received an unconditional admission offer for a postgraduate program at UQ.
    • The academic session must be beginning in September 2020.
  • not hold any other scholarships simultaneously
    • Those who have already received financial aid must highlight it in their scholarship application.

All scholarship applicants are required to submit necessary documents to back up their claims, in order to be eligible for the scholarship.

Applicants can contact the association regarding any queries at the following email id: engagement@hass.uq.edu.au

application_process.description: Applicants who fulfill the eligibility criteria for the UQ HASS Scholarship for Excellence can apply for the scholarship.The University of Queensland has a separate online application process for the scholarship. However, before applying for the scholarship, applicants must receive their admission letter from the university.Admission Checklist for Postgraduate Program at UQEnglish language proficiencyTOEFL-iBT: 87TOEFL-PBT: 570IELTS: 6.7Pearson Academic: 64Relevant bachelor’s degree with a minimum GPA of 4.50 on a 7.0 scale.Standardized testlike GMAT, GRE (if applicable)An updated CVNote:Applicants must adhere to the HASS Scholarship for Excellence application deadline established by the university.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants who fulfill the eligibility criteria for the UQ HASS Scholarship for Excellence can apply for the scholarship.

The University of Queensland has a separate online application process for the scholarship. However, before applying for the scholarship, applicants must receive their admission letter from the university.

Admission Checklist for Postgraduate Program at UQ

  • English language proficiency
    • TOEFL-iBT: 87
    • TOEFL-PBT: 570
    • IELTS: 6.7
    • Pearson Academic: 64
  • Relevant bachelor’s degree with a minimum GPA of 4.50 on a 7.0 scale.
  • Standardized test like GMAT, GRE (if applicable)
  • An updated CV

Note: Applicants must adhere to the HASS Scholarship for Excellence application deadline established by the university.

selection_process.description: All the applications are reviewed by the selection panel and since this is a merit-based scholarship, the selection process for the HASS scholarship is based on the following factors:Academic qualificationsGRE or GMAT scoresStatement of PurposeReferencesThe selection is done solely on the basis of applications. The selection committee takes the final decision and informs the awardees via email.Terms and ConditionsStudents have to fulfill all requirements associated with their student visasOverseas Student Health Cover is a compulsory requirement of your student visa.Students are expected to perform well and achieve good results academically.Students have to participate in a photoshoot and Testimonial for the Faculty, which is published on the website and used for other promotional purposes.In the case of deferring, transfer, or withdrawal from the program, students have to inform the Executive dean in writing.The scholarship is terminated if the student does not complete the academic year at UQ or fails to maintain full-time study
selection_process.html_content:
All the applications are reviewed by the selection panel and since this is a merit-based scholarship, the selection process for the HASS scholarship is based on the following factors:

  • Academic qualifications
  • GRE or GMAT scores
  • Statement of Purpose
  • References

The selection is done solely on the basis of applications. The selection committee takes the final decision and informs the awardees via email.

Terms and Conditions

  • Students have to fulfill all requirements associated with their student visas
    • Overseas Student Health Cover is a compulsory requirement of your student visa.
  • Students are expected to perform well and achieve good results academically.
  • Students have to participate in a photoshoot and Testimonial for the Faculty, which is published on the website and used for other promotional purposes.
  • In the case of deferring, transfer, or withdrawal from the program, students have to inform the Executive dean in writing.
  • The scholarship is terminated if the student does not complete the academic year at UQ or fails to maintain full-time study

grant_details.description: The HASS scholarship for Excellence covers a grant of up to 10,000 AUD per year for tuition fees. The scholars can make a request forthe extension of scholarshipto the Executive Dean of the Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences only under the following circumstances:If, due to sickness or significant personal conditions, a student need to delay the start of studies for a limited duration of one yearIf the scholarship recipient fails to continue studying for a maximum duration of 1 year, the scholarship will be revoked.The HASS scholarship is a great opportunity for undergraduate students with unexceptional academic qualifications to pursue their post-graduation at the University of Queensland.The application process for the year 2022 will start in August 2021.Contact number: (07) 3346 7557
grant_details.html_content:
The HASS scholarship for Excellence covers a grant of up to 10,000 AUD per year for tuition fees. The scholars can make a request for the extension of scholarship to the Executive Dean of the Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences only under the following circumstances:

  • If, due to sickness or significant personal conditions, a student need to delay the start of studies for a limited duration of one year

If the scholarship recipient fails to continue studying for a maximum duration of 1 year, the scholarship will be revoked.

The HASS scholarship is a great opportunity for undergraduate students with unexceptional academic qualifications to pursue their post-graduation at the University of Queensland.

The application process for the year 2022 will start in August 2021.

Contact number: (07) 3346 7557

description:
ANU Study Canberra India Scholarships are a joint venture of Australian National University and Study Canberra. This scholarship scheme is developed especially for meritorious Indian residents who have studied in India immediately prior to applying to ANU.

The scholarship is jointly funded by the Australian National University and the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) Government. Every year, up to five scholarships may be offered annually to eligible in Indian students admitted to UG or PG level program at Australian National University.

The latest deadline is yet to come, not available right now.

The distribution of ANU Study Canberra India Scholarships are:

Semester UG Scholarships PG Scholarships
Semester 1 2 1
Semester 2 1 1

Benefits of ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship

eligibility_criteria.description: The Australian National University follows strict eligibility criteria for ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship. As per the guidelines, eligible candidates will be the ones who fulfill all the requirements mentioned below:Holds Indian citizenshipCompleted of the most recent degree/certificate/diploma from an Indian institution.Enrolled in a single/doubleUG or PG program at Australian National University.Consistent academic results in secondary or undergraduate level.Received an unconditional offeradmission to the ANUbefore the deadline of the scholarship.Note:A spouse or a dependent, of an employee of diplomatic or consular missions, may apply for this scholarship at the graduate level. However, such applicants are not permitted to apply for this scholarship at the undergraduate level.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Australian National University follows strict eligibility criteria for ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship. As per the guidelines, eligible candidates will be the ones who fulfill all the requirements mentioned below:

  • Holds Indian citizenship
  • Completed of the most recent degree/certificate/diploma from an Indian institution.
  • Enrolled in a single/double UG or PG program at Australian National University.
  • Consistent academic results in secondary or undergraduate level.
  • Received an unconditional offer admission to the ANU before the deadline of the scholarship. 

Note: A spouse or a dependent, of an employee of diplomatic or consular missions, may apply for this scholarship at the graduate level. However, such applicants are not permitted to apply for this scholarship at the undergraduate level.

application_process.description: Eligible candidates have to apply for the ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship separately from their admission applications.The scholarship application process is entirely electronic and must be completed by the closing dates set by the Division of Student Recruitment and published on the ANU website.
application_process.html_content:
Eligible candidates have to apply for the ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship separately from their admission applications.

The scholarship application process is entirely electronic and must be completed by the closing dates set by the Division of Student Recruitment and published on the ANU website.

selection_process.description: A selection committee comprises of the Student Recruitment (or nominee), the Regional Manager or Manager, International Recruitment, the Manager International Admissions, and a representative from Study Canberra. It is chaired by the Associate Director.Selection for the ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship is intensely competitive and only the very best candidates are considered for the award. Students are selected based on their academic excellence and scholarship application.On getting selected for the scholarship, a student gets an offer letter for the same, in which the scholarship amount is stated.Note:Depending upon the applicant pool, it is within the rights of the selection committee to alter the number of awards or even refuse to award any scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
A selection committee comprises of the Student Recruitment (or nominee), the Regional Manager or Manager, International Recruitment, the Manager International Admissions, and a representative from Study Canberra. It is chaired by the Associate Director.

Selection for the ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship is intensely competitive and only the very best candidates are considered for the award. Students are selected based on their academic excellence and scholarship application. 

On getting selected for the scholarship, a student gets an offer letter for the same, in which the scholarship amount is stated. 

Note: Depending upon the applicant pool, it is within the rights of the selection committee to alter the number of awards or even refuse to award any scholarship.

grant_details.description: Offered to Indian students of ANU undergraduate and graduate programs, ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship a highly competitive scholarship scheme. Students with exceptional academic records, impactful application and SOP are considered for the scholarship.Some significant grant details of ANU Study Canberra Scholarships are tabulated in the following table:Applicable forAustralian National UniversityLevel of studyUndergraduate and PostgraduateApplicable ProgramsAll UG and PG programs at ANUAward Value6,818 USD per yearApplication SystemOnlineNo. of Scholarships5Award Distributed2 installmentsThe scholarship is meant for one fully loaded semester of 24 credits. Recipients are responsible for incurring the expenses of their tuition fees, supplies, accommodation and miscellaneous expenses for the duration of their program at ANU.Terms and ConditionsRecipients of this scholarship are not allowed to simultaneously hold any other scholarships, awards, grants, and bursaries.Any breach of academic and conduct related requirements shall result in the cancellation of the scholarship.Recipients who fail to comply with the scholarship guidelines may be asked to refund the scholarship award received.Students who receive this award may be required to participate in its publicity and may be required to appear for interviews and a photograph session under the aegis the Strategic Communications and Public Affairs Office of the University.
grant_details.html_content:
Offered to Indian students of ANU undergraduate and graduate programs, ANU Study Canberra India Scholarship a highly competitive scholarship scheme. Students with exceptional academic records, impactful application and SOP are considered for the scholarship. 

Some significant grant details of ANU Study Canberra Scholarships are tabulated in the following table:

Applicable for Australian National University
Level of study Undergraduate and Postgraduate
Applicable Programs All UG and PG programs at ANU
Award Value 6,818 USD per year
Application System Online
No. of Scholarships 5
Award Distributed 2 installments

The scholarship is meant for one fully loaded semester of 24 credits. Recipients are responsible for incurring the expenses of their tuition fees, supplies, accommodation and miscellaneous expenses for the duration of their program at ANU.

Terms and Conditions

  • Recipients of this scholarship are not allowed to simultaneously hold any other scholarships, awards, grants, and bursaries. 
  • Any breach of academic and conduct related requirements shall result in the cancellation of the scholarship. 
  • Recipients who fail to comply with the scholarship guidelines may be asked to refund the scholarship award received.

Students who receive this award may be required to participate in its publicity and may be required to appear for interviews and a photograph session under the aegis the Strategic Communications and Public Affairs Office of the University.

description: Macquarie University India Scholarships is awarded to talented international students from India who intends to pursue a coursework degree at Macquarie University offsetting almost a third of their annual tuition fees. The scholarships is open for Indian students all the year around, which means the eligible students will be considered for scholarship regardless of the term they are applying to. Macquarie University India Scholarship is valued at 10,000 AUD per year for the duration of your Bachelor's or Master's coursework degree (5,000 AUD will be credited each session). First payment of 10,000 AUD will be disbursed in the second session of your first year of enrolment, with 5,000 AUD disbursed in each subsequent session for the duration of the course.

eligibility_criteria.description: To avail Macquarie University India scholarship, the candidate must fulfill the below eligibility requirements.Eligibility Requirements:Candidate must be an Indian citizenAccept the offer letter and pay the commencement fee by the given deadline.Remain enrolled in the programStep 2: Fulfilling Macquarie UG/PG Admission Requirements:Candidates apply for respectiveMacquarie UG and PG programsmust fulfill the admission requirements given the following table:Study LevelMinimum GPALOR(s)SOP/ ProposalMinimum ELP scoreUndergraduate2.5RequiredNot RequiredIELTS: 6.5Postgraduate3.0RequiredRequiredIELTS: 7.0Step 3: Accepting Admission OfferAccept your Letter of Offer and pay the commencement fee by the Acceptance Deadline.Remain enrolled in each compulsory study period.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To avail Macquarie University India scholarship, the candidate must fulfill the below eligibility requirements. 

Eligibility Requirements:

  • Candidate must be an Indian citizen
  • Accept the offer letter and pay the commencement fee by the given deadline.
  • Remain enrolled in the program

Step 2: Fulfilling Macquarie UG/PG Admission Requirements:

Candidates apply for respective Macquarie UG and PG programs must fulfill the admission requirements given the following table:

Study Level Minimum GPA LOR(s) SOP/ Proposal Minimum ELP score
Undergraduate 2.5 Required Not Required IELTS: 6.5
Postgraduate 3.0 Required Required IELTS: 7.0

Step 3: Accepting Admission Offer

  • Accept your Letter of Offer and pay the commencement fee by the Acceptance Deadline.
  • Remain enrolled in each compulsory study period.

application_process.description: To apply for Mcquarie University Early Acceptance Scholarship, an applicant must receive the offer letter from the university. The eligible candidates will be automatically considered for the scholarships based on their program level. To avail the scholarship, prospective candidates must submit an application for undergraduate or postgraduate stiyd at Macquarie University. The candidate must have met the minimum eligibility criteria as required by the course he applied for.
application_process.html_content: To apply for Mcquarie University Early Acceptance Scholarship, an applicant must receive the offer letter from the university. The eligible candidates will be automatically considered for the scholarships based on their program level. To avail the scholarship, prospective candidates must submit an application for undergraduate or postgraduate stiyd at Macquarie University. The candidate must have met the minimum eligibility criteria as required by the course he applied for.

selection_process.description: The selection of the students for the Macquarie University India Scholarship ismerit-based. After the students are admitted into their respective UG and PG programs, the selection panel reviews their admission applications for the scholarship. Based on this, the university officials select the recipient.Terms and ConditionsScholarship aspirants and recipients should adhere to the terms and conditions mentioned below:Students should enroll and begin their classes according to the Offer letter.Should meet the university’s academic progression policy.Scholarship applies to only on-campus study and does not apply to theMaster of Management course.Shouldnot be a recipientof an external government-sponsored scholarship program.Australian or New Zealand students who hold permanent residency in Australia arenot eligible for this scholarship.In case the recipient withdraw from the program before completion, scholarship moneymust be repaid.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of the students for the Macquarie University India Scholarship is merit-based. After the students are admitted into their respective UG and PG programs, the selection panel reviews their admission applications for the scholarship. Based on this, the university officials select the recipient.

Terms and Conditions

Scholarship aspirants and recipients should adhere to the terms and conditions mentioned below:

  • Students should enroll and begin their classes according to the Offer letter.
  • Should meet the university’s academic progression policy.
  • Scholarship applies to only on-campus study and does not apply to the Master of Management course.
  • Should not be a recipient of an external government-sponsored scholarship program.
  • Australian or New Zealand students who hold permanent residency in Australia are not eligible for this scholarship.
  • In case the recipient withdraw from the program before completion, scholarship money must be repaid.

grant_details.description: Applicable forStudents of Macquarie University, batch 2025-2026Applicable programsAll Bachelors and Masters program (except Masters of Management courses)Eligible candidatesIndian Citizens onlyLevel of studyUndergraduate and postgraduateBenefitFee reductionApplication systemOnline/ postMacquarie University India Scholarship is a great opportunity for Indian students who want tostudy in Australia. Macquarie University is one of the best-known research colleges in Sydney. And through this scholarship, they are encouraging Indian talents. As the scholarship is merit-based, so the students who are good in academics and want to study abroad can apply for Macquarie University for higher studies.
grant_details.html_content:
Applicable for  Students of Macquarie University, batch 2025-2026
Applicable programs All Bachelors and Masters program (except Masters of Management courses)
Eligible candidates Indian Citizens only

Macquarie University India Scholarship is a great opportunity for Indian students who want to study in Australia. Macquarie University is one of the best-known research colleges in Sydney. And through this scholarship, they are encouraging Indian talents. As the scholarship is merit-based, so the students who are good in academics and want to study abroad can apply for Macquarie University for higher studies.

scholarship_name: Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship-NUI
description:
Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship program is specifically designed for the Indian students, who excel in academics and take admission in the Master-level program at the National University of Ireland Galway.

The latest deadline is yet to come, not available right now.

Of all the applications, the selection committee finalizes three students for the Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship. The benefits of the scholarship program have been tabulated below:

Category Included or not
Tuition fees Yes
Accommodation No
Living Expenses No

Terms and Conditions of the Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship:

Both applicants and recipients of Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship must adhere to the terms and conditions given below:

About Max Arthur Macauliffe

He joined Indian Civil Services in 1862 and held several senior positions until his retirement in 1893. He was a prolific scholar and an Indian culture immersed person. He became well renowned for translating Sikh scripture and history into English and for promotion of Sikkim and Punjabi Culture at an International level in the late 19th century.

eligibility_criteria.description: The eligibility requirements for NUI’s Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarships are:Applicant must an Indian citizen.The applicant must have securedadmission at NUIfor a Taught-Master’s program.The applicant must hold a four-year bachelor’s degree from a reputed institution.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The eligibility requirements for NUI’s Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarships are:

  • Applicant must an Indian citizen.
  • The applicant must have secured admission at NUI for a Taught-Master’s program.
  • The applicant must hold a four-year bachelor’s degree from a reputed institution.

application_process.description: The application process for the Max Arthur Macauliffe Merit Scholarship consists oftwo stages:Stage 1:Application for admission to the National University of Ireland.Stage 2:Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship Application.Along with the scholarship application, applicants have tosubmit a personal statement.It should be written inMS Word in a maximum of 1,000 words. The statement should include,Applicant’s interest in studying atNUI Galway.How the applicant foresees his/her relationship with the university in the future.How the applicant will promote links with the university, both during the tenure of the scholarship and as alumni.The personal statement must be emailed to InternationalMarketingRecruitment@nuigalway.ie. It should include a title of the scholarship scheme the applicant is applying for in the subject of the email and also the PAC application number.Note:Within 10 days of scholarship application submission, applicants will get e-receipt confirming the same
application_process.html_content:
The application process for the Max Arthur Macauliffe Merit Scholarship consists of two stages:

Stage 1: Application for admission to the National University of Ireland.
Stage 2: Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship Application.

Along with the scholarship application, applicants have to submit a personal statement. It should be written in MS Word in a maximum of 1,000 words. The statement should include,

  • Applicant’s interest in studying at NUI Galway.
  • How the applicant foresees his/her relationship with the university in the future.
  • How the applicant will promote links with the university, both during the tenure of the scholarship and as alumni.

The personal statement must be emailed to InternationalMarketingRecruitment@nuigalway.ie. It should include a title of the scholarship scheme the applicant is applying for in the subject of the email and also the PAC application number. 

Note: Within 10 days of scholarship application submission, applicants will get e-receipt confirming the same

selection_process.description: Recipients of the scholarship are selected based on theiracademic meritandpersonal statement.Each scholarship application is also reviewed to ensure that the student has applied for theIreland student VISA.Note:NUI Galway reserves the right to terminate the scholarship if the recipient fails to adhere to the terms and conditions.
selection_process.html_content:
Recipients of the scholarship are selected based on their academic merit and personal statement. 

Each scholarship application is also reviewed to ensure that the student has applied for the  Ireland student VISA. 

Note: NUI Galway reserves the right to terminate the scholarship if the recipient fails to adhere to the terms and conditions.

grant_details.description: Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship is awarded each year to remind the contribution of Max Arthur Macauliffe, who graduated from Galway with a degree in history, languages, and classics, in 1863.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Max Arthur Macauliffe Special Merit Scholarship 2020.Study-LevelMastersEligible CandidatesIndian Students who will pursue Masters at NUI GalwayNumber of Scholarship3Study-Length2 yearsScholarship AwardEquivalent to the tuition fee of the courseAward DistributedAnnually(One time only)

description:
The Sussex India Scholarships are offered to Indian students commencing postgraduate-level programs at the University of Sussex. Under this scheme, the university offers an unlimited number of scholarships to eligible applicants. 

Recipients of the Sussex India Scholarship program are rewarded with a tuition fee reduction. Selections are based on the applicant’s academic ability, financial requirements, and other eligibility criteria listed by the university.

eligibility_criteria.description: Foremostley, to be eligible for the Sussex India Scholarship, applicants must be enrolled in an eligiblePG program at the University of Sussex.Students will be shortlisted for the scholarship on the basis of the eligibility criteria as defined by the university.Theeligibility criteriaestablished by the University of Sussex is mentioned below:Nationality:Indian or permanently domiciled in India.Proof of residency is a must.Financial Sufficiency:Should be a self-financing student and should be able to show financial support equal to the cost of attendance.The student should haveaccepted an offer for a Masters’s courseat the University of Sussex,starting september 2026There are a few factors due to which the candidates areconsidered ineligible for the Sussex India Scholarship, have a look:Students who have the benefit of any other Sussex scholarship like the Chancellors International Scholarship.Students going to pursue any of the mentioned courses will not be considered eligible for the scholarship:Postgraduate diplomasCorruption, Law and Governance LLMMA(Development Studies, Globalization, Early years in Education, Business and Development, Development and Public Policy, Governance, Poverty and Development, Power, Participation and Social Change)PGCE course and a Masters’s degree in Social Work.Students with an offer to study in the University of Sussex Business School will be able to combine this award with the Business School International Masters Award (2026). Students with an offer to study in the School of Engineering & Informatics will be able to combine this award with the Engineering & Informatics International Masters Award (2026).
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Foremostley, to be eligible for the Sussex India Scholarship, applicants must be enrolled in an eligible PG program at the University of Sussex.

Students will be shortlisted for the scholarship on the basis of the eligibility criteria as defined by the university. 

The eligibility criteria established by the University of Sussex is mentioned below:

  • Nationality: Indian or permanently domiciled in India.
    • Proof of residency is a must.
  • Financial Sufficiency: Should be a self-financing student and should be able to show financial support equal to the cost of attendance. 
  • The student should have accepted an offer for a Masters’s course at the University of Sussex,starting september 2026

There are a few factors due to which the candidates are considered ineligible for the Sussex India Scholarship, have a look:

  • Students who have the benefit of any other Sussex scholarship like the Chancellors International Scholarship.
  • Students going to pursue any of the mentioned courses will not be considered eligible for the scholarship:
    • Postgraduate diplomas 
    • Corruption, Law and Governance LLM
    • MA(Development Studies, Globalization, Early years in Education, Business and Development, Development and Public Policy, Governance, Poverty and Development, Power, Participation and Social Change)
    • PGCE course and a Masters’s degree in Social Work.
  • Students with an offer to study in the University of Sussex Business School will be able to combine this award with the Business School International Masters Award (2026). Students with an offer to study in the School of Engineering & Informatics will be able to combine this award with the Engineering & Informatics International Masters Award (2026).

application_process.description: Register your interest in the scholarship via PG Apply when you accept our offer of a place on an eligible Masters course.  If you have applied via one of our overseas representatives, you will need to ask them to do this on your behalf. You will only be able to accept one University of Sussex scholarship.You must declare your interest in the scholarship via PG Apply before you register on your Masters degree. Information about the scholarship will be included in your CAS (Confirmation of Acceptance for Study) for your visa application, when it is produced. If the scholarship information is not showing on your CAS or you want to register for the scholarship after the CAS has been created, please contact Admissions:pg.applicants@sussex.ac.uk.

• Register your interest in the scholarship via PG Apply when you accept our offer of a place on an eligible Masters course.  If you have applied via one of our overseas representatives, you will need to ask them to do this on your behalf. You will only be able to accept one University of Sussex scholarship.
  • You must declare your interest in the scholarship via PG Apply before you register on your Masters degree. Information about the scholarship will be included in your CAS (Confirmation of Acceptance for Study) for your visa application, when it is produced. If the scholarship information is not showing on your CAS or you want to register for the scholarship after the CAS has been created, please contact Admissions: pg.applicants@sussex.ac.uk.

selection_process.description: After the submission of the Sussex India Scholarship application form, the scholarship evaluation panel reviews each application comprehensively.While the applicant’s academic records and financial need will play a crucial role, other factors are considered at the time of selection. Some of these factors are:Applicant’s chosen programFinancial stabilityNationalityAcceptance of admission offerAlso, the recipient must be commencing the master’s program for the same session for which the scholarship is offered.
selection_process.html_content:
After the submission of the Sussex India Scholarship application form, the scholarship evaluation panel reviews each application comprehensively. 

While the applicant’s academic records and financial need will play a crucial role, other factors are considered at the time of selection. Some of these factors are:

  • Applicant’s chosen program
  • Financial stability
  • Nationality
  • Acceptance of admission offer

Also, the recipient must be commencing the master’s program for the same session for which the scholarship is offered.

grant_details.description: Each year, applications for the Sussex India Scholarship are invited, along with the Admissions in Masters programs. Self-financing Indian students with outstanding academic records can apply for this scholarship program.TheUniversity of Sussexoffers an unlimited number of scholarships for eligible candidates. The table below provides all the essential details regarding the Sussex India Scholarship 2023, provided by the University of Sussex.Study-LevelPostgraduate or MastersEligible CandidatesIndian students, studying at some specific PG courses at the University of SussexNumber of ScholarshipUnlimitedStudy-Length1 year (full-time), 2 years (part-time)Scholarship Award5413.64 USD one time onlyAward DistributionAnnuallyTerms and Conditions for Sussex India ScholarshipThere are no specific terms and conditions for the scholarship, the candidate is only required to match the minimum eligibility criteria apply for the Sussex India Scholarship before the deadline.If one has any doubts regarding the admissions or scholarship, please contactpg.applicants@sussex.ac.ukorscholarships@sussex.ac.uk
grant_details.html_content:
Each year, applications for the Sussex India Scholarship are invited, along with the Admissions in Masters programs. Self-financing Indian students with outstanding academic records can apply for this scholarship program.

The University of Sussex offers an unlimited number of scholarships for eligible candidates. The table below provides all the essential details regarding the Sussex India Scholarship 2023, provided by the University of Sussex. 

Study-Level Postgraduate or Masters
Eligible Candidates Indian students, studying at some specific PG courses at the University of Sussex
Number of Scholarship Unlimited
Study-Length 1 year (full-time), 2 years (part-time)
Scholarship Award 5413.64 USD one time only
Award Distribution Annually

Terms and Conditions for Sussex India Scholarship

There are no specific terms and conditions for the scholarship, the candidate is only required to match the minimum eligibility criteria apply for the Sussex India Scholarship before the deadline. 

If one has any doubts regarding the admissions or scholarship, please contact pg.applicants@sussex.ac.uk or scholarships@sussex.ac.uk

scholarship_name: Sir Ratan Tata Post-Doctoral Fellowship for South Asian students
description:
Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship program is a collaboration between the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust. The program is intended for Ph.D. holders belonging to South Asia, SAARC region (Bangladesh, India, Bhutan, Afghanistan, Nepal, Maldives, Pakistan, and Sir Lanka).

Under this program, one scholar is awarded a six-month fellowship at LSE India Observatory. The recipient gets a monthly allowance of 2,366.70 USD with access to research facilities and a shared workspace.

The selected fellow is expected to engage in social science research on the Economy and Society in India and South Asia with their primary focus on:

Also, the fellow must finish a research paper and make a presentation at the seminar organized by the India observatory.

Within the limits of this fellowship, assistance will be provided to the fellow towards the cost of travel to the U.K. and related outlays. However, no additional financial benefits will be provided to the fellow to facilitate the fieldwork or any other activities.

eligibility_criteria.description: The foremost eligibility criteria for Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship atLSEis that applicants must belong to the SAARC region.In addition to the eligible citizenship, applicants must fulfill the followingacademic requirements:Applicants should have been awarded their Ph.D. degrees.Applicants should have started their research work on social science with a focus on South Asia.Applicants should be employed at a recognized institution in the SAARC region.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The foremost eligibility criteria for Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship at LSE is that applicants must belong to the SAARC region.

In addition to the eligible citizenship, applicants must fulfill the following academic requirements:

  • Applicants should have been awarded their Ph.D. degrees.
  • Applicants should have started their research work on social science with a focus on South Asia.
  • Applicants should be employed at a recognized institution in the SAARC region.

application_process.description: The application process of Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship program can be summarized in three steps:Step I:Check the official website page and read the fellowship guidelines. The application guidelines for Sir Ratan Tata Fellowships 2020-21 will be available inFebruary 2020.Step II:Provide the required student supporting documents:ResumeCover letterResearch proposalLetters of recommendation (minimum two)Step III:Submit the completed application package viaemail(Word or PDF document) toIndia.Observatory@lse.ac.ukOR via post at the followingaddress:The Fellowships Selection Committee, India Observatory,London School of Economics & Political Science,Houghton Street, London WC2A 2AE, UKNote:Applicants are advised to only use A-4 sized plain paper and not to staple the application form with supporting documents.Application Form DeadlineApplications for Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship arenow closed.
application_process.html_content:
The application process of Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship program can be summarized in three steps:

Step I: Check the official website page and read the fellowship guidelines. The application guidelines for Sir Ratan Tata Fellowships 2020-21 will be available in February 2020.

Step II: Provide the required student supporting documents:

  • Resume
  • Cover letter
  • Research proposal
  • Letters of recommendation (minimum two)

Step III: Submit the completed application package via email (Word or PDF document) to India.Observatory@lse.ac.uk OR via post at the following address:

The Fellowships Selection Committee, India Observatory,

London School of Economics & Political Science,

Houghton Street, London WC2A 2AE, UK

Note: Applicants are advised to only use A-4 sized plain paper and not to staple the application form with supporting documents.

Application Form Deadline

Applications for Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship are now closed.

selection_process.description: The selection of the Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellow is done by the Fellowship Selection Committee of LSE. Based on the eligibility criteria, the committee shortlists applicants for an interview.The final decision of the Fellow is made after the interview. The committee’s decision is final and cannot be challenged by any applicant.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of the Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellow is done by the Fellowship Selection Committee of LSE. Based on the eligibility criteria, the committee shortlists applicants for an interview.

The final decision of the Fellow is made after the interview. The committee’s decision is final and cannot be challenged by any applicant.

grant_details.description: Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship program began in 1997 at the London School of Economics and Political Science. The institution partnered with the trust to encourage scholars from the SAARC region to pursue research in the field of Social Science.For every academic session, a Fellow is selected and awarded a monthly allowance of 2,337 USD. Along with this, the recipient is offered a shared workspace and access to research facilities at the school.The Sir Rata Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship 2020 application dates are yet to be announced by the institution.
grant_details.html_content:
Sir Ratan Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship program began in 1997 at the London School of Economics and Political Science. The institution partnered with the trust to encourage scholars from the SAARC region to pursue research in the field of Social Science.

For every academic session, a Fellow is selected and awarded a monthly allowance of 2,337 USD. Along with this, the recipient is offered a shared workspace and access to research facilities at the school.

The Sir Rata Tata Post-doctoral Fellowship 2020 application dates are yet to be announced by the institution.

description:
Deakin Vice-chancellor’s Meritorious Scholarship program offers a 100% tuition fee waiver to academically excellent Indian students. At the beginning of the academic session, four Deakin Meritorious scholarships are awarded to students pursuing STEM, Sports, Arts and one for any other area at Deakin University. For each program, the committee selects one recipient.

The deadline for this year has expired, try again next year.

As mentioned earlier, the recipients are rewarded with 100% tuition fee waivers for their chosen program. To understand the scholarship’s significance, the tuition fees of these programs are mentioned in the following table:

Program Name Tuition Fee 
STEM  20,210 USD-24,508 USD
Sports 26,910 USD
Arts 18,379 USD

Recipients will also receive a priority place for on-campus accommodation but it is subjected to availability and at their own cost.

Applicants must note that applying for Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious 100% Scholarship is not just limited to fulfilling the eligibility criteria or completing the application process. It is significant for each applicant to express their interest in becoming a member of the Deakin community.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious 100% Scholarship applicants must fulfill all the requirements given below:Citizenship:Only Indian nationals who are residing in India at the time of the application.Scholarship applications must be sent via authorized Deakin agent present in India.Academic requirements tosecure admission at Deakin University.Academic Eligibility CriteriaIt is important for each applicant to meet the following academic requirements established for the Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious Scholarship:For UG, an overall score of 85% is required in class 12 CBSE/ ICSE / State Board; OR10 overall in the General Certificate of Secondary Education exam.A score of 32 in the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme is required.For PG, an overall score of 80% in UG degree is required.Apart from these requirements, there is a minimum English language capability for every course. The applicant must fulfill that depending on what course they choose.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious 100% Scholarship applicants must fulfill all the requirements given below:

  • Citizenship: Only Indian nationals who are residing in India at the time of the application.
  • Scholarship applications must be sent via authorized Deakin agent present in India.
  • Academic requirements to secure admission at Deakin University.

Academic Eligibility Criteria

It is important for each applicant to meet the following academic requirements established for the Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious Scholarship:

  • For UG, an overall score of 85% is required in class 12 CBSE/ ICSE / State Board; OR
  • 10 overall in the General Certificate of Secondary Education exam.
  • A score of 32 in the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme is required.
  • For PG, an overall score of 80% in UG degree is required.

Apart from these requirements, there is a minimum English language capability for every course. The applicant must fulfill that depending on what course they choose.

application_process.description: The application process of Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious Scholarship is quite flexible. Students may or may not choose to submit a separate scholarship application form.Eligible applicants will be automatically considered for the scholarship based on their Deakin University admission application form. those who choose to submit an application must do so at least one month prior to the commencement of the academic session.However, all applicants need to provide some supporting documents. Assessment of these documents will highly factor in the selection process.Student Supporting DocumentationThe supporting documents are required for the assessment of Deakin Vice-chancellor’s Meritorious 100% Scholarship 2020 are:A statement of purpose or personal statement, approximately 300 words.At least two references or letters of recommendation.Deakin admission application along with the academic transcripts.Thepersonal statementmust be written by the applicant only and should reflect the applicant’s personal views. Overall, the statement must includeDetails of any previous work experience or extracurricular activity.Brief description of why the applicant wants tostudy in Australiaand specifically Deakin UniversityThe reason why the applicant can become an outstanding ambassador for Deakin University.
application_process.html_content:
The application process of Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious Scholarship is quite flexible. Students may or may not choose to submit a separate scholarship application form.

Eligible applicants will be automatically considered for the scholarship based on their Deakin University admission application form. those who choose to submit an application must do so at least one month prior to the commencement of the academic session.

However, all applicants need to provide some supporting documents. Assessment of these documents will highly factor in the selection process.

Student Supporting Documentation

The supporting documents are required for the assessment of Deakin Vice-chancellor’s Meritorious 100% Scholarship 2020 are:

  • A statement of purpose or personal statement, approximately 300 words.
  • At least two references or letters of recommendation.
  • Deakin admission application along with the academic transcripts.

The personal statement must be written by the applicant only and should reflect the applicant’s personal views. Overall, the statement must include

  • Details of any previous work experience or extracurricular activity.
  • Brief description of why the applicant wants to study in Australia and specifically Deakin University
  • The reason why the applicant can become an outstanding ambassador for Deakin University.

selection_process.description: Upon receiving all applications and supporting documents, theDeakin Universityofficials will start evaluating each scholarship applicant. Students will be informed about the outcome of the selection process in due time.As per the requirements, shortlisted applicants may be asked to attend an interview as a part of the selection process. In that case, the final decision will be based on the applicant’s interview session.
selection_process.html_content:
Upon receiving all applications and supporting documents, the Deakin University officials will start evaluating each scholarship applicant. Students will be informed about the outcome of the selection process in due time.

As per the requirements, shortlisted applicants may be asked to attend an interview as a part of the selection process. In that case, the final decision will be based on the applicant’s interview session.

grant_details.description: Since its launch in 2014, 23 Indian students have received Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious 100% Scholarship. The benefits of this scholarship program include,100% of the total indicative tuition fee stated on the Letter of Offer.Priority place for on-campus accommodation (at own cost and subject to availability).The scholarships in selected academic areas (STEM, Sports,Arts, and one other area) are offered in recognition by an industry partner – BIOCON for STEM and Rajasthan Royals forSports.Some highlights of the Deakin Meritorious Scholarships are tabulated below:Eligible CandidatesIndian StudentsNumber of Scholarships4Study-LengthDepends on CourseScholarship Award100% Tuition FeesAward DistributedAnnuallyApplications for Deakin Vice-chancellor’s Meritorious Scholarship 2020 are now open. Prospective applicants are recommended to apply at the earliest.
grant_details.html_content:
Since its launch in 2014, 23 Indian students have received Deakin Vice-chancellor's Meritorious 100% Scholarship. The benefits of this scholarship program include,

  • 100% of the total indicative tuition fee stated on the Letter of Offer.
  • Priority place for on-campus accommodation (at own cost and subject to availability).

The scholarships in selected academic areas (STEM, Sports, Arts, and one other area) are offered in recognition by an industry partner – BIOCON for STEM and Rajasthan Royals for Sports.

Applications for Deakin Vice-chancellor’s Meritorious Scholarship 2020 are now open. Prospective applicants are recommended to apply at the earliest.

description:
The main aim of Sydney Scholars India Scholarships Program is to promote and strengthen the engagement between the University and India in their investment related to research, partnership with Industry partners as well as strengthening the commitment to education for the academically outstanding students to attain their full potential.

The Sydney Scholars India Scholarship Program worth of 500,000 AUD is available only for the Indian students to assist in deepening their bond with India. The scholarship is available to Indian students who have registered themselves in either Undergraduate or graduate courses at the University of Sydney.

Facilities of the Sydney Scholars India Scholarship Program are are as follows:

For 2025-2026, forms are yet to be announced.

eligibility_criteria.description: The aspiring candidate who wishes to avail Sydney India Scholarship Program must attain the below mentioned eligibility criteria:Be a current resident as well as a citizen of IndiaHave successfully received an offer of admission to anyUG or PG courses from the University of Sydney.Recipients beginning a second degree at the University of Sydney are qualified to apply for this Scholarship.Note:The candidates are not eligible if they are a permanent citizen of Australia or if the candidate earlier have earned a University of Sydney India Scholarship.Ongoing Eligibility for Sydney India Scholarship ApplicantsTo renew the scholarship, each recipient has to maintain a minimum semester average mark (SAM) of 65 and have no outstanding fees.Recipients undertaking an exchange during the tenure of this Scholarship are required to have achieved a Satisfied Requirements grade (SR) to receive their next payment.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The aspiring candidate who wishes to avail Sydney India Scholarship Program must attain the below mentioned eligibility criteria:

  • Be a current resident as well as a citizen of India
  • Have successfully received an offer of admission to any UG or PG courses from the University of Sydney.
  • Recipients beginning a second degree at the University of Sydney are qualified to apply for this Scholarship.

Note: The candidates are not eligible if they are a permanent citizen of Australia or if the candidate earlier have earned a University of Sydney India Scholarship.

Ongoing Eligibility for Sydney India Scholarship Applicants

  • To renew the scholarship, each recipient has to maintain a minimum semester average mark (SAM) of 65 and have no outstanding fees.
  • Recipients undertaking an exchange during the tenure of this Scholarship are required to have achieved a Satisfied Requirements grade (SR) to receive their next payment.

application_process.description: The ideal candidate must register themselves foradmissions at University of Sydneybefore applying for the Sydney Scholars India Scholarships.The recipients can apply for the scholarship program only when the applicants have obtained their acceptance letter.The applicants must complete the Admission offer in all respects by the cut-off date of their scholarship offer round. The scholarship offer will be revoked if they fail to abide by the same. It is highly essential for the applicants to put forward a few supporting documents which can be mentioned below:An updated CVProof of residenceDocuments related to the candidate’s previous academic results.The Sydney Scholars India Scholarship Application forms will be accessible on the official website of the University .For 2025-2026, forms are yet to be announced.
application_process.html_content:
The ideal candidate must register themselves for admissions at University of Sydney before applying for the Sydney Scholars India Scholarships.The recipients can apply for the scholarship program only when the applicants have obtained their acceptance letter.

The applicants must complete the Admission offer in all respects by the cut-off date of their scholarship offer round. The scholarship offer will be revoked if they fail to abide by the same. It is highly essential for the applicants to put forward a few supporting documents which can be mentioned below:

  • An updated CV
  • Proof of residence
  • Documents related to the candidate’s previous academic results.

The Sydney Scholars India Scholarship Application forms will be accessible on the official website of the University .

For 2025-2026, forms are yet to be announced.
