scholarship_name: Oxford and Cambridge Society of India (OCSI) Scholarships
description:
The Oxford and Cambridge Society of India (OCSI) Scholarship is awarded to the candidates opting for any undergraduate, graduate, research, or certificate program at the University of Oxford and University of Cambridge. 

The OCSI Scholarship is available for a number of programs at Oxford University and Cambridge University. Furthermore, students opting for admissions in any college affiliated by the mentioned universities can also apply for the scholarship.

Note: Each year The Oxford and Cambridge Society of India seeks to raise funds and receive other grants that become available by June each year. Candidates applying for The OCSI scholarships will be eligible for any such additional grants as well.

eligibility_criteria.description: In the first place, students need to opt for any part-time or full-timeprograms at Cambridge University, Oxford University or in any of the colleges affiliated by the two to be eligible for the scholarship. Further shortlisting of the candidates is done on the basis of the eligibility criteria defined by the universities.Eligibility criteriaas per the universities::Must be an Indian citizen, residing in the country.Must not be older than 30 years of age, as of September 1, on the year as per the year of application for the award.Must have secured admission to Cambridge or Oxford University.Must have proof of residence at Oxford or Cambridge before the scholarship funds are released.Note:Candidates are supposed to get admitted in the Oxford or Cambridge University via the normal academic procedure. OCSI will not assist them in the admissions.Terms and ConditionsRelatives of the members of the executive committee of the OCSI are not eligible to apply.Students who have already received a commitment for full outside support should not apply.Students who get awarded any other scholarship support after getting the OCSI Scholarship should inform the society so that the award may be passed on to the next ranked candidate.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In the first place, students need to opt for any part-time or full-time programs at Cambridge University, Oxford University or in any of the colleges affiliated by the two to be eligible for the scholarship. Further shortlisting of the candidates is done on the basis of the eligibility criteria defined by the universities.

Eligibility criteria as per the universities::

  • Must be an Indian citizen, residing in the country.
  • Must not be older than 30 years of age, as of September 1, on the year as per the year of application for the award.
  • Must have secured admission to Cambridge or Oxford University.
  • Must have proof of residence at Oxford or Cambridge before the scholarship funds are released.

Note: Candidates are supposed to get admitted in the Oxford or Cambridge University via the normal academic procedure. OCSI will not assist them in the admissions.

Terms and Conditions

  • Relatives of the members of the executive committee of the OCSI are not eligible to apply.
  • Students who have already received a commitment for full outside support should not apply.
  • Students who get awarded any other scholarship support after getting the OCSI Scholarship should inform the society so that the award may be passed on to the next ranked candidate.

application_process.description: Students applying for the OCSI scholarship should possess an offer letter from Oxford or Cambridge University or any of the affiliated colleges. Students going to apply for the scholarship are supposed to consider a few points, have a look:Application forms for the scholarship can be availed from the official website of Oxford and Cambridge Society of India by mid-February, every year.Completed applications must reach the society by May 31, 2024.All the shortlisted candidates will be required to appear for an interview at New Delhi, around early June 2024.Candidates who will qualify for the interview round will be awarded scholarships by mid-July 2024.Details required for the OCSI Scholarship programPersonal information and contact details of the applicantDetails of the university and program one opted for.Academic background of the applicant.Essay type questions related to work experience, community activities, life experiences, motivational aspects of life, future plans.Applicants can visit the official website of theOxford and Cambridge Society of India (OCSI)for any further details.
application_process.html_content:
Students applying for the OCSI scholarship should possess an offer letter from Oxford or Cambridge University or any of the affiliated colleges. Students going to apply for the scholarship are supposed to consider a few points, have a look:

  • Application forms for the scholarship can be availed from the official website of Oxford and Cambridge Society of India by mid-February, every year.
  • Completed applications must reach the society by May 31, 2024.
  • All the shortlisted candidates will be required to appear for an interview at New Delhi, around early June 2024.
  • Candidates who will qualify for the interview round will be awarded scholarships by mid-July 2024.

Details required for the OCSI Scholarship program

  • Personal information and contact details of the applicant
  • Details of the university and program one opted for.
  • Academic background of the applicant.
  • Essay type questions related to work experience, community activities, life experiences, motivational aspects of life, future plans.

Applicants can visit the official website of the Oxford and Cambridge Society of India (OCSI) for any further details.

selection_process.description: OCSI considers the overall performance of a candidate before deciding the result and awarding the scholarship. It is a highly coveted award since the number of scholarships is limited and there are a huge number of applicants.The major factors which catalyze theshortlisting of the candidatesare:Academic AchievementsCo-curricular AchievementsCommunity / Social WorkResponses Given in the Application FormNote:Shortlisted candidates are required to physically appear for an interview during the selection process.
selection_process.html_content:
OCSI considers the overall performance of a candidate before deciding the result and awarding the scholarship. It is a highly coveted award since the number of scholarships is limited and there are a huge number of applicants.

The major factors which catalyze the shortlisting of the candidates are:

  • Academic Achievements
  • Co-curricular Achievements
  • Community / Social Work
  • Responses Given in the Application Form

Note: Shortlisted candidates are required to physically appear for an interview during the selection process.

The society has a total number of 600 members. The society headquarters are situated in Delhi.
grant_details.html_content:
Study Level Undergraduate/ Graduate/ Post-graduate Level
Eligible Candidates Indian nationals only
Number of Scholarships Minimum 1
Study Length Varies
Scholarship Award USD 5,624
Award Distribution Annually

Decisions regarding the award of the OCSI scholarship are not based on age, sex color, caste, religion or disability as it is an equal opportunity scholarship.

The Oxford and Cambridge Society was founded in the 1960s and it is basically an alumni network of the students from both the mentioned universities. The society has a total number of 600 members. The society headquarters are situated in Delhi.

description: Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships is an initiative taken by Bournemouth University of recognizing and rewarding academically outstanding students. It is available to both domestic as well as international students pursuing UG and PG courses from Bournemouth University.

eligibility_criteria.description: Even though the scholarship program is available to both domestic and international students, applicants must provide proof of residency. In addition to that, students must fulfill the eligibility requirements listed below:Any overseas applicant for either a full-time taught postgraduate course delivered on campus or Master's by research delivered on campusYou must have achieved a minimum of an upper second-class Honours degree (or international equivalent grades - see below), or a CPE with a merit profileApplicants for the Graduate Diploma in Law (CPE) and Legal Practice Course (LPC) are eligible for this award.Exclusion:If you are applying for a Postgraduate Diploma, distance learning course or certain courses delivered by the Faculty of Health & Social Sciences, you will not be eligible for this awardYou can receive this scholarship alongside a Sports or Music scholarship, but cannot receive any other academic award.Part-time, student-driven and distance learning (i.e online courses) are not eligible
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Even though the scholarship program is available to both domestic and international students, applicants must provide proof of residency. In addition to that, students must fulfill the eligibility requirements listed below:

  • Any overseas applicant for either a full-time taught postgraduate course delivered on campus or Master's by research delivered on campus
  • You must have achieved a minimum of an upper second-class Honours degree (or international equivalent grades - see below), or a CPE with a merit profile
  • Applicants for the Graduate Diploma in Law (CPE) and Legal Practice Course (LPC) are eligible for this award.

Exclusion:

  • If you are applying for a Postgraduate Diploma, distance learning course or certain courses delivered by the Faculty of Health & Social Sciences, you will not be eligible for this award
  • You can receive this scholarship alongside a Sports or Music scholarship, but cannot receive any other academic award.
  • Part-time, student-driven and distance learning (i.e online courses) are not eligible

application_process.description: No separate form is required for Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships. Students will be automatically considered based on their admission application.They must know the required documents needed at the time of admission so that the scholarship process becomes easy for them.BU Admission Checklist for International StudentsAcademic transcripts from previous institutionsAccompanied by certified English translations.Letters of recommendationAcademic reference letter for UGProfessional and academic references for PGStatement of purposeResume (if applicable)English Language ProficiencyIELTS: 6.0; a minimum of 5.5 in every component.To be considered foradmission at Bournemouth University, applicants must provide the documents listed above. Once the applicant is offered admission, the application will be sent for the scholarship evaluation.
application_process.html_content:
No separate form is required for Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships. Students will be automatically considered based on their admission application.

They must know the required documents needed at the time of admission so that the scholarship process becomes easy for them.

BU Admission Checklist for International Students

  • Academic transcripts from previous institutions
    • Accompanied by certified English translations.
  • Letters of recommendation
    • Academic reference letter for UG
    • Professional and academic references for PG
  • Statement of purpose
  • Resume (if applicable)
  • English Language Proficiency
    • IELTS: 6.0; a minimum of 5.5 in every component.

To be considered for admission at Bournemouth University, applicants must provide the documents listed above. Once the applicant is offered admission, the application will be sent for the scholarship evaluation.

selection_process.description: Applications of the eligible candidates will be sent to the selection committee. They will then evaluate the admission application. Accordingly, students will be shortlisted and scholarship will be awarded.Factors Affecting the Scholarship Selection DecisionThe recipients of the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships are selected based on factors like :Academic ExcellenceFinancial requirementUnconditional admission offer from the universityProficiency in the English languageSelected students will be contacted by the university through an official email.
selection_process.html_content:
Applications of the eligible candidates will be sent to the selection committee. They will then evaluate the admission application. Accordingly, students will be shortlisted and scholarship will be awarded.

Factors Affecting the Scholarship Selection Decision

The recipients of the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships are selected based on factors like :

  • Academic Excellence
  • Financial requirement
  • Unconditional admission offer from the university
  • Proficiency in the English language

Selected students will be contacted by the university through an official email.

grant_details.description: Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships offer helping hand to international students who need support in financing their studies atBournemouth University.Students must be enrolled in either UG or PG programs at the university to be eligible.The table provides all the significant details regarding the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships:Study-LevelUndergraduate/ MastersEligible CandidatesInternational students, studying at UG/PG course at the University of BournemouthNumber of ScholarshipUnlimitedStudy-Length4 years (UG) and 2years (PG)Scholarship Award6055.92 USDAward DistributedAnnually( One time only)Along with knowing how to get the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships, it is important to know the scholarship’s terms and conditions.Terms and Conditions of the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships:The applicant should be a 1st year UG/PG student at BU.International students enrolled in distance courses are not eligible for this scholarship program.The university holds the right to amend, introduce, and withdraw the scholarship at any point in time.The Scholarship offered is subject to funding and availability.It is given only when you have not received any other BU scholarship (except the Music and Sport Scholarships).This scholarship is not applicable to the students enrolled in the courses offered through partner colleges.
grant_details.html_content:
Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships offer helping hand to international students who need support in financing their studies at Bournemouth University.

Students must be enrolled in either UG or PG programs at the university to be eligible.

The table provides all the significant details regarding the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships:

Study-Level Undergraduate/ Masters
Eligible Candidates International students, studying at UG/PG course at the University of Bournemouth
Number of Scholarship Unlimited
Study-Length 4 years (UG) and 2years (PG)
Scholarship Award 6055.92 USD
Award Distributed Annually( One time only)

Along with knowing how to get the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships, it is important to know the scholarship’s terms and conditions.

Terms and Conditions of the Bournemouth Academic Excellence Scholarships:

  • The applicant should be a 1st year UG/PG student at BU.
  • International students enrolled in distance courses are not eligible for this scholarship program.
  • The university holds the right to amend, introduce, and withdraw the scholarship at any point in time.
  • The Scholarship offered is subject to funding and availability.
  • It is given only when you have not received any other BU scholarship (except the Music and Sport Scholarships).
  • This scholarship is not applicable to the students enrolled in the courses offered through partner colleges.

description:
The University of Lincoln provides many scholarships and awards to students who excel in the field of academics all over the world. University of Lincoln India Scholarship is one such scholarship that is given only to students of India. Under this, a total amount of 4029 USD is provided for payment of tuition fees.

University of Lincoln India Scholarship is provided to only those academically excellent students who need support in financing their studies. Supporting documents such as Statement of Purpose, English language proficiency, LOR are also considered during the selection process.

The scholarships are aimed at supporting highly achieving Postgraduate students from India. It must be noted that the Scholarships awards are not in the form of money but take the form of a reduction in Tuition fees in the subsequent years of study.

eligibility_criteria.description: For programs commencing in 2026/27, scholarships are only given to high achieving applicants in the form of a reduction in tuition fees. Apart from this, prospective candidates must fulfill the given requirements for being eligible for the University of Lincoln India Scholarships:Must be a citizen and current resident of India.Must be a first-year student at the PG course at University of Lincoln.conditional/unconditional offer from the university2:2 Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university (minimum grade 50% overall)As an alternative to IELTS, we accept a minimum of 70% in the Standard XII awarded by CISCE or CBSE (for courses requiring IELTS 6.0).Must be proficient in the English language:ELP Test NameMinimum Score RequirementIELTS6.0 overall (no section below 5.5)TOEFL-iBT79 overallPTE Academic58 overall (no section below 51)University of Lincoln PEASS coursePass at 40% or aboveNote:The English language requirements of the prospective candidates should be submitted along with completing the application form atintscholarships@lincoln.ac.uk.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
For programs commencing in 2026/27, scholarships are only given to high achieving applicants in the form of a reduction in tuition fees. Apart from this, prospective candidates must fulfill the given requirements for being eligible for the University of Lincoln India Scholarships:

  • Must be a citizen and current resident of India.
  • Must be a first-year student at the PG course at University of Lincoln.
    • conditional/unconditional offer from the university
  • 2:2 Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university (minimum grade 50% overall)
  • As an alternative to IELTS, we accept a minimum of 70% in the Standard XII awarded by CISCE or CBSE (for courses requiring IELTS 6.0).
  • Must be proficient in the English language:
ELP Test Name Minimum Score Requirement
IELTS 6.0 overall (no section below 5.5)
TOEFL-iBT 79 overall
PTE Academic 58 overall (no section below 51)
University of Lincoln PEASS course Pass at 40% or above

Note: The English language requirements of the prospective candidates should be submitted along with completing the application form at intscholarships@lincoln.ac.uk.

application_process.description: University of Lincoln India Scholarship does not require any separate application form, eligible students will be automatically considered for the award. Only those students who secure conditional or unconditionaladmission to University of Lincolnwill be considered for the scholarship award.
application_process.html_content: University of Lincoln India Scholarship does not require any separate application form, eligible students will be automatically considered for the award. Only those students who secure conditional or unconditional admission to University of Lincoln will be considered for the scholarship award.

selection_process.description: Selection CriteriaIn order to be eligible to receive the India Scholarship, prospective students must meet the following criteria:Be a national of, or have permanent residence in, India.Hold a Conditional or Unconditional Offer from the University of Lincoln for a full-time postgraduate taught programme commencing in September/October 2025 or January/February 2026.Have been awarded, or be expected to receive, one of the following qualifications:- A Bachelor's degree from a recognised institution with a minimum grade of 2:2 or equivalent.- A Pre-Masters qualification from a recognised institution with a grade comparable to a 2:2.- A Master’s degree from a recognised institution with a merit grade or equivalent.Please visityour country webpagefor more detail regarding regional entry requirements that are equivalent to a 2:2.
selection_process.html_content:
Selection Criteria

In order to be eligible to receive the India Scholarship, prospective students must meet the following criteria:

  • Be a national of, or have permanent residence in, India. 
  • Hold a Conditional or Unconditional Offer from the University of Lincoln for a full-time postgraduate taught programme commencing in September/October 2025 or January/February 2026.
  • Have been awarded, or be expected to receive, one of the following qualifications:

    - A Bachelor's degree from a recognised institution with a minimum grade of 2:2 or equivalent.
    - A Pre-Masters qualification from a recognised institution with a grade comparable to a 2:2.
    - A Master’s degree from a recognised institution with a merit grade or equivalent.
  • Please visit your country webpage for more detail regarding regional entry requirements that are equivalent to a 2:2.

grant_details.description: The grant provided by the University of Lincoln Scholarship provides a lot of support to students to reduce the financial burden of students to a great extent.Each year, applications for the University of Lincoln India Scholarship are invited in September or February. The table below provides mentions all the programs covered under the scholarship:Fashion ManagementMaster of Business AdministrationManagementAgrifood TechnologyTourism and MarketingEngineering ManagementJournalismInternational BusinessMechanical EngineeringMarketingHuman Resource ManagementArchitecture and DesignFinanceInternational Hospitality ManagementAccounting and FinanceEvents ManagementLogistics and Global OperationsInternational Investment BankingProject ManagementPhysicsComputer ScienceGames Development and DesignConstruction Science and ManagementRobotics and Autonomous SystemsAlong with knowing how to obtain the University of Lincoln India Scholarship, each applicant must be familiar with the scholarship’s terms and conditions.Terms and Conditions of the University of Lincoln India ScholarshipThe scholarship is non-transferable.The University reserves the right to modify or withdraw the scholarships at any timeStudents enrolled in distance courses are not eligible for this scholarship.Students sponsored by charitable bodies or the government are not eligible.All university Scholarship decisions made by the University will be final.Only one scholarship per student, per program, is applied.Students who wish to study at the University Of Lincoln are advised to regularly check University’s website for further updates.
grant_details.html_content:
The grant provided by the University of Lincoln Scholarship provides a lot of support to students to reduce the financial burden of students to a great extent.

Each year, applications for the University of Lincoln India Scholarship are invited in September or February. The table below provides mentions all the programs covered under the scholarship:

Fashion Management Master of Business Administration Management
Agrifood Technology Tourism and Marketing Engineering Management
Journalism International Business Mechanical Engineering
Marketing Human Resource Management Architecture and Design
Finance International Hospitality Management Accounting and Finance
Events Management Logistics and Global Operations International Investment Banking
Project Management Physics Computer Science
Games Development and Design Construction Science and Management Robotics and Autonomous Systems

Along with knowing how to obtain the University of Lincoln India Scholarship, each applicant must be familiar with the scholarship’s terms and conditions.

Terms and Conditions of the University of Lincoln India Scholarship

  • The scholarship is non-transferable.
  • The University reserves the right to modify or withdraw the scholarships at any time
  • Students enrolled in distance courses are not eligible for this scholarship.
  • Students sponsored by charitable bodies or the government are not eligible.
  • All university Scholarship decisions made by the University will be final.
  • Only one scholarship per student, per program, is applied.

Students who wish to study at the University Of Lincoln are advised to regularly check University’s website for further updates.

scholarship_name: Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships
description:
Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships are designed for Indian women, offering them an opportunity to pursue higher education at an international university. The scholarship program is applicable to the masters-level degree programs at the universities of the USA, UK, and Europe. 

It is important for all the recipients of the Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships to submit a proof of available finances, showing that they can cover their program’s fee and other living expenses. Furthermore, the trust will not assist the recipients to complete their visa process to the USA or UK.

 Fresh applications for 2025-2026 is now closed.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships 2025, you must fulfill the followings criteria:Indian women graduate from a recognizedIndian universityShould have a consistently remarkable academic universityApplied for admission to reputed accrediteduniversities/institutions in the UK, Europe, or the USAMinimum of two years of work experienceStudents applying or studying for part-time, short-term, or correspondence courses or have already connected their studies abroad are not eligible to apply for Lady Meherbai D Tata scholarships.NOTE: Fresh applications for 2025-2026 is now closed.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships 2025, you must fulfill the followings criteria:

  • Indian women graduate from a recognized Indian university
  • Should have a consistently remarkable academic university
  • Applied for admission to reputed accredited universities/institutions in the UK, Europe, or the USA
  • Minimum of two years of work experience

Students applying or studying for part-time, short-term, or correspondence courses or have already connected their studies abroad are not eligible to apply for Lady Meherbai D Tata scholarships.

NOTE: Fresh applications for 2025-2026 is now closed.

application_process.description: If you are eligible for Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships 2025, send an email atigpedulmdtet@tatatrust.org, requesting for the scholarship application form. The email should strictly include the documents mentioned below:Course you wish to pursueThe university you are planning to attendCourse FeesSource of Funding (in brief)Current profileBased on the eligibility criteria and supporting documents, the Trust will email the application form. You have to send the filled-in forms along with required documents to the Trust Office at:Mulla House, 3rd floorHomi Mody StreetMumbai 400 001Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarship application form 2024-25 should be completed very carefully and sent before the prescribed deadline.
application_process.html_content:
If you are eligible for Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships 2025, send an email at igpedulmdtet@tatatrust.org, requesting for the scholarship application form. The email should strictly include the documents mentioned below:

  • Course you wish to pursue
  • The university you are planning to attend
  • Course Fees
  • Source of Funding (in brief)
  • Current profile

Based on the eligibility criteria and supporting documents, the Trust will email the application form. You have to send the filled-in forms along with required documents to the Trust Office at:

Mulla House, 3rd floor
Homi Mody Street
Mumbai 400 001

Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarship application form 2024-25 should be completed very carefully and sent before the prescribed deadline.

selection_process.description: After the evaluation of the applications, the Trust shortlists students for apersonal interview with the Board of Trustees. Information regarding the date and time of the interview will be conveyed to each student via email.Since the Trust’s headquarter is based in Mumbai, all the interviews will be held there itself. The travel expenses for the interview have to be incurred by the students only.A gift scholarship amounting up to 8365 USD per student is awarded to students selected after the personal interview. However, selected students must show proof of at least half funding to cover their tuition fee andstudent housing in the USAor UK.
selection_process.html_content:
After the evaluation of the applications, the Trust shortlists students for a personal interview with the Board of Trustees. Information regarding the date and time of the interview will be conveyed to each student via email.

Since the Trust’s headquarter is based in Mumbai, all the interviews will be held there itself. The travel expenses for the interview have to be incurred by the students only.

A gift scholarship amounting up to 8365 USD per student is awarded to students selected after the personal interview. However, selected students must show proof of at least half funding to cover their tuition fee and student housing in the USA or UK.

grant_details.description: Each year, up to 10 women benefit from the Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships.The academic fields covered by the Lady Meherbai D Tata scholarships include Social Sciences, Social Work, Education, Gender studies, Child health: Development and Nutrition, Public Health: Community health services and reproductive health, Needs of adolescents, Rural development work, and Communication for development.
grant_details.html_content:
Each year, up to 10 women benefit from the Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarships.

The academic fields covered by the Lady Meherbai D Tata scholarships include Social Sciences, Social Work, Education, Gender studies, Child health: Development and Nutrition, Public Health: Community health services and reproductive health, Needs of adolescents, Rural development work, and Communication for development.

description:
The Fulbright-Nehru Master’s Fellowships are awarded to talented Indian students who demonstrate qualities of leadership, have sufficient academic qualification, and work experience. The fellowship is offered for one year or two years, depending upon the duration of the selected master’s degree program in USA university. Explore USA Universities.

The benefits granted under the Fulbright-Nehru Master’s Fellowships are:

The Selection committee grants fellowship to only candidates that are committed to returning to India after course completion and who will contribute to making a transformative impact on the country’s development.

eligibility_criteria.description: Indian students must have completed their undergraduate degree from a recognized institution, that is equivalent to a US bachelor's degree such as:four-year bachelor's degree; orcompleted master's degree, orfull-time postgraduate diploma ( if UG degree is of less than four years' duration)Applicants who fulfill this basic requirement must verify the eligibility criteria mentioned below:Academic Qualification:Minimum 55% or higher in an undergraduate degreeSkills:Leadership skills and community service experience.Professional Experience:Minimum of 3-years full-time (paid) experience in the related field of study.Language Proficiency:Minimum acceptableIELTSscore of 6.0 or equivalent TOEFL/PTE score.For the language test waiver, students must contact the USIEF.Eligible Fields of StudyEach applicant should have enrolled in one of the fields of study:EconomicsEnvironmental Science/StudiesHigher Education AdministrationInternational Legal StudiesJournalism and Mass CommunicationPublic HealthSustainable Development/SustainabilityUrban and Regional PlanningNote:Each applicant should choose one field of study that matches his/her chief area of interest. The individual program may have a different structure and curriculum depending upon the academic host institution due to subspecialties, course offerings, and academic requirements.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Indian students must have completed their undergraduate degree from a recognized institution, that is equivalent to a US bachelor's degree such as:

  • four-year bachelor's degree; or
  • completed master's degree, or
  • full-time postgraduate diploma ( if UG degree is of less than four years' duration)

Applicants who fulfill this basic requirement must verify the eligibility criteria mentioned below:

  • Academic Qualification: Minimum 55% or higher in an undergraduate degree
  • Skills: Leadership skills and community service experience.
  • Professional Experience: Minimum of 3-years full-time (paid) experience in the related field of study.
  • Language Proficiency: Minimum acceptable IELTS score of 6.0 or equivalent TOEFL/PTE score.
    • For the language test waiver, students must contact the USIEF.

Eligible Fields of Study

Each applicant should have enrolled in one of the fields of study:

Economics Environmental Science/Studies
Higher Education Administration International Legal Studies
Journalism and Mass Communication Public Health
Sustainable Development/Sustainability Urban and Regional Planning

Note: Each applicant should choose one field of study that matches his/her chief area of interest. The individual program may have a different structure and curriculum depending upon the academic host institution due to subspecialties, course offerings, and academic requirements.

application_process.description: Fulbright-Nehru Master's Fellowships applications are accepted through an online process. As a prospective candidate, you have to complete the online Application form availablehere.The step by step procedure to fill Fulbright Nehru Master’s fellowship is given below:Step 1:Visit the web page and create an account.Step 2:Provide personal details and click "Continue".Step 3:Applicants will receive a pin by email which they would need to enter and proceed.Step 4:Create a password and log in to the account.Step 5:Provide personal, contact, and academic information.Step 6:Provide information on language skills, study plan, personal statement, university preference, etc.Step 7:Upload the required documents.Step 8:Fill in the grant and additional information and submit the form.Review the entire application before submitting it. The application should be free of grammatical and spelling errors.Documents RequiredApplicants are required to submit the below-mentioned documents along with their online applications:Academic transcripts (scanned) from previous institutions, accompanied by certified English translations.Statement of purposeUpdated CV/ResumeAcademic degree and mark sheetsExperience CertificateEnglish Language Proficiency Test ScorecardMinimum 3Letters of recommendations(Professional and academic references for PG)Copy of passportNote:Applicants must go through theInstruction formand keep documents ready beforehand. This will help them to submit the form easily. Students should also be aware ofNehru Master’s Fellowship terms and conditions.
application_process.html_content:
Fulbright-Nehru Master's Fellowships applications are accepted through an online process. As a prospective candidate, you have to complete the online Application form available here.

The step by step procedure to fill Fulbright Nehru Master’s fellowship is given below:

  • Step 1: Visit the web page and create an account.
  • Step 2: Provide personal details and click "Continue".
  • Step 3: Applicants will receive a pin by email which they would need to enter and proceed.
  • Step 4: Create a password and log in to the account.
  • Step 5: Provide personal, contact, and academic information.
  • Step 6: Provide information on language skills, study plan, personal statement, university preference, etc.
  • Step 7: Upload the required documents.
  • Step 8: Fill in the grant and additional information and submit the form.

Review the entire application before submitting it. The application should be free of grammatical and spelling errors.

Documents Required

Applicants are required to submit the below-mentioned documents along with their online applications:

  • Academic transcripts (scanned) from previous institutions, accompanied by certified English translations.
  • Statement of purpose
  • Updated CV/Resume
  • Academic degree and mark sheets
  • Experience Certificate
  • English Language Proficiency Test Scorecard
  • Minimum 3 Letters of recommendations (Professional and academic references for PG)
  • Copy of passport

Note: Applicants must go through the Instruction form and keep documents ready beforehand. This will help them to submit the form easily. Students should also be aware of Nehru Master’s Fellowship terms and conditions.

selection_process.description: The candidate did not need to apply separately to U.S. institutions, this isdone by IE/Fulbright Program, which will send their applications to four different institutions.The awardees for theFulbright Scholarshipare selected based on their overall performance in academics, work/experience skills, competency, skills and experience in community service. The selection committee alsoreviews the CV and essay submitted by the student,at the time of application.After a careful examination of all these, the candidates are shortlisted and are informed by the USIEF thereafter. Timeline and Placement Process for the Fellowship:May 14, 2025Application DeadlineEnd June 2025Review of applicationsEarly August 2025USIEF informs the applicants about the review outcomeEnd August 2025Interviews of short-listed candidatesEnd August 2025USIEF notifies principal and alternate nominees. Nominees take tests (such as TOEFL and GRE)October 2025USIEF forwards applications of recommended candidates to the U.S. for J. William Fulbright Foreign Scholarship Board (FFSB) approval and placementMarch/April 2026USIEF notifies the finalists about the FFSB approvalMay/June 2026Pre-Departure OrientationJuly/August 2026Pre-academic training in the U.S. (if required)August/September 2026Degree program beginsPlacement of shortlisted recipients is done by the Institute of International Education (IIE), New York. The recommended candidates are not required to separately apply to US institutions as the IIE/Fulbright program will apply on their behalf to 4 different institutions. While doing so, the preference of the candidates will be taken into consideration.Note:Those candidates that have previously applied to the U.S. Institutes must notify USIEF immediately.
selection_process.html_content:
The candidate did not need to apply separately to U.S. institutions, this is done by IE/Fulbright Program, which will send their applications to four different institutions.

The awardees for the Fulbright Scholarship are selected based on their overall performance in academics, work/experience skills, competency, skills and experience in community service. The selection committee also reviews the CV and essay submitted by the student, at the time of application.

After a careful examination of all these, the candidates are shortlisted and are informed by the USIEF thereafter. Timeline and Placement Process for the Fellowship:

May 14, 2025 Application Deadline
End June 2025 Review of applications
Early August 2025 USIEF informs the applicants about the review outcome
End August 2025 Interviews of short-listed candidates
End August 2025 USIEF notifies principal and alternate nominees. Nominees take tests (such as TOEFL and GRE)
October 2025 USIEF forwards applications of recommended candidates to the U.S. for J. William Fulbright Foreign Scholarship Board (FFSB) approval and placement
March/April 2026 USIEF notifies the finalists about the FFSB approval
May/June 2026 Pre-Departure Orientation
July/August 2026 Pre-academic training in the U.S. (if required)
August/September 2026 Degree program begins

Placement of shortlisted recipients is done by the Institute of International Education (IIE), New York. The recommended candidates are not required to separately apply to US institutions as the IIE/Fulbright program will apply on their behalf to 4 different institutions. While doing so, the preference of the candidates will be taken into consideration.

Note: Those candidates that have previously applied to the U.S. Institutes must notify USIEF immediately.

grant_details.description: The Fulbright-Nehru master's Fellowships provide grants to students enrolled in the Master’s Program. It covers tuition fees and basic living expenses.Terms and Conditions of Fulbright-Nehru Master’s FellowshipsThe scholarship does not cover overall costs, therefore the scholar may need additional grant benefits with some other resources also.Check:Cost of studying in USA.The fellowship does not provide any financial aid for dependents.The Applicant must return to work in their home country, after the completion of their master's course or Research.The benefit of the fellowship will not be extended after completion of the actual study i.e. a maximum of 2 yearsFulbright-Nehru applications are submitted online, otherwise stated.The applicant can apply for fellowship only under the Fulbright-Nehru category.No application will be taken into consideration after the deadline.Extension/ Transfer of Visa sponsorship is not permitted.Plagiarism in the application form will lead to disqualification.The Fulbright-Nehru Master's Fellowships are specially designed for outstanding Indian students to pursue a master's degree program at selected U.S. colleges and universities.
grant_details.html_content:
The Fulbright-Nehru master's Fellowships provide grants to students enrolled in the Master’s Program. It covers tuition fees and basic living expenses.

Terms and Conditions of Fulbright-Nehru Master’s Fellowships

The scholarship does not cover overall costs, therefore the scholar may need additional grant benefits with some other resources also. Check: Cost of studying in USA.

  • The fellowship does not provide any financial aid for dependents.
  • The Applicant must return to work in their home country, after the completion of their master's course or Research.
  • The benefit of the fellowship will not be extended after completion of the actual study i.e. a maximum of 2 years
  • Fulbright-Nehru applications are submitted online, otherwise stated.
  • The applicant can apply for fellowship only under the Fulbright-Nehru category.
  • No application will be taken into consideration after the deadline.
  • Extension/ Transfer of Visa sponsorship is not permitted.
  • Plagiarism in the application form will lead to disqualification.

The Fulbright-Nehru Master's Fellowships are specially designed for outstanding Indian students to pursue a master's degree program at selected U.S. colleges and universities.

description:
CorpFinance International Limited (Kevin Andrews) is a financial aid provided to Indian students admitted at Dalhousie University of Canada. Students who have taken admission for the Bachelor of Commerce program and Bachelor of commerce in market management at Dalhousie University, Canada are eligible for this bursary. The scholarship is renewable annually.

Selected Students will get tuition fees assistance up to a maximum of 15000 USD. Students were supposed to apply for the bursary by March 1, 2023.

eligibility_criteria.description: In order to be eligible for this scholarship, students are required to fulfill the eligibility criteria mentioned below :Students who possess Indian Citizenship are eligible for this scholarship.Students are required to demonstrate financial needs and outstanding academic merit.Students must have completed their class 12th grade from CBSE or any other recognized boards.They are required to demonstrate English proficiency in terms ofTOEFLorIELTSscores.An IELTS score of 6.0 or a TOEFL score of 90 is required.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to be eligible for this scholarship, students are required to fulfill the eligibility criteria mentioned below :

  • Students who possess Indian Citizenship are eligible for this scholarship.
  • Students are required to demonstrate financial needs and outstanding academic merit.
  • Students must have completed their class 12th grade from CBSE or any other recognized boards.
  • They are required to demonstrate English proficiency in terms of TOEFL or IELTS scores.
    • An IELTS score of 6.0 or a TOEFL score of 90 is required.

application_process.description: Students will be considered automatically for the scholarship when they apply for the courses for which this scholarship is applicable. No separate application is needed.Applications forms can be downloaded from the official website of the university. Students are required to fill the application form and send it through email or courier to the address provided below.Applications should have been submitted before thedeadline i.e. March 1, 2023Students are required to download the pdf of the form available on the website and fill it.Students can submit their application form by either email or courier.Students are required to submit all academic transcripts and other relevant documents demonstrating financial need and academic merit.The supporting documents such as medical documentation are required to be submitted asseparate pdfs.The duly filled application form along with required documents can be mailed toGEAsubmission@dal.ca.The supporting documents such as medical documentation are required to be submitted asseparate pdfs.Alternatively, students can also submit the form through courier to the below-mentioned address:Registrar's Office (Awards) sHenry Hicks Academic Admin Bldg - Rm 130.
application_process.html_content:
Students will be considered automatically for the scholarship when they apply for the courses for which this scholarship is applicable. No separate application is needed.

Applications forms can be downloaded from the official website of the university. Students are required to fill the application form and send it through email or courier to the address provided below.

  • Applications should have been submitted before the deadline i.e. March 1, 2023
  • Students are required to download the pdf of the form available on the website and fill it.
  • Students can submit their application form by either email or courier.
  • Students are required to submit all academic transcripts and other relevant documents demonstrating financial need and academic merit.
  • The supporting documents such as medical documentation are required to be submitted as separate pdfs.
  • The duly filled application form along with required documents can be mailed to GEAsubmission@dal.ca .
  • The supporting documents such as medical documentation are required to be submitted as separate pdfs.
  • Alternatively, students can also submit the form through courier to the below-mentioned address:
    • Registrar's Office (Awards) s Henry Hicks Academic Admin Bldg - Rm 130.

selection_process.description: International students are eligible for various scholarships and grants at the University of Dalhousie. They are required to submit theGeneral Entrance Award Applicationirrespective of their nationality.The submission makes students eligible for various scholarships automatically. Indian Students enrolled in theBachelor of Commerce programandBachelor of commercein market management will only be considered for CorpFinance International Limited (Kevin Andrews) India Bursary.They are required to submit documents listed below for the selection:Students are required to submit the transcript of 12th grade.They can also submit certificates of activities that help them to demonstrate their academic excellence.They are required to demonstrate their financial needs.On the basis of the academic merit and the financial need, students will be shortlisted for further rounds of evaluations.Students will be called for Interviews at the university on the basis of no. of scholarships available.The final list of selected candidates will be published on the basis of the required criteria specified along with the number of scholarships available.
selection_process.html_content:
International students are eligible for various scholarships and grants at the University of Dalhousie. They are required to submit the General Entrance Award Application irrespective of their nationality.

The submission makes students eligible for various scholarships automatically. Indian Students enrolled in the Bachelor of Commerce program and Bachelor of commerce in market management will only be considered for CorpFinance International Limited (Kevin Andrews) India Bursary.

They are required to submit documents listed below for the selection:

  • Students are required to submit the transcript of 12th grade.
  • They can also submit certificates of activities that help them to demonstrate their academic excellence.
  • They are required to demonstrate their financial needs.
  • On the basis of the academic merit and the financial need, students will be shortlisted for further rounds of evaluations.
  • Students will be called for Interviews at the university on the basis of no. of scholarships available.
  • The final list of selected candidates will be published on the basis of the required criteria specified along with the number of scholarships available.

description:
The Skoll Scholarship is awarded to the students pursuing or getting admissions into the MBA program in the Said Business School, Oxford University. The scholarship applies only to students who are intended to become social entrepreneurs combating urgent environmental and social needs. Oxford University and its affiliated colleges can serve as best options if one is planning to study in the UK.

The scholarship also provides access to the Skoll Scholar Community wherein social entrepreneurs, investors, world leaders thriving to positively create and innovate through systems change, interact and communicate with each other.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for the Skoll Scholarship, applicants must either be a social entrepreneur or be a part of an impact career. An impact career professional is someone who has used entrepreneurial approaches to address the same social or environmental issue. They can demonstrate they have a clear core thread that unites their work throughout their careers.These professionals can demonstrate a commitment to social change in a particular area through this thread of work. To get the benefits of the Skoll Scholarship, the applicant must have spent at least 3 years in his or her social venture, meaning that the applicant has:Started a social ventureTackling a social or environmental issueCreated an impact initiative inside an organizationThe applicant would also have to explain the need for a financial grant like the Skoll Scholarship as well as demonstrate why business education is fundamental in an entrepreneur’s case.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for the Skoll Scholarship, applicants must either be a social entrepreneur or be a part of an impact career. An impact career professional is someone who has used entrepreneurial approaches to address the same social or environmental issue. They can demonstrate they have a clear core thread that unites their work throughout their careers.

These professionals can demonstrate a commitment to social change in a particular area through this thread of work. To get the benefits of the Skoll Scholarship, the applicant must have spent at least 3 years in his or her social venture, meaning that the applicant has:

  • Started a social venture
  • Tackling a social or environmental issue
  • Created an impact initiative inside an organization

The applicant would also have to explain the need for a financial grant like the Skoll Scholarship as well as demonstrate why business education is fundamental in an entrepreneur’s case.

application_process.description: To get the benefits of the Skoll Scholarship, Students are supposed to apply forMBA at Oxford University.Applicants will be required to write a scholarship essay at the time of submitting their MBA application.After being selected, the second part of the scholarship involves logistics and reference form including basic short questions like how the applicant got to know about the opportunity or the references.A written application is followed by a virtual interview and further a personal interview foradmissions at Oxford University. Also, there is no age restriction for applying to the Skoll Scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
• To get the benefits of the Skoll Scholarship, Students are supposed to apply for MBA at Oxford University.
  • Applicants will be required to write a scholarship essay at the time of submitting their MBA application.
  • After being selected, the second part of the scholarship involves logistics and reference form including basic short questions like how the applicant got to know about the opportunity or the references.

A written application is followed by a virtual interview and further a personal interview for admissions at Oxford University. Also, there is no age restriction for applying to the Skoll Scholarship.

selection_process.description: Candidates will receive an update on the status of their scholarship application and whether they have been shortlisted shortly after admissions decisions have been made. Final shortlisting is planned to take place in late March with candidates expected to be invited to interview in April and May. The candidates are also required to take GRE or GMAT. Candidates have to take IELTS or TOEFL as the English Language proficiency tests.Applicants who are unsalaried or have an income which may exhaust if studying forMasters of Business Administration (MBA) in the UKor paying the admissions fee can apply for a fee waiver from the center. The applicants can send in their CV and cover letter atskollscholarship@sbs.ox.ac.uk. Applicants are required to apply for the fee waiver before submitting the MBA application.
selection_process.html_content:
Candidates will receive an update on the status of their scholarship application and whether they have been shortlisted shortly after admissions decisions have been made. Final shortlisting is planned to take place in late March with candidates expected to be invited to interview in April and May. The candidates are also required to take GRE or GMAT. Candidates have to take IELTS or TOEFL as the English Language proficiency tests. 

Applicants who are unsalaried or have an income which may exhaust if studying for Masters of Business Administration (MBA) in the UK or paying the admissions fee can apply for a fee waiver from the center. The applicants can send in their CV and cover letter at skollscholarship@sbs.ox.ac.uk. Applicants are required to apply for the fee waiver before submitting the MBA application.

description:
Health Insurance plays an important part for any International Student. It can protect them from any financial burden if any unexpected injury or illness happens. BrokerFish helps students to find and buy health insurance. Apart from this, they have BrokerFish International student scholarship program which is designed for international students to help them to cover the health insurance expenses. While studying abroad, it is important that you must have health insurance coverage for the duration of your course.

Recipients are awarded a non-renewable scholarship amount of 1000 USD. This scholarship applies to the Universities in the U.S, Singapore, Canada, Australia, and the U.K and many other countries. There is no specific restriction for the field of study, the rewarded student can choose any field of study of their interest. The scholarship amount can only be used to cover health insurance expenses.

eligibility_criteria.description: To become eligible for BrokerFish International student scholarship, there are some general requirements that the students applying for both postgraduate and undergraduate courses need to fulfill:The applicant must be pursuing a degree, diploma, or equivalent program from an accredited university.It must be kept in mind, that employees of academic institutions and their respective family members are not eligible for this scholarship
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To become eligible for BrokerFish International student scholarship, there are some general requirements that the students applying for both postgraduate and undergraduate courses need to fulfill:

  • The applicant must be pursuing a degree, diploma, or equivalent program from an accredited university.
  • It must be kept in mind, that employees of academic institutions and their respective family members are not eligible for this scholarship

application_process.description: The interested applicants must apply for this scholarship program in December in order to be a part of this program. The applicants must note that they have to submit required documents on the basis of which they will be assessed. The required documents are as follows:The applicant must submit an essay of 500 – 1000 words on the topic entitled“The Importance of International Health Insurance for Expatriates”.The essay must focus on why international health insurance is important for anyone who is staying away from their home country for studying, working, or for any other purpose.A photograph is required that captures the thrust of the essay that the applicant has written.Proof of admissionmust be submitted along with the above documents in order to prove that you are a qualified student.All these documents must be sent via mail to the BrokerFish on the mail idscholarships@brokerfish.comwith the title as“BrokerFish(year) Scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
The interested applicants must apply for this scholarship program in December in order to be a part of this program. The applicants must note that they have to submit required documents on the basis of which they will be assessed. The required documents are as follows:

The applicant must submit an essay of 500 – 1000 words on the topic entitled “The Importance of International Health Insurance for Expatriates”.

  • The essay must focus on why international health insurance is important for anyone who is staying away from their home country for studying, working, or for any other purpose.
  • A photograph is required that captures the thrust of the essay that the applicant has written.
  • Proof of admission must be submitted along with the above documents in order to prove that you are a qualified student.

All these documents must be sent via mail to the BrokerFish on the mail id scholarships@brokerfish.com with the title as “BrokerFish(year) Scholarship.

selection_process.description: After the applicant has successfully applied for the scholarship, next comes the selection process.The selection of the candidate is done onmerit-basis.Profile of the potential candidate is evaluated so that no deserving student is missed out and the most deserving one gets the reward.Selected students will be intimated through email and will be awarded the scholarship amount of1000 USD, which he/she can use only for covering health insurance expenses.
selection_process.html_content:
After the applicant has successfully applied for the scholarship, next comes the selection process.

  • The selection of the candidate is done on merit-basis.
  • Profile of the potential candidate is evaluated so that no deserving student is missed out and the most deserving one gets the reward.

Selected students will be intimated through email and will be awarded the scholarship amount of 1000 USD, which he/she can use only for covering health insurance expenses.

The amount rewarded is 1000 USD and given only once to a selected student.

description:
The National Overseas Scholarship is an Indian scholarship provided by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, India. Students from socially and economically backward classes can benefit from this scheme and get an opportunity to study abroad in an accredited and recognized university.The scholarship supports their pursuit of higher education, such as Master's degree or Ph.D. courses, by providing opportunities to study abroad, ultimately contributing to their economic and social upliftment.

Note: Even though the National Overseas Scholarship is valid for the majority of the universities in Australia, US, Germany, Canada, etc. applicants are still advised to check the same before starting their application process.

eligibility_criteria.description: As mentioned earlier, the National Overseas Scholarship is valid at variousuniversities in Canada, Germany, US, etc. Along with fulfilling the admission requirements of the chosen university, applicants are required to fulfill the eligibility criteria established for the scholarship scheme.SC, ST, and OBC candidates applying for the National Overseas Scholarship must fulfill the requirements given below:Educational Qualification:For Masters:Minimum 55% or it's equivalent at the undergraduate level.For Doctorate:Minimum 55% or it's equivalent at the master’s levelApplicants must note that preference will be given to candidates with relevant experience.Maximum Age Limit:Applicants must be below 35 years as of April 1, 2025.Maximum Permissible Income Limit:Total family income should not exceed 6,00,000 INR.Children Criteria:Only two children from the same parent can get the benefit of the National Overseas Scholarship.Along fulfilling these requirements, it is significant that the applicants meet the minimum score requirements of tests likeIELTS,PTE,GMAT, GRE, etc. Every university has its own minimum ELP and other test score requirements.Note:Bachelor Degree courses are NOT ELIGIBLE for the scholarshipCandidates already settled or studying abroad will not be considered for the scholarshipA maximum of two candidates from a single-family are allowed to avail this scholarship
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
As mentioned earlier, the National Overseas Scholarship is valid at various universities in Canada, Germany, US, etc. Along with fulfilling the admission requirements of the chosen university, applicants are required to fulfill the eligibility criteria established for the scholarship scheme.

SC, ST, and OBC candidates applying for the National Overseas Scholarship must fulfill the requirements given below:

  • Educational Qualification:
    • For Masters: Minimum 55% or it's equivalent at the undergraduate level.
    • For Doctorate: Minimum 55% or it's equivalent at the master’s level

Applicants must note that preference will be given to candidates with relevant experience.

  • Maximum Age Limit: Applicants must be below 35 years as of April 1, 2025.
  • Maximum Permissible Income Limit: Total family income should not exceed 6,00,000 INR.
  • Children Criteria: Only two children from the same parent can get the benefit of the National Overseas Scholarship.

Along fulfilling these requirements, it is significant that the applicants meet the minimum score requirements of tests like IELTS, PTE, GMAT, GRE, etc. Every university has its own minimum ELP and other test score requirements.

Note:

  • Bachelor Degree courses are NOT ELIGIBLE for the scholarship
  • Candidates already settled or studying abroad will not be considered for the scholarship
  • A maximum of two candidates from a single-family are allowed to avail this scholarship

application_process.description: The application form for the National Overseas Scholarship will be made available from the Secondweek of Febrauryon the official website of the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.Students are required to submit the completed application along with necessary documents within the established deadline. The Ministry requires all the students to submit self-attested copies of the following documents:Proof of Date of BirthAll Degree/ Diploma/ Certificate along with mark sheetsIncome Certificate of FamilyOffer Letter College/ UniversityNote:Offer of admission from the chosenuniversity in Germany, Canada, US is mandatory.
application_process.html_content:
The application form for the National Overseas Scholarship will be made available from the Second week of Febraury on the official website of the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.

Students are required to submit the completed application along with necessary documents within the established deadline. The Ministry requires all the students to submit self-attested copies of the following documents:

  • Proof of Date of Birth
  • All Degree/ Diploma/ Certificate along with mark sheets
  • Income Certificate of Family
  • Offer Letter College/ University

Note: Offer of admission from the chosen university in Germany, Canada, US is mandatory.

selection_process.description: The Selection Committee for the National Overseas Scholarship considers all applications impartially. The selection for the scholarship award is given to the candidates who fulfill the eligibility criteria.Along with that, the National Overseas Scholarship panel focuses on the following factors:Only applications submitted before the deadline will be considered.Preference will be given to those who have already secured admission at auniversity in the UK, Germany, Canada, etc.Students yet to secure admission to an international university will also be considered on a conditional basis.In case of a tie, between two or more applicants, the following procedure will be followed:First of all, available unfilled slots earmarked for female applicants will be given to the most eligible candidates.Next, the remaining slots will be filled up by the eligible applicants exceeding the age limit, i.e., the first available slot will be given to the oldest candidate and subsequent slots in the descending order.Note:Applicants must remember thatNOadditional interviews or group discussions will take place.
selection_process.html_content:
The Selection Committee for the National Overseas Scholarship considers all applications impartially. The selection for the scholarship award is given to the candidates who fulfill the eligibility criteria.

Along with that, the National Overseas Scholarship panel focuses on the following factors:

  • Only applications submitted before the deadline will be considered.
  • Preference will be given to those who have already secured admission at a university in the UK, Germany, Canada, etc.
  • Students yet to secure admission to an international university will also be considered on a conditional basis.

In case of a tie, between two or more applicants, the following procedure will be followed:

  • First of all, available unfilled slots earmarked for female applicants will be given to the most eligible candidates.
  • Next, the remaining slots will be filled up by the eligible applicants exceeding the age limit, i.e., the first available slot will be given to the oldest candidate and subsequent slots in the descending order.

Note: Applicants must remember that NO additional interviews or group discussions will take place.

grant_details.description: The National Overseas Scholarship covers the following expenses which might be incurred by a student during their period of studying in a foreign country. The expenses covered under the scholarship are mentioned below:Maintenance AllowanceContingency AllowancePoll TaxIncidental Journey and Equipment AllowanceVisa FeesTuition FeesMedical Insurance PremiumAir PassageLocal TravelStudents are also allowed to supplement these allowances by taking up Teaching/ Research Assistantship jobs. For 2024-2025, the organization is going to allocate 100 slots for scholarships to eligible students. the distribution of these slots are tabulated below:CategoryNumber of SlotsScheduled tribes90Nomadic and semi-nomadic tribes06Landless agricultural laborers and traditional artisans04Field of Study covered by the National Overseas Scholarship:Engineering and Management (32 seats)Pure Sciences and Applied Sciences (17 seats)Agricultural Sciences and Medicine (17 seats)International Commerce Accounting and Finance (17 seats)Humanities and Social Sciences (17 seats)The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment has implemented this scheme for the benefit of socially oppressed classes so that they can get the opportunity of studying abroad. The scheme also expects, under normal circumstances, that the students return to India after concluding their studies, and serve the country in a government office for a minimum of 5 years.
grant_details.html_content:
The National Overseas Scholarship covers the following expenses which might be incurred by a student during their period of studying in a foreign country. The expenses covered under the scholarship are mentioned below:

  • Maintenance Allowance
  • Contingency Allowance
  • Poll Tax
  • Incidental Journey and Equipment Allowance
  • Visa Fees
  • Tuition Fees
  • Medical Insurance Premium
  • Air Passage
  • Local Travel

Students are also allowed to supplement these allowances by taking up Teaching/ Research Assistantship jobs. For 2024-2025, the organization is going to allocate 100 slots for scholarships to eligible students. the distribution of these slots are tabulated below:

Category Number of Slots
Scheduled tribes 90
Nomadic and semi-nomadic tribes 06
Landless agricultural laborers and traditional artisans 04

Field of Study covered by the National Overseas Scholarship:

  • Engineering and Management (32 seats)
  • Pure Sciences and Applied Sciences (17 seats)
  • Agricultural Sciences and Medicine (17 seats)
  • International Commerce Accounting and Finance (17 seats)
  • Humanities and Social Sciences (17 seats)

The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment has implemented this scheme for the benefit of socially oppressed classes so that they can get the opportunity of studying abroad. The scheme also expects, under normal circumstances, that the students return to India after concluding their studies, and serve the country in a government office for a minimum of 5 years.

description:
Sussex MBA Scholarship is a partial fee waiver of 1,500 GBP to 5,000 GBP  (1,49,908 INR to 4,99,694 INR) that is awarded to incoming students. This scholarship program is designed keeping in mind those University of Sussex applicants who have prior management experience and/or graduate degree complementing the MBA program.

This is the only MBA scholarship offered by the university. In case the students want to apply for other masters scholarships, they can explore various University of Sussex scholarships available for international students.

eligibility_criteria.description: Firstly, to be eligible for the scholarship, candidates need to be from the list of the countries mentioned eligible for the scholarship. The candidates are supposed to perform outstandingly well in their undergraduate degrees so that their application can be considered by the award distributing committee.Except for the above-mentioned points, candidates need to fulfill the eligibility criteria as defined by the university:Secureadmission at the University of Sussexin the MBA program.Previous senior management experienceEligible CountriesStudents from Bangladesh, India, Bhutan, China, Egypt, England, Japan, France, Germany, Malaysia, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Panama, Sri Lanka, and a few more countries are eligible for the award.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Firstly, to be eligible for the scholarship, candidates need to be from the list of the countries mentioned eligible for the scholarship. The candidates are supposed to perform outstandingly well in their undergraduate degrees so that their application can be considered by the award distributing committee.

Except for the above-mentioned points, candidates need to fulfill the eligibility criteria as defined by the university:

  • Secure admission at the University of Sussex in the MBA program.
  • Previous senior management experience

Eligible Countries

Students from Bangladesh, India, Bhutan, China, Egypt, England, Japan, France, Germany, Malaysia, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Panama, Sri Lanka, and a few more countries are eligible for the award.

application_process.description: The application forms for the Sussex MBA scholarship are available on the official website of the University of Sussex for the September session. The scholarship forms will be accepted via online process. Candidates are supposed to first enroll themselves in theUniversity of Sussex’s MBA programusing the university’s PG online application system.Admission RequirementStudents are required to submit their updated CV and a personal statement.At the time of admissions, all the students must have a lower second-class undergraduate honors degree.Candidates are supposed to have their IELTS score with them for being eligible to take admissions for MBA at the University of Sussex.Note : Once a decision has been reached whether you will be awarded a scholarship you will be notified of the outcome. Should you be offered a scholarship you have to accept/decline the offer within one month. You will not be able to defer the scholarship offer to a different start date.DeadlinesFor starting in September 2026:30 September 2026For starting in January 2027:30 November 2026
application_process.html_content:
The application forms for the Sussex MBA scholarship are available on the official website of the University of Sussex for the September session. The scholarship forms will be accepted via online process. Candidates are supposed to first enroll themselves in the University of Sussex’s MBA program using the university’s PG online application system.

Admission Requirement

  • Students are required to submit their updated CV and a personal statement.
  • At the time of admissions, all the students must have a lower second-class undergraduate honors degree.
  • Candidates are supposed to have their IELTS score with them for being eligible to take admissions for MBA at the University of Sussex.

Note : Once a decision has been reached whether you will be awarded a scholarship you will be notified of the outcome. Should you be offered a scholarship you have to accept/decline the offer within one month. You will not be able to defer the scholarship offer to a different start date.

Deadlines

  • For starting in September 2026: 30 September 2026
  • For starting in January 2027: 30 November 2026

selection_process.description: The major decisions related to the Sussex MBA scholarship are taken based on the criteria defined by the university:Relevant academic qualificationManagerial work experienceAdmission offer to MBA programThe university ensures that all eligible applicants receive benefits of the scholarship program.Note:Students who donot possessup to the mark results in the undergraduate degree and lack of relevant management experience can also apply for the scholarship by writing an informal application of interest atmba@sussex.ac.uk.For these students,an interview sessionwill be conducted.Once the decision has been made by the committee regarding the distribution of the scholarship, as per the defined parameters, the student is notified for the same and is supposed to accept or decline the offer, within one month. As soon as they accept the offer, students mustapply for Tier 4 UK Student visa.
selection_process.html_content:
The major decisions related to the Sussex MBA scholarship are taken based on the criteria defined by the university:

  • Relevant academic qualification
  • Managerial work experience
  • Admission offer to MBA program

The university ensures that all eligible applicants receive benefits of the scholarship program.

Note: Students who do not possess up to the mark results in the undergraduate degree and lack of relevant management experience can also apply for the scholarship by writing an informal application of interest at mba@sussex.ac.uk. For these students, an interview session will be conducted.

Once the decision has been made by the committee regarding the distribution of the scholarship, as per the defined parameters, the student is notified for the same and is supposed to accept or decline the offer, within one month. As soon as they accept the offer, students must apply for Tier 4 UK Student visa.
