description:
Funded by University College Dublin (UCD), V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship is awarded to international students. The scholarship is applicable for UG and PG programs at UCD. The award encourages the students to apply early for their desired program.

V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship program offers international students to study in Ireland at a minimal cost. Since their tuition fees will be covered under the scholarship, all they will have to pay for is their cost of living and travel in Ireland.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be considered for the V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship, applicants are expected to fulfill the eligibility requirements given below:Classified as an international student (non-EU) for tuition fee and application purposes.Should be a self-funding student.Must belong to eligible countryApplied for a full-timeUCD graduate-taught or undergraduate program.College of Arts and HumanitiesCollege of BusinessCollege of Engineering and ArchitectureCollege of Health and Agricultural SciencesCollege of Social Sciences and LawProof of English language proficiency throughIELTSorTOEFL.Obtained a conditional/ unconditional offer of admission to the university.V.V. Giri Global Excellence ScholarshipRegional EligibilityThe applicants from the following countries are eligible for the V.V. Giri Global Scholarship:NepalIndiaSeychellesAfghanistanBhutanRéunionBangladeshSri LankaPakistanMauritiusMaldives-
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be considered for the V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship, applicants are expected to fulfill the eligibility requirements given below:

  • Classified as an international student (non-EU) for tuition fee and application purposes.
    • Should be a self-funding student.
    • Must belong to eligible country
  • Applied for a full-time UCD graduate-taught or undergraduate program.
    • College of Arts and Humanities
    • College of Business
    • College of Engineering and Architecture
    • College of Health and Agricultural Sciences
    • College of Social Sciences and Law
  • Proof of English language proficiency through IELTS or TOEFL.
  • Obtained a conditional/ unconditional offer of admission to the university.

V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship Regional Eligibility

The applicants from the following countries are eligible for the V.V. Giri Global Scholarship:

Nepal India Seychelles
Afghanistan Bhutan Réunion
Bangladesh Sri Lanka Pakistan
Mauritius Maldives -

application_process.description: The V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship application must be submitted online through the UCD online application portal.Before applying to the program, it is mandatory for the applicants to accept their offer ofadmission to the University College Dublin.Once they have accepted the offer and verified the eligibility, applicants must follow the steps given below:Step I:Log in to the application using the unique user ID and password.Step II:Under Applications menu page, select Scholarship Applications.Step III:Select the V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship tab.Step IV:Answer the general questions and submit the form.Applications for the scholarship are to be made this way only. Be it a UG student or PG student, all have to adhere to the steps mentioned above. However, the V.V. Giri Global Scholarship application deadlines vary for the UG and PG applicants:ProgramScholarship deadlineUndergraduate programs28th February 2025Postgraduate taught programs28th February 2025Please note that candidates who have offers for more than one program must indicate the program for which they would like to apply for the scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
The V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship application must be submitted online through the UCD online application portal. Before applying to the program, it is mandatory for the applicants to accept their offer of admission to the University College Dublin.

Once they have accepted the offer and verified the eligibility, applicants must follow the steps given below:

Step I: Log in to the application using the unique user ID and password.
Step II: Under Applications menu page, select Scholarship Applications.
Step III: Select the V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship tab.
Step IV: Answer the general questions and submit the form.

Applications for the scholarship are to be made this way only. Be it a UG student or PG student, all have to adhere to the steps mentioned above. However, the V.V. Giri Global Scholarship application deadlines vary for the UG and PG applicants:

Program Scholarship deadline 
Undergraduate programs 28th February 2025
Postgraduate taught programs 28th February 2025

Please note that candidates who have offers for more than one program must indicate the program for which they would like to apply for the scholarship.

selection_process.description: The UCD’s scholarship selection committee will evaluate each candidate’s V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship Application. Scholarship decision is based primarily on theacademic meritof the candidates.A holistic review of the scholarship application will be taken into consideration.Scores of theexams to study in IrelandCompletion of application on timeReference and statementsA face-to-face or virtual interview of the candidate with a Scholarship Committee member is conducted before the final decision is taken.Recipients of the V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship will be notified within 2 to 4 weeks. Students must accept their scholarship offer within the timeframe indicated in the letter/email. Failing to do so will be considered as declining the scholarship.Note:All decisions taken by the are final and cannot be requested to be reviewed under any circumstances.
selection_process.html_content:
The UCD’s scholarship selection committee will evaluate each candidate’s V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship Application. Scholarship decision is based primarily on the academic merit of the candidates.

  • A holistic review of the scholarship application will be taken into consideration.
    • Scores of the exams to study in Ireland
    • Completion of application on time
    • Reference and statements
  • A face-to-face or virtual interview of the candidate with a Scholarship Committee member is conducted before the final decision is taken.

Recipients of the V.V. Giri Global Excellence Scholarship will be notified within 2 to 4 weeks. Students must accept their scholarship offer within the timeframe indicated in the letter/email. Failing to do so will be considered as declining the scholarship.

Note: All decisions taken by the are final and cannot be requested to be reviewed under any circumstances.

description:
The Orange Tulip Scholarship programme gives bright students in India a chance to pursue higher studies in the Netherlands. It is offered by the Netherlands universities, colleges, graduate schools, conglomerates, and government agencies. The scholarship is automatically renewable. 

The wide variety of courses incorporated in the Orange Tulip Scholarship Scheme completely varies from one institute to another. In this scholarship, even Bachelor/Master/Doctoral courses can be covered. Some colleges offer this scholarship for Undergraduate and Masters degree courses as well.

eligibility_criteria.description: The eligibility requirements for the Orange Tulip Scholarship are quite basic and straightforward. The most important part is the candidates must be Indian citizens not working in the Netherlands.Applicants who fulfil the requirements mentioned below can proceed to apply for the scholarship:Candidates need to be Indian citizens not currently employed orstudying in the Netherlands.Currently applying or already enrolled in one of the premier universities in the Netherlands Orange Tulip Scholarship participants.ShouldNotbe a part of any otherinternational scholarships in the Netherlands.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The eligibility requirements for the Orange Tulip Scholarship are quite basic and straightforward. The most important part is the candidates must be Indian citizens not working in the Netherlands.

Applicants who fulfil the requirements mentioned below can proceed to apply for the scholarship:

  • Candidates need to be Indian citizens not currently employed or studying in the Netherlands.
  • Currently applying or already enrolled in one of the premier universities in the Netherlands Orange Tulip Scholarship participants.
  • Should Not be a part of any other international scholarships in the Netherlands.

application_process.description: Applicants must be accepted at any of the eligible institutes for a full-time program or should be in the process of applying foruniversities in the Netherlandsto avail Orange Tulip Scholarship.How to apply for the Orange Tulip Scholarships?The step-by-step process for the application is given below:Establish OTS eligibility and entry requirements.Choose an appropriate course as well as Netherlands college from the Nuffic NESOs Study Finder portal.Apply and get confirmation from the chosen Dutch UniversityComplete the Orange Tulip Scholarship application process by downloading the OTS form from Nesco.Submit the form in word or PDF format (file size should be below 20 MB)Attach copies of required documents.The candidates must email the duly filled application form toots@nesoindia.org.The subject of the email should be: OTS 2024-2025 Application [scheme] - [your name].Example:OTS 2024-2025 Application-Radboud University- Shreya Dey.The filename of each document should have a clear name in English: [document name] - [applicant’s name]. Example:IELTSScore Sheet- Shreya Dey.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants must be accepted at any of the eligible institutes for a full-time program or should be in the process of applying for universities in the Netherlands to avail Orange Tulip Scholarship.

How to apply for the Orange Tulip Scholarships?

The step-by-step process for the application is given below:

  1. Establish OTS eligibility and entry requirements.
  2. Choose an appropriate course as well as Netherlands college from the Nuffic NESOs Study Finder portal.
  3. Apply and get confirmation from the chosen Dutch University
  4. Complete the Orange Tulip Scholarship application process by downloading the OTS form from Nesco.
    • Submit the form in word or PDF format (file size should be below 20 MB)
    • Attach copies of required documents.
  5. The candidates must email the duly filled application form to ots@nesoindia.org.
    • The subject of the email should be: OTS 2024-2025 Application [scheme] - [your name]. Example: OTS 2024-2025 Application-Radboud University- Shreya Dey.

The filename of each document should have a clear name in English: [document name] - [applicant’s name]. Example: IELTS Score Sheet- Shreya Dey.

selection_process.description: The selection of the Orange Tulip Scholarship India is based on the academic performance and work experience of an applicant. The selection process for the OTS India program includes the following stages:Phase 1: Application Acceptance & Pre-SelectionNeso India will select the highly talented candidates on the basis of the general terms and conditions mentioned on the first page along with the specified requirements set by the Orange Tulip Scholarship benefactor. Only the files which are complete in all respects and attaining the minimum specifications will be sent to the Company or University for necessary formalities.Phase 2:File Review and Selection of RecipientsTo evaluate the overall process of file registration and selection by the Orange Tulip Scholarship benefactor. Will choose the registration file that qualifies the pre-selectionphase. This phase is basically done by the sponsor.Stage 3:Announcement of Scholarship RecipientsEach OrangeTulip Scholarship benefactor will declare the results about selection to Nesco India or directly inform the successful student. If the selected candidate receives the Scholarship Offer, the offer letter must be endorsed and returned to Neso India.The next phase regarding scholarship agreement, tuition fees will be conducted between the scholarship recipient and the sponsor.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of the Orange Tulip Scholarship India is based on the academic performance and work experience of an applicant. The selection process for the OTS India program includes the following stages:

Phase 1: Application Acceptance & Pre-Selection

Neso India will select the highly talented candidates on the basis of the general terms and conditions mentioned on the first page along with the specified requirements set by the Orange Tulip Scholarship benefactor. Only the files which are complete in all respects and attaining the minimum specifications will be sent to the Company or University for necessary formalities.

Phase 2: File Review and Selection of Recipients

To evaluate the overall process of file registration and selection by the Orange Tulip Scholarship benefactor. Will choose the registration file that qualifies the pre-selection

phase. This phase is basically done by the sponsor.

Stage 3: Announcement of Scholarship Recipients

Each OrangeTulip Scholarship benefactor will declare the results about selection to Nesco India or directly inform the successful student. If the selected candidate receives the Scholarship Offer, the offer letter must be endorsed and returned to Neso India.

The next phase regarding scholarship agreement, tuition fees will be conducted between the scholarship recipient and the sponsor.

grant_details.description: Orange Tulip Scholarships are available for Indian students who wish to study in the Netherlands. The scholarship amount varies by university. It can be 100% of the total fees, or 50% or even 25% of the tuition fees depending on the sponsor.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Orange Tulip Scholarships:Study LevelFoundation/ Bachelor’s/ Master’sEligible CandidatesIndian Nationals onlyNumber of ScholarshipsvariableStudy LengthOne yearScholarship AwardComplete tuition fee waiverAward DistributionAnnuallyOut of several options, the Orange Tulip Scholarship Scheme is one of the most convenient methods for funding of study in the Netherlands.
grant_details.html_content:
Orange Tulip Scholarships are available for Indian students who wish to study in the Netherlands. The scholarship amount varies by university. It can be 100% of the total fees, or 50% or even 25% of the tuition fees depending on the sponsor.

The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Orange Tulip Scholarships:

Study Level Foundation/ Bachelor’s/ Master’s
Eligible Candidates Indian Nationals only
Number of Scholarships variable
Study Length One year
Scholarship Award Complete tuition fee waiver
Award Distribution Annually

Out of several options, the Orange Tulip Scholarship Scheme is one of the most convenient methods for funding of study in the Netherlands.

description:
As the name suggests, Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship is for Indian students commencing undergraduate studies at the university. Based primarily on academic achievements, this Deakin University scholarship financially help students to complete their studies from start to finish.

The annual tuition fee of a Deakin UG program is around 31,000 AUD. With the scholarship award, the recipients will have to pay 25,200 AUD.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for the Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship, candidates must enroll in full-time bachelor-levelprograms at Deakin University. There are no age-based restrictions.In addition to the aforementioned criteria, an applicant has to fulfill the following conditions:Must be an Indian residentMust be living in India at the time of application.The application must be made through a Deakin University authorized agent officially licensed in India*.Must have an average score of 70-79.9% in XII, as listed by the National Office for Overseas Skills Recognition (NOOSR).If you have a score of 80% or above in XII, then you are eligible forDeakin India 25% merit scholarship.*There are more than 140 Deakin representatives in India located in Kerala, Ahmedabad, New Delhi, Ludhiana, Vijayawada, and many other states.Note:Non-Indian applicants must fulfill the following eligibility criteria:Must have above average marks of 60-64% in class XII.Must be living in the country of birth.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for the Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship, candidates must enroll in full-time bachelor-level programs at Deakin University. There are no age-based restrictions.

In addition to the aforementioned criteria, an applicant has to fulfill the following conditions:

  • Must be an Indian resident
  • Must be living in India at the time of application.
  • The application must be made through a Deakin University authorized agent officially licensed in India*.
  • Must have an average score of 70-79.9% in XII, as listed by the National Office for Overseas Skills Recognition (NOOSR).
    • If you have a score of 80% or above in XII, then you are eligible for Deakin India 25% merit scholarship.

*There are more than 140 Deakin representatives in India located in Kerala, Ahmedabad, New Delhi, Ludhiana, Vijayawada, and many other states.

Note: Non-Indian applicants must fulfill the following eligibility criteria:

  • Must have above average marks of 60-64% in class XII.
  • Must be living in the country of birth.

application_process.description: The Deakin India 20% of Undergraduate Scholarship application should be made online with the help of Deakin's Overseas Representative.  Along with the scholarship application, students are required to submit essential academic documents.Student DocumentationSome of the essential supporting documents are mentioned below:English Language proficiency proof (IELTS/TOEFL/CPE/CAE/PTE)Certified academic transcripts.There might be an interview.Copy of passport.Curriculum Vitae (Encouraged but not essential)Personal statement(might be needed)Scholarship applicant ID (if available)Note:Documents must reach the university before the closing date. Documents must be translated into English.
application_process.html_content:
The Deakin India 20% of Undergraduate Scholarship application should be made online with the help of Deakin's Overseas Representative.  Along with the scholarship application, students are required to submit essential academic documents.

Student Documentation

Some of the essential supporting documents are mentioned below:

  • English Language proficiency proof (IELTS/TOEFL/CPE/CAE/PTE)
  • Certified academic transcripts.
  • There might be an interview.
  • Copy of passport.
  • Curriculum Vitae (Encouraged but not essential)
  • Personal statement(might be needed)
  • Scholarship applicant ID (if available)

Note: Documents must reach the university before the closing date. Documents must be translated into English.

grant_details.description: Deakin University serves as one of the best options tostudy in Australiaat an affordablecost of attendanceandcost of living. With the help of grants like Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship, students from countries like India get an opportunity to pursue a recognized UG level program at the university.The university has more than 300 partners in 50 countries for research and higher education collaboration. Its offices are situated in India, China, Sri Lanka, Indonesia, and Europe. Deakin scholarship applicants can apply for any of the undergraduate streams including engineering, science, math, and other programs to get a chance of receiving the aid.Study levelUndergraduateEligibilityIndian nationalNumber of scholarshipsVariesAward distributionAnnuallyStudy lengthVariesStudents must note that Deakin India 20% scholarship program offers a tuition fee waiver of 20%. To apply, one should be a citizen of India, residing in India at the time of application. The selection process weighs the merit and qualification of the eligibility criteria.Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship Program is a merit-based grant and provides a part of the total tuition fee stated on the offer letter. The same scholarship turns into a 25% one if a student has 80% or above marks in class XII.
grant_details.html_content:
Deakin University serves as one of the best options to study in Australia at an affordable cost of attendance and cost of living. With the help of grants like Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship, students from countries like India get an opportunity to pursue a recognized UG level program at the university.

The university has more than 300 partners in 50 countries for research and higher education collaboration. Its offices are situated in India, China, Sri Lanka, Indonesia, and Europe. Deakin scholarship applicants can apply for any of the undergraduate streams including engineering, science, math, and other programs to get a chance of receiving the aid.

Study level  Undergraduate
Eligibility Indian national
Number of scholarships Varies
Award distribution Annually
Study length Varies

Students must note that Deakin India 20% scholarship program offers a tuition fee waiver of 20%. To apply, one should be a citizen of India, residing in India at the time of application. The selection process weighs the merit and qualification of the eligibility criteria.

Deakin India 20% Undergraduate Scholarship Program is a merit-based grant and provides a part of the total tuition fee stated on the offer letter. The same scholarship turns into a 25% one if a student has 80% or above marks in class XII.

description:
QS awards a range of scholarships worth 7 million USD to international students through its Scholarship Schemes which targets candidates with demonstrated academic excellence and achievements. The plethora of QS scholarships are designed for students keen on pursuing undergraduate, graduate, or Ph.D. programs at a QS partnered university.

Students can apply for QS scholarships of their specific area of interest either through the QS Events App (available on the App Store or Google Play) or by visiting the official website of QS.

Before applying for the QS scholarships, applicants must qualify for respective exams to study abroad as it comes under the eligibility criteria for admissions in various institutes.

eligibility_criteria.description: In order to get the benefits of the QS scholarships, students will be selected on the basis of the eligibility criteria as defined by the respective universities and QS:Anoffer of admissionfrom the concerneduniversity in Australia, UK, or another country, within thescholarship deadline.Apply one year prior to the commencement of the program, they are interested in.Accepted this offer before the announcement of thescholarship recipient names by QSApart from these basic requirements stated by QS, applicants are also required to fulfill category-based requirements:Vanderbilt MBA QS Scholarship:Possess an undergraduate degree equivalent to a 4-year, US degreeMinimum of a 2-year full-time professional work experienceMinimum of 680GMATand a TOEFL score of 100/IELTS of 7 (if required)Antai MBA GMAT Scholarship:Minimum GMAT score of 630 for scholarship amount of 20,000 RMB (3,086 USD)Minimum GMAT score of 680 for a 25% full program fee scholarshipMinimum 730 GMAT score are awarded a 50% full program fee scholarshipScholarship for ESMT:Minimum of 3 years of international working experienceProfessional background with interest in innovation technology or sustainability in general management.Must score not less than 650 in GMATMust be awarded admission for a full-time 12 month MBA program at ESMT.Note:Students from diverse backgrounds, irrespective of their native countries, are encouraged to apply for these scholarships tostudy abroad.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to get the benefits of the QS scholarships, students will be selected on the basis of the eligibility criteria as defined by the respective universities and QS:

An offer of admission from the concerned university in Australia, UK, or another country, within the scholarship deadline.

  • Apply one year prior to the commencement of the program, they are interested in.
  • Accepted this offer before the announcement of the scholarship recipient names by QS

Apart from these basic requirements stated by QS, applicants are also required to fulfill category-based requirements:

  • Vanderbilt MBA QS Scholarship:
    • Possess an undergraduate degree equivalent to a 4-year, US degree
    • Minimum of a 2-year full-time professional work experience
    • Minimum of 680 GMAT and a TOEFL score of 100/IELTS of 7 (if required)
  • Antai MBA GMAT Scholarship:
    • Minimum GMAT score of 630 for scholarship amount of 20,000 RMB (3,086 USD)
    • Minimum GMAT score of 680 for a 25% full program fee scholarship
    • Minimum 730 GMAT score are awarded a 50% full program fee scholarship
  • Scholarship for ESMT:
    • Minimum of 3 years of international working experience
    • Professional background with interest in innovation technology or sustainability in general management.
    • Must score not less than 650 in GMAT
    • Must be awarded admission for a full-time 12 month MBA program at ESMT.

Note: Students from diverse backgrounds, irrespective of their native countries, are encouraged to apply for these scholarships to study abroad.

application_process.description: Students may apply for different QS scholarships via the QS Events mobile phone apps or by visiting the official website of QS.In case the studentfinds the school of their choice listed on either, they may apply directly through either of these two websites.In case the student isunable to find the school of their choice on either of these two websites, they must apply through theQS Events appalong with the login details created at the time of registering for the QS event.Students may simultaneously apply for multiple scholarships, provided they submit the relevant essay, required for each such scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
Students may apply for different QS scholarships via the QS Events mobile phone apps or by visiting the official website of QS.

  • In case the student finds the school of their choice listed on either, they may apply directly through either of these two websites.
  • In case the student is unable to find the school of their choice on either of these two websites, they must apply through the QS Events app along with the login details created at the time of registering for the QS event.

Students may simultaneously apply for multiple scholarships, provided they submit the relevant essay, required for each such scholarship.

selection_process.description: The scholarship Selection Committee evaluates all submitted applications and the best is selected based onAcademic achievementsQuality of essays.The essay is simply a chance for applicants to show the selection team how talented and competent they are. Candidates should note that only the best essays are chosen as essays are judged by structure, content, word limit (not too long or too short), good grammar, and spellingsEssays are chosen based on the following criteria:20% structure and format of the essay80 % relevance, content, and quality of the contentNote:If the scholarship is offered by QS partners such as schools and universities, the final decision is taken exclusively by these organizations after the evaluation of each application.
selection_process.html_content:
The scholarship Selection Committee evaluates all submitted applications and the best is selected based on

  • Academic achievements
  • Quality of essays.

The essay is simply a chance for applicants to show the selection team how talented and competent they are. Candidates should note that only the best essays are chosen as essays are judged by structure, content, word limit (not too long or too short), good grammar, and spellings

Essays are chosen based on the following criteria:

  • 20% structure and format of the essay
  • 80 % relevance, content, and quality of the content

Note: If the scholarship is offered by QS partners such as schools and universities, the final decision is taken exclusively by these organizations after the evaluation of each application.

grant_details.description: The shortlisted students are contacted by the QS Scholarships Team, 2-3 weeks after the scholarship deadlines. Due to the large volume of applications, only the applicants who have qualified for the final round are contacted, as it is not possible for each application to be responded to in the case of rejection.QS Scholarships and RewardsScholarship NameAmount (in USD)DeadlineQS Leadership Scholarship for MBA10,000May 31QS Community Scholarship for MBA5,000May 31QS Social Responsibility Scholarship10,000April 30QS Undergraduate Scholarship5,000April 30Scholarship for EDHEC Business School50% tuition fee waiverJune 1Antai Interview-Performance Scholarship50% tuition fee waiverJune1QS Women Scholarship5,000April 30ESSEC Business School10% tuition fee waiverApr 30Maastricht School of Management10% tuition fee waiverNov 2Apart from this, each year, QS also offers 5 prepaid credit cards of up to 500 USD to students who complete the QS International Student Survey. The subsequent winners of the QS scholarship scheme are declared on the official QS websites, and the interviews of the candidates may be published on the websites.Any inquiry about the award can be forwarded to the email address of the QS Scholarships Team viascholarships@qs.com
grant_details.html_content:
The shortlisted students are contacted by the QS Scholarships Team, 2-3 weeks after the scholarship deadlines. Due to the large volume of applications, only the applicants who have qualified for the final round are contacted, as it is not possible for each application to be responded to in the case of rejection.

QS Scholarships and Rewards

Scholarship Name Amount (in USD) Deadline
QS Leadership Scholarship for MBA 10,000 May 31
QS Community Scholarship for MBA 5,000 May 31

QS Social Responsibility Scholarship

 10,000 April 30
QS Undergraduate Scholarship 5,000 April 30
Scholarship for EDHEC Business School 50% tuition fee waiver June 1
Antai Interview-Performance Scholarship 50% tuition fee waiver June1
QS Women Scholarship 5,000 April 30

ESSEC Business School

 10% tuition fee waiver Apr 30

Maastricht School of Management

 10% tuition fee waiver Nov 2

Apart from this, each year, QS also offers 5 prepaid credit cards of up to 500 USD to students who complete the QS International Student Survey. The subsequent winners of the QS scholarship scheme are declared on the official QS websites, and the interviews of the candidates may be published on the websites. 

Any inquiry about the award can be forwarded to the email address of the QS Scholarships Team via scholarships@qs.com

description:
The Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship is one of the best means for the international as well as the domestic students to pursue Masters as well as research degree at University of Melbourne. There are a lot of bright talented students who are awarded this scholarship. These can be mentioned as follows:

The Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship is designed for all master-by-research and doctoral programs at UMelbourne. However, preference will be given to those candidates who have refereed publication, composing original music along with specific medical qualifications.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students must meetentry requirements at University of Melbourneto secure Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships. In addition to that, they must fulfill the eligibility criteria mentioned below:Enroll in master's or doctoral research degree at the University of Melbourne.Meet minimum English Language requirements.TOEFL: 94+ (Writing: 27; Speaking: 18; Reading & Listening: 13)IELTS: 7.0 (Written: 7.0; no band less than 6.0)PTE: 65+Fulfill Melbourne graduate research degree program entry requirements75% marks in the last year of the four-year Bachelor degreeCompletion of a research project or component at 4th year of the UG or PG degree
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students must meet entry requirements at University of Melbourne to secure Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships. In addition to that, they must fulfill the eligibility criteria mentioned below:

  • Enroll in master's or doctoral research degree at the University of Melbourne.
  • Meet minimum English Language requirements.
    • TOEFL: 94+ (Writing: 27; Speaking: 18; Reading & Listening: 13)
    • IELTS: 7.0 (Written: 7.0; no band less than 6.0)
    • PTE: 65+
  • Fulfill Melbourne graduate research degree program entry requirements
    • 75% marks in the last year of the four-year Bachelor degree
    • Completion of a research project or component at 4th year of the UG or PG degree

application_process.description: Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarshipdoesn’t require additional scholarship application.To be considered, prospective candidates need to submit their admission application form within the stipulated time frameThe prospective candidates will receive a response on their application within 5-6 weeks. Their application will consequently be examined for a wide variety of graduate research Scholarships.Check:University of Melbourne no-application scholarships.
application_process.html_content:
Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship doesn’t require additional scholarship application. To be considered, prospective candidates need to submit their admission application form within the stipulated time frame

The prospective candidates will receive a response on their application within 5-6 weeks. Their application will consequently be examined for a wide variety of graduate research Scholarships. Check: University of Melbourne no-application scholarships.

selection_process.description: The process of selection for Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships is highly competitive in nature and is mainlybased on academic record.The qualified students will beawarded a score and ranked as per their performance in the academics.evaluated on the basis of their research potential in their own domain of study.evaluated on numerous other factors such as successful conclusion of a degree at the same standard of the research program.assessed on the basis of their refereed publications, specific medical qualifications along with devising original music.These above mentioned factors also play a crucial role in getting selected for this Scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The process of selection for Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships is highly competitive in nature and is mainly based on academic record. The qualified students will be

  • awarded a score and ranked as per their performance in the academics.
  • evaluated on the basis of their research potential in their own domain of study.
  • evaluated on numerous other factors such as successful conclusion of a degree at the same standard of the research program.
  • assessed on the basis of their refereed publications, specific medical qualifications along with devising original music.

These above mentioned factors also play a crucial role in getting selected for this Scholarship.

grant_details.description: Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship is offered to the high-performing research students who are entering or have already enrolled in a graduate research degree at the University of Melbourne.The University selects the potential candidates on the basis ofnumerous factorslike academic performance, professional work experience, successful completion of the pursuing degree, specific medical qualifications and composing of original music.Other Benefits offered by Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships are listed below:Living allowances of 34,400 AUD per yearCheck:Student accommodation options in AustraliaRelocation allowance of USD 3,000 per year for international students.Complete waiver of tuition feesOverseas Student Health Cover Scheme(OSHC) forAustralia Student VisaTerms and Conditions of the Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships are:Thescholarship is conditionalon maintaining full-time enrolment in the course at the University of Melbourne.Commence the scholarship in the year for which the scholarship was offered.The maximum duration of a stipend and fee offset for students undertaking a Master’s degree is 2 years.Themaximum duration of a stipend is 3.5 yearsfull-time equivalent.The maximum duration of a fee offset is 4 years full-time equivalent for students undertaking a Doctoral degree.Any false or misleading information provided by students may cease the scholarship amount.The student is required to repay any scholarship benefits within 14 days of being requested to do so by the University.Students who are currently enrolled in a graduate course and wish to acquire a scholarship must submit an online application formbefore October 31, 2024.It is an undeniable fact that the Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship is one of the best scholarships to pursue higher studies at the University of Melbourne which is one of the top universities in Australia.
grant_details.html_content:
Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship is offered to the high-performing research students who are entering or have already enrolled in a graduate research degree at the University of Melbourne.

The University selects the potential candidates on the basis of numerous factors like academic performance, professional work experience, successful completion of the pursuing degree, specific medical qualifications and composing of original music.

Other Benefits offered by Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships are listed below:

  • Living allowances of 34,400 AUD per year Check: Student accommodation options in Australia
  • Relocation allowance of USD 3,000 per year for international students.
  • Complete waiver of tuition fees
  • Overseas Student Health Cover Scheme(OSHC) for Australia Student Visa

Terms and Conditions of the Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships are:

  1. The scholarship is conditional on maintaining full-time enrolment in the course at the University of Melbourne.
  2. Commence the scholarship in the year for which the scholarship was offered.
  3. The maximum duration of a stipend and fee offset for students undertaking a Master’s degree is 2 years.
  4. The maximum duration of a stipend is 3.5 years full-time equivalent.
  5. The maximum duration of a fee offset is 4 years full-time equivalent for students undertaking a Doctoral degree.
  6. Any false or misleading information provided by students may cease the scholarship amount.
  7. The student is required to repay any scholarship benefits within 14 days of being requested to do so by the University.

Students who are currently enrolled in a graduate course and wish to acquire a scholarship must submit an online application form before October 31, 2024.

It is an undeniable fact that the Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship is one of the best scholarships to pursue higher studies at the University of Melbourne which is one of the top universities in Australia.

description:
Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship Program supports the education of students who are pursuing a career in Fraud Examination. Students can advance their education through the funding of the Association of Certified Fraud Examiners Foundation (ACFEF). In the year 2013, they provided a scholarship of 53,000 USD to 30 universities in the USA.

In its efforts to promote the careers as an anti-fraud professional, the ACFE distributes substantial funds to students keen on pursuing a career in investigating fraud and upholding the law. Applicants must have a degree or certificate in Accounting, Business Administration, Finance and Criminal justice. The scholarship is given to students enrolled in both Undergraduate and Postgraduate courses. The scholarship is given to students studying in U.S. universities.

eligibility_criteria.description: The Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship Program covers students who are actively seeking education and have a desire to pursue a career in fraud examinations. Many of the scholarship holders have dignified careers in the anti-fraud profession. eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship Program covers students who are actively seeking education and have a desire to pursue a career in fraud examinations. Many of the scholarship holders have dignified careers in the anti-fraud profession. Students who fulfill the requirements given below are eligible for the Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship Program:

  1. Enrolled in an accredited university/college in the U.S.
  2. Declared their major or minor in either business administration, accounting, finance or criminal justice.
  3. Demonstrated a substantial desire to pursue a career in a fraud examination or a likewise profession.
  4. Completed Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship application, supported by the official transcripts and other documents
  5. Undergraduate Students: Must be enrolled for 9 semester hours per term.
  6. Graduate Students: Must be enrolled for 6 semester hours per term.
  7. Must have submitted two recommendation forms.

Note: The applicants will provide information on two recommenders. These individuals will upload information forms on the applicant's behalf. At least one form is preferred to be from a Certified Fraud Examiner or a professor. Applicants are encouraged to sit in circles with the local Fraud Examiners and get acquainted with them.

Individuals who are not eligible for the scholarship are :

  1. Past recipients (Award/Scholarship)
  2. High School Students/Seniors
  3. Students set to graduate in 2024 (Applicants must be enrolled through 2025)
  4. Existing ACFE chapter directors/officers.

application_process.html_content:
Applicants who are interested in the Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship can apply for a scholarship online on the ACFE website.

Step I: Applicants are required to create an account at the scholarship portal:
The application is divided into 8 categories:

  1. Applicant General Information
  2. College or University Information
  3. Academic Information (Applicant’s current study structure)
  4. Official Transcripts (All official transcripts of institutions/colleges previously attended)
  5. Essay Instructions (Sections of essays demanded, entailing the applicant’s history and future anticipations)
  6. Recommendation Request
  7. ACFE Foundation Affiliation (Information about the applicant’s association with the ACFE Foundation.)
  8. Certification (Electronic Signature)

Step II: Provide Official transcripts, that prove the complete history of education and institutions attended by the applicant.
Step III: Provide two letters of recommendation, one preferable from a Certified Fraud Examiner.
Step IV: Fill the application form with necessary details and submit the same.

The schedules for the 2024-2025 Scholarship module is:

Application status: September 18, 2023
Application Deadline: February 5, 2024
Scholarship Award Recipients Announced: April 19, 2024
Scholarship Awards Distributed: May 4, 2024

selection_process.description: The ACFE Foundation takes pride in having an unbiased and fair selection process. The committee selects students regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability or sexual orientation in any of its programs or activities.The detailed Selection and Non-discrimination Policy of the Foundation entails that applicants will be awarded annually on the basis of:Completed scholarship applicationRecommendation FormsPersonal and professional interests, goals, desired career paths and activities of the applicant.Academic history, as presented through the transcripts.After the submission of the application form, potential candidates will be evaluated and selected by ACFE.
selection_process.html_content:
The ACFE Foundation takes pride in having an unbiased and fair selection process. The committee selects students regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability or sexual orientation in any of its programs or activities.

The detailed Selection and Non-discrimination Policy of the Foundation entails that applicants will be awarded annually on the basis of:

  1. Completed scholarship application
  2. Recommendation Forms
  3. Personal and professional interests, goals, desired career paths and activities of the applicant.
  4. Academic history, as presented through the transcripts.

After the submission of the application form, potential candidates will be evaluated and selected by ACFE.

grant_details.html_content:
The Ritchie-Jennings Memorial Scholarship provides an excellent opportunity for students to advance their education and anti-fraud career paths.

Through this Scholarship, Students receive award amount 10,000 USD, 7,500 USD, 5,000 USD, and 2,000 USD and they vary as per the merit, and the divisional requirement of the students. The award also includes a one-year ACFE Student Associate membership. The Award will be paid directly to the applicant’s university.

Application for the Ritchie Jennings Memorial Scholarship Program is still open for the year 2024-25. Application Deadline for the same is February 5, 2024. The scholarship award recipients will be announced on the April 19, 2024 and the award will be distributed on May 5, 2024.

scholarship_name: Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business
description:
Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business is a type of internal academic merit award or scholarship that values up to 2,600 USD. It is awarded annually to a continuing UG student who’s entering the second year in the Haskayne School of Business.

Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business is an excellent opportunity for present students of the Haskayne School, the University of Calgary. Students are advised to check the eligibility and application procedure to avail this scholarship program.

eligibility_criteria.description: Since Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business is merit-based, an applicant’s academic excellence will play a significantly crucial role. Other eligibility criteria include,An applicantmust be a continuing UG studententering the second year in the Haskayne School of Business.Minimum GPA of 3.20in the chosen UG level program at Haskayne.Completion ofat least 24 units of academic coursework.Applicants with a verifiable permanent disability must complete a minimum of 18 units of academic coursework.There areno citizenship or residency criteriafor the students.Note:The students who are already a recipient of another international scholarship likeOntario Graduate scholarship,OTS, etc. are not eligible for this scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Since Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business is merit-based, an applicant’s academic excellence will play a significantly crucial role. Other eligibility criteria include,

  • An applicant must be a continuing UG student entering the second year in the Haskayne School of Business.
  • Minimum GPA of 3.20 in the chosen UG level program at Haskayne.
  • Completion of at least 24 units of academic coursework.
    • Applicants with a verifiable permanent disability must complete a minimum of 18 units of academic coursework.
  • There are no citizenship or residency criteria for the students.

Note: The students who are already a recipient of another international scholarship like Ontario Graduate scholarship, OTS, etc. are not eligible for this scholarship.

application_process.description: As the guidelines established for theUniversity of Calgaryscholarships, applicants have to submita separate scholarship application form. In addition to the form, candidates must submit a cover letter and a 300-word essay emphasizing the importance of business etiquette.The application deadline for Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business 2024 is yet to be announced. However, eligible students are expected to begin the second year of their UGprogram at HaskaynebeforeMarch 21.
application_process.html_content:
As the guidelines established for the University of Calgary scholarships, applicants have to submit a separate scholarship application form. In addition to the form, candidates must submit a cover letter and a 300-word essay emphasizing the importance of business etiquette.

The application deadline for Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business 2024 is yet to be announced. However, eligible students are expected to begin the second year of their UG program at Haskayne before March 21.

selection_process.description: The selection process takes place once the applications are submitted at the university. Generally, the panel takes 4-5 weeks to announce the name of the Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business recipient.The selection committee primarily focuses on theapplicant’s academic performanceand potential. Since it is an internal award, student’s performance is monitored by the faculty members in their first year.Along with the applicant’s academic merit, a300-word essaysubmitted by the applicant is also thoroughly reviewed.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process takes place once the applications are submitted at the university. Generally, the panel takes 4-5 weeks to announce the name of the Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business recipient.

The selection committee primarily focuses on the applicant’s academic performance and potential. Since it is an internal award, student’s performance is monitored by the faculty members in their first year.

Along with the applicant’s academic merit, a 300-word essay submitted by the applicant is also thoroughly reviewed.

Students admitted at Haskayne are offered various grants each year. However, there are very few scholarships available for continuing UG students. One such scholarship available at Haskayne is Arthur J.E. Child Scholarship in Business.

The applications for the Arthur J.E Child Scholarship in Business 2024 will open soon. Eligible students are advised to check the official link regularly for updates.

description:
Pursuing a full-time MBA program in the U.S. is a costly affair as the total cost of attendance varies from 1,50,000-2,50,000 USD. Moreover, when you plan to study at the Chicago School of Business, you have to bear several other expenses such as accommodation, insurance, student service fee, etc.

To give you an idea, the estimated cost of attendance Booth Business School is mentioned in the following table:

Category  Expense (in USD)
MBA Tuition Fees 1,44,000
Student Service Fee 1,248
Health Insurance 4,600
Service Fee 2,500
Lifetime Fee Credentials 75
Books 684
Room and Board 22,185
Personal 2,286
Transportation 1,944
Computer Allowance 1,300
Total 1,80,822

All three scholarship programs offered students relaxation in the Tuition fee.

eligibility_criteria.description: To establish eligibility for theUniversity of Chicago Booth School of Businessscholarships,You must live and work in India at the time of the application.You must be eligible to enroll for the full-time MBA program at Booth School of Business.It is quite easy to provide proof of citizenship and residentship, all you have to do is provide the institution with your updated passport. However, the eligibility criteria for the MBA program is not so simple.To be considered for admission, you have to submit various documents. The table below will guide you for the same.CriteriaRequirementsAcademic QualificationsUG transcripts & degreeEnglish language proficiencyTOEFL-iBT: 104; TOEFL-pBT: 600;IELTS: 7.0; PTE Academic: 70References1 academic LOR; 1 professional LORApplication questions2 questions; minimum 250 words for each answerStandardized test scoreGRE/GMAT score
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To establish eligibility for the University of Chicago Booth School of Business scholarships,

  • You must live and work in India at the time of the application.
  • You must be eligible to enroll for the full-time MBA program at Booth School of Business.

It is quite easy to provide proof of citizenship and residentship, all you have to do is provide the institution with your updated passport. However, the eligibility criteria for the MBA program is not so simple.

To be considered for admission, you have to submit various documents. The table below will guide you for the same.

Criteria Requirements
Academic Qualifications UG transcripts & degree
English language proficiency TOEFL-iBT: 104; TOEFL-pBT: 600; IELTS: 7.0; PTE Academic: 70
References 1 academic LOR; 1 professional LOR
Application questions 2 questions; minimum 250 words for each answer
Standardized test score GRE/GMAT score

Recipients are chosen on their academic merit, prospective concentration, competitiveness, career goals, and life experiences.

grant_details.description: At Booth Business School, Indian students considered for three different scholarships: The India Trust Fellowship, Akhtarali H. Tobaccowalla Fellowship, and Ramakrishnan Family Scholarship. The grant history for all three scholarships are given below:The India Trust FellowshipThrough the generosity of individuals, corporate, alumni, and foundation donors, the business school offers The India Trust Fellowship. This is a merit-based fellowship that recognizes students with outstanding academic and extracurricular achievements.Akhtarali H. Tobaccowalla FellowshipThis fellowship scheme is established in memory of the 1952 graduate of Chicago Booth. Applications of all the eligible students will be considered automatically. Decisions are made using the comprehensive approach which takes into account your educational achievement, experiences, interests, location of residence, and goals as indicated in the application for admission.Ramakrishnan Family ScholarshipsThe Ramakrishnan Family Scholarship scheme provides tuition support to three incoming students from India. Recipients will be awarded 25,000 USD per year, totaling 50,000 USD each for the two-year program.
grant_details.html_content:
At Booth Business School, Indian students considered for three different scholarships: The India Trust Fellowship, Akhtarali H. Tobaccowalla Fellowship, and Ramakrishnan Family Scholarship. The grant history for all three scholarships are given below:

The India Trust Fellowship

Through the generosity of individuals, corporate, alumni, and foundation donors, the business school offers The India Trust Fellowship. This is a merit-based fellowship that recognizes students with outstanding academic and extracurricular achievements.

Akhtarali H. Tobaccowalla Fellowship

This fellowship scheme is established in memory of the 1952 graduate of Chicago Booth. Applications of all the eligible students will be considered automatically. Decisions are made using the comprehensive approach which takes into account your educational achievement, experiences, interests, location of residence, and goals as indicated in the application for admission.

Ramakrishnan Family Scholarships

The Ramakrishnan Family Scholarship scheme provides tuition support to three incoming students from India. Recipients will be awarded 25,000 USD per year, totaling 50,000 USD each for the two-year program.

scholarship_name: Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarships
description:
Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarship is an entrance-based award designed for UG students admitted at the University of Waterloo. The program is applicable for only those students who will be commencing their UG degree in the university’s Faculty of Engineering.

The scholarships are funded by Mr. Arthur Church, Mechanical Engineering batch BASc’76. Since funds are donated by an individual, the number of scholarships and award amount is limited. Based on the eligibility criteria, the scholarship selection committee shortlists two students:

Each Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarship recipient is awarded 7,695 USD. Recipients can use the scholarship reward amount for their respective undergraduate tuition and fees only. 

The purpose of this scholarship program is to encourage students who are exceptional in academics to attend the University of Waterloo and to provide assistance to them in scholarly pursuits. The scholarship program does not have any residency restrictions.

Read more Scholarships/ Latest Updated Scholarships:-

         Ontario Graduate Scholarship
         Tata Scholarship- Cornell University
         GREAT Scholarships India

eligibility_criteria.description: Students pursuing UG courses available underWaterloo’s Faculty of Engineeringare the only ones who will be considered for Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarships.In addition to the choice of the academic program, applicants must fulfill the criteria given below:Academic performanceProof of residency (applicable for both domestic and international students)Completion of Admission Information Form (AIF)Note:AIF is a form which is submitted at the time of Waterloo admission applications. Through this form, the applicant is allowed to talk about themselves, their achievements, career goals, extracurricular hobbies, etc. AIF plays an important role in admission decisions.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students pursuing UG courses available under Waterloo’s Faculty of Engineering are the only ones who will be considered for Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarships.

In addition to the choice of the academic program, applicants must fulfill the criteria given below:

  • Academic performance
  • Proof of residency (applicable for both domestic and international students)
  • Completion of Admission Information Form (AIF)

Note: AIF is a form which is submitted at the time of Waterloo admission applications. Through this form, the applicant is allowed to talk about themselves, their achievements, career goals, extracurricular hobbies, etc. AIF plays an important role in admission decisions.

application_process.description: Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarship program does not have any separate or additional scholarship application system. Students who have applied to the engineering programs at theUniversity of Waterloowill be considered for the scholarship.
application_process.html_content: Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarship program does not have any separate or additional scholarship application system. Students who have applied to the engineering programs at the University of Waterloo will be considered for the scholarship.

Arthur F. Church Mechanical Engineering Scholarships are offered to students pursuing Computer Engineering, Systems Design Engineering, and Mechatronics Engineering at UG level at the University of Waterloo.

There is no separate application for the scholarship and all the students pursuing these courses are considered for it. 7,695 USD is given as a scholarship amount to two academically exceptional students. Some other key details of the scholarship program are mentioned in the following table:

Study-Level Graduate
Eligible Candidates Canadian/ Permanent resident, International/ study permit student
Number of Scholarships 2
Study-Length 3 years
Scholarship Award Tuition fees
Award Distributed Yearly

Since the number of scholarships awarded is just two, the candidates must expect to get tough competition. Students need to maintain a good academic background and simultaneously balance extracurricular records. A little hard work from the beginning will help you to outshine many competitors who you might face otherwise.

description:
John Kinghorn Scholarship is awarded to the students commencing a Master’s level program at the School of Engineering, University of Sussex. A tuition fee waiver of

£10,000 is provided to the students under this scholarship program. Three students are selected for the John Kinghorn scholarships provided by the University of Sussex.

One scholarship is reserved for female applicants to encourage more female participation in STEM subjects. John Kinghorn Scholarship is offered both to the domestic students as well as students belonging to specific countries including the USA, South-Asian Countries, etc. Due to the various financial aids and quality education, the University of Sussex can be considered as one of the best options to study in the UK.

eligibility_criteria.description: Eligibility for the John Kinghorn Scholarship is based on the financial need of a candidate and a few other factors like the chosen degree, academic interest, etc. Eligible candidates must opt for afull-time master's programs at the University of Sussex:MSc in 5G Mobile Communications and Intelligent Embedded Systems5G Mobile Communications and Intelligent Embedded Systems (with an industrial placement year) MScMSc in Advanced Mechanical EngineeringMSc in Digital Signal and Image ProcessingMSc in Engineering Business ManagementMSc in Robotics and Autonomous SystemsMSc in Robotics and Autonomous Systems(with a Masters industrial placement)MSc in Robotics and Autonomous Systems (with an industrial placement year)The first step to get the scholarship is to takeadmissions at the University of Sussex. The students who have already taken the benefit of any other Sussex scholarship like the Chancellor’s International Scholarship will be considered ineligible for the John Kinghorn Scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Eligibility for the John Kinghorn Scholarship is based on the financial need of a candidate and a few other factors like the chosen degree, academic interest, etc. Eligible candidates must opt for a full-time master's programs at the University of Sussex:

  • MSc in 5G Mobile Communications and Intelligent Embedded Systems
  • 5G Mobile Communications and Intelligent Embedded Systems (with an industrial placement year) MSc
  • MSc in Advanced Mechanical Engineering
  • MSc in Digital Signal and Image Processing
  • MSc in Engineering Business Management
  • MSc in Robotics and Autonomous Systems
  • MSc in Robotics and Autonomous Systems (with a Masters industrial placement)
  • MSc in Robotics and Autonomous Systems (with an industrial placement year)

The first step to get the scholarship is to take admissions at the University of Sussex. The students who have already taken the benefit of any other Sussex scholarship like the Chancellor’s International Scholarship will be considered ineligible for the John Kinghorn Scholarship.

application_process.description: To apply for theJohn Kinghorn Scholarshipat theUniversity of Sussex, all the candidates are required to follow the below-mentioned steps:Eligible candidates are supposed tocomplete the scholarship applicationform after receiving and accepting an offer of a place in any of the eligible master’s program.Once thescholarship office reviews the application, they willcontact the candidate to announce the decision.If the candidate fails to meet the eligibility criteria, the application will not be considered in any case.If thecandidate’s application is shortlisted for the scholarship, an anonymous version will be shared with thescholarship selection panelso that the deserving candidates get them in the final selection process.There will be strict monitoring as no identifying characteristics will be shared. However, the statement of academic interests will be shared in full.To be considered for the scholarship, you will need to submita personal statement.  The statement will be assessed on the following:academic interests relating to your chosen degreefuture career plans related to your chosen field of studyyour entrepreneurial spirit and aspirations
application_process.html_content:
To apply for the John Kinghorn Scholarship at the University of Sussex, all the candidates are required to follow the below-mentioned steps:

  1. Eligible candidates are supposed to complete the scholarship application form after receiving and accepting an offer of a place in any of the eligible master’s program.
  2. Once the scholarship office reviews the application, they will contact the candidate to announce the decision.
  3. If the candidate fails to meet the eligibility criteria, the application will not be considered in any case.
  4. If the candidate’s application is shortlisted for the scholarship, an anonymous version will be shared with the scholarship selection panel so that the deserving candidates get them in the final selection process.
  5. There will be strict monitoring as no identifying characteristics will be shared. However, the statement of academic interests will be shared in full.

To be considered for the scholarship, you will need to submit a personal statement.  The statement will be assessed on the following:

  • academic interests relating to your chosen degree
  • future career plans related to your chosen field of study
  • your entrepreneurial spirit and aspirations

selection_process.description: The selection process takes place once the application is received by the university. The selection process takes a few weeks to get completed. Applications are assessed according to thestatement of academic interestsand thegradesobtained up to date.The selection panel will typically focus on the candidate’s academic interests related to the chosen degree. In addition to that, they also keep a check on future career plans of the candidates related to their chosen field of study.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process takes place once the application is received by the university. The selection process takes a few weeks to get completed. Applications are assessed according to the statement of academic interests and the grades obtained up to date.

The selection panel will typically focus on the candidate’s academic interests related to the chosen degree. In addition to that, they also keep a check on future career plans of the candidates related to their chosen field of study.

The award is available to people from specific countries including the US, South Asian countries, etc.The number of Scholarships available is 3 and the application deadline is 15 May 2026.Through the John Kinghorn Scholarship, the University of Sussex financially helps the students who want to make their careers in the field of Advanced engineering and robotics. The deadline to fill the application form for the scholarship isMay 15, 2026.

Study level Graduate
Eligibility International students from specific regions
Award amount £10,000
Number of Scholarships 3
Award distribution Annually
  • John Kinghorn Scholarship of £10,000 is given exclusively to the meritorious students who have completed the scholarship application form after they have received and accepted an offer of a place on the eligible master’s program.
  • The best part about the grant is, it is not just limited to domestic students. The award is available to people from specific countries including the US, South Asian countries, etc.

Through the John Kinghorn Scholarship, the University of Sussex financially helps the students who want to make their careers in the field of Advanced engineering and robotics. The deadline to fill the application form for the scholarship is May 15, 2026.

description:
Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship offers tuition fee reduction of 2500 GBP to incoming international students at the University of Liverpool. The scholarship program is designed for all postgraduate taught programs offered by the University of Liverpool.

Students will be automatically considered for the scholarship once they have successfully secured admission at the University of Liverpool. The selection is based on their admission application, test scores, academic scores, and other relevant documents submitted along with admission application.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship, an applicant must satisfy the following eligibility criteria:An international student with the overseas fee-paying status.Applying for anyPG taught courses at University of Liverpool.It applies only to London and Liverpool campus.Achieved a UK first-class undergraduate degree or equivalent.For Indian students, above 70% in BTech/BEng or above 65% in Bsc/BA/BComNotsponsored by any organization, including government and commercial.Cannot opt for scholarships likeHornby Scholarships,GREAT scholarships, etc.Notan alumnus of Liverpool International College, XJTLU (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University).*Mustnothave completed UG studies in Liverpool.*Such students have separate scholarship provisions.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship, an applicant must satisfy the following eligibility criteria:

  • An international student with the overseas fee-paying status.
  • Applying for any PG taught courses at University of Liverpool.
  • It applies only to London and Liverpool campus.
  • Achieved a UK first-class undergraduate degree or equivalent.
    • For Indian students, above 70% in BTech/BEng or above 65% in Bsc/BA/BCom
  • Not sponsored by any organization, including government and commercial.
    • Cannot opt for scholarships like Hornby Scholarships, GREAT scholarships, etc.
  • Not an alumnus of Liverpool International College, XJTLU (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University).*
  • Must not have completed UG studies in Liverpool.

*Such students have separate scholarship provisions.

application_process.description: No separate applicationis required for Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship. On confirmation of admission, eligible students will be automatically considered based on details provided in the admission application.Admission Checklist for PG Programs at University of Liverpool:Academic Transcripts with certified translations.Personal Statement/SOPTwo academic referencesScores of English Proficiency tests likeTOEFL, IELTS, etc. Minimum scores:IELTS: 6.5 or moreTOEFL IBT: 78 or morePTEAcademic: 62Note:No additional language tests are required for Indian students if they are educated in English medium for class XII and maintain 70% or above score.
application_process.html_content:
No separate application is required for Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship. On confirmation of admission, eligible students will be automatically considered based on details provided in the admission application.

Admission Checklist for PG Programs at University of Liverpool:

  • Academic Transcripts with certified translations.
  • Personal Statement/SOP
  • Two academic references
  • Scores of English Proficiency tests like TOEFL, IELTS, etc. Minimum scores:
    • IELTS: 6.5 or more
    • TOEFL IBT: 78 or more
    • PTE Academic: 62

Note:  No additional language tests are required for Indian students if they are educated in English medium for class XII and maintain 70% or above score.

selection_process.description: Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship is amerit-based scholarship program. The selection committee at theUniversity of Liverpoolreviews the admission application of the candidate.Factors that are taken into consideration while reviewing the application are listed below :Academic scoresExams taken to study in UKGrade Point Average (GPA) or equivalent obtained in UG studyPersonal statement/ essayReviewed for assessing any additional achievements.After the final decision has been taken by the selection committee, it will notify the recipients about the outcome of the same. Recipients of Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship are awardedGBP 2500 for the payment of their tuition fees. It is a one-time payment scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship is a merit-based scholarship program. The selection committee at the University of Liverpool reviews the admission application of the candidate.

Factors that are taken into consideration while reviewing the application are listed below :

  • Academic scores
  • Exams taken to study in UK
  • Grade Point Average (GPA) or equivalent obtained in UG study
  • Personal statement/ essay
    • Reviewed for assessing any additional achievements.

After the final decision has been taken by the selection committee, it will notify the recipients about the outcome of the same. Recipients of Liverpool Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship are awarded GBP 2500 for the payment of their tuition fees. It is a one-time payment scholarship.
