scholarship_name: Education for Sustainable Energy Development Scholarship Program
description:
The Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) Scholarship Program, offered by the Global Sustainable Electricity Partnership (GSEP), is awarded to students belonging to developing countries studying courses in sustainable energy development. Annually, 6-8 students pursuing master’s level studies in the USA, UK, Canada, etc. are recognized under this scholarship program.

Recipients of Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) Scholarship must return to their home country after completing their studies abroad and contribute to their country’s development.

eligibility_criteria.description: In order to become eligible for the Sustainable Energy Development Scholarship, applicants must fulfill the given criteria:belong to developing nations and must be committed to returning back to the home country after completion of the studies.pursue full- time studies for at least 2 or 3 semesters (one complete school year), starting in autumn 2020.can opt for an eligible program in anyuniversity of UK, USA, Australia, etc.be outstanding students with a good graduation score and belonging to the top 20% of their classes.have a history of community involvement and should be committed to sustainable energy development.determined students and interested in advancing their understanding and knowledge.Note:Students who have already received full funding for their studies and those who have already received scholarships to cover their tuition fees are not eligible for the scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to become eligible for the Sustainable Energy Development Scholarship, applicants must fulfill the given criteria:

  • belong to developing nations and must be committed to returning back to the home country after completion of the studies.
  • pursue full- time studies for at least 2 or 3 semesters (one complete school year), starting in autumn 2020.
    • can opt for an eligible program in any university of UK, USA, Australia, etc.
  • be outstanding students with a good graduation score and belonging to the top 20% of their classes.
  • have a history of community involvement and should be committed to sustainable energy development.
  • determined students and interested in advancing their understanding and knowledge.

Note: Students who have already received full funding for their studies and those who have already received scholarships to cover their tuition fees are not eligible for the scholarship.

application_process.description: Interested students will have to fill theonline application formforSustainable Energy Development scholarship.Application sent through email will not be accepted.An electronic copy of the following documents has to be provided at the time of filling up the application form:Birth certificate or passportUpdated Resume (details on education, awards, work experience, participation in other activities, etc.)Official translated Transcripts from universityAdmission letter from the universityScores of tests likeTOEFL, IELTS, PTE, etc.Program outlineProvide a complete copy of Academic reference formPersonal or academic reference letterThe application process for 2020- 2021 will start fromJanuary 2020and the deadline for the application isMar 06, 2020.Students who have not received their admission letter can also apply but they will have to send the admission letter by email toscholarship@globalelectricity.orgbeforeApril 17, 2020.The application will not be considered if the candidate fails to send an admission letter by April 17, 2020.
application_process.html_content:
Interested students will have to fill the online application form for Sustainable Energy Development scholarship. Application sent through email will not be accepted.

An electronic copy of the following documents has to be provided at the time of filling up the application form:

  • Birth certificate or passport
  • Updated Resume (details on education, awards, work experience, participation in other activities, etc.)
  • Official translated Transcripts from university
  • Admission letter from the university
  • Scores of tests like TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, etc.
  • Program outline
  • Provide a complete copy of Academic reference form
  • Personal or academic reference letter

The application process for 2020- 2021 will start from January 2020 and the deadline for the application is Mar 06, 2020.

Students who have not received their admission letter can also apply but they will have to send the admission letter by email to scholarship@globalelectricity.org before April 17, 2020. The application will not be considered if the candidate fails to send an admission letter by April 17, 2020.

selection_process.description: Recipients of Sustainable Energy Development scholarship are selected on the basis of theiracademic qualifications and achievements,extracurricular records, andwork experience.Other criteria are also considered while selecting eligible students. Academic Panel consists of representatives of notable academic institutions who will review the applications and select the deserving candidates for the scholarship.The selected candidate will be contacted by the selection panel in May and their names will be posted on the website.
selection_process.html_content:
Recipients of Sustainable Energy Development scholarship are selected on the basis of their

  • academic qualifications and achievements,
  • extracurricular records, and
  • work experience.

Other criteria are also considered while selecting eligible students. Academic Panel consists of representatives of notable academic institutions who will review the applications and select the deserving candidates for the scholarship.

The selected candidate will be contacted by the selection panel in May and their names will be posted on the website.

grant_details.description: Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) is offered to 6- 8 students from developing countries pursuing post-graduation courses in sustainable energy development annually. The amount offered as scholarship goes up to21,000 USD per yearand it can be awarded for a maximum of 2 years. It is eligible foruniversities of USA, Australia, Canada, UK, etc.Students who are interested in the scholarship are advised to apply at the earliest.The program aims to foster the upcoming generation of climate, electricity, and energy sector specialists to prepare them to tackle the challenges of the future
grant_details.html_content:
Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) is offered to 6- 8 students from developing countries pursuing post-graduation courses in sustainable energy development annually. The amount offered as scholarship goes up to 21,000 USD per year and it can be awarded for a maximum of 2 years. It is eligible for universities of USA, Australia, Canada, UK, etc.

Students who are interested in the scholarship are advised to apply at the earliest.

The program aims to foster the upcoming generation of climate, electricity, and energy sector specialists to prepare them to tackle the challenges of the future

description:
The Stuart Hall scholarship is offered to one student in the Department of Media and Film. It is one of the most prestigious scholarships offered by the University of Sussex.

The main aim of the scholarship is to provide financial aid to the students who want to study in the UK by providing a reduction in the cost of attendance.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students opting for themaster’s programs offered by the Department of Film and Mediawill be considered eligible for the Stuart Hall Scholarship. In addition to that,Applicants must hold or expect to hold a first class honours degree or the overseas equivalent.Applicants must not be a recipient of any other scholarship from Sussex.The courses eligible for the Stuart Hall Scholarship are mentioned below:Master of Arts in Digital MediaMaster of Arts in Film StudiesMaster of Arts in Cultural and Creative IndustriesMaster of Arts in Journalism and Documentary PracticeMaster of Arts in FilmmakingMaster of Arts in International JournalismMaster of Arts in Gender and MediaMaster of Arts in Journalism and Media StudiesMaster of Arts in Media Practice for Development and Social ChangeMaster of Arts in Media and Cultural Studies
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students opting for the master’s programs offered by the Department of Film and Media will be considered eligible for the Stuart Hall Scholarship. In addition to that,

  • Applicants must hold or expect to hold a first class honours degree or the overseas equivalent.
  • Applicants must not be a recipient of any other scholarship from Sussex.

The courses eligible for the Stuart Hall Scholarship are mentioned below:

Master of Arts in Digital Media Master of Arts in Film Studies
Master of Arts in Cultural and Creative Industries Master of Arts in Journalism and Documentary Practice
Master of Arts in Filmmaking Master of Arts in International Journalism
Master of Arts in Gender and Media Master of Arts in Journalism and Media Studies
Master of Arts in Media Practice for Development and Social Change Master of Arts in Media and Cultural Studies

application_process.description: Anonline applicationmust be submitted for the scholarship after you have submitted the course application. You will have to use the same application number that you receive after completing the course application.Fill in personal details.Write a 500-wordstatement of purpose, explaining your interest in the area of study and your future plans, as well as any voluntary activities you have undertaken.Upload a CV detailing your previous education and work experience.The documentary uploaded in your course application form will also be reviewed for the scholarship.If you are selected, the Scholarships Office will notify you. The deadline for form submission is usually in June/July.
application_process.html_content:
An online application must be submitted for the scholarship after you have submitted the course application. You will have to use the same application number that you receive after completing the course application.

  • Fill in personal details.
  • Write a 500-word statement of purpose, explaining your interest in the area of study and your future plans, as well as any voluntary activities you have undertaken.
  • Upload a CV detailing your previous education and work experience.
  • The documentary uploaded in your course application form will also be reviewed for the scholarship.

If you are selected, the Scholarships Office will notify you. The deadline for form submission is usually in June/July.

selection_process.description: The selection panel will make a decision after assessing your:Academic recordCareer plansVoluntary/Community workPersonal CircumstancesStudents who are planning to focus on the following areas, which are of interest to Stuart Hall, are given preference:Postcolonial and Diasporic ModernitiesCultural StudiesRace, Ethnicity and Visual CulturesRadical Thinking on the LeftOnly one scholaris selected every year across all the Masters programs.Note:Those students who have received any other Sussex Scholarships like theChancellor’s International Scholarship,Sussex India Scholarshipare not eligible for Stuart Hall scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection panel will make a decision after assessing your:

  • Academic record
  • Career plans
  • Voluntary/Community work
  • Personal Circumstances

Students who are planning to focus on the following areas, which are of interest to Stuart Hall, are given preference:

  • Postcolonial and Diasporic Modernities
  • Cultural Studies
  • Race, Ethnicity and Visual Cultures
  • Radical Thinking on the Left

Only one scholar is selected every year across all the Masters programs.

Note: Those students who have received any other Sussex Scholarships like the Chancellor’s International Scholarship, Sussex India Scholarship are not eligible for Stuart Hall scholarship.

grant_details.description: Although funded by the university itself,the Stuart Hall Scholarship at the University of Sussex is supported by the Stuart Hall Foundation, who aspire to give aid to creative thinkers who are from culturally diverse and disadvantaged backgrounds.Stuart Hall Foundation scholarships and fellowships are available at a number of other institutions, some of which are:Birkbeck, University of LondonRuhr-University BochumTechnical University of DortmundGoldsmiths, University of LondonHutchins Centre of African and African American Research, Harvard UniversityUniversity of ManchesterMerton College, Oxford University/TORCH, The Oxford Research Centre in HumanitiesTavistock and Portman NHS Foundation TrustUniversity of Central LancashireUniversity of East LondonThe scholarship type and amount varies at different universities.
grant_details.html_content:
Although funded by the university itself,the Stuart Hall Scholarship at the University of Sussex is supported by the Stuart Hall Foundation, who aspire to give aid to creative thinkers who are from culturally diverse and disadvantaged backgrounds.

Stuart Hall Foundation scholarships and fellowships are available at a number of other institutions, some of which are:

  • Birkbeck, University of London
  • Ruhr-University Bochum
  • Technical University of Dortmund
  • Goldsmiths, University of London
  • Hutchins Centre of African and African American Research, Harvard University
  • University of Manchester
  • Merton College, Oxford University/TORCH, The Oxford Research Centre in Humanities
  • Tavistock and Portman NHS Foundation Trust
  • University of Central Lancashire
  • University of East London

The scholarship type and amount varies at different universities.

description:
Article 26 Scholarship is financial assistance provided to the applicants who wish to enroll for a UG program at the University of Sussex. This scholarship program extends support to the forced migrant students in the UK or higher education.

The scholarship is aimed at providing financial assistance to an asylum seeker or applicant granted a temporary form of leave who wishes to take up an undergraduate degree at the University of Sussex.

It should be noted that the scholarship covers the tuition fee of the university which varies according to the undergraduate course chosen by the applicant. The average tuition fee for most programs at the University of Sussex is 24,050 USD per year. Tuition Fee for some of the courses is mentioned below-

Program Fees
B.Sc in Accounting and Finance USD 24,050 per year
BA (Hons) American Studies  USD 24,050 per year
BA (Hons) Anthropology  USD 24,050 per year
BA (Hons) Art History and Film Studies  USD 29,250 per year

The scholarship covers the cost of attendance and maintenance costs up to 14,950 USD. However, the applicants will have to pay for accommodation, travel, and stay in the UK on their own.

eligibility_criteria.description: Applicants are supposed to meet the eligibility criteria defined by the University of Sussex to get benefits of the Article 26 Scholarship. The very first step to get the scholarship is to takeadmissions at the University of Sussexin an undergraduate course.The first and foremost thing is that one must be offered a place for an undergraduate degree at the University of Sussex to be eligible for the scholarship.Must have a household income of under 55,737.50 USD.Other than this, one must be-Be an asylum-seeker; orHave been granted a temporary form of leave to remain as a result of an asylum application (e.g. limited leave to remain, humanitarian protection); orBe a child or partner of an asylum seeker or an unaccompanied asylum-seeking child.Any applicant who fails to meet the above-mentioned eligibility criteria will be considered ineligible for the scholarship.Countries eligible for Article 26 ScholarshipArticle 26 scholarship is available for applicants from some specific countries. Here is the list of the countries where the scholarship is available:AfghanistanBangladeshCzech RepublicIndiaPakistanUnited StatesAlbaniaBrazilDenmarkJapanSingaporeVietnamAlgeriaCanadaEnglandMalaysiaSouth AfricaThailandAustraliaFranceFinlandMaldivesSwitzerlandSri LankaArgentinaBulgariaDominican RepublicNepalUAESouth Korea
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Applicants are supposed to meet the eligibility criteria defined by the University of Sussex to get benefits of the Article 26 Scholarship. The very first step to get the scholarship is to take admissions at the University of Sussex in an undergraduate course.

  • The first and foremost thing is that one must be offered a place for an undergraduate degree at the University of Sussex to be eligible for the scholarship.
  • Must have a household income of under 55,737.50 USD.
  • Other than this, one must be-
    • Be an asylum-seeker; or
    • Have been granted a temporary form of leave to remain as a result of an asylum application (e.g. limited leave to remain, humanitarian protection); or
    • Be a child or partner of an asylum seeker or an unaccompanied asylum-seeking child.

Any applicant who fails to meet the above-mentioned eligibility criteria will be considered ineligible for the scholarship.

Countries eligible for Article 26 Scholarship

Article 26 scholarship is available for applicants from some specific countries. Here is the list of the countries where the scholarship is available:

  • Afghanistan
  • Bangladesh
  • Czech Republic
  • India
  • Pakistan
  • United States
  • Albania
  • Brazil
  • Denmark
  • Japan
  • Singapore
  • Vietnam
  • Algeria
  • Canada
  • England
  • Malaysia
  • South Africa
  • Thailand
  • Australia
  • France
  • Finland
  • Maldives
  • Switzerland
  • Sri Lanka
  • Argentina
  • Bulgaria
  • Dominican Republic
  • Nepal
  • UAE
  • South Korea

application_process.description: All the students seeking the Article 26 scholarship will have toapply onlinefor the same. The applicationdeadline for Article 26 scholarship is May 1, 2024. Candidates can refer to the below-mentioned steps to know about the complete application process:Step 1:After opening the application link, candidates will be redirected to the application form for the Article 26 Scholarship.Step 2:After filling the basic details in the application form, all the candidates will be required to fill the eligibility details including:Submission of the UCAS applicationBachelor's degree for which the student has applied for.Current status of the studentstudying in the UK.Date of discretionary leave award to remain in the UK (if applicable)Step 3:Applicants will be required to submit a “Statement of Purpose” of not more than 500 words. One can upload a statement of purpose in only doc, Docx, ODT, pdf, RTF, txt, and HTML formats. Also, the file size should not be more than 5MB.Step 4:In the end, applicants are supposed to provide all necessary documents including evidence of current status in the UK (letter or Biometric Residence Permit Card) and proof of family income (P60, payslips, benefit notification letters, etc).
application_process.html_content:
All the students seeking the Article 26 scholarship will have to apply online for the same. The application deadline for Article 26 scholarship is May 1, 2024. Candidates can refer to the below-mentioned steps to know about the complete application process:

Step 1: After opening the application link, candidates will be redirected to the application form for the Article 26 Scholarship.

Step 2: After filling the basic details in the application form, all the candidates will be required to fill the eligibility details including:

  • Submission of the UCAS application
  • Bachelor's degree for which the student has applied for.
  • Current status of the student studying in the UK.
  • Date of discretionary leave award to remain in the UK (if applicable)

Step 3: Applicants will be required to submit a “Statement of Purpose” of not more than 500 words. One can upload a statement of purpose in only doc, Docx, ODT, pdf, RTF, txt, and HTML formats. Also, the file size should not be more than 5MB.

Step 4: In the end, applicants are supposed to provide all necessary documents including evidence of current status in the UK (letter or Biometric Residence Permit Card) and proof of family income (P60, payslips, benefit notification letters, etc).

selection_process.description: Applicants shortlisted for the Article 26 Scholarship then they will be contacted by the Scholarship Office of theUniversity of Sussex. It should be noted that the scholarship decision will be informed to the applicant after the last date of application.If a candidate’s application is shortlisted for scholarship, an anonymous version of the application will be shared with the scholarship selection panel for the final selection process. None of the identifying characteristics will be shared with the panel.
selection_process.html_content:
Applicants shortlisted for the Article 26 Scholarship then they will be contacted by the Scholarship Office of the University of Sussex. It should be noted that the scholarship decision will be informed to the applicant after the last date of application.

If a candidate’s application is shortlisted for scholarship, an anonymous version of the application will be shared with the scholarship selection panel for the final selection process. None of the identifying characteristics will be shared with the panel.

description:
Deakin India 25% Merit Scholarship is a tuition fee waiver that is offered in a form of a scholarship to Indian students. Applicable for both undergraduate and graduate programs at Deakin, this scholarship program offers an unlimited number of scholarships to eligible students.

The proof of residency and academic excellence are primary eligibility and selection criteria for Deakin India 25% Merit Scholarship. Applicants are not required to submit any additional applications. The selection panel reviews the Deakin University admission applications of eligible students. Recipients are required to maintain an average score for continued eligibility of the scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: Applicants must fulfill the given conditions to be eligible for this scholarship. If the applicant is unable to fulfill the given conditions then he is not applicable for this scholarship.Must be an Indian CitizenMust be in India at the time of applicationMust fulfill the academic eligibilityAcademic Eligibility for Deakin India 25% Merit ScholarshipGiven below are the minimum academic requirements to be eligible for the scholarship:For UG programs:A minimum of 80% as an overall score in class XII.For PG programs:a minimum of 75% as an overall score in bachelors.For continued eligibility, the Weighted Average Mark (WAM) must be maintained at a minimum of 65.Applicants attaining marks less than the ones specified above can check other scholarships likeDeakin India 20% Bursary, available for lower academic scores in previous classes.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Applicants must fulfill the given conditions to be eligible for this scholarship. If the applicant is unable to fulfill the given conditions then he is not applicable for this scholarship.

  • Must be an Indian Citizen
  • Must be in India at the time of application
  • Must fulfill the academic eligibility

Academic Eligibility for Deakin India 25% Merit Scholarship

Given below are the minimum academic requirements to be eligible for the scholarship:

  • For UG programs: A minimum of 80% as an overall score in class XII.
  • For PG programs: a minimum of 75% as an overall score in bachelors.
  • For continued eligibility, the Weighted Average Mark (WAM) must be maintained at a minimum of 65.

Applicants attaining marks less than the ones specified above can check other scholarships like Deakin India 20% Bursary, available for lower academic scores in previous classes.

application_process.description: Applicants who fulfill the eligibility criteria listed by theDeakin Universityare automatically accepted for the scholarship.No separate application formis to be submitted.Applicants who have queries regarding the scholarship or the application process can mail the university at the given id southasia@deakin.edu.au.Note:The scholarship is applicable for all full-time courses and thus applicants from any program which accepts this scholarship are eligible as long as they meet the specified conditions.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants who fulfill the eligibility criteria listed by the Deakin University are automatically accepted for the scholarship. No separate application form is to be submitted. 

Applicants who have queries regarding the scholarship or the application process can mail the university at the given id southasia@deakin.edu.au.

Note: The scholarship is applicable for all full-time courses and thus applicants from any program which accepts this scholarship are eligible as long as they meet the specified conditions.

selection_process.description: The selection committee assigned for Deakin India 25% Merit Scholarship, analyses each application. Selections for the scholarship program are based on,CitizenshipApplication process and timelineAcademic scoresThe applicants who are eligible receive the 25% fee reduction to the total tuition fee in the admission letter.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection committee assigned for Deakin India 25% Merit Scholarship, analyses each application. Selections for the scholarship program are based on,

  • Citizenship
  • Application process and timeline
  • Academic scores

The applicants who are eligible receive the 25% fee reduction to the total tuition fee in the admission letter.

The Deakin India 25% Merit Scholarship is an academic-based grant which provides financial assistance academically promising Indian students. The scholarship program does not have any additional application system. Therefore, all an applicant has to do is fulfill the eligibility criteria.

description:
Ashok Khurana Scholarship for Outstanding Indian Students is awarded to meritorious Indian students commencing a postgraduate program. The scholarship is eligible for specific academic subjects at the university such as aerospace, education, clean technology, etc. 

Ashok Khurana Scholarship for Outstanding Indian Students covers more than just the tuition fees. The recipients of the scholarship can use the award amount for airfare and other living expenses of pursuing higher education in Australia,

eligibility_criteria.description: In order to be eligible for the Ashok Khurana Scholarship, applicants must have their admission letter to the University of Adelaide. The other eligibility requirements for the scholarship are:Be enrolled on a full time basisBe an international student with Indian Citizenship not currently studying in Australia and/or residing in Australia on a Student, Bridging or any other visa.Commencement of master’sprogram at the University of Adelaidein same session and years as the scholarship.Students must be pursuing a postgraduate program in one of the following academic areas:EducationAgriculture (including Food Security and Wine)Health Services (including Biotechnology)Clean TechnologyEnvironment (including Urban Planning and Architecture)AerospaceResourcesStudents must have achieved over 65% in the undergraduate degree program.Note:-Candidates who have either applied for or will apply for Australian permanent resident status will not be eligible to apply for this scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to be eligible for the Ashok Khurana Scholarship, applicants must have their admission letter to the University of Adelaide. The other eligibility requirements for the scholarship are:

  • Be enrolled on a full time basis
  • Be an international student with Indian Citizenship not currently studying in Australia and/or residing in Australia on a Student, Bridging or any other visa.
  • Commencement of master’s program at the University of Adelaide in same session and years as the scholarship.
  • Students must be pursuing a postgraduate program in one of the following academic areas:
    • Education
    • Agriculture (including Food Security and Wine)
    • Health Services (including Biotechnology)
    • Clean Technology
    • Environment (including Urban Planning and Architecture)
    • Aerospace
    • Resources
  • Students must have achieved over 65% in the undergraduate degree program.

Note:- Candidates who have either applied for or will apply for Australian permanent resident status will not be eligible to apply for this scholarship.

application_process.description: Applications for theUniversity of AdelaideAshok Khurana Scholarship accepted in the online mode only. To apply to this scholarship, candidates need to follow the below-mentioned steps in order:Check the next deadline by visiting the official website of the scholarship page of the Adelaide University.Click on the ‘Apply Online’ button.Fill the application form completely and correctly.Attach the required documents in PDF format with the online application.Submit the completed application and all the necessary documents much before the deadline.Applicants are required to provide some important details provided below at the time of the application:Details of self-income and parent’s incomeNoncustodial parent asset and incomeCitizenship documentsPhotocopy of the Passport
application_process.html_content:
Applications for the University of Adelaide Ashok Khurana Scholarship accepted in the online mode only. To apply to this scholarship, candidates need to follow the below-mentioned steps in order:

  1. Check the next deadline by visiting the official website of the scholarship page of the Adelaide University.
  2. Click on the ‘Apply Online’ button.
  3. Fill the application form completely and correctly.
  4. Attach the required documents in PDF format with the online application.
  5. Submit the completed application and all the necessary documents much before the deadline.

Applicants are required to provide some important details provided below at the time of the application:

  • Details of self-income and parent’s income
  • Noncustodial parent asset and income
  • Citizenship documents
  • Photocopy of the Passport

selection_process.description: Selection of the successful candidate will be made according to:Academic merit (GPA)Demonstrated leadership qualities and potential to significantly enhance IndiaAnswers to questions on the application formOverall, every Ashok Khurana Scholarship application must strongly reflect an applicant’s suitability for the scholarship and the ability to enhance educational outcomes in the chosen field.Note:Maintaining the ‘international student’ status for the entire duration of the Ashok Khurana Scholarship. The scholarship will be terminated if a student changes his/ her residency status.
selection_process.html_content:
Selection of the successful candidate will be made according to:

  • Academic merit (GPA)
  • Demonstrated leadership qualities and potential to significantly enhance India
  • Answers to questions on the application form

Overall, every Ashok Khurana Scholarship application must strongly reflect an applicant’s suitability for the scholarship and the ability to enhance educational outcomes in the chosen field. 

Note: Maintaining the ‘international student’ status for the entire duration of the Ashok Khurana Scholarship. The scholarship will be terminated if a student changes his/ her residency status.

description:
The President's International Scholarship is provided to all international students who have applied by January 25, 2026, beginning undergraduate programs. The scholarship is only applicable at the City, University of London. Students need to complete the application process within the given deadline, or they will not be eligible.

The President’s International Scholarship intends to reward students with exceptional academic performance. This scholarship was previously known as the Vice-Chancellor's International Scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students opting for any undergraduateprograms at the City, University of Londonare eligible for the President’s International Scholarship. Apart from that, applicants must fulfill the eligibility criteria given below:An international student paying tuition fees at an overseas rate.Starting in year 1 of your degree at City starting in September 2025Applying for undergraduate programs at the City, University of London.the university should be the first preference tostudy in the UKExcellent academic scores, especially for admission inCass Business School& School of Arts and Social SciencesGrades AAA or above in 'A' levels or IB 35 or above in the International BaccalaureateIndians must have 80% or above in Higher secondary educationMake City your Firm choice, either as Conditional Firm (CF) or Unconditional Firm (UF), in line with the UCAS response deadline in June 2024.Only applicants fulfilling these requirements will be reviewed for the President’s International Scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students opting for any undergraduate programs at the City, University of London are eligible for the President’s International Scholarship. Apart from that, applicants must fulfill the eligibility criteria given below:

  • An international student paying tuition fees at an overseas rate.
  • Starting in year 1 of your degree at City starting in September 2025
  • Applying for undergraduate programs at the City, University of London.
    • the university should be the first preference to study in the UK
  • Excellent academic scores, especially for admission in Cass Business School & School of Arts and Social Sciences
    • Grades AAA or above in 'A' levels or IB 35 or above in the International Baccalaureate
    • Indians must have 80% or above in Higher secondary education
  • Make City your Firm choice, either as Conditional Firm (CF) or Unconditional Firm (UF), in line with the UCAS response deadline in June 2024.

Only applicants fulfilling these requirements will be reviewed for the President’s International Scholarship.

application_process.description: All students who submitted applications by February 6, 2026, and have not been subsequently unsuccessful. will be contacted with details of how they can apply for this Scholarship. All applications should take place online, and no applications will be considered outside of the advertised timeframe.At stage 1, students will have to:Demonstrate that you are expected to achieve academic grades above the conditions of the offerProvide a written statement detailing how you are hoping to make a contribution to the wider City community. This statement should be no more than 500 words; but it should demonstrate research into thewider City initiativesand any evidence of previous community engagement or leadershipStudents will have until 2nd June 2026 to submit an application for the Scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
All students who submitted applications by February 6, 2026, and have not been subsequently unsuccessful. will be contacted with details of how they can apply for this Scholarship. All applications should take place online, and no applications will be considered outside of the advertised timeframe.

At stage 1, students will have to:

  • Demonstrate that you are expected to achieve academic grades above the conditions of the offer
  • Provide a written statement detailing how you are hoping to make a contribution to the wider City community. This statement should be no more than 500 words; but it should demonstrate research into the wider City initiatives and any evidence of previous community engagement or leadership

Students will have until 2nd June 2026 to submit an application for the Scholarship.

selection_process.description: Students will be informed by the23rd June 2024to confirm whether that they have been shortlisted. This short listing will be made by a panel of senior staff within the Admissions Teams and every applicant will bescored and ranked for the relevancy and quality of their submission.Students who are successful in being shortlisted will only proceed to stage 3 and the Selection Panel, if they select City as their ‘Firm’ choice and meet the conditions of their offer.The final stage is conducted by the Selection panel who will review shortlisted applicants before making the final award. All students who have progressed to stage 3 will be written to by the8th September 2024to confirm if they have been awarded the scholarship.Applicants should follow the admissions Appeals and Complaints Policy should they wish to follow up on any decisions made as paNote:If, after applying for one of the scholarships, your circumstances change and you are no longer eligible for that scholarship, you may be considered for one of the other available awards at the discretion of CityStudents who are successful in their application to this scheme are not eligible to receive funding from any of our other scholarshipsStudents who do not complete the application process by this deadline will not be eligible
selection_process.html_content:
• Students will be informed by the 23rd June 2024 to confirm whether that they have been shortlisted. This short listing will be made by a panel of senior staff within the Admissions Teams and every applicant will be scored and ranked for the relevancy and quality of their submission.
  • Students who are successful in being shortlisted will only proceed to stage 3 and the Selection Panel, if they select City as their ‘Firm’ choice and meet the conditions of their offer.
  • The final stage is conducted by the Selection panel who will review shortlisted applicants before making the final award. All students who have progressed to stage 3 will be written to by the 8th September 2024 to confirm if they have been awarded the scholarship.
  • Applicants should follow the admissions Appeals and Complaints Policy should they wish to follow up on any decisions made as pa

Note:

  • If, after applying for one of the scholarships, your circumstances change and you are no longer eligible for that scholarship, you may be considered for one of the other available awards at the discretion of City
  • Students who are successful in their application to this scheme are not eligible to receive funding from any of our other scholarships
  • Students who do not complete the application process by this deadline will not be eligible

grant_details.description: Study levelUndergraduateEligible candidatesInternational studentsNumber of scholarshipsVariableScholarship award50% of the course feeVia the President’s International Scholarship, the students who want tostudy in the UKget a 50% scholarship which is available for your first year.Students are supposed to get the scholarship from the very first year of their undergraduate program. Students failing to get the scholarship in the first year will not get the same in the second or third year of their undergraduate program.
grant_details.html_content:
Study level Undergraduate
Eligible candidates International students
Number of scholarships Variable
Scholarship award 50% of the course fee

Via the President’s International Scholarship, the students who want to study in the UK get a 50% scholarship which is available for your first year. 

Students are supposed to get the scholarship from the very first year of their undergraduate program. Students failing to get the scholarship in the first year will not get the same in the second or third year of their undergraduate program.

scholarship_name: Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program
description:
The Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program is offered by the University of Toronto to its international students in recognition of their academic performance, achievements, and creativity. The scholarship is awarded to incoming undergraduate students of the University of Toronto.

For international students, Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program is one of the most prestigious and competitive scholarships awarded by the U of T. It will cover the cost of attendance and cost of living in Canada including other expenses like books, incidental fees, and others.

eligibility_criteria.description: Only students who are freshmen and applying to UG programs at the university will be eligible for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program. Along with this, applicants must fulfill certain eligibility criteria listed below:An international student (i.e. a non-Canadian) with aCanadian student visa.Display a certain level of originality of thoughts and creativity in school and communityAcademic achievements and participation in creative pursuitsDisplay enthusiasm towards learning and acquisition of new skillsDemonstration of leadership qualitiesIn the final year of higher secondary school at the time of applicationORGraduated not before June 2025Beginning your studies at the University of Toronto in September 2026Students NOT Eligible for Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program:Studying post-secondary education in Canada.Commencing post-secondary education, in January 2024, at anotheruniversity in Canada.Note: If a student is already attending post-secondary studies or will be starting their studies in January prior to the start of studies at U of T in another post-secondary institution, then they cannot be considered for the scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Only students who are freshmen and applying to UG programs at the university will be eligible for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program. Along with this, applicants must fulfill certain eligibility criteria listed below:

  • An international student (i.e. a non-Canadian) with a Canadian student visa.
  • Display a certain level of originality of thoughts and creativity in school and community
  • Academic achievements and participation in creative pursuits
  • Display enthusiasm towards learning and acquisition of new skills
  • Demonstration of leadership qualities
  • In the final year of higher secondary school at the time of application OR
    • Graduated not before June 2025
  • Beginning your studies at the University of Toronto in September 2026

Students NOT Eligible for Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program:

  • Studying post-secondary education in Canada.
  • Commencing post-secondary education, in January 2024, at another university in Canada.

Note: If a student is already attending post-secondary studies or will be starting their studies in January prior to the start of studies at U of T in another post-secondary institution, then they cannot be considered for the scholarship.

application_process.description: Students, who meet the eligibility criteria, have to complete the application process for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program. Prospective candidates must follow the below-mentioned steps to apply for thescholarship provided by the University of Toronto:Nomination:Get nominated by your school for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program at the U of T.Some schools are not verified by the university, so they must submit an application for participating in the scholarship program.Admission Application Form:Submit an application for admission at UToronto to begin studying in the year 2026.Only applications completed before the deadline will be considered.Completion of Scholarship Application:After submitting the application foradmission at the U of Tand receiving a nomination from the scholarship, you must complete your Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program application.Documents RequiredTranscriptsLetters of referenceUpdated ResumeStatement of intentA sample of written workGREscoresScholarship DeadlinesThe important deadlines by which each step of the application process must be complete have been mentioned in the table below:ParticularsDeadlineSchool nominationOctober 10, 2025Submission of admission applicationOctober 17, 2025Submission of scholarship applicationNovember 7, 2025Note:The above-mentioned date is the final date to submit an application to the OUAC; however, it is recommended that students apply for admission through the OUAC before November 7, 2023, as spaces in programs fill-up quickly and popular programs may close early.
application_process.html_content:
Students, who meet the eligibility criteria, have to complete the application process for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program. Prospective candidates must follow the below-mentioned steps to apply for the scholarship provided by the University of Toronto:

  1. Nomination: Get nominated by your school for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program at the U of T.
    • Some schools are not verified by the university, so they must submit an application for participating in the scholarship program.
  2. Admission Application Form: Submit an application for admission at UToronto to begin studying in the year 2026.
    • Only applications completed before the deadline will be considered.
  3. Completion of Scholarship Application: After submitting the application for admission at the U of T and receiving a nomination from the scholarship, you must complete your Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program application.

Documents Required

  • Transcripts
  • Letters of reference
  • Updated Resume
  • Statement of intent
  • A sample of written work
  • GRE scores

Scholarship Deadlines

The important deadlines by which each step of the application process must be complete have been mentioned in the table below:

Particulars Deadline
School nomination October 10, 2025
Submission of admission application October 17, 2025
Submission of scholarship application November 7, 2025

Note: The above-mentioned date is the final date to submit an application to the OUAC; however, it is recommended that students apply for admission through the OUAC before November 7, 2023, as spaces in programs fill-up quickly and popular programs may close early.

selection_process.description: Approximately 37 incoming students of theUToronto UG programare awarded under Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program. Recipients are majorly selected based on the:Scholarship applicationHigh school nominationFulfillment of eligibility criteriaAny scholarships awarded will be valid and acceptable only at the University of Toronto.Note:If students apply for more than one program and get admission to all of them then, the scholarship will be applicable only for the first choice of program and not the subsequent ones.
selection_process.html_content:
Approximately 37 incoming students of the UToronto UG program are awarded under Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program. Recipients are majorly selected based on the:

  • Scholarship application
  • High school nomination
  • Fulfillment of eligibility criteria

Any scholarships awarded will be valid and acceptable only at the University of Toronto.

Note: If students apply for more than one program and get admission to all of them then, the scholarship will be applicable only for the first choice of program and not the subsequent ones.

grant_details.description: Students who have applied for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program can expect to get a reply regarding the University’s decision by the end of April 2024. The grant details of the scholarship have been presented in a tabular form below:Study-LevelUndergraduateEligible CandidatesInternational students across the worldNumber of Scholarships37Study-Length4 yearsScholarship AwardTuition feesAward DistributedAnnuallyThis scholarship is awarded in the name of the father of modern peacekeeping i.e. Lester B. Pearson. He was one of the greatest prime ministers of Canada and only Canadian to win a Nobel Prize for peace.The scholarship targets to reduce the financial pressure of students who have leadership qualities and can contribute in various fields of development. The University of Toronto can be one of the best options for students tostudy in Canadaas it is one of the best Canadian universities for higher studiesFor any further information kindly contact the university at pearson.scholarship@utoronto.ca
grant_details.html_content:
Students who have applied for the Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program can expect to get a reply regarding the University’s decision by the end of April 2024. The grant details of the scholarship have been presented in a tabular form below:

Study-Level Undergraduate
Eligible Candidates International students across the world
Number of Scholarships 37
Study-Length 4 years
Scholarship Award Tuition fees

This scholarship is awarded in the name of the father of modern peacekeeping i.e. Lester B. Pearson. He was one of the greatest prime ministers of Canada and only Canadian to win a Nobel Prize for peace.

The scholarship targets to reduce the financial pressure of students who have leadership qualities and can contribute in various fields of development. The University of Toronto can be one of the best options for students to study in Canada as it is one of the best Canadian universities for higher studies

For any further information kindly contact the university at pearson.scholarship@utoronto.ca

description:
IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships is designed for students coming from low or lower-middle-income countries who wish to pursue higher education at University College London(ULC).

ULC has partnered with International Students House (ISH), UCL Institute of Education (IOE) - International Students House Centenary Scholarship, and the Mary Trevelyan Centenary Scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: To secure IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships, students must meet the eligibility criteria listed below :Must be citizens and residents of a low or middle-income country with a GNI not higher than 8000 EUR per capita (as per theWorld Bank )Must have an unconditional offer to study a full-time master'sprogram at the University College London.Online programs are ineligible.Must not have studied or lived in the UK before.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To secure IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships, students must meet the eligibility criteria listed below :

  • Must be citizens and residents of a low or middle-income country with a GNI not higher than 8000 EUR per capita (as per the World Bank )
  • Must have an unconditional offer to study a full-time master's program at the University College London.
    • Online programs are ineligible.
  • Must not have studied or lived in the UK before.

application_process.description: Students who recieved an offer letter from theUniversity College Londoncan apply for the scholarship.They should send an email at IOEinternational@ucl.ac.uk requesting for a scholarship application form. Including student ID number in the email is mandatory.Candidates must complete the scholarship form along with any required documents. This must be submitted no later than May 02, 2023 (23:55 PM London time).
application_process.html_content:
Students who recieved an offer letter from the University College London can apply for the scholarship.

They should send an email at IOEinternational@ucl.ac.uk requesting for a scholarship application form. Including student ID number in the email is mandatory.

Candidates must complete the scholarship form along with any required documents. This must be submitted no later than May 02, 2023 (23:55 PM London time).

selection_process.description: The selection of the recipients of IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships is based on the scholarship application.Their academic background, LOR, scores ofexams to study in the UK,CV may be taken into consideration from the final decision.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of the recipients of IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships is based on the scholarship application.

Their academic background, LOR, scores of exams to study in the UK, CV may be taken into consideration from the final decision.

grant_details.description: International students who wish tostudy abroadat University College London with some financial assistance can apply for IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships.This is applicable to the master’s program at ULC only.It will cover full tuition fees and 1-year accommodation at International Students House.It does not covertravel and stays in the UK.The scholarship is applicable for one academic year, subject to satisfactory progress.University College London is one of the top institutes in the UK with excellentreviewsand ratings. Students who wish to study at ULC must check their official website for more information.
grant_details.html_content:
International students who wish to study abroad at University College London with some financial assistance can apply for IOE-ISH Centenary Taught Master's Scholarships.

  • This is applicable to the master’s program at ULC only.
  • It will cover full tuition fees and 1-year accommodation at International Students House.
    • It does not cover travel and stays in the UK.
  • The scholarship is applicable for one academic year, subject to satisfactory progress.

University College London is one of the top institutes in the UK with excellent reviews and ratings. Students who wish to study at ULC must check their official website for more information.

description:
ASEAN Partner Scholarship intends to support international students who want to pursue higher studies at Macquarie University. Also, students must have transferred from any of the universities namely HELP University, Bangkok University, and Ho Chi Minh City University, Vietnam.

Selection will take place once applications have been received by the university. ASEAN Partner Scholarships is limited so Macquarie University encourages applicants to accept offers and scholarships early to avoid disappointment.

eligibility_criteria.description: Prospective applicants must meetadmission criteria at Macquarie Universityto be eligible for the ASEAN Partner Scholarship. Apart from that, they must meet the eligibility criteria listed below:Citizenship:Must be a citizen of any country other than Australia or New Zealand.Program:Must pursue a full-time UG program offered by Macquarie University.It must be at least longer than one session.Must have transferred fromoneof the following universities:HELP University, Malaysia,Bangkok University, ThailandHo Chi Minh City University, Vietnam.Achieved a minimum GPA of 5.0 on a scale of 7.0Must provide ELP scores of IELTS,TOEFL,etc.Must have remained enrolled in the program to maintain the scholarship.Conditions regarding ASEAN Partner Scholarship:The student is enrolled in a Study Abroad or in an Exchange program incoming to Macquarie University are ineligible.Student who has applied to or enrolled in Macquarie University International College are ineligible.Note:If the student withdraws from the program before it is completed, the student might have to repay the scholarship amount awarded previously during the study period.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Prospective applicants must meet admission criteria at Macquarie University to be eligible for the ASEAN Partner Scholarship. Apart from that, they must meet the eligibility criteria listed below:

  • Citizenship: Must be a citizen of any country other than Australia or New Zealand.
  • Program: Must pursue a full-time UG program offered by Macquarie University.
    • It must be at least longer than one session.
  • Must have transferred from one of the following universities:
    • HELP University, Malaysia,
    • Bangkok University, Thailand
    • Ho Chi Minh City University, Vietnam.
  • Achieved a minimum GPA of 5.0 on a scale of 7.0
  • Must provide ELP scores of IELTS, TOEFL, etc.
  • Must have remained enrolled in the program to maintain the scholarship.

Conditions regarding ASEAN Partner Scholarship:

  • The student is enrolled in a Study Abroad or in an Exchange program incoming to Macquarie University are ineligible.
  • Student who has applied to or enrolled in Macquarie University International College are ineligible.

Note: If the student withdraws from the program before it is completed, the student might have to repay the scholarship amount awarded previously during the study period.

application_process.description: A separate application for the ASEAN Partner Scholarship must be filled online at the university’s application portal. The portal is accessible once the scholarship application dates are announced.Once the candidates receive astudent ID numberfrom the university, a scholarship application can be submitted.Log in to theapplication portaland fill out an application form.Complete the application form along with the required details.The scholarship form must be complete in itself and submit before the deadline.
application_process.html_content:
A separate application for the ASEAN Partner Scholarship must be filled online at the university’s application portal. The portal is accessible once the scholarship application dates are announced.

  • Once the candidates receive a student ID number from the university, a scholarship application can be submitted.
  • Log in to the application portal and fill out an application form.
  • Complete the application form along with the required details.

The scholarship form must be complete in itself and submit before the deadline.

selection_process.description: All student applications submitted to the university are evaluated on an individual basis. The following documents submitted along with admission application may also be taken into consideration:Academic track record, transcripts, or GPAScores ofstandardized tests to study in Australia.Recommendations from an academic professor or prior employersRecipients will be notified about the outcome of ASEAN Partner Scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
All student applications submitted to the university are evaluated on an individual basis. The following documents submitted along with admission application may also be taken into consideration:

  • Academic track record, transcripts, or GPA
  • Scores of standardized tests to study in Australia.
  • Recommendations from an academic professor or prior employers

Recipients will be notified about the outcome of ASEAN Partner Scholarship.

grant_details.description: International students who wish to pursuehigher education in Australiaat Macquarie University can apply for the ASEAN Partner Scholarship. It is awarded to students who have been offered a place to study at Macquarie University.Students must enroll in any of the UGprogram at Macquarie UniversityRecipients are offered upto 15,000 AUD.The awarded amount is to be used for tuition and fees.Students must remain enrolled full-time in their program and not withdraw before completion of the program. They might have to repay the amount as per the scholarship guidelines.
grant_details.html_content:
International students who wish to pursue higher education in Australia at Macquarie University can apply for the ASEAN Partner Scholarship. It is awarded to students who have been offered a place to study at Macquarie University.

  • Students must enroll in any of the UG program at Macquarie University
  • Recipients are offered upto 15,000 AUD.
  • The awarded amount is to be used for tuition and fees.

Students must remain enrolled full-time in their program and not withdraw before completion of the program. They might have to repay the amount as per the scholarship guidelines.

scholarship_name: University of Liverpool International College Excellence Award
description:
Designed for international students, the University of Liverpool College Excellence Award is awarded to those who have completed the UoLIC pre-masters program and have applied for a full-time master's degree program at the university. 

The completion of the UoLIC pre-masters program guarantees admission to the university’s full-time master’s programs. With the University of Liverpool College Excellence Award, the students receive small financial assistance to start a full-load degree program.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for this award you must:be liable to pay full tuition fees at the overseas ratebe starting a new non-clinical undergraduate programme in academic year 2025/26achieve one of the highest academic scores in a UoLIC Foundation Certificate programme, achieving at least 75%.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for this award you must:

  • be liable to pay full tuition fees at the overseas rate
  • be starting a new non-clinical undergraduate programme in academic year 2025/26
  • achieve one of the highest academic scores in a UoLIC Foundation Certificate programme, achieving at least 75%.

application_process.description: A student applying for the University of Liverpool International College Excellence Award isNOTrequired to submit a separate for the scholarship. All the eligible applicants will be considered on the basis of details provided in the application foradmission at University of Liverpool.Since the admission requirements slightly vary for the applicants who have completed UoLIC pre-master programs, ensure you have submitted the following documents:Certified copies of undergraduate degree transcriptsUoLIC Pre-masters program certification showing you have attained above 75%.English language test scores:IELTS: 6.5; TOEFL-iBT: 88Valid passport and Tier 4 visa
application_process.html_content:
A student applying for the University of Liverpool International College Excellence Award is NOT required to submit a separate for the scholarship. All the eligible applicants will be considered on the basis of details provided in the application for admission at University of Liverpool.

Since the admission requirements slightly vary for the applicants who have completed UoLIC pre-master programs, ensure you have submitted the following documents:

  • Certified copies of undergraduate degree transcripts 
  • UoLIC Pre-masters program certification showing you have attained above 75%.
  • English language test scores: IELTS: 6.5; TOEFL-iBT: 88
  • Valid passport and Tier 4 visa

selection_process.description: There isNOstringent selection procedure established for the University of Liverpool International College Excellence Award. During the evaluation process, admission/selection committee verify the following details:Completion of relevant UoLIC Pre-master’s programCumulative percentage obtained in the programChoice of UoL full-time masters degree programExams taken to study in the UKPrevious academic qualificationsThe universityguarantees scholarship awardto the applicants who meet the eligibility requirements and complete the application process on time.
selection_process.html_content:
There is NO stringent selection procedure established for the University of Liverpool International College Excellence Award. During the evaluation process, admission/selection committee verify the following details:

  • Completion of relevant UoLIC Pre-master’s program
  • Cumulative percentage obtained in the program
  • Choice of UoL full-time masters degree program
  • Exams taken to study in the UK
  • Previous academic qualifications

The university guarantees scholarship award to the applicants who meet the eligibility requirements and complete the application process on time.

scholarship_name: Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship
description:
Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is offered by the Leeds University Business School. This scholarship is awarded to the top 20 students achieving the highest marks in the Accounting & Finance Division in the first and in the second year of their undergraduate program.

Recipients of the Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship will receive an award of 2,626 USD towards their continued studies on the program. This amount will either be deducted from their fees or will be paid in their bank account in monthly installments.

Note: For the upcoming session, Leeds University Business School is not offering this scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is designed for continued UG students. The eligibility criteria for this scholarship program are:Applicants should be pursuingBSc Accounting & Financeor BSc Banking & Finance at Leeds University Business School.Applicants should either be the first-year or second-year students.Applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic excellence during their studies.The scholarship program is available for both domestic and international students. However, applicants are advised to submit proof of residency for verification.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is designed for continued UG students. The eligibility criteria for this scholarship program are:

  • Applicants should be pursuing BSc Accounting & Finance or BSc Banking & Finance at Leeds University Business School.
  • Applicants should either be the first-year or second-year students.
  • Applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic excellence during their studies.

The scholarship program is available for both domestic and international students. However, applicants are advised to submit proof of residency for verification.

application_process.description: The Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship does not have any additional application process. application_process.html_content:
The Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship does not have any additional application process. Students are reviewed based on the applications submitted at the time of admissions at the University of Leeds Business School.

Admission Requirements for International Students:

  • Academic records/transcripts
  • Proof of English proficiency for non-native English speakers.
    • IELTS: 6.0
    • TOEFL-iBT: 87
  • One Letter of recommendation
  • An updated resume
  • Letter of Intent or Statement of purpose

selection_process.description: The selection for Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is based on theacademic performanceof the students. The top 20 students who have scored the highest marks in the Accounting and Finance Division in the first and second years will be selected.The students achieving higher grades in the first year will be awarded in the second year and the students who are achieving higher grades in 2nd year will be awarded in the third year. How the scholarship will be awardedIt will be awarded in the next year, after the year of achievement.Students planning to spend their third year in an industry or study abroad will be receiving the award at the starting of the third year.Students who become temporary leavers for a valid reason, such as ill-health, will also have their award deferred until their return to study.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection for Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is based on the academic performance of the students. The top 20 students who have scored the highest marks in the Accounting and Finance Division in the first and second years will be selected.

The students achieving higher grades in the first year will be awarded in the second year and the students who are achieving higher grades in 2nd year will be awarded in the third year. How the scholarship will be awarded

  • It will be awarded in the next year, after the year of achievement.
  • Students planning to spend their third year in an industry or study abroad will be receiving the award at the starting of the third year.
  • Students who become temporary leavers for a valid reason, such as ill-health, will also have their award deferred until their return to study.

grant_details.description: Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is awarded to only 20 students from the Accounting and finance division.10 students are selected from the first year andThe other 10 students are selected from the second year.These 20 students are selected based on their overall academic scores. The highest achieving students will receive an amount of 2000 pounds. This amount can act as fee reduction or this can be sent directly to the student’s bank account in monthly installments.
grant_details.html_content:
Accounting and Finance Division Top Ten Achievement Scholarship is awarded to only 20 students from the Accounting and finance division.

  • 10 students are selected from the first year and
  • The other 10 students are selected from the second year.

These 20 students are selected based on their overall academic scores. The highest achieving students will receive an amount of 2000 pounds. This amount can act as fee reduction or this can be sent directly to the student’s bank account in monthly installments.

description:
Tata Trusts offer multiple scholarships to Indian students for undergraduate, postgraduate, and research-level studies in India and abroad. Key programs include the JN Tata Endowment, Means Grant, Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust, and Lady Tata Memorial Trust scholarships.

These scholarships support fields like science, public health, social work, education, and biomedical research. Awards are mostly for full-time, degree-based courses. Funding varies—up to ?10 lakh for overseas postgraduate studies under the JN Tata Endowment and ?60,000 to ?80,000 under the Means Grant.

Deadlines for 2025 intakes ranged between February and May 2025, depending on the scholarship. For example, the Lady Meherbai D Tata Scholarship closed on March 15, 2025, and the JN Tata Endowment on March 31, 2025.

The application process includes form submission, academic records, income proof (for need-based grants), and a statement of purpose. Some scholarships also require an interview or expert review.

Selection depends on academic merit, financial need, interview performance, and long-term societal impact.

Each program has distinct focus areas and applicant profiles.JN Tata Endowment Loan ScholarshipFor: Higher Education Abroad (Master’s, PhD, Postdoc)Open toIndian nationalspursuingpostgraduate, doctoral, or postdoctoralstudiesabroad.No restriction on field of study.Selection is strictlymerit-based.Candidates must have astrong academic recordand demonstrated potential.Scholarship is aloan of up to ?10 lakh, repayable in five instalments starting from the third year.Tata Trust Means Grant for CollegeFor: School and College Students in MaharashtraApplicable to students pursuing studies inMaharashtra(Class 8 onward, up to graduation).Only valid foracademic year 2025–26.Must have secured at least a“Pass” classin the previous exam.ATKT, grace marks, or condoned results are not accepted.Onlytwo siblings per familycan apply.Students must possess theoriginal annual fee receiptat the time of application.Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust ScholarshipFor: Indian Women Pursuing Overseas Master’s (Social Sector Fields)Open toIndian women graduateswith a strong academic and professional background.Must be seeking admission to aMaster’s program abroad.Fields:Social work, child welfare, education (including special education), and related areas.Typically supports10 scholars annuallythrough a rigorous selection process.Lady Tata Memorial Trust – Young Researcher AwardFor: Early-career Indian Scientists (Biomedical Research)Open toIndian researchersworking in the field ofleukemia, blood disorders, and related biomedical sciences.Applicants should be engaged inscientific research at recognized Indian institutions.Supports bothindividual researchandinstitutional projects.Focus areas:Cancer biology,bioinformatics,healthcare materials, anddisease mitigation.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Below are the eligibility details for the four main Tata Trust scholarships for the academic year 2025–26. Each program has distinct focus areas and applicant profiles.

  1. JN Tata Endowment Loan Scholarship

For: Higher Education Abroad (Master’s, PhD, Postdoc)

  • Open to Indian nationals pursuing postgraduate, doctoral, or postdoctoral studies abroad.
     
  • No restriction on field of study.
     
  • Selection is strictly merit-based.
     
  • Candidates must have a strong academic record and demonstrated potential.
     
  • Scholarship is a loan of up to ?10 lakh, repayable in five instalments starting from the third year.
     
  1. Tata Trust Means Grant for College

For: School and College Students in Maharashtra

  • Applicable to students pursuing studies in Maharashtra (Class 8 onward, up to graduation).
     
  • Only valid for academic year 2025–26.
     
  • Must have secured at least a “Pass” class in the previous exam.
     
  • ATKT, grace marks, or condoned results are not accepted.
     
  • Only two siblings per family can apply.
     
  • Students must possess the original annual fee receipt at the time of application.
     
  1. Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarship 

For: Indian Women Pursuing Overseas Master’s (Social Sector Fields)

  • Open to Indian women graduates with a strong academic and professional background.
     
  • Must be seeking admission to a Master’s program abroad.
     
  • Fields: Social work, child welfare, education (including special education), and related areas.
     
  • Typically supports 10 scholars annually through a rigorous selection process.
     
  1. Lady Tata Memorial Trust – Young Researcher Award 

For: Early-career Indian Scientists (Biomedical Research)

  • Open to Indian researchers working in the field of leukemia, blood disorders, and related biomedical sciences.
     
  • Applicants should be engaged in scientific research at recognized Indian institutions.
     
  • Supports both individual research and institutional projects.
     

Focus areas: Cancer biology, bioinformatics, healthcare materials, and disease mitigation.
