Below is the step-by-step guide:JN Tata Endowment Loan ScholarshipApply onlineatapplication.jntataendowment.org.Upload scanned copies of:Passport-size photoAadhaar card and passportAcademic transcripts and degree certificatesStatement of Purpose (max 800 words)Work experience (if applicable)Latest ITR/payslip (for working professionals)No editsallowed post-submission. For corrections, email with reference number.Application Deadline (2025–26):March 23, 2025Tata Trust Means Grant for CollegeApply online at tatatrusts.goodera.com.Register and fill the form with academic and personal details.Upload:Latest mark sheetOriginal annual fee receiptMust be studying inMaharashtra, with a minimum pass class.Application Deadline (2025–26):February 15, 2025Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust ScholarshipApply online attatatrusts.org.Register and fill the online application form.Required:Academic recordsProof of admission or application to a Master’s program abroadStatement of purposeand resumeFor Indian women only, in social-sector fields.Application Deadline (2025–26):May 2, 2025Lady Tata Memorial Trust – Young Researcher AwardApply via ladytatatrust.org.Download and submit the application as per instructions.Submit:Research proposalCVLetter from host institutionPublications (if any)Open to early-career Indian researchers in biomedical sciences.Application Deadline (2025–26):March 25, 2025
application_process.html_content:
Each Tata Trust scholarship has a separate application process, typically conducted online. Below is the step-by-step guide:

  1. JN Tata Endowment Loan Scholarship
  • Apply online at application.jntataendowment.org.
     
  • Upload scanned copies of:
    • Passport-size photo
    • Aadhaar card and passport
    • Academic transcripts and degree certificates
    • Statement of Purpose (max 800 words)
    • Work experience (if applicable)
    • Latest ITR/payslip (for working professionals)
       
  • No edits allowed post-submission. For corrections, email with reference number.
     
  • Application Deadline (2025–26): March 23, 2025
  1. Tata Trust Means Grant for College
  • Apply online at tatatrusts.goodera.com.
     
  • Register and fill the form with academic and personal details.
     
  • Upload:
    • Latest mark sheet
    • Original annual fee receipt
       
  • Must be studying in Maharashtra, with a minimum pass class.
     
  • Application Deadline (2025–26): February 15, 2025
  1. Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarship
  • Apply online at tatatrusts.org.
     
  • Register and fill the online application form.
     
  • Required:
    • Academic records
    • Proof of admission or application to a Master’s program abroad
    • Statement of purpose and resume
       
  • For Indian women only, in social-sector fields.
     
  • Application Deadline (2025–26): May 2, 2025 
  1. Lady Tata Memorial Trust – Young Researcher Award
  • Apply via ladytatatrust.org.
     
  • Download and submit the application as per instructions.
     
  • Submit:
    • Research proposal
    • CV
    • Letter from host institution
      Publications (if any)
       
  • Open to early-career Indian researchers in biomedical sciences.
     
  • Application Deadline (2025–26): March 25, 2025

selection_process.description: Each scholarship offered by Tata Trusts follows a merit-based and/or need-based evaluation process. Here’s how candidates are selected:JN Tata Endowment Loan ScholarshipCandidates must submit a complete application with all supporting documents.Shortlisting is based onacademic merit,statement of purpose, andletters of recommendation.Shortlisted applicants may be called for apersonal interview.The interview assessescareer goals,clarity of purpose, andpotential social impact.Final selection is based onacademic record,interview performance, andfuture potential.Selected candidates are notified by the Trust.Tata Trust Means Grant for CollegeApplications are evaluated based on thecompleteness of the formandfinancial documents.The Trust reviews the applicant’sfamily income,expenses, andoverall financial condition.In some cases, candidates may be called for aninterview.Final selection is based solely onfinancial need and eligibility.Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust ScholarshipApplications are shortlisted based onacademic excellenceandpurpose of study.Selected candidates may be invited for apersonal interview.The interview evaluatesgoals,motivation, andcareer impact.Final selection is based on:Academic recordStatement of purposeLetters of recommendationInterview performancePotential to contribute to societyAwardees are directly notified by the Trust.Lady Tata Memorial Trust (Young Researcher Award)Application Review:Based onresearch proposal,scientific merit, andalignment with trust themesShortlisting:By expert committeesEvaluation:Scientific relevance, impact potential, and applicant's research backgroundFinal Selection:Made by the Trust based on overall merit and project value
selection_process.html_content:
Each scholarship offered by Tata Trusts follows a merit-based and/or need-based evaluation process. Here’s how candidates are selected:

  1. JN Tata Endowment Loan Scholarship
  • Candidates must submit a complete application with all supporting documents.
     
  • Shortlisting is based on academic merit, statement of purpose, and letters of recommendation.
     
  • Shortlisted applicants may be called for a personal interview.
     
  • The interview assesses career goals, clarity of purpose, and potential social impact.
     
  • Final selection is based on academic record, interview performance, and future potential.
     
  • Selected candidates are notified by the Trust.
  1. Tata Trust Means Grant for College
  • Applications are evaluated based on the completeness of the form and financial documents.
     
  • The Trust reviews the applicant’s family income, expenses, and overall financial condition.
     
  • In some cases, candidates may be called for an interview.
     
  • Final selection is based solely on financial need and eligibility.
  1. Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarship
  • Applications are shortlisted based on academic excellence and purpose of study.
     
  • Selected candidates may be invited for a personal interview.
     
  • The interview evaluates goals, motivation, and career impact.
     
  • Final selection is based on:
    • Academic record
    • Statement of purpose
    • Letters of recommendation
    • Interview performance
    • Potential to contribute to society
       
  • Awardees are directly notified by the Trust.
  1. Lady Tata Memorial Trust (Young Researcher Award)
  • Application Review: Based on research proposal, scientific merit, and alignment with trust themes
     
  • Shortlisting: By expert committees
     
  • Evaluation: Scientific relevance, impact potential, and applicant's research background
     
  • Final Selection: Made by the Trust based on overall merit and project value

grant_details.description: Tata Trusts provide merit- and need-based scholarships for Indian students pursuing studies in India or abroad. Key scholarships for 2025 are listed below:JN Tata Endowment Loan ScholarshipType:Merit-based loan scholarship (up to ?10 lakh)Purpose:Foroverseas Master's, PhD, and Postdoctoralstudies in any fieldRepayment:Begins in the 3rd year after award, repayable in 5 equal installments over 7 yearsImpact:Over 5,700 scholars supported since 1892, including national leaders, scientists, and academicsTata Trust Means Grant for CollegeType:Need-based grant (partial fee assistance)Eligibility:Forstudents in Maharashtra, from Std VIII to undergraduate college levelCriteria:Family income, fee receipts, academic pass grade (not ATKT/grace)Note:Max two siblings from a family may applyLady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust ScholarshipType:Merit-based scholarship forwomenpursuingoverseas Master’sFields:Social work, child welfare, education (including special needs)Awarded:To10 outstanding womenannuallyEstablished:In 1933; known for its rigorous selection and trustee involvementLady Tata Memorial Trust – Young Researcher AwardType:Competitive research grantFocus:Research inleukemia, blood disorders, and allied biomedical fieldsSupport:Junior Research Fellowships, Institutional Research, and International AwardsNotable Grants (2021-22):?1.84 crore for 5 global research projects15 Indian students awarded JRFs2 national teachers’ training programs held
grant_details.html_content:
Tata Trusts provide merit- and need-based scholarships for Indian students pursuing studies in India or abroad. Key scholarships for 2025 are listed below:

  1. JN Tata Endowment Loan Scholarship
  • Type: Merit-based loan scholarship (up to ?10 lakh)
     
  • Purpose: For overseas Master's, PhD, and Postdoctoral studies in any field
     
  • Repayment: Begins in the 3rd year after award, repayable in 5 equal installments over 7 years
     
  • Impact: Over 5,700 scholars supported since 1892, including national leaders, scientists, and academics
  1. Tata Trust Means Grant for College
  • Type: Need-based grant (partial fee assistance)
     
  • Eligibility: For students in Maharashtra, from Std VIII to undergraduate college level
     
  • Criteria: Family income, fee receipts, academic pass grade (not ATKT/grace)
     
  • Note: Max two siblings from a family may apply
  1. Lady Meherbai D Tata Education Trust Scholarship
  • Type: Merit-based scholarship for women pursuing overseas Master’s
     
  • Fields: Social work, child welfare, education (including special needs)
     
  • Awarded: To 10 outstanding women annually
     
  • Established: In 1933; known for its rigorous selection and trustee involvement
  1. Lady Tata Memorial Trust – Young Researcher Award
  • Type: Competitive research grant
     
  • Focus: Research in leukemia, blood disorders, and allied biomedical fields
     
  • Support: Junior Research Fellowships, Institutional Research, and International Awards
     
  • Notable Grants (2021-22):
     
    • ?1.84 crore for 5 global research projects
    • 15 Indian students awarded JRFs
    • 2 national teachers’ training programs held

scholarship_name: Hira and Kamal Ahuja Award in Engineering
description:
Hira and Kamal Ahuja Award is a type of financial need award or bursary that values up to 10000 CAD awarded annually to a graduate student registered full time in a Master’s or Doctoral program in the Faculty of Engineering. Students with good academic performance and in need of financial help are considered for this award by the University of Waterloo. For the application to be considered, the students are required to complete the Graduate Student Award Application form available on the website and demonstrate their cultural contributions to the Indian community.

The number or value of awards changes from year to year. Students who pursue Master’s and Doctoral degree programs at the University of Waterloo are eligible for this award.

Programs for which the scholarship is available are:

Engineering?Architecture, MBET, Mechanical & Mechatronics Eng, Chemical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Eng, Management Sciences, Systems Design Engineering, Civil & Environmental Eng.

eligibility_criteria.description: Eligibility & selection criteria:Graduate students registered full-time in a Master's or Doctoral program in the Faculty of EngineeringApplicants with minimum 80% aggregate are eligibleInternational students who have graduated from any of the following IITs – Delhi, Mumbai, Ropar, Roorkee, Kanpur, and Kharagpur. If an eligible candidate from IIT is not available, students from all NIITs in India will be considered.Permanent resident of Canada who has graduated from IIT or NIITPreference will be given to candidates who identify as women,who fulfill the above criteria, and wherein women are underrepresentedShould an eligible candidate not be available in any one year, available funds will be held and multiple awards may be given out in a future year Engineering Graduate Office in consultation with Prof. Sanjeev Bedi will identify candidates and select recipients.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Eligibility & selection criteria: 

  • Graduate students registered full-time in a Master's or Doctoral program in the Faculty of Engineering
  • Applicants with minimum 80% aggregate are eligible 
  • International students who have graduated from any of the following IITs – Delhi, Mumbai, Ropar, Roorkee, Kanpur, and Kharagpur. If an eligible candidate from IIT is not available, students from all NIITs in India will be considered.
  • Permanent resident of Canada who has graduated from IIT or NIIT
  • Preference will be given to candidates who identify as women, who fulfill the above criteria, and wherein women are underrepresented 
  • Should an eligible candidate not be available in any one year, available funds will be held and multiple awards may be given out in a future year Engineering Graduate Office in consultation with Prof. Sanjeev Bedi will identify candidates and select recipients.

Candidates then need to upload the required documents and will help them check the application status.Candidates can then use the ‘Application Information Form’, to further strengthen the chances of their admission.International Candidates have to upload the official transcripts of their academic certificates, along with their English Proficiency Test Scores.Selected candidates will be sent the application offer.Candidates can log in to their OUAC account to check the offer. application_process.html_content:
Candidates are required to follow the steps to apply for Graduate Award Application are listed below:

  • Complete the Graduate Student Award application
  • Attach required documentation as mentioned in the application form.
  • Submit your completed application package to Graduate Studies and Postdoctoral Affairs (GSPA) before the application deadline.

Students who wish to avail of the benefits of scholarship should also know about the admission process at the University of Waterloo.

Application to Waterloo (by International Students) can be made through OUAC (Ontario Universities Application Centre). Before filling this form, candidates must check whether they meet the admission requirements or not.

Within 2 weeks of receiving the application, the university will send instructions for further steps. These instructions will be sent through email, from the address myapplication@waterloo.ca.

  • After this, candidates will need to create a Guest Account on the university servers. Candidates then need to upload the required documents and will help them check the application status.
  • Candidates can then use the ‘Application Information Form’, to further strengthen the chances of their admission.
  • International Candidates have to upload the official transcripts of their academic certificates, along with their English Proficiency Test Scores.
  • Selected candidates will be sent the application offer.
  • Candidates can log in to their OUAC account to check the offer. Candidates need to accept the offer within deadlines given, to be considered for further process.
  • Selected (international) candidates then need to apply for Study Permit and submit it to the university after they get it.

selection_process.description: The selection process takes place once the application is received by the university.The application is mandatory for the selection process to take place.Student applications with good academic results and demonstration of their cultural responsibility to the Indian community will be considered first and will also stand a chance to get selected into the university soon.The selection process will take place with the application review followed by the interview.Selected candidates will be intimated through email.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process takes place once the application is received by the university.

  • The application is mandatory for the selection process to take place.
  • Student applications with good academic results and demonstration of their cultural responsibility to the Indian community will be considered first and will also stand a chance to get selected into the university soon.
  • The selection process will take place with the application review followed by the interview.
  • Selected candidates will be intimated through email.

grant_details.description: The value of the award will be determined by the income generated by the Fund each year.The goal is to provide at least one Award valued up to $10,000.The value and/or number of awards may change from year to year.Master's students may receive this award for a maximum of two years and Doctoral students may receive it for a maximum of four years provided they maintain good academic standing (minimum 80%) and continue to remain registered full time in their program.This award will be in addition to the guaranteed funding in the student's offer letter.
grant_details.html_content:
• The value of the award will be determined by the income generated by the Fund each year.
  • The goal is to provide at least one Award valued up to $10,000.
  • The value and/or number of awards may change from year to year.
  • Master's students may receive this award for a maximum of two years and Doctoral students may receive it for a maximum of four years provided they maintain good academic standing (minimum 80%) and continue to remain registered full time in their program.
  • This award will be in addition to the guaranteed funding in the student's offer letter.

scholarship_name: Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship- India
description:
Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship- India is awarded to Indian students who have completed the International Pathway India Program and are studying a bachelor’s degree program at the Australia campus of Monash College. Recipients are awarded scholarship amount AUD 10,000.

Every year, up to 10 Indian students are awarded through Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship- India scholarship program.

eligibility_criteria.description: All international students are eligible to apply for Monash College India - Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship. In addition to this, Candidates have to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the university:Must be commencing an undergraduate program in the Monash Business School, Australia campus.Must have completed the international pathway India program.Must have scored a minimum weighted average mark* of 75.*Weighted average mark means the average of marks earned in all completed units of a program. It is a popularly used method by the universities to judge the academic performance of a candidate. It may also include the marks achieved in extracurricular activities or project work. The weights are variable and assigned by the university itself. It is calculated by using the credit point for each unit and the year level.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
All international students are eligible to apply for Monash College India - Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship. In addition to this, Candidates have to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the university:

  • Must be commencing an undergraduate program in the Monash Business School, Australia campus.
  • Must have completed the international pathway India program.
  • Must have scored a minimum weighted average mark* of 75.

*Weighted average mark means the average of marks earned in all completed units of a program. It is a popularly used method by the universities to judge the academic performance of a candidate. It may also include the marks achieved in extracurricular activities or project work. The weights are variable and assigned by the university itself. It is calculated by using the credit point for each unit and the year level.

application_process.description: The Monash College India - Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship is awarded on the basis of merit so no application process is required. The scholarship is for the students who take admission in the undergraduate program at Monash University.The academic records and performance of a candidate are reviewed which was submitted at the time of application foradmission at Monash College. The Monash College is fully administered by theMonash University.
application_process.html_content:
The Monash College India - Monash Business School Undergraduate Scholarship is awarded on the basis of merit so no application process is required. The scholarship is for the students who take admission in the undergraduate program at Monash University.

The academic records and performance of a candidate are reviewed which was submitted at the time of application for admission at Monash College. The Monash College is fully administered by the Monash University.

selection_process.description: The selection of students for the scholarship is clearly dependent on the academic performance which they display in their application for admission. This scholarship is renewable for a period of 2 years but in order to retain it the students must meet the set criteria.The criteria for retaining the scholarship for another year is maintaining a minimum 65 weighted average mark while pursuing a bachelor’s degree in the college. The scholarship amount goes up to20,000 USDif the performance of the candidate is outstanding in the second year as the shortlisted candidates get the amount in installments of10,000 USDfor two years.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of students for the scholarship is clearly dependent on the academic performance which they display in their application for admission. This scholarship is renewable for a period of 2 years but in order to retain it the students must meet the set criteria.

The criteria for retaining the scholarship for another year is maintaining a minimum 65 weighted average mark while pursuing a bachelor’s degree in the college. The scholarship amount goes up to 20,000 USD if the performance of the candidate is outstanding in the second year as the shortlisted candidates get the amount in installments of 10,000 USD for two years.

If not, the scholarship might be withdrawn or reallocated depending on the situation.Yearly scholarships are awarded in 2 parts i.e. 50% in the first semester and 50% in the second semester.Students holdingmerit-based scholarshipsare allowed to hold more than one scholarship. They areeligible for another scholarship or grantfor equity, accommodation, music, travel and placement, sport, vacation.To retain a scholarship:Students must maintain their residency statusMust be able to provide verification at any time as requestedMust maintain their enrollment status in the undergraduate course at the Monash campus in AustraliaAdhere to the academic and administrative rules and regulations of Monash College.The academic progress of the students will be reviewed each semester and if the student is found incapable then the scholarship might be terminated. The weighted average mark is the average of all units in a course.The main purpose of the scholarship is to provide financial support to the students by awarding them 10,000 USD for the first year. If the student continues to perform well, then they also get 10,000 USD more for the second year as financial aid.Monash University can serve as one of the best institutes forhigher education in Australiaand scholarships provided by the institute also help the students financially and give them a chance to study in the topuniversities in Australia.
grant_details.html_content:
Study-Level Undergraduate
Eligible Candidates International students studying at the Australian campus
Number of Scholarships 10
Study-Length 3 years
Scholarship Award Up to 20,000 USD
Award Distributed Yearly

Terms and Conditions

The general terms and conditions that you must be aware of while applying for a scholarship which will be mentioned in the scholarship offer are as follows:

  • The acceptance of the scholarship must be in the prescribed manner. If not, the scholarship might be withdrawn or reallocated depending on the situation.
  • Yearly scholarships are awarded in 2 parts i.e. 50% in the first semester and 50% in the second semester.
  • Students holding merit-based scholarships are allowed to hold more than one scholarship. They are eligible for another scholarship or grant for equity, accommodation, music, travel and placement, sport, vacation.

To retain a scholarship:

  • Students must maintain their residency status
  • Must be able to provide verification at any time as requested
  • Must maintain their enrollment status in the undergraduate course at the Monash campus in Australia
  • Adhere to the academic and administrative rules and regulations of Monash College.
  • The academic progress of the students will be reviewed each semester and if the student is found incapable then the scholarship might be terminated. The weighted average mark is the average of all units in a course.

The main purpose of the scholarship is to provide financial support to the students by awarding them 10,000 USD for the first year. If the student continues to perform well, then they also get 10,000 USD more for the second year as financial aid.

Monash University can serve as one of the best institutes for higher education in Australia and scholarships provided by the institute also help the students financially and give them a chance to study in the top universities in Australia.

scholarship_name: Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship- Dalhousie University
description:
Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship is awarded to students of Dalhousie University located in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. International Students taking admissions at the Dalhousie University in Masters or Doctoral Programs can apply for this Scholarship. Via this scholarship, financial aid of 40,000 CAD is provided to the students.

Applications for the Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship are received through the Dalhousie University's Harmonized Scholarship process. The Harmonized Scholarship Process allows the current students of the Dalhousie University to get access to various scholarships based on the Faculty of Graduate Studies like Nova Scotia Graduate Scholarship, Vitamin Scholarship, Killam Predoctoral Scholarship and a few more.

eligibility_criteria.description: To get the Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship, students are first supposed to take admissions in Masters or Doctoralprograms at Dalhousie University. Apart from that, candidates are supposed to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the university.Students from all over the world can apply for this Scholarship.Iranian students are given first preference.Students must have maintained at least a 3.7 GPA on a scale of 4.3 GPA in the last two years of their academic studies.Students are eligible for the complete duration of the programs upon renewal.Students from any discipline are eligible.The eligibility criteria stated by the university are purely based on merit which makes it easy for bright students to get an opportunity tostudy in Canada.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To get the Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship, students are first supposed to take admissions in Masters or Doctoral programs at Dalhousie University. Apart from that, candidates are supposed to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the university.

  • Students from all over the world can apply for this Scholarship.
    • Iranian students are given first preference.
  • Students must have maintained at least a 3.7 GPA on a scale of 4.3 GPA in the last two years of their academic studies.
  • Students are eligible for the complete duration of the programs upon renewal.
  • Students from any discipline are eligible.

The eligibility criteria stated by the university are purely based on merit which makes it easy for bright students to get an opportunity to study in Canada.

application_process.description: If candidates meet the eligibility criteria, they are supposed to fill the application form for theAbdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship.Faculty of Graduate Studies at Dalhousie University followHarmonized Scholarship Processfor awarding the scholarship. This process uses a common application form for various FGS Scholarships.There are two ways to apply for this Scholarship:Current students or new students once they have applied for a program at the Dalhousie University, can apply directly before the Internal Deadline of their Department.Departments can nominate eligible students and submit the nominated students’ paperwork.Applicants need to provide the following documents:Completed application formMasters -Click hereDoctoral -Click hereTranscripts from previously attended universities. Final discretion will depend until the original transcripts are submitted.Two Reference lettersApplication forms should be sent by post.
application_process.html_content:
If candidates meet the eligibility criteria, they are supposed to fill the application form for the Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship. Faculty of Graduate Studies at Dalhousie University follow Harmonized Scholarship Process for awarding the scholarship. This process uses a common application form for various FGS Scholarships.

  • There are two ways to apply for this Scholarship:
    • Current students or new students once they have applied for a program at the Dalhousie University, can apply directly before the Internal Deadline of their Department.
    • Departments can nominate eligible students and submit the nominated students’ paperwork.
  • Applicants need to provide the following documents:
    • Completed application form
      • Masters - Click here
      • Doctoral - Click here
    • Transcripts from previously attended universities. Final discretion will depend until the original transcripts are submitted.
    • Two Reference letters
  • Application forms should be sent by post.

selection_process.description: Applications are evaluated on the basis of Tri-Council Guidelines for evaluation of academic excellence, research ability, communication, interpersonal and leadership abilities.Masters applications are evaluated through CGS-M criteriaIt considers applicants’ background in academic excellence - Scholarships and awards, duration of previous studies, type of program and courses pursued, etc.Research Potential-Quality and Originality of contribution to research and development, judgment and ability to think critically, ability to apply skills and knowledge, significance, the feasibility of proposed research, etc.Personal Characteristics and Interpersonal Skills-Work experience, leadership experience, volunteerism, ability to communicate theoretical, technical and Scientific concepts, etcDoctoral applications are evaluated through CGS Doctoral Criteria.Research Ability and Potential -Quality of Research Proposal, Relevant training, quality of contributions and extent of advancement in research, ability to communicate theoretical and scientific concepts, etcRelevant Experience and Achievements obtainedwithin and beyond academia- Scholarships and awards, academic record, professional and extracurricular activities, etc.Offers are communicated to the respective departments.Applicants will have 21 days to accept or reject the offer.Note:The tuition fee is not waived by the scholarship and the students are supposed to pay the same with the scholarship amount. Application for the scholarship should be submitted before the internal deadline of the particular department.
selection_process.html_content:
Applications are evaluated on the basis of Tri-Council Guidelines for evaluation of academic excellence, research ability, communication, interpersonal and leadership abilities.

  • Masters applications are evaluated through CGS-M criteria
    • It considers applicants’ background in academic excellence - Scholarships and awards, duration of previous studies, type of program and courses pursued, etc.
    • Research Potential- Quality and Originality of contribution to research and development, judgment and ability to think critically, ability to apply skills and knowledge, significance, the feasibility of proposed research, etc.
    • Personal Characteristics and Interpersonal Skills- Work experience, leadership experience, volunteerism, ability to communicate theoretical, technical and Scientific concepts, etc
  • Doctoral applications are evaluated through CGS Doctoral Criteria.
    • Research Ability and Potential - Quality of Research Proposal, Relevant training, quality of contributions and extent of advancement in research, ability to communicate theoretical and scientific concepts, etc
    • Relevant Experience and Achievements obtained within and beyond academia- Scholarships and awards, academic record, professional and extracurricular activities, etc.
    • Offers are communicated to the respective departments.
  • Applicants will have 21 days to accept or reject the offer.

Note: The tuition fee is not waived by the scholarship and the students are supposed to pay the same with the scholarship amount. Application for the scholarship should be submitted before the internal deadline of the particular department.

Dalhousie University is one of the best Canadian Universities and it provides a number of grants and financial aids to the students like the Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship, Vitamin Scholarship few more. Higher education in Canada can be one of the best ways to shape up one’s career with the help of various scholarships provided by top universities in Canada.

Via the Abdul Majid Bader Graduate Scholarship, students get a financial aid of 40,000 USD which is an appropriate amount to manage the cost of attendance and cost of living in Canada.

The average cost of living in Canada is approximately 20,000 USD excluding food and other expenses. The scholarship amount removes the burden of financial issues from the students.

description: London Business School India Scholarship program is an initiative towards helping students from India to pursue their MBA at London Business School without any financial hurdle. The recipient of the scholarship program is awarded 35,000 GBP for tuition fees.

eligibility_criteria.description: London Business School India Scholarship program is specifically designed for the Indian students, who show their academic excellence and get admission to theMBA program at the London Business School.Only one student, out of the many who apply for this gets the scholarship award.Therefore, the students must fulfill the requirements given below to get eligible for the London Business School India Scholarship 2021:Nationality:Indian citizensWork Experience:A minimum of 2 years of experience in the related field.Along with this, the applicant has to meet academic requirements for the ScholarshipEnglish Proficiency scores:IELTSor PTEELP can be exempted, if the UG or PG degree of the applicant was in English or if he/she has worked or lived in an English speaking country (min 2 years)Exam Scores:GMAT/GREScoresBachelor degree or equivalent qualification
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
London Business School India Scholarship program is specifically designed for the Indian students, who show their academic excellence and get admission to the MBA program at the London Business School. Only one student, out of the many who apply for this gets the scholarship award.

Therefore, the students must fulfill the requirements given below to get eligible for the London Business School India Scholarship 2021:

  • Nationality: Indian citizens
  • Work Experience: A minimum of 2 years of experience in the related field.

Along with this, the applicant has to meet academic requirements for the Scholarship

  • English Proficiency scores: IELTS or PTE
    • ELP can be exempted, if the UG or PG degree of the applicant was in English or if he/she has worked or lived in an English speaking country (min 2 years)
  • Exam Scores: GMAT/GRE Scores
  • Bachelor degree or equivalent qualification

application_process.description: Applicants do not need to fill any kind of application form for the scholarship, they will be automatically considered for this award if they satisfy the eligibility criteria. Therefore, all an applicant has to do is secureadmission at LSB.Some other documents required to submit to avail benefits of the London Business School India Scholarship are :Two Letters of Recommendation.An essay on the Post MBA goals of the student.An updated CV detailing work experience in a related field.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants do not need to fill any kind of application form for the scholarship, they will be automatically considered for this award if they satisfy the eligibility criteria. Therefore, all an applicant has to do is secure admission at LSB.

Some other documents required to submit to avail benefits of the London Business School India Scholarship are :

  • Two Letters of Recommendation.
  • An essay on the Post MBA goals of the student.
  • An updated CV detailing work experience in a related field.

selection_process.description: Candidates are shortlisted based on the eligibility criteria and submission of required documents. Shortlisted candidates are then invited for an interview session.The interviews are conducted by an alumnus of the school’s MBA program. Interviews are conducted in India. Candidates may have to travel for the interview.The interview session helps in evaluating the applicant’s abilities to work in multicultural teams and an international environment, along with the eligibility parameters. The result and recipient’s name is declared on the London School of Business’ official website.
selection_process.html_content:
Candidates are shortlisted based on the eligibility criteria and submission of required documents. Shortlisted candidates are then invited for an interview session.

The interviews are conducted by an alumnus of the school’s MBA program. Interviews are conducted in India. Candidates may have to travel for the interview.

The interview session helps in evaluating the applicant’s abilities to work in multicultural teams and an international environment, along with the eligibility parameters. The result and recipient’s name is declared on the London School of Business’ official website.

grant_details.description: Masters programs offered by the London Business School are ranked best in the world. The school offers 10 different kinds of master programs in which students can get admission according to their interests by fulfilling the entry requirements. LBS offers scholarships for these programs. One of them is London Business School India Scholarship which is given to only one student from India.Terms and Conditions of the London Business School India ScholarshipIt is only applicable for Masters Degree (MBA) at the LBS.LBS holds all the rights for change or modification.This is a one-time scholarship and will not be renewed.The scholarship amountcovers only the tuition and feesof the MBA program.Theliving or other expenses to study in the U.K.have to be incurred by the student only.If the student coming for Masters have any Spouse/Child, then they are not covered under the benefit of this award.
grant_details.html_content:
Masters programs offered by the London Business School are ranked best in the world. The school offers 10 different kinds of master programs in which students can get admission according to their interests by fulfilling the entry requirements. LBS offers scholarships for these programs. One of them is London Business School India Scholarship which is given to only one student from India.

Terms and Conditions of the London Business School India Scholarship

  • It is only applicable for Masters Degree (MBA) at the LBS.
    • LBS holds all the rights for change or modification.
  • This is a one-time scholarship and will not be renewed.
  • The scholarship amount covers only the tuition and fees of the MBA program.
    • The living or other expenses to study in the U.K. have to be incurred by the student only.
  • If the student coming for Masters have any Spouse/Child, then they are not covered under the benefit of this award.

description:
The Brilliant Minds MBA Scholarship is awarded by the Imperial College Business School. Students taking admissions at the Imperial College Business School in MBA program are eligible for the Brilliant Minds MBA Scholarship.

Students get an award of 52,000 USD through this scholarship which helps them financially and partially removes the burden of the cost of attendance and cost of accommodation, travel, and stay in the UK. Students can manage to meet these expenses by taking multiple sources of funding like personal resources and education loans or scholarships.

The Imperial College Business School awards a number of significant scholarships to the candidates who are able to prove their talents. It is an attempt by the college to give scholarships to maximum self-funded students. Such students are automatically considered for the suitable category given they meet the eligibility criteria and deadline for application.

The fee associated with a full-time MBA at the Imperial College Business School is the same for UK students and international students. For the September 2020 entry, students will have to pay 59,665 USD. Students who display exceptional performance and skills with the potential to build a good career for them but at the same time they are incapable of meeting the expenses may be eligible for this scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: The Brilliant Minds MBA scholarship will be awarded to students who opt for MBAprograms at the Imperial College Business School. Apart from that, students need to meet the eligibility criteria set by the college:Applicant must have a strong academic background, high scores in GMAT and also possess excellent professional record before joining the college.Applicants will have to submit GMAT scores before the deadline. The college expects these scores to not only be high but also well balanced.Applicants will be assessed during the admission process to judge eligibility on academic and professional grounds.Applicants will have to submit professional references along with their applications. The college may contact them if they find it appropriate.It is preferable for the candidates to hold either a first-class honors degree or its international equivalent.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Brilliant Minds MBA scholarship will be awarded to students who opt for MBA programs at the Imperial College Business School. Apart from that, students need to meet the eligibility criteria set by the college:

  • Applicant must have a strong academic background, high scores in GMAT and also possess excellent professional record before joining the college.
  • Applicants will have to submit GMAT scores before the deadline. The college expects these scores to not only be high but also well balanced.
  • Applicants will be assessed during the admission process to judge eligibility on academic and professional grounds.
  • Applicants will have to submit professional references along with their applications. The college may contact them if they find it appropriate.
  • It is preferable for the candidates to hold either a first-class honors degree or its international equivalent.

application_process.description: The applications for full-time MBA which will be received by the college before the deadline with all the necessary requirements shall be automatically considered for the Brilliant Minds MBA Scholarship. The application requirements and process are described below:Complete an application form for admission to a full-timeMBA program at Imperial College Business School.SubmitGMATscores.Submit an essay as a part of the application. All candidates will have to write a 700-word essay on the topic: “Describe your greatest academic achievement, and why this is a particular source of pride for you.”Candidates are recommended to submit their application before the deadline. This helps in increasing the chance of getting the scholarship. The deadline for scholarship applications are as follows:The completed application along with the essay can be submitted either as a part of the application form or via email to mba@imperial.ac.uk within the deadlines mentioned above. Any emails regarding this scholarship must state theBrilliant Minds Scholarship applicationand the candidate’s CID number should be mentioned in the subject line.
application_process.html_content:
The applications for full-time MBA which will be received by the college before the deadline with all the necessary requirements shall be automatically considered for the Brilliant Minds MBA Scholarship. The application requirements and process are described below:

  • Complete an application form for admission to a full-time MBA program at Imperial College Business School.
  • Submit GMAT scores.
  • Submit an essay as a part of the application. All candidates will have to write a 700-word essay on the topic: “Describe your greatest academic achievement, and why this is a particular source of pride for you.”

Candidates are recommended to submit their application before the deadline. This helps in increasing the chance of getting the scholarship. The deadline for scholarship applications are as follows:

The completed application along with the essay can be submitted either as a part of the application form or via email to mba@imperial.ac.uk within the deadlines mentioned above. Any emails regarding this scholarship must state the Brilliant Minds Scholarship application and the candidate’s CID number should be mentioned in the subject line.

selection_process.description: The selection for awarding scholarships to candidates is made by two scholarship committees based upon the date of submission of application.The full-time MBA program commences in September. Candidates who receive an offer for admission become a part of the selection process for the scholarship. The selection is made on the basis of the academic standing that the candidate displays at the time of application, the balance of GMAT scores and the response in the form of an essay.Also, the professional experience of the candidate and how their professional references speak of them will also be considered for the selection process. Therefore, it is completely a merit-based scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection for awarding scholarships to candidates is made by two scholarship committees based upon the date of submission of application.

The full-time MBA program commences in September. Candidates who receive an offer for admission become a part of the selection process for the scholarship. The selection is made on the basis of the academic standing that the candidate displays at the time of application, the balance of GMAT scores and the response in the form of an essay.

Also, the professional experience of the candidate and how their professional references speak of them will also be considered for the selection process. Therefore, it is completely a merit-based scholarship.

grant_details.description: The candidates for this scholarship must have completed a first-class honors degree or equivalent in their respective countries. The number of scholarships awarded each year is not specified. The main focus of the scholarship is to help financially challenged students and give them an opportunity to study in the UK. As Imperial College Business School is one of thetop universities in the UK,an MBA degree from there can help the candidates boost their careers.
grant_details.html_content:
The candidates for this scholarship must have completed a first-class honors degree or equivalent in their respective countries. The number of scholarships awarded each year is not specified. The award is distributed yearly and covers a huge portion of the full-time tuition fees.

Study-Level Postgraduate
Eligible Candidates International and UK students
Study-Length 2 years
Scholarship Award Tuition fees
Award Distributed Yearly
Number of Scholarships Variable

All students who wish to study in the UK can take advantage of the Brilliant Minds MBA Scholarship as it will support them financially. The main focus of the scholarship is to help financially challenged students and give them an opportunity to study in the UK. As Imperial College Business School is one of the top universities in the UK, an MBA degree from there can help the candidates boost their careers.

description:
The Eiffel Excellence Scholarship is awarded to international students by the French Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs. The scholarship is awarded to students who want to study abroad and are willing to take admission in France in any Ph.D. or Master's program.

All the students selected for the scholarship are awarded a financial aid of 1,181 USD per month, which results in a total amount of 14,172 USD per year.

The scholarship provides an opportunity for people up to 27 years of age for the master’s-level program and up to 32 years of age for the Ph.D. level program.

Type of Expense Cost (in USD)
Tuition and Fees 3,102 - 4,222
Cost of living 11,200-20,160

If the average cost of living and attendance in France is considered, then it can be easily figured out that the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship can help in minimizing the financial burden for international students.

Read more Scholarships/ Latest Updated Scholarships:-

         Ontario Graduate Scholarship
         Tata Scholarship- Cornell University
         GREAT Scholarships India

eligibility_criteria.description: As per the eligibility criteria for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship, candidates are not supposed to fulfill any special requirement. However, candidates need to meet the basic eligibility criteria as defined by the scholarship awarding body:The candidate must be an international student and submit a copy of the passport for verification.Applications must be submitted via French education institutions. Any application submitted through other sources will not be entertained.Applicants must be opting for a Master's level or Ph.D. program.Programs eligible for the scholarship:Political ScienceLawEconomics and managementEngineering SciencesTerms and Conditions for Eiffel Excellence Scholarship ProgramApplicants must not have already applied for any scholarship provided by the French government.Students who are applying for the second time will not be entertained even if the institution and course are different.Students should also have a basic knowledge of the French language.Note:Students who got the scholarship at the Masters's level canre-apply for receiving the scholarshipat a Ph.D. level.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
As per the eligibility criteria for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship, candidates are not supposed to fulfill any special requirement. However, candidates need to meet the basic eligibility criteria as defined by the scholarship awarding body:

  • The candidate must be an international student and submit a copy of the passport for verification.
  • Applications must be submitted via French education institutions. Any application submitted through other sources will not be entertained.
  • Applicants must be opting for a Master's level or Ph.D. program. Programs eligible for the scholarship:
    • Political Science
    • Law
    • Economics and management
    • Engineering Sciences

Terms and Conditions for Eiffel Excellence Scholarship Program

  • Applicants must not have already applied for any scholarship provided by the French government.
  • Students who are applying for the second time will not be entertained even if the institution and course are different.
  • Students should also have a basic knowledge of the French language.

Note: Students who got the scholarship at the Masters's level can re-apply for receiving the scholarship at a Ph.D. level.

application_process.description: The applications for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship program are not accepted directly by the Students. All the applications from the students for the scholarship are to be submitted by the French Higher Education Institutions.Check more scholarshipsBefore applying for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship, applicants are advised to go through the below-mentioned points:Students are supposed to contact the International relations department of the university via email, phone or website to know the deadlines.Students are supposed to contact the French Embassy office or the Campus France office in their home country.The respective French university supports the application form and helps the student in completing the form.The application if finally send by the university on behalf of the student.
application_process.html_content:
The applications for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship program are not accepted directly by the Students. All the applications from the students for the scholarship are to be submitted by the French Higher Education Institutions. Check more scholarships

Before applying for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship, applicants are advised to go through the below-mentioned points:

  • Students are supposed to contact the International relations department of the university via email, phone or website to know the deadlines.
  • Students are supposed to contact the French Embassy office or the Campus France office in their home country.
  • The respective French university supports the application form and helps the student in completing the form.
  • The application if finally send by the university on behalf of the student.

selection_process.description: The selection process for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship is carried out by a committee consisting of four panels of experts from the department of political science, law, engineering sciences, and management.The members of the panels are not allowed to evaluate the applications form the institutions with which they are associated or affiliated.Candidates are judged based on their academic performance as mentioned in their application forms.The institution and the department of the candidates are also considered based on their contribution to promoting the Eiffel Excellence program.Around 70% of the scholarships are offered to the candidates with outstanding academic performance and the rest 30% of scholarships are awarded to the candidates who have not received any scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process for the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship is carried out by a committee consisting of four panels of experts from the department of political science, law, engineering sciences, and management.

  • The members of the panels are not allowed to evaluate the applications form the institutions with which they are associated or affiliated.
  • Candidates are judged based on their academic performance as mentioned in their application forms.
  • The institution and the department of the candidates are also considered based on their contribution to promoting the Eiffel Excellence program.

Around 70% of the scholarships are offered to the candidates with outstanding academic performance and the rest 30% of scholarships are awarded to the candidates who have not received any scholarship.

grant_details.description: The French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs founded the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship to attract bright international students to their Master's and Doctoral programs. A total of 350 students are provided a scholarship every year under the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship program.Scholarship amount1181 USD per monthStudy length2 - 3 yearsApplicable programsLaw, political science, economics, management, and engineering sciencesApplication systemVia French Higher Education InstitutionsThe scholarship is awarded for a maximum period of 24 months for students taking admission in the master's level program and for 36 months for students taking admission in the engineering program.The students who get the scholarship have the advantage of a complimentary return trip to their home country from France, which will be provided by Campus France.
grant_details.html_content:
The French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs founded the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship to attract bright international students to their Master's and Doctoral programs. A total of 350 students are provided a scholarship every year under the Eiffel Excellence Scholarship program.

Scholarship amount 1181 USD per month
Study length 2 - 3 years
Applicable programs Law, political science, economics, management, and engineering sciences 
Application system Via French Higher Education Institutions

The scholarship is awarded for a maximum period of 24 months for students taking admission in the master's level program and for 36 months for students taking admission in the engineering program.

The students who get the scholarship have the advantage of a complimentary return trip to their home country from France, which will be provided by Campus France.

scholarship_name: Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award
description:
The Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award is a need and merit-based scholarship for international students. The award is designed for students starting their undergraduate degree at the University of British Columbia(UBC).

The renewability of the award is dependent on the recipient's performance and his/her ranking in the top quartile of the program of study and based on his behavior/status as per the student authorization to study in Canada.

eligibility_criteria.description: In order to be considered for the Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award, applicants must fulfill all the requirements listed below:Nationality: International student studying in Canada on a verifiedCanadian student visa.High School Completion:From a recognized secondary school/ college, or another university.Academic Qualification:Demonstrate exceptional and consistent academic performance.UG Condition:Securedadmission at the University of British Columbia.Students should be entering their first year of the UBC undergraduate degree.Demonstrate financial need that will otherwise prevent the applicant from studying in Canada.Applicants must note that if they are nominated for a Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award, then they will not be considered for merit-based awards offered by the university, includingInternational Major Entrance Scholarshipsand any other awards including theOutstanding International Student Awards.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to be considered for the Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award, applicants must fulfill all the requirements listed below:

  • Nationality: International student studying in Canada on a verified Canadian student visa.
  • High School Completion: From a recognized secondary school/ college, or another university.
  • Academic Qualification: Demonstrate exceptional and consistent academic performance.
  • UG Condition: Secured admission at the University of British Columbia.
    • Students should be entering their first year of the UBC undergraduate degree.
  • Demonstrate financial need that will otherwise prevent the applicant from studying in Canada.

Applicants must note that if they are nominated for a Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award, then they will not be considered for merit-based awards offered by the university, including International Major Entrance Scholarships and any other awards including the Outstanding International Student Awards.

application_process.description: The process for the Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award is given below:Mid- September:Decide on your academic program/campus.Late September:Decide on a nominator/referee.Early October:Discuss your nomination and create an account:-The nominator and teacher recommendations need to be completed and submitted a few days beforeNovember 15.Early October: Start your UBC admissions application.Mid-October: Gather relevant information for application and complete your sections of the award application.By November 15: Submit your completed application.By December 1:Apply to UBC.By January 31:Submit required documents.Mid- April: Check your email to learn if you have received an award.ELP Test NameMinimum Score RequirementIELTS6.5 (no section below 6.0)PTE(Academic)Overall: 65; Reading: 60; Listening: 60; Writing: 60; Speaking: 60TOEFLOverall: 90; Reading: 22; Listening: 22; Writing: 21; Speaking: 21DuolingoOverall: 125Applications for 2026 open in mid-September. When the application opens, you can only apply to winter session (September 2026 – April 2027).
application_process.html_content:
The process for the Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award is given below:

  • Mid- September: Decide on your academic program/campus.
  • Late September: Decide on a nominator/referee.
  • Early October: Discuss your nomination and create an account:- The nominator and teacher recommendations need to be completed and submitted a few days before November 15. 
  • Early October: Start your UBC admissions application.
  • Mid-October: Gather relevant information for application and complete your sections of the award application.
  • By November 15: Submit your completed application.
  • By December 1: Apply to UBC.
  • By January 31: Submit required documents.
  • Mid- April: Check your email to learn if you have received an award.
ELP Test Name Minimum Score Requirement
IELTS 6.5 (no section below 6.0)
PTE(Academic) Overall: 65; Reading: 60; Listening: 60; Writing: 60; Speaking: 60
TOEFL

Overall: 90; Reading: 22; Listening: 22; Writing: 21; Speaking: 21
Duolingo

Overall: 125

Applications for 2026 open in mid-September. When the application opens, you can only apply to winter session (September 2026 – April 2027).

selection_process.description: Students are awarded on the basis of their academic merit and financial need. selection_process.html_content:
Students are awarded on the basis of their academic merit and financial need. In addition to that, the Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award recipients are selected on the following factors:

  • Involvement in the Student Affairs

grant_details.html_content:
The Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award is a tuition fee waiver type of scholarship and covers nearly all the tuition and fees requirements of the student.

This is a type of need-and-merit-based award, which recognizes international undergraduate students who succeed to demonstrate their superior academic achievements, leadership skills, their involvement in student affairs and their contribution to community service, and other recognized achievement in some.

Benefits Under The Karen McKellin International Leader of Tomorrow Award

The value of each award varies and it depends upon the applicant's financial circumstances and course fees. The awards are made to students who are entering their first UG study at UBC.

The table below shows significant benefits of the scholarship :

Award Amount Varies, depending upon the financial need of the student
Award Duration 1 year (renewed for next 3 years based on performance)
Applicable Programs UG programs at UBC

The financial need of a student is determined by totaling their tuition fees of the study and living costs, and by subtracting the financial contribution made by them and their family towards the study each year.

Students who wish to study in Canada at the University of British Columbia are advised to keep an eye on its official website for further updates.

description:
The University of Liverpool is giving a generous amount of scholarship to students who wish to pursue graduate courses at University. The ULMS Indian Subcontinent Excellence Scholarship being one of them. It is categorized under International Students – Country specific Awards.

The scholarship is given only for the Master’s subject. MSc programs can include MSc Advanced Aerospace Engineering, MSc Advanced Biological Sciences, and MSc Economics, etc. It is a partial fee waiver – 50%. The scholarship is for the Indian Subcontinent and given to all eligible students across the on-campus MSc Programs. Academic merit is the key to the Scholarship.

Unlike other Scholarships, this award can be combined with any centrally-awarded funding that the student is eligible for. Students may contact the University about the further process of combining scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: Candidates are required to meet the eligibility criteria given below to enjoy the benefits of the scholarship.Applicant must hold or be on track to obtain, at least a high 2:1 (65+%) in their undergraduate degree, including 60+% in modules relevant to the MSc program.Applicants must be from countries like Bangladesh, India, Nepal, Maldives, Pakistan and Sri Lanka only.Indian subcontinent applicants across all Liverpool on-campus MSc programs are eligible .Work experience relevant to the program would be advantageous, as would previously studying at a highly ranked university.Note 1:Work experience can include a paid internship, shadowing or voluntary positions.Note 2:All these criteria are for MSc taught program and not MSc research programs.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates are required to meet the eligibility criteria given below to enjoy the benefits of the scholarship.

  • Applicant must hold or be on track to obtain, at least a high 2:1 (65+%) in their undergraduate degree, including 60+% in modules relevant to the MSc program.
  • Applicants must be from countries like Bangladesh, India, Nepal, Maldives, Pakistan and Sri Lanka only.
  • Indian subcontinent applicants across all Liverpool on-campus MSc programs are eligible .
  • Work experience relevant to the program would be advantageous, as would previously studying at a highly ranked university.

Note 1: Work experience can include a paid internship, shadowing or voluntary positions.

Note 2: All these criteria are for MSc taught program and not MSc research programs.

application_process.description: Eligible program applicants will be considered. No separate scholarship application is needed. Documents required at the time of admission intoMSc programs at the University of Liverpoolare :School or College transcripts/certificatesUniversity transcripts and certified translation if applicableDegree certificatesEvidence of English Language proficiencyPersonal StatementTwo referencesThe application process might require an interview even if it is not otherwise mentioned to evaluate some candidates personally. A great positive attitude and good knowledge of the subject studied is generally advised to possess while giving the interview.Note:Scanned copies are allowed but students have to bring original documents at the time of admission.
application_process.html_content:
Eligible program applicants will be considered. No separate scholarship application is needed. Documents required at the time of admission into MSc programs at the University of Liverpool are :

  • School or College transcripts/certificates
  • University transcripts and certified translation if applicable
  • Degree certificates
  • Evidence of English Language proficiency
  • Personal Statement
  • Two references

The application process might require an interview even if it is not otherwise mentioned to evaluate some candidates personally. A great positive attitude and good knowledge of the subject studied is generally advised to possess while giving the interview.

Note: Scanned copies are allowed but students have to bring original documents at the time of admission.

selection_process.description: Early program applications are advised as scholarships will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.The selection committee will review the program application along with documents required to submit for the scholarship. Selected candidates will be informed through email and scholarship funds will be allocated to them.
selection_process.html_content:
Early program applications are advised as scholarships will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.

The selection committee will review the program application along with documents required to submit for the scholarship. Selected candidates will be informed through email and scholarship funds will be allocated to them.

grant_details.description: Applicants are advised to apply at the earliest if they want to be considered for the scholarship. The course eligible is all the MSc Programmes. Though eligibility is 2:1 (65+%), it does not guarantee admission, applicants have to score really high.Scholarships can be extremely competitive and scoring one is a great achievement in itself so applicants are advised to write the personal statements effectively.ULMS Indian Subcontinent Excellence Scholarshipoffers wavier of 50% of the total fees and it willnot include the accommodation charges.Interested students are advised to visit the official website of the college.
grant_details.html_content:
Applicants are advised to apply at the earliest if they want to be considered for the scholarship. The course eligible is all the MSc Programmes. Though eligibility is 2:1 (65+%), it does not guarantee admission, applicants have to score really high.

Scholarships can be extremely competitive and scoring one is a great achievement in itself so applicants are advised to write the personal statements effectively.

ULMS Indian Subcontinent Excellence Scholarship offers wavier of 50% of the total fees and it will not include the accommodation charges.

Interested students are advised to visit the official website of the college.

description:
The MSc Merit-based scholarship for international students is offered by the Michael Smurfit Graduate Business School. The business school is a part of the University College Dublin. Students get a 50% tuition fee waiver under this scholarship. The eligibility criteria are flexible as the scholarship program is available to all international students.

Here is a list of few MSc Programs offered by the Michael Smurfit Graduate Business School, University College Dublin along with their fee:

Program Name Tuition Fee
MSc Advance Software Engineering  14,088 USD
MSc Chemistry 28,177 USD
MSc Business analytics 21,814 USD
MSc Data analytics  21,814 USD
MSc Computer Science 28,177 USD

As the tuition fee at the University College Dublin ranges from 14,088 USD to 28,177 USD, the MSc merit-based scholarship provided to the students taking admissions in the MSc programs at the University College Dublin will help them easily meet their financial expenses.

eligibility_criteria.description: To get the scholarship, students are supposed to takeadmission at the University College Dublinin the MSc program. This scholarship is to provide financial aid to students with exceptional academic records.The shortlisted students get a 50% tuition fee waiver and are also trained to represent the course and the institution at a global level when they enter the job industry. Students are required to meet the eligibility criteria as stated by the university.2:1 or 65% in  bachelor’s degreeA minimum score of 630 points in the GMAT test, if you haven’t attempted the GRE test (GMAT score is a primary factor kept in mind by the bench of admissions):Verbal component score must at least be 30/51,The quantitative score no lower than 40/60;A score lying in 130-170 scoring scale for GRE:Minimum 158 out of 170GREVerbal ReasoningMinimum 160 out of 170 GRE Quantitative ReasoningMust have obtained a first-class honors degree (or equivalent) from a recognized institution.Secured a minimum overall score of 7.0 in the IELTS test, a score of 100/120 in the TOEFL test (or equivalent): only if applicable.Who isn’t eligible:Students opting for the below-mentioned courses will be considered ineligible for theMSc Merit-Based Scholarship for International Students:MSc in Biotechnology and BusinessMSc in Biotherapeutics and BusinessMSc in International Law and Business
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To get the scholarship, students are supposed to take admission at the University College Dublin in the MSc program. This scholarship is to provide financial aid to students with exceptional academic records.

The shortlisted students get a 50% tuition fee waiver and are also trained to represent the course and the institution at a global level when they enter the job industry. Students are required to meet the eligibility criteria as stated by the university.

  • 2:1 or 65% in  bachelor’s degree
  • A minimum score of 630 points in the GMAT test, if you haven’t attempted the GRE test (GMAT score is a primary factor kept in mind by the bench of admissions):
  • Verbal component score must at least be 30/51,
  • The quantitative score no lower than 40/60;
  • A score lying in 130-170 scoring scale for GRE:
  • Minimum 158 out of 170 GRE Verbal Reasoning
  • Minimum 160 out of 170 GRE Quantitative Reasoning
  • Must have obtained a first-class honors degree (or equivalent) from a recognized institution.
  • Secured a minimum overall score of 7.0 in the IELTS test, a score of 100/120 in the TOEFL test (or equivalent): only if applicable.

Who isn’t eligible:

Students opting for the below-mentioned courses will be considered ineligible for the MSc Merit-Based Scholarship for International Students:

  • MSc in Biotechnology and Business
  • MSc in Biotherapeutics and Business
  • MSc in International Law and Business

application_process.description: Candidates have to first apply for admission in any of the MSc programs at the University College Dublin.All the students are supposed to fill the application form for the scholarship available at the official website of University College Dublin.After filling all the necessary details in the application form, candidates are required to attach their GRE orGMATtest scores with the application form.Candidates will be supposed to fill the application form before the last date of application which is August 01, 2025.
application_process.html_content:
Candidates have to first apply for admission in any of the MSc programs at the University College Dublin.

All the students are supposed to fill the application form for the scholarship available at the official website of University College Dublin.

After filling all the necessary details in the application form, candidates are required to attach their GRE or GMAT test scores with the application form.

Candidates will be supposed to fill the application form before the last date of application which is August 01, 2025.

selection_process.description: The selection of the candidates for the scholarship is completely based on merit, academic performance, and eligibility criteria and resume with all the details about the students.
selection_process.html_content: The selection of the candidates for the scholarship is completely based on merit, academic performance, and eligibility criteria and resume with all the details about the students.

University College Dublin is one of the best options for candidates who want to study in Ireland. By getting a 50% tuition fee reduction, students will find it easy to manage the cost of living in Ireland.
