The MSc Merit-Based Scholarship for International students can be availed by the students of selected countries. For Indian students, the scholarship is released into two parts by providing a 50% reduction in the cost of attendance in the first semester and 50% in the second semester.

description:
The Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarships are awarded every year to bright Indian students with an excellent academic base who are willing to do a doctoral study at the St. Johns College, one of the largest colleges in Cambridge. 

The recipients of the Dr, Manmohan Singh Scholarships have acknowledged the difference this program has made in their lives. This fully-funded scholarship has not just made their dreams to study in the U.K a reality but has created a platform for them to become the leaders of their chosen field.

eligibility_criteria.description: The University of Cambridge has established certain eligibility criteria that the prospective applicants need to fulfill. To be considered for the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship program, an applicant must:Be an Indian national with a valid Indian Passport.Must be currently residing in IndiaHold a recognized masters of PG degree from an Indian university/institution.Below the age of 35 years as of January 31.Be intending to pursue a full-time Doctoral program at the University of Cambridge.For the 2021 scholarship, an applicant must be commencing the program in September-October 2021.Not be a recipient of otherscholarships to study in the U.K.Eligible CoursesHere is the list of the Doctoral courses that are included in the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship.Science and TechnologyEconomicsSocial studiesAerospace EngineeringMarine EngineeringEnergy studies
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The University of Cambridge has established certain eligibility criteria that the prospective applicants need to fulfill. To be considered for the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship program, an applicant must:

  • Be an Indian national with a valid Indian Passport.
    • Must be currently residing in India
  • Hold a recognized masters of PG degree from an Indian university/institution.
  • Below the age of 35 years as of January 31.
  • Be intending to pursue a full-time Doctoral program at the University of Cambridge.
    • For the 2021 scholarship, an applicant must be commencing the program in September-October 2021.
  • Not be a recipient of other scholarships to study in the U.K.

Eligible Courses

 Here is the list of the Doctoral courses that are included in the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship.

  • Science and Technology
  • Economics
  • Social studies
  • Aerospace Engineering
  • Marine Engineering
  • Energy studies

application_process.description: Applicants who fulfill the eligibility criteria can move ahead and apply for the scholarship. The application process of Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship is entirely online.Step-by-Step ProcessBefore applying for the scholarship, applicants must be complete applications to secureadmission at the University of Cambridge. The step-by-step process for Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship 2020 is given below:Step I:Choose a doctoral program and a supervisor at the University of Cambridge.Step II:Complete the admission requirements for theCambridge doctoral programs:UG and PG degrees and transcript2 academic/professional referenceResumeResearch proposalStatement of purpose/ personal essaySubmit the application forms before the admission application deadline.Step III:Choose St. John’s College as the first preference in the application form.Step IV:Upon confirmation of admission, complete the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship application via the college website to notify the officials at St. John’s. The college will email the acknowledgment recipient to the applicants.Important DatesLast Date of application15thof January 2024Interview RoundBetween April 2024- June 2024Result DeclarationJune 2024Commencement of ClassesGenerally, in Sep/Oct every yearNote:Applicants must not contact St. John’s College at this stage.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants who fulfill the eligibility criteria can move ahead and apply for the scholarship. The application process of Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship is entirely online.

Step-by-Step Process

Before applying for the scholarship, applicants must be complete applications to secure admission at the University of Cambridge. The step-by-step process for Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship 2020 is given below:

Step I: Choose a doctoral program and a supervisor at the University of Cambridge.
Step II: Complete the admission requirements for the Cambridge doctoral programs:

  • UG and PG degrees and transcript
  • 2 academic/professional reference
  • Resume
  • Research proposal
  • Statement of purpose/ personal essay

Submit the application forms before the admission application deadline.
Step III: Choose St. John’s College as the first preference in the application form.
Step IV: Upon confirmation of admission, complete the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship application via the college website to notify the officials at St. John’s. The college will email the acknowledgment recipient to the applicants.

Important Dates

Last Date of application

15th of January 2024

Interview Round

Between April 2024- June 2024

Result Declaration

June 2024

Commencement of Classes

Generally, in Sep/Oct every year

Note: Applicants must not contact St. John’s College at this stage.

selection_process.description: Cambridge Universityfollows a strict selection process to select candidates for the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship. The candidates are selected in a two-stage process:Stage I:Core selection committee and the Central Board of the St. Johns College and the Cambridge university go through the submitted applications and release the initial list of shortlisted candidates.Stage II:The PI round whereskype interviewsof candidates shortlisted from the first round are taken and then the final list of grantees is released.The interviews will be conducted between April and June 2024. Within a month of the skype interview session, the selection committee announces the name of the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship recipient. The decision of the selection committee is final and cannot be challenged.Post Selection:After selection, St. John’s College will coordinate with the shortlisted students for pre-departure, travel arrangements, andU.K. student visas.
selection_process.html_content:
Cambridge University follows a strict selection process to select candidates for the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship. The candidates are selected in a two-stage process:

  • Stage I: Core selection committee and the Central Board of the St. Johns College and the Cambridge university go through the submitted applications and release the initial list of shortlisted candidates.
  • Stage II: The PI round where skype interviews of candidates shortlisted from the first round are taken and then the final list of grantees is released. 

The interviews will be conducted between April and June 2024. Within a month of the skype interview session, the selection committee announces the name of the Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship recipient. The decision of the selection committee is final and cannot be challenged.

Post Selection: After selection, St. John’s College will coordinate with the shortlisted students for pre-departure, travel arrangements, and U.K. student visas.

grant_details.description: For several Indian students who wish tostudy at the U.K university, the University of Cambridge is an obvious choice. Ever since its inception, the university has produced numerous laureates including Scientists, Artists, Prime Minister and many more.Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship program is also named after one such honorary graduate of St. John’s College, University of Cambridge. Designed specifically for academically excellent Indian students, this scholarship program is applicable for doctoral-students.Benefits of Dr. Manmohan Singh ScholarshipsThe Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarships is a merit-based, expense waiver scholarship program for Indian students. The table below highlights the type of expenses for which a student has to incur to study at the university and whether or not it is covered under the benefits of Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship program:Type of ExpenseCovered or NotTuition FeesYesAccommodationNoBooks and SuppliesNoInternational AirfareYesMonthly stipend*YesU.K visYes*the monthly stipend provided by the university can be used for housing, transportation, meals, books, and other miscellaneous expenses.For further information, applicants can send an email at drmanmohansinghscholarships@joh.cam.ac.uk
grant_details.html_content:
For several Indian students who wish to study at the U.K university, the University of Cambridge is an obvious choice. Ever since its inception, the university has produced numerous laureates including Scientists, Artists, Prime Minister and many more.

Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship program is also named after one such honorary graduate of St. John’s College, University of Cambridge. Designed specifically for academically excellent Indian students, this scholarship program is applicable for doctoral-students.

Benefits of Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarships

The Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarships is a merit-based, expense waiver scholarship program for Indian students. The table below highlights the type of expenses for which a student has to incur to study at the university and whether or not it is covered under the benefits of Dr. Manmohan Singh Scholarship program:

Type of Expense Covered or Not
Tuition Fees Yes
Accommodation No
Books and Supplies No
International Airfare Yes
Monthly stipend* Yes
U.K vis Yes

*the monthly stipend provided by the university can be used for housing, transportation, meals, books, and other miscellaneous expenses.

For further information, applicants can send an email at drmanmohansinghscholarships@joh.cam.ac.uk

scholarship_name: University of Sussex Chancellor's International Scholarship
description:
The University of Sussex is one of the renowned universities that witness a huge number of international students applying for different courses over there. The University of Sussex provides many scholarships to international students to help them to fund education.

Out of many types of master’s degree funding available for the students at the university, one of them is Chancellor’s International Scholarship (2026). The scholarship is available to the international applicants who wish to study PG programs at University. The total no. of the scholarship available is 25.

The scholarship is a partial fee waiver and reduces up to £5,000 of tuition fees for international PG applicants. The scholarship is non-renewable. The students have to demonstrate amazing academic excellence for getting the scholarship.

The University of Sussex provides many other scholarships to international students to fund their studies at the campus. Some of them are John Kinghorn Scholarship, Sussex MBA Scholarship 2026 and Sussex India Scholarship 2026.

eligibility_criteria.description: This scholarship is available to all the students who plan to continue their higher education in the U.K. The students who have been grantedadmission to the University of Sussexcan avail this scholarship. To apply for the Chancellor’s International Scholarship, the students must fulfill the given criteria:The student must have accepted a place on a full-time eligible Masters, which will commence at the University of Sussex in September 2026.A student must have secured excellent grades (UK first class or equivalent)A student must have a clear and specific goal with defined links to the course.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
This scholarship is available to all the students who plan to continue their higher education in the U.K. The students who have been granted admission to the University of Sussex can avail this scholarship. To apply for the Chancellor’s International Scholarship, the students must fulfill the given criteria:

  • The student must have accepted a place on a full-time eligible Masters, which will commence at the University of Sussex in September 2026.
  • A student must have secured excellent grades (UK first class or equivalent)
  • A student must have a clear and specific goal with defined links to the course.

application_process.description: Applying for Chancellor’s International Scholarship is quite easy. To be considered for the Chancellors International Scholarship, the students have to received and accepted an offer of a place on an eligibleMasters at Sussex.To apply for the scholarship, the students need to submit a statement of academic interests and should provide clear information to the university about:Drive and ambitionsApplicant’s ambitious plan post completing his/her studies on returning to home countryRelevant work experience, skills or extra-curricular activities that relate to applicants’ ambitions and/or chosen course.In order to get considered for the scholarship, you need to showcase excellent grades in your most recent qualification.Also, the students have to submit the application online only asno offline forms are available.The applicant has to fill personal details like name, contact information, education qualification, background details.In case the students are applying for a master’s course which starts in September 2026, they mustsubmit the application by May 1, 2026.
application_process.html_content:
Applying for Chancellor’s International Scholarship is quite easy. To be considered for the Chancellors International Scholarship, the students have to received and accepted an offer of a place on an eligible Masters at Sussex.

To apply for the scholarship, the students need to submit a statement of academic interests and should provide clear information to the university about:

  • Drive and ambitions
  • Applicant’s ambitious plan post completing his/her studies on returning to home country
  • Relevant work experience, skills or extra-curricular activities that relate to applicants’ ambitions and/or chosen course.

In order to get considered for the scholarship, you need to showcase excellent grades in your most recent qualification.

Also, the students have to submit the application online only as no offline forms are available. The applicant has to fill personal details like name, contact information, education qualification, background details.

In case the students are applying for a master’s course which starts in September 2026, they must submit the application by May 1, 2026.

selection_process.description: The criterion of selection is that an applicant must meet the eligibility criteria set by the University.The student must have submitted the application form along with a statement by the mentioned deadline.The write up mentions the applicant’s ambition plans.An international student has to meet English language requirements or should have completed a pre-sessional English course.The criteria for getting selected for a scholarship also include performance in the interview session.Students will be evaluated based on the information provided in the application form. Information provided with the master’s application may be used as part of the assessment.The scholarship Office will contact the applicant after the final decision is taken. The application of non-eligible candidates will be withdrawn.
selection_process.html_content:
The criterion of selection is that an applicant must meet the eligibility criteria set by the University.

  • The student must have submitted the application form along with a statement by the mentioned deadline.
  • The write up mentions the applicant’s ambition plans.
  • An international student has to meet English language requirements or should have completed a pre-sessional English course.
  • The criteria for getting selected for a scholarship also include performance in the interview session.

Students will be evaluated based on the information provided in the application form. Information provided with the master’s application may be used as part of the assessment.

The scholarship Office will contact the applicant after the final decision is taken. The application of non-eligible candidates will be withdrawn.

grant_details.description: The international students are eligible for different kinds of student loans and funding options which include international scholarships, Ph.D. studentships, Masters’s degree funding tostudy in UK.The university provides Chancellor’s International Scholarships to students applying for a full-time postgraduate degree program to get additional funding to support their education. It covers £5,000 of the tuition fee and it is non-renewable.The application deadline for the scholarship is May 1, 2026. As the number of scholarships is limited, interested candidates are advised to apply for the same as early as possible.The University of Sussex provides many other scholarships to international students to fund their studies at the campus. Some of them areJohn Kinghorn Scholarship, Sussex MBA Scholarship 2026 andSussex India Scholarship 2026.
grant_details.html_content:
The international students are eligible for different kinds of student loans and funding options which include international scholarships, Ph.D. studentships, Masters’s degree funding to study in UK.

The university provides Chancellor’s International Scholarships to students applying for a full-time postgraduate degree program to get additional funding to support their education. It covers £5,000 of the tuition fee and it is non-renewable.

The application deadline for the scholarship is May 1, 2026. As the number of scholarships is limited, interested candidates are advised to apply for the same as early as possible.

The University of Sussex provides many other scholarships to international students to fund their studies at the campus. Some of them are John Kinghorn Scholarship, Sussex MBA Scholarship 2026 and Sussex India Scholarship 2026.

description:
The B.J. Seaman Scholarship is provided to one of the meritorious students for their academic performance. The B.J. Seaman Scholarship is provided to the students by the University of Calgary.

The Student shortlisted for the B.J. Seaman Scholarship is awarded with an amount of 2200 USD. Anonymous donations are made in recognition of the participation of B.J. Seaman in bringing the Flames Hockey team to Calgary.

eligibility_criteria.description: To get the B.J. Seaman Scholarship, all the international students are required to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the University of Calgary. The applicant:Must have takenadmissions at the University of Calgaryin a full-time undergraduate program.Should be continuing their studies in the 2nd, 3rd or 4th year in any faculty.Should have completed the most recent fall and winter terms with at least 24 units.Disabled students will be accepted with 18 units.Should have aminimum GPA of 3.20in the most recent fall and winter terms.Terms and Conditions:The students entering an after-degree program in the fall term are not eligible for this scholarship. However, they will be eligible after completing the first year of their after-degree program.The supplemental exams, deferred exams, and special deferred exams or term work can affect the eligibility of the candidate for the B.J. Seaman scholarship.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To get the B.J. Seaman Scholarship, all the international students are required to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the University of Calgary. The applicant:

  • Must have taken admissions at the University of Calgary in a full-time undergraduate program.
  • Should be continuing their studies in the 2nd, 3rd or 4th year in any faculty.
  • Should have completed the most recent fall and winter terms with at least 24 units. Disabled students will be accepted with 18 units.
  • Should have a minimum GPA of 3.20 in the most recent fall and winter terms.

Terms and Conditions:

  • The students entering an after-degree program in the fall term are not eligible for this scholarship. However, they will be eligible after completing the first year of their after-degree program.
  • The supplemental exams, deferred exams, and special deferred exams or term work can affect the eligibility of the candidate for the B.J. Seaman scholarship.

application_process.description: Students who have enrolled themselves in any of theundergraduate programs at the University of Calgarycan fill the application form for the scholarship. The students are supposed to apply for the B.J. Seaman Scholarship by visiting the official website of the University of Calgary.The applicant will have to sign in to their Study Center from the myUofC portal. Here is the direct link for theportal.On the home page, click on ‘My Financials’.Then scroll down to the Awards & Scholarship section.Click on ‘Apply for Undergraduate Award’.Ensure that the popups are enabled in the windows.The pop-up window will open on the screen. If it does not open then maybe the pop-ups are blocked in the windows.The new page will show all the scholarships or awards that are available and their application deadline dates.Apply for the B.J. Seaman Scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
Students who have enrolled themselves in any of the undergraduate programs at the University of Calgary can fill the application form for the scholarship. The students are supposed to apply for the B.J. Seaman Scholarship by visiting the official website of the University of Calgary.

  • The applicant will have to sign in to their Study Center from the myUofC portal. Here is the direct link for the portal.
  • On the home page, click on ‘My Financials’.
  • Then scroll down to the Awards & Scholarship section.
  • Click on ‘Apply for Undergraduate Award’.
  • Ensure that the popups are enabled in the windows.
  • The pop-up window will open on the screen. If it does not open then maybe the pop-ups are blocked in the windows.
  • The new page will show all the scholarships or awards that are available and their application deadline dates.
  • Apply for the B.J. Seaman Scholarship.

selection_process.description: The selection of the candidate is purely based on academic merit. The scholarship is only for the students enrolled in the undergraduateprograms at University of Calgary. The performances of the applicants in their most recent fall and winter terms will decide whether they will be selected for the scholarship or not.Few other things are considered such as the financial need, extracurricular activities, leadership, volunteerism, etc may be considered, depending on the terms of the scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection of the candidate is purely based on academic merit. The scholarship is only for the students enrolled in the undergraduate programs at University of Calgary. The performances of the applicants in their most recent fall and winter terms will decide whether they will be selected for the scholarship or not.

Few other things are considered such as the financial need, extracurricular activities, leadership, volunteerism, etc may be considered, depending on the terms of the scholarship.

grant_details.description: To receive award payments, the student must continue to meet the terms of reference for their award and maintain full-time enrollment (minimum of 24 units) during the upcoming fall and winter term. Below are some of the related information about the payment of the scholarship fund:The value of the scholarship award will be applied directly to the tuition fees of the student. The amount will be added until the end of December.If there is any remaining award fund, then it will be paid directly to the student's bank account. This amount is referred to as ‘ Payout of Scholarship Refund’. It will be deposited by October 25 for the fall term and February 25 for the winter term.Students can check their award payments in their Student Centre. All the information will be available in ‘My Financials’.For receiving the ‘Payout of the Scholarship’, the student must provide the university with their bank details. They can update it in their Study Center, in the ‘My Financials’ and submit it on the ‘Submit Direct Deposit Info’.Payments can be delayed if the banking information is not accurate or not updated.Study length4 yearsEligibilityInternational studentsAward amount2200 USDAward distributionAnnuallyThe award amount is 2200 USD and will be provided to the student at the end of December. The student who has been selected for the scholarship will also have to maintain their GPA and should at least complete a minimum of 24 units for both the upcoming fall and winter term.
grant_details.html_content:
To receive award payments, the student must continue to meet the terms of reference for their award and maintain full-time enrollment (minimum of 24 units) during the upcoming fall and winter term. Below are some of the related information about the payment of the scholarship fund:

  • The value of the scholarship award will be applied directly to the tuition fees of the student. The amount will be added until the end of December.
  • If there is any remaining award fund, then it will be paid directly to the student's bank account. This amount is referred to as ‘ Payout of Scholarship Refund’. It will be deposited by October 25 for the fall term and February 25 for the winter term.
  • Students can check their award payments in their Student Centre. All the information will be available in ‘My Financials’.
  • For receiving the ‘Payout of the Scholarship’, the student must provide the university with their bank details. They can update it in their Study Center, in the ‘My Financials’ and submit it on the ‘Submit Direct Deposit Info’.
  • Payments can be delayed if the banking information is not accurate or not updated.
Study length 4 years
Eligibility International students
Award amount 2200 USD
Award distribution Annually

The award amount is 2200 USD and will be provided to the student at the end of December. The student who has been selected for the scholarship will also have to maintain their GPA and should at least complete a minimum of 24 units for both the upcoming fall and winter term.

scholarship_name: Young Women in Public Affairs Award
description:
Zonta International Foundation is a worldwide organization and has several clubs and districts across six continents. It offers Young Women in Public Affairs Awards(YWPA) to recognize charismatic young ladies with high achievements in the public frontier. The YWPA Awards is a highly selective and prestigious award given to young women who passionately look forward to serving the people.

Candidates have to be driven with commitment and strive for the betterment of society and channelize their work towards public service and civic causes. Candidates may apply to the nearest Zonta club for selection to the award.

The Zonta Foundation sponsors district/ regional level and international level awards. Ten candidates are chosen as international winners from the district/ region level winners

International recipients will get 5,000 USD as the prize money.

The award funds can only be used for tuition fees and materials like books, supplies and other equipment required for study at a secondary school, college or university. Women aged between 16-19 years can apply for this award. Recipients cannot defer the YWPA Award.

Read more Scholarships/ Latest Updated Scholarships:-

         Ontario Graduate Scholarship
         Tata Scholarship- Cornell University
         GREAT Scholarships India

eligibility_criteria.description: Eligibility criteria to be selected for Young Women in Public Affairs Award is given below :Only female candidates are eligible for this scholarshipYoung women in theage group of 16 – 19 yearsas on April 01 every year will be eligibleApplicants must be students at a school, college, or university in a Zonta district/region, or studying elsewhere butare citizens of a Zonta CountryApplicants have to show proof ofActive commitment to volunteerism.Paid or unpaid leadership experience in local government or workplace.Volunteer leadership achievements.Knowledge in Zonta International and its programs.Support in Zonta International's mission of empowering women worldwide through service and advocacy.The applicant must not be a previous recipient of this award.Classified members, employees of Zonta International and Zonta International Foundation are not eligible to apply.** Classified members: Club members and individuals with direct membership with Zonta InternationalThe term ‘family members’ refer to - ancestors, descendants, adoptees, siblings, nieces or cousins, and spouse or cohabiting partner.Note: Z and Golden Z club members are also eligible to apply.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Eligibility criteria to be selected for Young Women in Public Affairs Award is given below :

  • Only female candidates are eligible for this scholarship
  • Young women in the age group of 16 – 19 years as on April 01 every year will be eligible
  • Applicants must be students at a school, college, or university in a Zonta district/region, or studying elsewhere but are citizens of a Zonta Country
  • Applicants have to show proof of
    • Active commitment to volunteerism.
    • Paid or unpaid leadership experience in local government or workplace.
    • Volunteer leadership achievements.
    • Knowledge in Zonta International and its programs.
    • Support in Zonta International's mission of empowering women worldwide through service and advocacy.
  • The applicant must not be a previous recipient of this award.
  • Classified members, employees of Zonta International and Zonta International Foundation are not eligible to apply.*

* Classified members: Club members and individuals with direct membership with Zonta International

The term ‘family members’ refer to - ancestors, descendants, adoptees, siblings, nieces or cousins, and spouse or cohabiting partner.

Note: Z and Golden Z club members are also eligible to apply.

application_process.description: Applicant must follow the steps given below to apply for Young Women in Public Affairs Awards:Step 1:Locate the nearest Zonta Club. *Step 2:Contact the Zonta Club for application deadline.Step 3:Download the application form from the website.Step 4:Fill the downloaded application form.Step 5:Submit required documents for verification of current enrolment from the school, college or university officials .Two confidential recommendationsfrom school, college or university are also required.Step 6:Submit all documents in English and the completed application form to your nearest Zonta Club.Note:Applicants from geographic areas within a Zonta district/ region where no clubs are located may apply through a Zonta e-club or directly to the district to be eligible for the district/ region and international awards.Application TimelineThe schedule of application and selection procedure is as follows:Date by which Zonta International posts the application on the official websiteAugust 01Last date by which Zonta clubs receive the applications.Varied (Contact club for deadline)Date by which club recipients are selected and applications are received by governor/ region representative.April 01Date by which district/ region recipients selected and applications are received by Zonta International Headquarters.May 01Announcement of district/ region and international winners.July 01
application_process.html_content:
Applicant must follow the steps given below to apply for Young Women in Public Affairs Awards:

Step 1: Locate the nearest Zonta Club. *

Step 2: Contact the Zonta Club for application deadline.

Step 3: Download the application form from the website.

Step 4: Fill the downloaded application form.

Step 5: Submit required documents for verification of current enrolment from the school, college or university officials .Two confidential recommendations from school, college or university are also required.

Step 6: Submit all documents in English and the completed application form to your nearest Zonta Club.

Note: Applicants from geographic areas within a Zonta district/ region where no clubs are located may apply through a Zonta e-club or directly to the district to be eligible for the district/ region and international awards.

Application Timeline

The schedule of application and selection procedure is as follows:

Date by which Zonta International posts the application on the official website August 01
Last date by which Zonta clubs receive the applications. Varied (Contact club for deadline)
Date by which club recipients are selected and applications are received by governor/ region representative. April 01
Date by which district/ region recipients selected and applications are received by Zonta International Headquarters. May 01
Announcement of district/ region and international winners. July 01

selection_process.description: All the applicants are shortlisted on the basis of their merit, concerning their commitment, volunteerism to public service and leadership skills.Each Zonta club reviews the submitted applications and the supporting documents and selects one applicant as the club level winner. The winning entry from each club is sent to the Zonta governor/ region representative.The district/ region evaluating committee reviews the applications received from various clubs and selects one applicant from each district/ region.The Zonta International Award Committee chooses 10 international recipients from district/region applications to Zonta International Board. After the consent of the Zonta International Board, Zonda Foundations providesYoung Women in Public Affairs Awardsand certificates to all the recipients.
selection_process.html_content:
All the applicants are shortlisted on the basis of their merit, concerning their commitment, volunteerism to public service and leadership skills.

Each Zonta club reviews the submitted applications and the supporting documents and selects one applicant as the club level winner. The winning entry from each club is sent to the Zonta governor/ region representative.

The district/ region evaluating committee reviews the applications received from various clubs and selects one applicant from each district/ region.

The Zonta International Award Committee chooses 10 international recipients from district/region applications to Zonta International Board. After the consent of the Zonta International Board, Zonda Foundations provides Young Women in Public Affairs Awards and certificates to all the recipients.

grant_details.description: To encourage young women to work for public service, the Zonta International Foundation offersYoung Women in Public Affairs (YWPA) Awards.10 international awards are given to women who work passionately for social service. The award is given only once to the selected candidate and it is non-renewable.The details of the grant offered are as follows.Study levelSchool, College, or UniversityAge group16 – 19 yearsSexFemaleGrant amountInternational: USD 4,000District/ Regional: USD 1,500Club: VariesNumber of scholarshipsInternational: 10District/ Regional: 1 from each district or regionClub: 1 from each clubTypeMerit-basedRenewable or notNon-renewableRedeemable as cash or notYesAwarded forPublic welfare influence and social workAward OfferedAnnuallyApplications for the 2026 Young Women in Public Affairs Award must be received by the assigned deadline that is declared by the applicant's local Zonta club. The2023 recipients will be chosen by July 01, 2026.YWPA Awards chooses young women demonstrating their strength in leadership qualities to bring out the work and life problems in society to the forefront and fights against injustice, as the winners.
grant_details.html_content:
To encourage young women to work for public service, the Zonta International Foundation offers Young Women in Public Affairs (YWPA) Awards. 10 international awards are given to women who work passionately for social service. The award is given only once to the selected candidate and it is non-renewable.

The details of the grant offered are as follows.

Study level School, College, or University
Age group 16 – 19 years
Sex Female
Grant amount International: USD 4,000
District/ Regional: USD 1,500
Club: Varies
Number of scholarships International: 10
District/ Regional: 1 from each district or region
Club: 1 from each club
Type Merit-based
Renewable or not Non-renewable
Redeemable as cash or not Yes
Awarded for Public welfare influence and social work
Award Offered Annually

Applications for the 2026 Young Women in Public Affairs Award must be received by the assigned deadline that is declared by the applicant's local Zonta club. The 2023 recipients will be chosen by July 01, 2026.

YWPA Awards chooses young women demonstrating their strength in leadership qualities to bring out the work and life problems in society to the forefront and fights against injustice, as the winners.

description: The VueVille Future Technology Scholarship, Valued 1000 USD, is awarded to one student enrolled in any university of Canada, Australia, UK, Germany, USA, Singapore, etc. Selection decisions are entirely based on an essay submitted by the applicants.

selection_process.description: Students who want to avail of the benefit of the scholarship will submit an essay on the given topic: “?How Smart Home technology can help us adapt to the new normal of the COVID Era?”Applicants will be evaluated on the basis of the submitted essay only:Word count should be between 750- 1000 words.Essay must be original and creative; written after thorough research.The selection process for the VueVille Future Technology Scholarshipmay include aninterview session.The shortlisting process will begin in the month of October and the decision will be announced byNovember 30, 2020.The decision notification will be sent to the recipient’s educational institution.
selection_process.html_content:
Students who want to avail of the benefit of the scholarship will submit an essay on the given topic: “?How Smart Home technology can help us adapt to the new normal of the COVID Era?” Applicants will be evaluated on the basis of the submitted essay only:

  • Word count should be between 750- 1000 words.
  • Essay must be original and creative; written after thorough research.

The selection process for the VueVille Future Technology Scholarship may include an interview session.

The shortlisting process will begin in the month of October and the decision will be announced by November 30, 2020. The decision notification will be sent to the recipient’s educational institution.

scholarship_name: Global Academic Excellence Scholarship- University of Adelaide
description:
The University of Adelaide offers many scholarships to students who wish to pursue higher education in Australia. One such scholarship is the Global Academic Excellence Scholarship given to international students by the University of Adelaide.

The Global Academic Excellence Scholarship offers a reduction of 50% in the tuition fee to students enrolled in the full-time duration of the chosen UG and PG degree. The student must demonstrate extraordinary academic excellence in order to be selected for the program.

eligibility_criteria.description: The student is considered for the scholarship upon application or enrollment in their desired field of study at UG and PG level. The applicant must meet all theadmission requirements at the University of Adelaidefor the course work. The application must contain all the required documents and must be error-free.The academic eligibility for the scholarship is:Raw ATAR of 98 OR 95% (for UG level)GPA 6.8on 7.0 OR equivalent (for PG level)Applicants who arenot eligibleto receive Global Academic Excellence Scholarship scholarships are:Students who are transferring from one program to another prior to the successful completion of their program of study (internal transfers);Students who are recipients of a scholarship awarded by recognized bodies such as a government ministry or department;Applicants for Masters by Research or Ph.D. programs.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The student is considered for the scholarship upon application or enrollment in their desired field of study at UG and PG level. The applicant must meet all the admission requirements at the University of Adelaide for the course work. The application must contain all the required documents and must be error-free.

The academic eligibility for the scholarship is:

  • Raw ATAR of 98 OR 95% (for UG level)
  • GPA 6.8 on 7.0 OR equivalent (for PG level)

Applicants who are not eligible to receive Global Academic Excellence Scholarship scholarships are:

  • Students who are transferring from one program to another prior to the successful completion of their program of study (internal transfers);
  • Students who are recipients of a scholarship awarded by recognized bodies such as a government ministry or department;
  • Applicants for Masters by Research or Ph.D. programs.

application_process.description: It is not necessary to apply for the University of Adelaide Global Academic Excellence Scholarship because this scholarship will be automatically awarded to students who meet the eligibility requirements. No separate Scholarship application form is required. Scholarship recipients will be confirmed at the point of acceptance.A list of eligible students will be provide to faculties for selection of scholarships. Successful applicants will be advised in writing within fourteen days of faculty approval.Satisfactory completion of Year 12 or AISSC/ ISC or GCE Advanced Level Examination for UG admissionsSatisfactory completion of Bachelors degree or its equivalent for PG admissionsStudents must provide test scores of ELP test likeIELTS,TOEFL, PTE or C1 Advanced
application_process.html_content:
It is not necessary to apply for the University of Adelaide Global Academic Excellence Scholarship because this scholarship will be automatically awarded to students who meet the eligibility requirements. No separate Scholarship application form is required. Scholarship recipients will be confirmed at the point of acceptance.

A list of eligible students will be provide to faculties for selection of scholarships. Successful applicants will be advised in writing within fourteen days of faculty approval.

  • Satisfactory completion of Year 12 or AISSC/ ISC or GCE Advanced Level Examination for UG admissions
  • Satisfactory completion of Bachelors degree or its equivalent for PG admissions

Students must provide test scores of ELP test like IELTS, TOEFL, PTE or C1 Advanced

selection_process.description: The selection process for the Global Academic Excellence Scholarship scholarship is competitive. The main criteria for scholarship selection are academic achievement.Students are expected to haveexcellent academic performancein their previous course work. Students are selected based on their scores at high school or undergraduate level.A student must have a score equivalent to that ofATAR 98 and GPA 6.8for UG and PG levels, respectively, in order to increase their chances of getting selected for the scholarship.Applicants who are eligible for more than one scholarship offered by the university will receive only one scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process for the Global Academic Excellence Scholarship scholarship is competitive. The main criteria for scholarship selection are academic achievement.

Students are expected to have excellent academic performance in their previous course work. Students are selected based on their scores at high school or undergraduate level.

A student must have a score equivalent to that of ATAR 98 and GPA 6.8 for UG and PG levels, respectively, in order to increase their chances of getting selected for the scholarship.

Applicants who are eligible for more than one scholarship offered by the university will receive only one scholarship.

grant_details.description: The Global Academic Excellence Scholarshipdoes not coverthe costs of visas, Overseas Student Health Cover, travel, accommodation, living expenses, or any other such costs. It is given to waive off tuition fees only.Only two studentshaving the highest score from each faculty will be awarded the50% reduction of the tuition fee.Meeting the academic eligibility requirements does not guarantee to receive the award. Successful applicants will be notified within two weeks of the scholarship closing date. Selected students mustaccept their award within 14 daysof receiving the scholarship, otherwise, it will be awarded to the next deserving candidate.Students enrolled in UG and PGprograms at the University of Adelaidecan avail of the benefits of scholarship if selected.The scholarship holder must be enrolled in full-time courses and required to maintain good academic standing and progress.The University reserves the right to vary the awards, withdraw or not to offer scholarships under specific conditions. The scholarship holder Students may get a chance toparticipate in a photoshootand complete a testimonial for the University, which may be published on the website.
grant_details.html_content:
The Global Academic Excellence Scholarship does not cover the costs of visas, Overseas Student Health Cover, travel, accommodation, living expenses, or any other such costs. It is given to waive off tuition fees only. Only two students having the highest score from each faculty will be awarded the 50% reduction of the tuition fee.

Meeting the academic eligibility requirements does not guarantee to receive the award. Successful applicants will be notified within two weeks of the scholarship closing date. Selected students must accept their award within 14 days of receiving the scholarship, otherwise, it will be awarded to the next deserving candidate.

Students enrolled in UG and PG programs at the University of Adelaide can avail of the benefits of scholarship if selected. The scholarship holder must be enrolled in full-time courses and required to maintain good academic standing and progress.

The University reserves the right to vary the awards, withdraw or not to offer scholarships under specific conditions. The scholarship holder Students may get a chance to participate in a photoshoot and complete a testimonial for the University, which may be published on the website.

scholarship_name: HKBU Hinrich Foundation scholarship for Masters in International Journalism
description:
The Hinrich Global Trade Leader Program, funded by the philanthropic Hinrich Foundation, awards 150 scholarships to eligible students from 10 Asian Countries to pursue a university degree and kick-start a promising career in specified trade. The Hinrich full tuition fee waiver for MA in International Journalism is awarded to the students of the Hong Kong Baptist University (HKBU).
Through this program, the Hinrich Foundation aims to blend trade knowledge with relevant skills through customized academic programs in partnership with universities and organizations. The scholarship program combines the opportunity to earn a reputable degree in Journalism and also join the Hinrich Foundation for a post-degree work placement in a trade-related communication and export development capacity.

The Benefits of HBKU Hinrich Foundation Scholarships includes,

As mentioned earlier, the most lucrative aspect of the award is the 12-month internship with Hinrich Foundation to develop practical knowledge and skills as well as a 2-year work placement upon graduation.

eligibility_criteria.description: Firstly, to be eligible for the scholarship, students are supposed to takeadmissions at the Hong Kong Baptist University. Candidates are also required to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the Hinrich Foundation to avail the scholarship:Should be either a citizen of Vietnam, Philippines, Indonesia or India.Should have 5+ years of working experience.Must have acquired at least an undergraduate degree in either marketing, business, journalism, social sciences, or any other related field.Should be proficient in English with a valid test score in support of such proficiency. Acceptable English proficiency test scores are:TOEFL (iBT):79IELTS6.5Must showcase strong communication & teamwork skills as well as leadership ability.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Firstly, to be eligible for the scholarship, students are supposed to take admissions at the Hong Kong Baptist University. Candidates are also required to meet the eligibility criteria as defined by the Hinrich Foundation to avail the scholarship:

  • Should be either a citizen of Vietnam, Philippines, Indonesia or India.
  • Should have 5+ years of working experience.
  • Must have acquired at least an undergraduate degree in either marketing, business, journalism, social sciences, or any other related field.
  • Should be proficient in English with a valid test score in support of such proficiency. Acceptable English proficiency test scores are:
    • TOEFL (iBT): 79
    • IELTS 6.5
  • Must showcase strong communication & teamwork skills as well as leadership ability.

application_process.description: Applications for the Hinrich Full Scholarship forMasters of International Journalismprograms at Hong Kong Baptist Universityhas to be submitted through the foundation’s online portal. The application should be supported by the following documentation:Academic transcriptsValid ELP ScoresUpdated Curriculum vitaeCover letterProfessional LORA copy of the PassportA 500-word essay on the topic “How will the Work Integrated Learning approach help you to become an outstanding Global Trade Leader?”Note:You can drop in your queries at careerdevelopment@hinrichfoundation.com.
application_process.html_content:
Applications for the Hinrich Full Scholarship for Masters of International Journalism programs at Hong Kong Baptist University has to be submitted through the foundation’s online portal. The application should be supported by the following documentation:

  • Academic transcripts
  • Valid ELP Scores
  • Updated Curriculum vitae
  • Cover letter
  • Professional LOR
  • A copy of the Passport
  • A 500-word essay on the topic “How will the Work Integrated Learning approach help you to become an outstanding Global Trade Leader?”

Note: You can drop in your queries at careerdevelopment@hinrichfoundation.com.

selection_process.description: Applications should be complete in all respect and should be submitted before the scheduled deadline to be considered for the scholarship program. Candidates who can demonstrate a clear understanding of study objectives and can show a connection between their academic rigor and the intended career through the essay and a compelling cover letter stands better scope of winning the award.Please notethat applicants who,demonstrate an interest in working in Asia after degree completion;exhibit a strong interest in working in trade-related sectors; and,agree to engage with the Hinrich Foundation post completion of the degree for mentorship as well as membership in the foundation’s Alumni Association;are given preference during the selection process of the Hinrich Full Scholarship for MAIJS in HKBU.
selection_process.html_content:
Applications should be complete in all respect and should be submitted before the scheduled deadline to be considered for the scholarship program. Candidates who can demonstrate a clear understanding of study objectives and can show a connection between their academic rigor and the intended career through the essay and a compelling cover letter stands better scope of winning the award.

Please note that applicants who,

  • demonstrate an interest in working in Asia after degree completion;
  • exhibit a strong interest in working in trade-related sectors; and,
  • agree to engage with the Hinrich Foundation post completion of the degree for mentorship as well as membership in the foundation’s Alumni Association;

are given preference during the selection process of the Hinrich Full Scholarship for MAIJS in HKBU.

grant_details.description: The Hinrich Foundation, as a not-for-profit, independent establishment, welcomes individuals to apply for its Global Trade Leader Development Program of which the full scholarship for Masters in International Journalism at HKBU is a part of. Candidates with a keen interest to follow a career path in international journalism with a focus in Asia are promised:Fully sponsored Master of Arts in International Journalism Studies at Hong Kong Baptist University.A career with the Hinrich Foundation in trade-related communication and export development upon graduation.Internship and job placement for skills development in-between study periods.Scholarship TypeMerit-BasedEligibilityInternational students from Vietnam, Philippines, Indonesia or IndiaNumber of Scholarships2Work ExperienceRequiredAward distributionAnnuallyThe Hinrich foundation provides an opportunity for the students who want tostudy in Hong Kongas it removes all the burden of the Cost of attendance from the students. Awardees of the Hinrich Full Scholarship for MAIJS in HKBU can gain invaluable international exposure to build both professional as well as personal networks.
grant_details.html_content:
The Hinrich Foundation, as a not-for-profit, independent establishment, welcomes individuals to apply for its Global Trade Leader Development Program of which the full scholarship for Masters in International Journalism at HKBU is a part of. Candidates with a keen interest to follow a career path in international journalism with a focus in Asia are promised:

  • Fully sponsored Master of Arts in International Journalism Studies at Hong Kong Baptist University.
  • A career with the Hinrich Foundation in trade-related communication and export development upon graduation.
  • Internship and job placement for skills development in-between study periods.
Scholarship Type Merit-Based
