description:
BeArt-Presets Academic Scholarship Program is an initiative taken by BeArt Presets to help the students to achieve their educational goals and reach their full potential. BeArt Presets-Academic Scholarship Program invites applications from all students irrespective of their nationalities who wish to study in a university abroad.

It is a need-based scholarship and is applicable for students applying in all the Universities of the U.S., Canada, Australia, Japan. The applicant must a high school senior, an undergraduate, or a graduate with an acceptance letter from recognized University or College.

Under this scholarship program, only two students are awarded an amount of 2500 USD. The scholarship amount can only be used to pay for tuition fees of the universities. To apply for the scholarship, applicants have to submit an essay about 1000 words. The best essay is selected by the experts in the organization on the basis of the originality and grammar of the essay.

Be Art Presets Academic Scholarship Program helps those students who work hard to earn high scores and dream of education in big Universities but they aren't able to afford it.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for Be Art Presets-Academic Scholarship Program, applicants have to fulfill the eligibility criteria given below.Must be an undergraduate, graduate, or a high school senior.Must have an acceptance letter from the recognizeduniversity or college in the U.K., Australia, Japan, or the U.S.Excellent academic scores which are accredited by the highest relevant academic bodies in the applicant's country.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for Be Art Presets-Academic Scholarship Program, applicants have to fulfill the eligibility criteria given below.

  • Must be an undergraduate, graduate, or a high school senior.
  • Must have an acceptance letter from the recognized university or college in the U.K., Australia, Japan, or the U.S.
  • Excellent academic scores which are accredited by the highest relevant academic bodies in the applicant's country.

application_process.description: To apply for Be Art Presets-Academic Scholarship Program, applicants have to complete the application form available on the official website of BeArt Presets. Along with the Be Art Presets-Academic Scholarship 2020 application, applicants have to write anessay in about 1000 wordson the following topic:How will a BeArt-Presets Academic Scholarship help achieve your education & career goals?The essay should be personal including the applicant’s future career goals and how the scholarship will add value to his/her academic studies. The essay should be grammatically correct and should reflect one's own research and original thinking.The students must also include a link to theirFacebook or Linkedin profileso that the selection committee can confirm their identity and school enrollment.The application deadline for theBeArt-Presets Academic Scholarship is April 01, 2025.Any application which is received after the deadline will not be considered and straightforwardly rejected.
application_process.html_content:
To apply for Be Art Presets-Academic Scholarship Program, applicants have to complete the application form available on the official website of BeArt Presets. Along with the Be Art Presets-Academic Scholarship 2020 application, applicants have to write an essay in about 1000 words on the following topic:

How will a BeArt-Presets Academic Scholarship help achieve your education & career goals?

The essay should be personal including the applicant’s future career goals and how the scholarship will add value to his/her academic studies. The essay should be grammatically correct and should reflect one's own research and original thinking.

The students must also include a link to their Facebook or Linkedin profile so that the selection committee can confirm their identity and school enrollment.

The application deadline for the BeArt-Presets Academic Scholarship is April 01, 2025. Any application which is received after the deadline will not be considered and straightforwardly rejected.

selection_process.description: The process of selection for theBeArt-Presets Academic Scholarshipis carried out by a selection committee of the organization. The evaluation of the profile differs case by case for every student.The selection committee will choose one essay on the basis of content originality, creativity, punctuation and sentence formation.The candidate selected for the scholarship will be announced after two weeks of the given deadline. The amount of the scholarship will be directly transferred to the University’s financial aid office and from there the amount will be transferred to the account of the student.
selection_process.html_content:
The process of selection for the BeArt-Presets Academic Scholarship is carried out by a selection committee of the organization. The evaluation of the profile differs case by case for every student.

The selection committee will choose one essay on the basis of content originality, creativity, punctuation and sentence formation.

The candidate selected for the scholarship will be announced after two weeks of the given deadline. The amount of the scholarship will be directly transferred to the University’s financial aid office and from there the amount will be transferred to the account of the student.

scholarship_name: Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship For Graduate Study in HR
description:
Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship is named in honor of Susan R. Meisinger, chief executive officer and president of SHRM(2002-2008), who believes that HR professionals should get strong and meaningful education with relevant experience in the field of Human Resources.

Eligibility is strictly restricted to a student enrolled in an HR master’s degree program in the university accredited by the government or the body widely known and recognized within that country. Students from more than 239 countries including India are eligible. The fellowship winner is selected annually on merit bases and awarded by 10,000 USD which is renewable for next year, hence the total amount awarded is 20,000 USD.

In its six-year term, the SHRM's membership increased by 29 percent. This fellowship started in 2008 during her retirement. Additional fellowships can be awarded depending upon the quality and quantity of applicants, and funding available. Doctoral students are not eligible including Ph.D.s and DBAs.

Some significant benefits of the Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship for Graduate Study in HR are:

Award Amount 10,000 USD
Award Duration 2 years
Applicable Programs Masters Degree in Human Resources field

Note: The fellowship cannot be used to attend professional development seminars, it is only for college degree programs which can be online, part-time, Full-time programs.

eligibility_criteria.description: Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship is designed foran academically outstanding student, who is enrolled in a Master’s Degree program related to HR like organizational development, MBA, psychology, etc and should have a 50% degree remaining at least. Also, candidates must be SHRM certified or SHRM members.Academic Eligibility for Susan R. Meisinger FellowshipProspective UG and PG applicants for Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship are expected to fulfill the following academic-based requirements:Academics:An excellent academic record with a GPA of more than 3.0 on a scale of 4.0 in the UG program and 3.5 on a scale of 4.0 in the PG program.Degree Requirement:The applicant should not have received any other Master’s degree in an HR-related field.Along with these academic requirements, applicants must fulfill the following requirements:Work Experience:A person should haveat least five yearsof professional experience andthree years of HR experience.University Selection:An applicant may choose anyuniversity to study abroad. However, there are some regulations for the selection of the university.If the university is in the USA, then it needs to be regionally accredited.If it is a university outside of the USA, then it must be accredited by the government’s higher education or any equivalent body.Note:There are no eligibility criteria for this fellowship based on race, sexual orientation, gender, color, religion, ancestry, citizenship or national origin, marital status because of the non-discrimination policy of the SHRM Foundation.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship is designed for an academically outstanding student, who is enrolled in a Master’s Degree program related to HR like organizational development, MBA, psychology, etc and should have a 50% degree remaining at least. Also, candidates must be SHRM certified or SHRM members.

Academic Eligibility for Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship

Prospective UG and PG applicants for Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship are expected to fulfill the following academic-based requirements:

  • Academics: An excellent academic record with a GPA of more than 3.0 on a scale of 4.0 in the UG program and 3.5 on a scale of 4.0 in the PG program.
  • Degree Requirement: The applicant should not have received any other Master’s degree in an HR-related field.

Along with these academic requirements, applicants must fulfill the following requirements:

  • Work Experience: A person should have at least five years of professional experience and three years of HR experience.
  • University Selection: An applicant may choose any university to study abroad. However, there are some regulations for the selection of the university.
    • If the university is in the USA, then it needs to be regionally accredited.
    • If it is a university outside of the USA, then it must be accredited by the government’s higher education or any equivalent body.

Note: There are no eligibility criteria for this fellowship based on race, sexual orientation, gender, color, religion, ancestry, citizenship or national origin, marital status because of the non-discrimination policy of the SHRM Foundation.

application_process.description: Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship 2024, for Graduate Study in HR, invites application each year. As a prospective candidate, you have to complete the online Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship Application and submit it, along with all the documents.Student Supporting DocumentationApplicants must provide the following student supporting documents at the time of Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship application submission:Contact information and details of past work experiences and projected career path.Transcripts of Undergraduate college and Graduate college(if enrolled).The transcripts must be written in English.For transcript evaluation, the SHRM Foundation can request a person from any reputable service like World Education Services.If a student is not currently enrolled in any master’s program then, a copy of the acceptance letter needs to be submitted.Two reference letters highlighting the person’s values, work ethics, characters, and career accomplishments.Must be addressed to the “SHRM Foundation Scholarship Review Committee”.Should be written by professors, colleagues, or coaches.A copy of an updated CV or resumeOne letter of referenceOpensJan 9 2026 12:00 AM (EST)DeadlineMar 31 2026 08:00 PM (EST)
application_process.html_content:
Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship 2024, for Graduate Study in HR, invites application each year. As a prospective candidate, you have to complete the online Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship Application and submit it, along with all the documents.

Student Supporting Documentation

Applicants must provide the following student supporting documents at the time of Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship application submission:

  • Contact information and details of past work experiences and projected career path.
  • Transcripts of Undergraduate college and Graduate college(if enrolled).
    • The transcripts must be written in English.
    • For transcript evaluation, the SHRM Foundation can request a person from any reputable service like World Education Services.
  • If a student is not currently enrolled in any master’s program then, a copy of the acceptance letter needs to be submitted.
  • Two reference letters highlighting the person’s values, work ethics, characters, and career accomplishments.
    • Must be addressed to the “SHRM Foundation Scholarship Review Committee”.
    • Should be written by professors, colleagues, or coaches.
  • A copy of an updated CV or resume
  • One letter of reference

Opens

Jan 9 2026 12:00 AM (EST)

Deadline

Mar 31 2026 08:00 PM (EST)

selection_process.html_content:
The selection depends on various factors, which determine a student's capabilities and achievements. The recipient of the Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship is selected based on factors like,

  • Academic Excellence during an undergraduate degree
  • Leadership Quality
  • Students Achievements
  • Community Service
  • Work experiences
  • Financial requirement
  • potential to become a successful HR leader
  • Career Objective

As a result of the selection process, two students or professionals are awarded annually,

  • one person is an award recipient of the previous year whose fellowship gets renewed for a year and
  • The other is the recipient of that year.

T&C for Renewing Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship

The student must fulfill the given requirements to continue the receipt of the award for the next year, after achieving the year in his first year of Masters study:

  • During the fellowship period, a recipient needs to work in the HR field and continue SHRM membership or HR certification.
  • A candidate is expected to give back to the community by serving as a judge of SHRM scholarships, reviewer of SHRM publication, participation in any research studies or item-writing panel of SHRM Certification.
  •  If selected to receive the Susan R. Meisinger Fellowship, recipients will be required to provide proof of enrollment and college/university payment instructions. The SHRM Foundation will issue a check not to exceed $10,000 directly to the institution for payment of tuition and fees required for enrollment or attendance at the educational institution, or for fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at the educational institution. 

Special Considerations

Each scholarship is a one-time award, renewable for a second year; up to $10,000 total.  Previous applicants may reapply, but past scholarship recipients are ineligible.

  • Full-time, part-time, online, and distance learning programs are acceptable. 
  • Scholarships are for college-degree programs only and may not be used to attend professional development seminars.
  • Recipients should intend on submitting proof of enrollment no later than July for the institution to receive timely payment.

grant_details.description: Along with the award is for a $10,000 fellowship, there are certain expectations:Expectations of FellowsTo accept the fellowship, recipients must commit to working in the HR field for a minimum of one year for every year of funding received. They must maintain their HR certification and/or SHRM membership during the fellowship. They must maintain a 3.5 GPA (on a 4.0 scale) and university enrollment in their original degree program to be eligible for a second year of funding.Fellows who withdraw from their academic program early will be obligated to return any unused funds and will not be eligible for additional award distributions. Fellows who complete their program in good standing are not obligated to pay back the award.After completing their studies, Meisinger Fellows are encouraged to give back to the HR community, for example: by participating in research studies, becoming certified, serving as a reviewer for SHRM and Foundation publications, serving as a judge for SHRM Foundation scholarships or joining an item-writing panel for SHRM Certification.Please note, the SHRM Foundation does not reimburse for any fees or any associated expenses incurred prior to award. SHRM/SHRM Foundation employees or board members and the immediate family are not eligible to apply for SHRM Foundation Scholarships, Grants, or Awards.
grant_details.html_content:
Along with the award is for a $10,000 fellowship, there are certain expectations:

Expectations of Fellows  

To accept the fellowship, recipients must commit to working in the HR field for a minimum of one year for every year of funding received. They must maintain their HR certification and/or SHRM membership during the fellowship. They must maintain a 3.5 GPA (on a 4.0 scale) and university enrollment in their original degree program to be eligible for a second year of funding.

Fellows who withdraw from their academic program early will be obligated to return any unused funds and will not be eligible for additional award distributions. Fellows who complete their program in good standing are not obligated to pay back the award.  

After completing their studies, Meisinger Fellows are encouraged to give back to the HR community, for example: by participating in research studies, becoming certified, serving as a reviewer for SHRM and Foundation publications, serving as a judge for SHRM Foundation scholarships or joining an item-writing panel for SHRM Certification. 

Please note, the SHRM Foundation does not reimburse for any fees or any associated expenses incurred prior to award. SHRM/SHRM Foundation employees or board members and the immediate family are not eligible to apply for SHRM Foundation Scholarships, Grants, or Awards.

description:
To recognize and reward its incoming undergraduate students, the U of T has designed the University of Toronto Scholars Program. Annually, 900 domestic and international students, who secure admission at the UToronto, are rewarded value of $10,000.

The payment of the scholarship is done conditionally on full-time registration during September at the university. This program is valid for the span of one year and is therefore non-renewable.

eligibility_criteria.description: As mentioned earlier, the University of Toronto Scholars Program applies to both domestic and international students.To be considered for the award, applicants must fulfill the following eligibility requirements:Outstanding and consistent academic records at the secondary school level.Enrolling for a full-timeundergraduate study programApplying through the direct entry for the first year of undergraduate studies.While it is not directly related to the University of Toronto Scholars Program eligibility requirements, international applicants are advised to obtain theirstudent visa to study in Canada, at the earliest.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
As mentioned earlier, the University of Toronto Scholars Program applies to both domestic and international students.

To be considered for the award, applicants must fulfill the following eligibility requirements:

  • Outstanding and consistent academic records at the secondary school level.
  • Enrolling for a full-time undergraduate study program
  • Applying through the direct entry for the first year of undergraduate studies.

While it is not directly related to the University of Toronto Scholars Program eligibility requirements, international applicants are advised to obtain their student visa to study in Canada, at the earliest.

application_process.description: Candidates are considered for this scholarship automatically based on their academic performance at the time of admission.This auto-consideration process for the entrance-based scholarships is common across all the awards at the University of Toronto.Student Supporting DocumentationWhile the applicants are evaluated based on their admission applications, there are a few supporting documents that are significant for both admission and scholarship.High School transcriptsEnglish language proficientIELTS: 7.0TOEFL: 93Reference and SOPScores of standardizedexams to study in Canada
application_process.html_content:
Candidates are considered for this scholarship automatically based on their academic performance at the time of admission.

This auto-consideration process for the entrance-based scholarships is common across all the awards at the University of Toronto. 

Student Supporting Documentation

While the applicants are evaluated based on their admission applications, there are a few supporting documents that are significant for both admission and scholarship. 

  • High School transcripts
  • English language proficient
    • IELTS: 7.0
    • TOEFL: 93
  • Reference and SOP
  • Scores of standardized exams to study in Canada

selection_process.description: Selections of the University of Toronto Scholars Programs are similar to any other merit-based admission scholarship at the university. Applicants are shortlisted and selected based on theiracademic scores.The university selects candidates based on interim marks and it is typically conditional depending upon achieving acceptable final standing.Recipients must remember that thepayment of the awardamount is conditional on full-time registration inSeptember.
selection_process.html_content:
Selections of the University of Toronto Scholars Programs are similar to any other merit-based admission scholarship at the university. Applicants are shortlisted and selected based on their academic scores. 

The university selects candidates based on interim marks and it is typically conditional depending upon achieving acceptable final standing. 

Recipients must remember that the payment of the award amount is conditional on full-time registration in September.

grant_details.description: The University of Toronto, one of thetop-ranking universities in Canada, is the first preference for the majority of international students. Every year, the university enrolls several international students in various undergraduate programs. In addition to that, it offers several entrance awards, one of them being the University of Toronto Scholars Program.The details of the University of Toronto Scholars Program have been tabulated below:Number of Scholarships900Eligible ApplicantsNew Domestic and International StudentsApplicable ProgramsAll UToronto Undergraduate ProgramsScholarship Reward10,000 EachPayment DetailsSeptember, at time of university registrationProspective students of the University of Toronto, with exceptional academic records, must seek financial aid through this award. Apart from that, the applicants can apply for other scholarships offered by the university such as theLester B. Pearson Scholarship Program.
grant_details.html_content:
The University of Toronto, one of the top-ranking universities in Canada, is the first preference for the majority of international students. Every year, the university enrolls several international students in various undergraduate programs. In addition to that, it offers several entrance awards, one of them being the University of Toronto Scholars Program. 

The details of the University of Toronto Scholars Program have been tabulated below:

Number of Scholarships 900
Eligible Applicants New Domestic and International Students
Applicable Programs All UToronto Undergraduate Programs
Scholarship Reward 10,000 Each
Payment Details September, at time of university registration

Prospective students of the University of Toronto, with exceptional academic records, must seek financial aid through this award. Apart from that, the applicants can apply for other scholarships offered by the university such as the Lester B. Pearson Scholarship Program.

description:
Initiated in the year 1954 by late Dr. Theodore Van Karman, the Josephine De Karman Fellowship was a step taken forward by Van Karman for students who reflect his ideologies and equal interests.

The Josephine de Karman Fellowship was established to help students with high scholastic aptitude and overall achievements.

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for the Josephine De Karman Fellowship , the candidates mustBe international studentsstudying in the U.S.on a student visa.Be currently enrolled in a Ph.D. degree at any university in the U.S.Applicants studying in one of the following universities will be considered for scholarship:California Institute of TechnologyStanford UniversityUniversity of California (all campuses)University of Southern CaliforniaApplications are due 11:59 PM Pacific Time, January 30, 2025. Late applications will not be considered. Announcement of 2025-2026 award recipients will be made in May, 2025.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for the Josephine De Karman Fellowship , the candidates must

  • Be international students studying in the U.S. on a student visa.
  • Be currently enrolled in a Ph.D. degree at any university in the U.S.
  • Applicants studying in one of the following universities will be considered for scholarship:
    • California Institute of Technology
    • Stanford University
    • University of California (all campuses)
    • University of Southern California
  • Applications are due 11:59 PM Pacific Time, January 30, 2025. Late applications will not be considered. Announcement of 2025-2026 award recipients will be made in May, 2025.

application_process.description: Applications for the Josephine de Karman Fellowship is an online process.Application PackageType of DocumentRequired (Yes or No)TranscriptsYesLORYesSOP/EssayYesResumeYesLetter of Recommendation(s):Each applicant must submit at least two LORs.Essay:500-word essay statement of intellectual interest.

• Applications for the Josephine de Karman Fellowship is an online process.

Application Package

LOR Yes

  • Letter of Recommendation(s): Each applicant must submit at least two LORs.
  • Essay: 500-word essay statement of intellectual interest.

Candidates for the De Karman Fellowship are shortlisted on the basis of their scholarship forms and dissertation completion.

Factors Affecting the Scholarship Selection Decision

  • Personal Essay
  • Extra-curricular activities
  • Recommendations
  • Academic performance
  • Scholarly Contributions

Announcement of 2025-2026 award recipients will be made in May, 2025.The De Karman Fellowship is only for students pursuing a Ph.D.UG, PG, or doctorate students are ineligible.Every year, 8 fellowships of 25,000 USD are distributed to the selected students.Selection is based on an essay of 500 words.To make a mark and get through the application process, applicants should have outstanding letters of recommendation, along with timely completion of their dissertation at the time of the application.The candidates should also possess a great history of scholarly contributions along with co-curricular activities. grant_details.html_content:
Applications are due 11:59 PM Pacific Time, January 30, 2025. Late applications will not be considered. Announcement of 2025-2026 award recipients will be made in May, 2025.

  • The De Karman Fellowship is only for students pursuing a Ph.D.
    • UG, PG, or doctorate students are ineligible.
  • Every year, 8 fellowships of 25,000 USD are distributed to the selected students.
  • Selection is based on an essay of 500 words.

To make a mark and get through the application process, applicants should have outstanding letters of recommendation, along with timely completion of their dissertation at the time of the application.

The candidates should also possess a great history of scholarly contributions along with co-curricular activities. It is also seen that the fellowships are usually won by candidates studying in the top tier schools of the country.

scholarship_name: Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship
description:
The Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship is offered by PCB Solutions in memory of its former employee, Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom, who died in 2014. The award was started by her husband, Greg Engstrom.

Students pursuing UG and PG programs at recognized U.S Universities are eligible to apply. To apply for the scholarship, applicants have to submit an essay on the topic given by PCB solutions.

PCB values higher education and has a strong desire to give back to students, in hopes of furthering their concentration on the manufacturing/engineering fields.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students coming from a diverse background irrespective of their nationalities who wish tostudy abroadare eligible to apply.To obtain Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship, applicants must meet Eligibility Criteria listed below :An applicant pursuing a full-time UG or PG program at Universities of the U.S.Must have to maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5.No age requirement for the scholarship.Eligible Student NationalityStudents from counties like U.S.Canada, Australia, India, Japan, France, etc pursuing education in the accredited U.S.universities are eligible.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students coming from a diverse background irrespective of their nationalities who wish to study abroad are eligible to apply.

To obtain Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship, applicants must meet Eligibility Criteria listed below :

  • An applicant pursuing a full-time UG or PG program at Universities of the U.S.
  • Must have to maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5.
  • No age requirement for the scholarship.

Eligible Student Nationality

Students from counties like U.S.Canada, Australia, India, Japan, France, etc pursuing education in the accredited U.S.universities are eligible.

application_process.description: To secure the Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship, applicants have to submit an essay.List of DocumentsRequired or NotEssayRequiredAn original essay must be written on the topic ‘Discuss your vision of Electronic Design, Engineering and Manufacturing in the Global Economy.’It should describe in detail the experience in manufacturing, logistics, electrical or mechanical engineering or any business ideas that would be helpful for their vision.The bestessays are often treated as a reference for publications.It should bring entrepreneurial ideas about successful business and starting their own business, proving in detail how the management guidelines will be beneficial for their companies.The topic is broad and can include different aspects like healthcare, business, science, engineering, etc.Applicants also need toinclude a short bio video or a short written document.Students are encouraged to discuss why education is important to them and what they will do with the scholarship if rewarded.Scholarship ApplicationApplicant have to mail the essay via word doc or pdf tocameron@pcb-solutions.comAlong with the essay, applicants have to attach the Content Contribution Agreement along with their contact, major, graduation date.
application_process.html_content:
To secure the Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship, applicants have to submit an essay.

List of Documents  Required or Not 
Essay  Required 
  • An original essay must be written on the topic ‘Discuss your vision of Electronic Design, Engineering and Manufacturing in the Global Economy.’
    • It should describe in detail the experience in manufacturing, logistics, electrical or mechanical engineering or any business ideas that would be helpful for their vision.
    • The best essays are often treated as a reference for publications.
    • It should bring entrepreneurial ideas about successful business and starting their own business, proving in detail how the management guidelines will be beneficial for their companies.
    • The topic is broad and can include different aspects like healthcare, business, science, engineering, etc.
  • Applicants also need to include a short bio video or a short written document.
    • Students are encouraged to discuss why education is important to them and what they will do with the scholarship if rewarded.

Scholarship Application

  • Applicant have to mail the essay via word doc or pdf to cameron@pcb-solutions.com
  • Along with the essay, applicants have to attach the Content Contribution Agreement along with their contact, major, graduation date.

selection_process.description: The students having a cumulative GPA lower than 2.5 will be automatically dropped from the selection process.Essays will be reviewed by the Scholarship Committee of PCB Solutions. It may take at least 15 days for the selection process to be completed.The recipient of the Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship will be notified via email.Once awarded, a check will be deposited to the recipient’s enrolled university and credited for academic costs.
selection_process.html_content:
The students having a cumulative GPA lower than 2.5 will be automatically dropped from the selection process.

Essays will be reviewed by the Scholarship Committee of PCB Solutions. It may take at least 15 days for the selection process to be completed.

The recipient of the Chuan Ai Lu Engstrom Memorial Scholarship will be notified via email.

Once awarded, a check will be deposited to the recipient’s enrolled university and credited for academic costs.

description:
Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business, at University of Calgary, is a merit-based scholarship program for the students of Haskayne School of Business. The scholarship program aims to provide financial assistance to Haskayne’s current undergraduate students.

The Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business only covers tuition fees and not the recipients living expenses in Canada. Therefore, the amount will be automatically deducted from the recipient’s tuition fee-paying account.

eligibility_criteria.description: Buchanan Family Scholarship is designed for academically excellent students, who are entering their 2nd, 3rd or 4th year ofUG studies in Business at the University of Calgary. The complete eligibility requirements for the Buchanan Scholarship in Business 2024:Student Type:UG student pursuing Business program(s)Citizenship/Residency:Any; no special restrictionsAcademics:Completion of at least 24 units of academic courseworkGPA Requirement:Minimum GPA of 3.20 is mandatory
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Buchanan Family Scholarship is designed for academically excellent students, who are entering their 2nd, 3rd or 4th year of UG studies in Business at the University of Calgary. The complete eligibility requirements for the Buchanan Scholarship in Business 2024:

  • Student Type: UG student pursuing Business program(s)
  • Citizenship/Residency: Any; no special restrictions
  • Academics: Completion of at least 24 units of academic coursework
  • GPA Requirement: Minimum GPA of 3.20 is mandatory

application_process.description: The applicants of the Buchanan Family Scholarship 2024 mustapply through the MyUofC portalof the University of Calgary. This scholarship requires a separate external application which is only accepted through an online process.As a prospective candidate, you need to complete the online Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business Application and submit it, along with all the documents.How to Apply for Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business 2026?The step-by-step procedure for the Buchanan Scholarship in Business 2026 is given below:Step I:Create your ID and sign onto your MyUofC portal of the University of Calgary Official website using the same.Step II:Fill in the application form available at the portal.Step III:Complete all the details of the online scholarship application.Step IV:Send in the required student supporting documents, along with the application, and submit it.
application_process.html_content:
The applicants of the Buchanan Family Scholarship 2024 must apply through the MyUofC portal of the University of Calgary. This scholarship requires a separate external application which is only accepted through an online process.

As a prospective candidate, you need to complete the online Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business Application and submit it, along with all the documents.

How to Apply for Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business 2026?

The step-by-step procedure for the Buchanan Scholarship in Business 2026 is given below:

Step I: Create your ID and sign onto your MyUofC portal of the University of Calgary Official website using the same.
Step II: Fill in the application form available at the portal.
Step III: Complete all the details of the online scholarship application.
Step IV: Send in the required student supporting documents, along with the application, and submit it.

selection_process.description: After the submission of the application for the Buchanan Family Scholarship, candidates will be shortlisted by a panel of selectors at the University of Calgary. The recipient of the Buchanan Family Scholarship 2026 will be selected based on factors like,Academic ExcellencePast Achievements & ExperienceFinancial NeedRecipients of the Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business are then notified by email.
selection_process.html_content:
After the submission of the application for the Buchanan Family Scholarship, candidates will be shortlisted by a panel of selectors at the University of Calgary. The recipient of the Buchanan Family Scholarship 2026 will be selected based on factors like,

  • Academic Excellence
  • Past Achievements & Experience
  • Financial Need

Recipients of the Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business are then notified by email.

grant_details.description: Buchanan Scholarship is an internal award as it is offered by the university itself. Recipients for the scholarship program have to complete and submit the online application form before the deadline.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Buchanan Scholarship program available at the University of Calgary:Study-LevelUndergraduateNumber of Scholarship1Study-Length4 yearsScholarship Award3000 CADAward Distributedone-timeTerms and Conditions of Buchanan Family Scholarship in BusinessThere are no significant terms and conditions of the Buchanan Scholarship in Business, but the students are advised to keep in mind the following before applying for the scholarship:The student should be entering their 2nd, 3rd or 4th year of undergraduate studiesOnly one student is awarded each year, so it is very competitiveThe scholarship amount can be used for tuition & fees and other expenses.In case of any query, students may contact the university:Email:ucawards@ucalgary.caContact number:1.403.210.7625
grant_details.html_content:
Buchanan Scholarship is an internal award as it is offered by the university itself. Recipients for the scholarship program have to complete and submit the online application form before the deadline.

The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Buchanan Scholarship program available at the University of Calgary:

Study-Level Undergraduate
Number of Scholarship 1
Study-Length 4 years
Scholarship Award 3000 CAD
Award Distributed one-time

Terms and Conditions of Buchanan Family Scholarship in Business

There are no significant terms and conditions of the Buchanan Scholarship in Business, but the students are advised to keep in mind the following before applying for the scholarship:

  • The student should be entering their 2nd, 3rd or 4th year of undergraduate studies
  • Only one student is awarded each year, so it is very competitive
  • The scholarship amount can be used for tuition & fees and other expenses.

In case of any query, students may contact the university:

Email: ucawards@ucalgary.ca

Contact number: 1.403.210.7625

scholarship_name: Alan Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical & Mechatronics Engineering
description:
The Alun Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical and Mechatronics is funded by Dr. Alan Pluntree. It is offered to graduate students at the University of Waterloo. The scholarship applies to students pursuing Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering and registered in the faculty of engineering.

The student who has scholastic excellence in Fluid Mechanics and interested in its research-based application will be considered.

To be eligible, students must hold the Ontario Graduate Scholarship or Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship in Science and Technology.

The scholarship is applicable for a Master’s Degree.

The scholarship is applicable for the following courses at the University of Waterloo in Canada.

The amount offered to the recipient of the scholarship is 5,000 USD.

The scholarship is awarded annually.

The table below highlights the type of expense student has to incur to study at the University of Waterloo and whether or not it is covered under the benefits of the Alan Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical & Mechatronics Engineering:

Type of expense  Covered or not 
Tuition fee  Yes 
Accommodation  No
Books and supplies  No
International Fare  No
Monthly Stipend  No

The scholarship is given to only one student.

Award Value for Alun Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical and Mechatronics

The award value will be decided upon income generated through funds. The total value is 20,000 USD.

However, if the university fails to find a match or the funding required, the scholarship will be given out as a normal graduate scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: To secure the scholarship, applicants must meet the eligibility criteria listed below:Must be pursuing graduation in Mechanical and Mechatronics EngineeringMust be registered in the faculty of engineeringMust bear academic excellence (minimum 80% )Must have an interest in research in Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering and its application.Must also holdOntario Graduate Scholarship(OGS) or a Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship in Science and Technology (QEII GSST)Eligible Student NationalityStudents from countries like India, the USA, the UK, New Zealand, Australia, Canada, Bangladesh Canada, Germany, Malaysia, etc,admitted at the University of Waterlooare eligible.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To secure the scholarship, applicants must meet the eligibility criteria listed below:

  • Must be pursuing graduation in Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
    • Must be registered in the faculty of engineering
  • Must bear academic excellence (minimum 80% )
    • Must have an interest in research in Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering and its application.
  • Must also hold Ontario Graduate Scholarship (OGS) or a Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship in Science and Technology (QEII GSST)

Eligible Student Nationality

Students from countries like India, the USA, the UK, New Zealand, Australia, Canada, Bangladesh Canada, Germany, Malaysia, etc, admitted at the University of Waterloo are eligible.

application_process.description: There is no separate application process specified by the university for the scholarship. The student will be selected on a merit basis.Scholarship ApplicationNo separate application form needed for the Alan Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical and Mechatronics.Student DocumentationNo specific documents required to submit by the students at the university.Important Dates Regarding the Scholarship:Application DateApplication DeadlineAdditional InformationNot AvailableNot AvailableThe application will be considered by the Faculty of Engineering.
application_process.html_content:
There is no separate application process specified by the university for the scholarship. The student will be selected on a merit basis.

Scholarship Application

No separate application form needed for the Alan Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical and Mechatronics.

Student Documentation

No specific documents required to submit by the students at the university.

Important Dates Regarding the Scholarship:

Application Date Application Deadline Additional Information
Not Available Not Available The application will be considered by the Faculty of Engineering.

selection_process.description: TheAlan Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical and Mechatronicsis offered to the student based on academic excellence.Therefore, the students who are considered need to meet eligibility criteria specified by the University.Must be a graduate pursuing Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering at the University of Waterloo.Must have academic score of more than 80%.If an applicant meets the criteria mentioned above, the university will automatically select one student whom they find deserving for the award.
selection_process.html_content:
The Alan Plumtree Graduate Scholarship in Mechanical and Mechatronics is offered to the student based on academic excellence.

Therefore, the students who are considered need to meet eligibility criteria specified by the University.

  • Must be a graduate pursuing Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering at the University of Waterloo.
  • Must have academic score of more than 80%. 

If an applicant meets the criteria mentioned above, the university will automatically select one student whom they find deserving for the award.

eligibility_criteria.description: The university has specified a few basic requirements for the aspirants of Cass Business School International Scholarship. Only those who fulfill the eligibility criteria given below will be considered for the scholarship program:Be a student expecting to pay Overseas fees; andBe in your first year of undergraduate study in 2025/26; and Starting in year 1 of your degree at Bayes Business School of City, University of London, from September 2024Be expected to achieve academic grades that exceed the conditions of your offer and the advertised academic criteriaMake City your Firm choice, either as Conditional Firm (CF) or Unconditional Firm (UF).
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The university has specified a few basic requirements for the aspirants of Cass Business School International Scholarship. Only those who fulfill the eligibility criteria given below will be considered for the scholarship program:

  • Be a student expecting to pay Overseas fees; and
  • Be in your first year of undergraduate study in 2025/26; and Starting in year 1 of your degree at Bayes Business School of City, University of London, from September 2024
  • Be expected to achieve academic grades that exceed the conditions of your offer and the advertised academic criteria
  • Make City your Firm choice, either as Conditional Firm (CF) or Unconditional Firm (UF).

application_process.description: All International applicants who submitted an application by 29stJanuary 2026 (and have not been made unsuccessful) will be contacted with details of how to apply for the scholarship. Applicants who applied after the UCAS deadline of 29stJanuary 2026 must contact our Admissions team atbayesug@city.ac.ukif they are interested in applying for the scholarship, and will be sent a scholarship application via email.Applicants will have untilThursday 29thAugust 2025to submit an application for the scholarship. Applications received after this date will not be considered.Applications will only be considered if an applicant selects City as their ‘firm’ choice and are due to enrol with us in September 2025.
application_process.html_content:
• All International applicants who submitted an application by 29st  January 2026 (and have not been made unsuccessful) will be contacted with details of how to apply for the scholarship. Applicants who applied after the UCAS deadline of 29st January 2026 must contact our Admissions team at bayesug@city.ac.uk if they are interested in applying for the scholarship, and will be sent a scholarship application via email.
  • Applicants will have until Thursday 29th August 2025 to submit an application for the scholarship. Applications received after this date will not be considered.
  • Applications will only be considered if an applicant selects City as their ‘firm’ choice and are due to enrol with us in September 2025.

selection_process.description: All International applicants who submitted an application by 31stJanuary 2024 (and have not been made unsuccessful) will be contacted with details of how to apply for the scholarship.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Applicants who appliedafter the UCAS deadline of 25thJanuary 2024must contact our Admissions team atbayesug@city.ac.ukif they are interested in applying for the scholarship, and will be sent a scholarship application via email.Applicants will have untilThursday 31stAugust 2024to submit an application for the scholarship. Applications received after this date will not be considered.Applications will only be considered if an applicant selects City as their ‘firm’ choice and are due to enrol with us in September 2024.Applicants must have completed registration in full. The deadline for 2024 registration will be 21 days after the first day of term (Welcome Week). This is expected to be 16th October 2024.Students who have met the above requirements will receive written confirmation as to whether they have been awarded the scholarship by Thursday 30th November 2024.Successful recipients of the scholarship will receive the amount of £5,500 (25% of the tuition fee of £22,000 for first year students commencing their studies in 2024) as a discount to their year 1 tuition fee and the amount will be subtracted from their January 2025 tuition fee instalment.
selection_process.html_content:
• All International applicants who submitted an application by 31st  January 2024 (and have not been made unsuccessful) will be contacted with details of how to apply for the scholarship.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Applicants who applied after the UCAS deadline of 25th January 2024 must contact our Admissions team at bayesug@city.ac.uk if they are interested in applying for the scholarship, and will be sent a scholarship application via email.
  • Applicants will have until Thursday 31st August 2024 to submit an application for the scholarship. Applications received after this date will not be considered.
  • Applications will only be considered if an applicant selects City as their ‘firm’ choice and are due to enrol with us in September 2024.
  • Applicants must have completed registration in full. The deadline for 2024 registration will be 21 days after the first day of term (Welcome Week). This is expected to be 16th October 2024.
  • Students who have met the above requirements will receive written confirmation as to whether they have been awarded the scholarship by Thursday 30th November 2024.
  • Successful recipients of the scholarship will receive the amount of £5,500 (25% of the tuition fee of £22,000 for first year students commencing their studies in 2024) as a discount to their year 1 tuition fee and the amount will be subtracted from their January 2025 tuition fee instalment.

description: Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship is offered to students who have completed the first year of their UG degree in computer science at the University of Waterloo. It is a renewable scholarship, i.e. it is applicable for students entering the 2nd, 3rd or 4th year of bachelor’s program.

eligibility_criteria.description: The Cecil and Edna Cotton scholarship provides a chance for students of Waterloo to continue their UG studies. Prospective applicants must fulfill the following requirements:Citizenship:Permanent resident/ Canadian citizen/International studentCompletion of the first year ofUG studies at the University of Waterloo.Enrolled in the regular or co-op computer science program
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Cecil and Edna Cotton scholarship provides a chance for students of Waterloo to continue their UG studies. Prospective applicants must fulfill the following requirements:

  • Citizenship: Permanent resident/ Canadian citizen/International student
  • Completion of the first year of UG studies at the University of Waterloo.
  • Enrolled in the regular or co-op computer science program

application_process.description: The University of Waterloo does not require applicants to submit any external form for Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship.All students who are studying in their second year of regular or co-op computer science program, at theUniversity of Waterloo, are considered for the scholarship.
application_process.html_content:
The University of Waterloo does not require applicants to submit any external form for Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship.

All students who are studying in their second year of regular or co-op computer science program, at the University of Waterloo, are considered for the scholarship.

selection_process.description: Selection for the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship is done on a merit basis. Upon completion of the first year at the University of Waterloo, students are automatically considered for the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship.A selection committee will review the student’s past academic profile, any significant achievements including marks scored in the first year.After all consideration, one student is chosen to receive the scholarship award.
selection_process.html_content:
Selection for the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship is done on a merit basis. Upon completion of the first year at the University of Waterloo, students are automatically considered for the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship.

A selection committee will review the student’s past academic profile, any significant achievements including marks scored in the first year.

After all consideration, one student is chosen to receive the scholarship award.

grant_details.description: As per U.S. News Rankings, the University of Waterloo is the second-best university tostudy in Canadafor its computer science programs.To encourage students, the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship is awarded to regular and co-op computer science students at the undergraduate level. It is available to both domestic and international students who fulfill the eligibility criteria.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship at the University of Waterloo.Study-LevelUndergraduateEligible CandidatesDomestic and international students enrolled in ug programNumber of Scholarship1Study-Length4 yearsScholarship Award2500 CADAward DistributedAnnuallyInternational students who wish to pursuehigher education in Canadaat the University of Waterloo may visit its official website for more information.
grant_details.html_content:
As per U.S. News Rankings, the University of Waterloo is the second-best university to study in Canada for its computer science programs.

To encourage students, the Cecil and Edna Cotton Scholarship is awarded to regular and co-op computer science students at the undergraduate level. It is available to both domestic and international students who fulfill the eligibility criteria.
