description: Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador (MLSA) program is a global initiative for students passionate about technology and community impact. Every year, over 4,000 students from 100+ countries join the program. Open to all currently enrolled students, the program offers tiered recognition, namely, New, Alpha, Beta, and Gold, based on contribution and engagement. Ambassadors gain access to Microsoft training, mentorship, Azure credits, event support, and networking with global tech leaders. There is no experience requirement, making it an inclusive platform to build technical and leadership skills.

eligibility_criteria.description: To qualify for the Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador program, Indian applicants must meet the following conditions:Minimum Age:Must be at least 16 years old at the time of application.Enrollment Status:Must be a full-time student at an accredited college or university.Individual Requirement:Must apply as an individual, not on behalf of an organization or company.Employment Restriction:Must not be a current Microsoft employee or contractor.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To qualify for the Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador program, Indian applicants must meet the following conditions:

  • Minimum Age: Must be at least 16 years old at the time of application.
  • Enrollment Status: Must be a full-time student at an accredited college or university.
  • Individual Requirement: Must apply as an individual, not on behalf of an organization or company.
  • Employment Restriction: Must not be a current Microsoft employee or contractor.

application_process.description: You will need the following supporting documents to apply to the program:A clear photo of yourschool IDshowing current enrollment dateA copy of yourclass scheduleYour most recentacademic transcriptAn officialenrollment or affiliation verification letterfrom your institution.
application_process.html_content:
You will need the following supporting documents to apply to the program:

  • A clear photo of your school ID showing current enrollment date
  • A copy of your class schedule
  • Your most recent academic transcript
  • An official enrollment or affiliation verification letter from your institution.

grant_details.description: Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador program provides a wide range of practical and career-focused benefits:Azure Credits:$150 worth of monthly Azure credits to build and deploy projects.Software Access:Free Visual Studio Enterprise, Microsoft 365, Snagit, and Camtasia.Professional Development:Free LinkedIn Learning access, Microsoft certification exam vouchers, and mentorship from Microsoft professionals.Event Support:Resources and guidance to host workshops, hackathons, and tech talks.Recognition & Networking:Digital milestone badges, free domain for project portfolios, and networking opportunities with Cloud Advocates and MVPs.
grant_details.html_content:
Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador program provides a wide range of practical and career-focused benefits:

  • Azure Credits: $150 worth of monthly Azure credits to build and deploy projects.
  • Software Access: Free Visual Studio Enterprise, Microsoft 365, Snagit, and Camtasia.
  • Professional Development: Free LinkedIn Learning access, Microsoft certification exam vouchers, and mentorship from Microsoft professionals.
  • Event Support: Resources and guidance to host workshops, hackathons, and tech talks.
  • Recognition & Networking: Digital milestone badges, free domain for project portfolios, and networking opportunities with Cloud Advocates and MVPs.

description:
Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship is exclusively designed for students who are enrolled in B.Com (Hons) majoring in Accounts and finance at Monash University. Domestic and international students with an Australian student visa are eligible.

The aim of the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship is to reduce the burden of educational expenses on students who are academically very capable in their field.

eligibility_criteria.description: Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship offers the chance to international students who wish to pursuehigher education in Canadaat Monash University. Students must meet certain eligibility requirements listed below:Both domestic and international students can apply.Must be commencing full-time majoring in the Monash campus of AustraliaB.Com Hons in Accounting and Finance.Must also maintain Weighted Average Mark (WAM) of 70% and above.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship offers the chance to international students who wish to pursue higher education in Canada at Monash University. Students must meet certain eligibility requirements listed below:

  • Both domestic and international students can apply.
  • Must be commencing full-time majoring in the Monash campus of Australia
    • B.Com Hons in Accounting and Finance.
  • Must also maintain Weighted Average Mark (WAM) of 70% and above.

application_process.description: Students who want to secure the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship must also meetadmission requirements at Monash University.All students of the Monash University who are currently pursuing B.COM Honors in Accounting and Finance are automatically assessed by the University.The scholarship cannot be deferred and is automatically applied to the student’s educational purposes.
application_process.html_content:
Students who want to secure the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship must also meet admission requirements at Monash University.

All students of the Monash University who are currently pursuing B.COM Honors in Accounting and Finance are automatically assessed by the University.

The scholarship cannot be deferred and is automatically applied to the student’s educational purposes.

selection_process.description: Only those applicants who have a Weighted Average Marks of 70% and above in their previous semesters are considered for Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship.The applicants are evaluated based on academic achievement in accounting or finance during the final two years of their degree.The selection committee also takes into account the significant awards received due to academic excellence in their fields.The final decision is taken by a selection panel where each student is judged on the basis of aptitude, conduct, knowledge, and other criteria.
selection_process.html_content:
Only those applicants who have a Weighted Average Marks of 70% and above in their previous semesters are considered for Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship.

  • The applicants are evaluated based on academic achievement in accounting or finance during the final two years of their degree.
  • The selection committee also takes into account the significant awards received due to academic excellence in their fields.

The final decision is taken by a selection panel where each student is judged on the basis of aptitude, conduct, knowledge, and other criteria.

grant_details.description: Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship offered a grant of6000 AUDto the students ofMonash University. It applies to all students pursuing their B.Com Honors majoring in Accounting and Finance.Students are automatically considered, however, the selection is done on merit basis.This one-time scholarship is non-renewable.It is given on the basis of the academic performance of the students in their two final years of UG study.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship:Study LevelundergraduateEligible CandidatesStudents enrolled in a UG degree in Accounts and finance at Monash University.Number of ScholarshipVariesStudy-Length1 yearScholarship Award6000 AUDRecipients must maintain WAM of 70% or above to retain the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship.For any information related to the admission process, programs offered or selection criteria at Monash University, students can check its official website.
grant_details.html_content:
Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship offered a grant of 6000 AUD to the students of Monash University. It applies to all students pursuing their B.Com Honors majoring in Accounting and Finance.

  • Students are automatically considered, however, the selection is done on merit basis.
  • This one-time scholarship is non-renewable.
  • It is given on the basis of the academic performance of the students in their two final years of UG study.

The table below provides all the significant details regarding the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship:

Study Level  undergraduate
Eligible Candidates Students enrolled in a UG degree in Accounts and finance at Monash University.
Number of Scholarship Varies 
Study-Length 1 year
Scholarship Award 6000 AUD 

Recipients must maintain WAM of 70% or above to retain the Monash Accounting Honors Scholarship.

For any information related to the admission process, programs offered or selection criteria at Monash University, students can check its official website.

description: The Calgary Board of Governors Bursary is the financial aid provided to UG students enrolled in the University of Calgary. Students entering the 2nd, 3rd or 4th year of their UG program at the University of Calgary are eligible for the scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.description: In order to be eligible for Calgary Board of Governors Bursary at theUniversity of Calgary, students are required to fulfill the eligibility criteria mentioned below :Citizenship:Permanent resident/ Canadian citizen/International studentStudents are required to demonstrate financial needs and outstanding academic merit.Must be pursuing a UG degree in any field, but only students in the second, third or fourth year of study are eligible to receive the award.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to be eligible for Calgary Board of Governors Bursary at the University of Calgary, students are required to fulfill the eligibility criteria mentioned below :

  • Citizenship: Permanent resident/ Canadian citizen/International student
  • Students are required to demonstrate financial needs and outstanding academic merit.
  • Must be pursuing a UG degree in any field, but only students in the second, third or fourth year of study are eligible to receive the award.

application_process.description: Studentsadmitted at the University of Calgaryand entering in 2nd,3rd or 4th year of UG study are eligible for the scholarship.Students who wish to secure the Board of Governors Bursary have to apply online for the scholarship.How to Apply for the Scholarship?The step-by-step process to apply for the scholarship is mentioned below.Step I: Access Student Centre in myUofC portal available at the University of Calgary Official website.Step II:In the Student Centre section, click on the "My Financials" page.Step III:Click on the Awards & Scholarships section, and click on "Apply for Undergraduate Awards".Step IV:A pop-up window will open on the screen with a number of applications for the different scholarships. Choose the Board of Governors Bursary application.Step V:Complete all the details of the online scholarship application.Step VI:Send in the required student supporting documents, along with the application and submit it.Applicants Deadline for 2026 is currently not available.Additional queries or clarifications may be addressed to the following e-mail addressucawards@ucalgary.ca
application_process.html_content:
Students admitted at the University of Calgary and entering in 2nd,3rd or 4th year of UG study are eligible for the scholarship.

Students who wish to secure the Board of Governors Bursary have to apply online for the scholarship.

How to Apply for the Scholarship?

The step-by-step process to apply for the scholarship is mentioned below.

Step I: Access Student Centre in myUofC portal available at the University of Calgary Official website.

Step II: In the Student Centre section, click on the "My Financials" page.

Step III: Click on the Awards & Scholarships section, and click on "Apply for Undergraduate Awards".

Step IV: A pop-up window will open on the screen with a number of applications for the different scholarships. Choose the Board of Governors Bursary application.

Step V: Complete all the details of the online scholarship application.

Step VI: Send in the required student supporting documents, along with the application and submit it.

Applicants Deadline for 2026 is currently not available.

Additional queries or clarifications may be addressed to the following e-mail address

ucawards@ucalgary.ca

selection_process.description: After the submission of the application for the Calgary Board of Governors Bursary, applicants will be shortlisted by a panel of selectors at the University of Calgary.The applications will be judged on academic merit and financial need of the applicants. Recipient of the scholarship will be informed through email.
selection_process.html_content:
After the submission of the application for the Calgary Board of Governors Bursary, applicants will be shortlisted by a panel of selectors at the University of Calgary.

The applications will be judged on academic merit and financial need of the applicants. Recipient of the scholarship will be informed through email.

grant_details.description: Students registered under any faculty and pursuing the UG program at the University of Calgary are eligible for the Calgary Board of Governors Bursary.It is a form of financial assistance provided to all undergraduate students, domestic or international who have been admitted to the University of Calgary.The table below provides all the significant details regarding the University of Calgary Board of Governors Bursary:No.of bursaries awarded1Amount awarded3500 USDRenewabilityRenewed annuallyStudents who wish to pursuehigher education in Canadaat the University of Calgary should visit its official website for more information.
grant_details.html_content:
Students registered under any faculty and pursuing the UG program at the University of Calgary are eligible for the Calgary Board of Governors Bursary.

It is a form of financial assistance provided to all undergraduate students, domestic or international who have been admitted to the University of Calgary.

The table below provides all the significant details regarding the University of Calgary Board of Governors Bursary:

No.of bursaries awarded 1
Amount awarded 3500 USD
Renewability Renewed annually

Students who wish to pursue higher education in Canada at the University of Calgary should visit its official website for more information.

description:
The Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarship is offered to students from Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe. The scholarship program is applicable to those who wish to pursue their UG and PG studies in Germany.

Selections are based on two interview sessions conducted by the Foundation.  Application deadline for UG students varies; however, PG students can only apply before May 31.

eligibility_criteria.description: To qualify for the Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarship, applicants must fulfill eligibility criteria mentioned below:Must be from Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern EuropeExceptional academic recordsMust have social and political involvement.Pursuing a UG and PG program in a German universityFES supports almost all academic subjects allowing students from public/ state-approved universities and polytechnic or applied science colleges in Germany.The scholarship isNOTavailable for Second-degree courses, study visits outside Germany, and the final phase of studies and PG in medicine.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To qualify for the Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarship, applicants must fulfill eligibility criteria mentioned below:

  • Must be from Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe
  • Exceptional academic records
  • Must have social and political involvement.
  • Pursuing a UG and PG program in a German university
  • FES supports almost all academic subjects allowing students from public/ state-approved universities and polytechnic or applied science colleges in Germany.

The scholarship is NOT available for Second-degree courses, study visits outside Germany, and the final phase of studies and PG in medicine.

application_process.description: Applicants have to apply online for the Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarships. Applications should be received no later than :Diploma/magister/state examination:On completion of 6th semesterUndergraduate Programs: On completion of 3 semestersIf 6 semesters: By the end of the 3rd semesterIf 7 semesters: By the end of the 4th semesterPostgraduate Programs:On completion of 1st semesterWhile completing the form, they must provide proof ofGerman proficiency like C 1, TestDAF.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants have to apply online for the Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarships. Applications should be received no later than :

  • Diploma/magister/state examination: On completion of 6th semester
  • Undergraduate Programs: On completion of 3 semesters
    • If 6 semesters: By the end of the 3rd semester
    • If 7 semesters: By the end of the 4th semester
  • Postgraduate Programs: On completion of 1st semester

While completing the form, they must provide proof of German proficiency like C 1, TestDAF.

selection_process.description: Applications will be considered on the basis of academic excellence, financial need and social and political involvement in the young Democracy of the Weimar Republic.Selected candidates will have to go through two individual interviews.Interview Session I:Taken by one of the FES lecturers.Interview Session II:Taken by one of the members of the FES Scholarship Committee.Two reports will be generated based on these interviews and handed over to the AWA.The final decision will be taken by the AWA. The AWA is an independent body comprising of university lecturers and people from fields of science, politics, art, and media. Recipients will be notified by AWA and grants will be provided to them.
selection_process.html_content:
Applications will be considered on the basis of academic excellence, financial need and social and political involvement in the young Democracy of the Weimar Republic.

Selected candidates will have to go through two individual interviews.

  • Interview Session I: Taken by one of the FES lecturers.
  • Interview Session II: Taken by one of the members of the FES Scholarship Committee.

Two reports will be generated based on these interviews and handed over to the AWA.

The final decision will be taken by the AWA. The AWA is an independent body comprising of university lecturers and people from fields of science, politics, art, and media. Recipients will be notified by AWA and grants will be provided to them.

grant_details.description: The Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarships are awarded to students who show excellent academic performance and their social and political involvement. 40 scholarships are awarded to students from Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe admitted to German universities.Selected students will get a monthly scholarship and additional benefits that are given below:276 € for  family allowance, if applicablerefund of health care costsIncome exceeding 400 € monthly will be credited against the scholarship.The scholarship holders are expected to be involved in:Extra-curricular activities and seminars s of FES campus groups.Students should continue and intensify their socio-political commitment.At the end of each term, a report will be sent to FES which describes the scholar’s current academic performance and his/her social engagement.
grant_details.html_content:
The Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarships are awarded to students who show excellent academic performance and their social and political involvement. 40 scholarships are awarded to students from Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe admitted to German universities.

Selected students will get a monthly scholarship and additional benefits that are given below:

  • 276 € for  family allowance, if applicable
  • refund of health care costs
  • Income exceeding 400 € monthly will be credited against the scholarship.

The scholarship holders are expected to be involved in:

  • Extra-curricular activities and seminars s of FES campus groups.
  • Students should continue and intensify their socio-political commitment.

At the end of each term, a report will be sent to FES which describes the scholar’s current academic performance and his/her social engagement.

description:
Rhodes Scholarship, a fully-funded program, is intended for international students beginning PG programs at the University of Oxford. Recipients are provided with the scholarship for the duration of the Oxford postgraduate program.

The Rhodes Scholarship covers University of Oxford course fees, as well as providing an annual stipend. For the 2024/25 academic year, the stipend is £19,800 per annum (£1,650 per month) from which Scholars pay all living expenses, including accommodation.

eligibility_criteria.description: To secure benefits of the Rhodes Scholarship, applicants must beadmitted at the University of Oxford.Apart from that, applicants must fulfill the eligibility requirements listed below:Nationality:Citizen of a Rhodes eligible country such as India, Australia, Germany, Singapore, etc.Education:Completed education from your home country for at least 4 years in the last 10 years.For example, Indian applicants could have completed their 10/12th standard and/or UG program at anIndian university.Age:Between the age group of 19 to 25 years, at the time of the scholarship application.Academic Achievement:Completed or will complete the UG degree with first class.Candidates fulfilling these eligibility requirements will be considered for the Rhodes Scholarship India, Australia, etc.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To secure benefits of the Rhodes Scholarship, applicants must be admitted at the University of Oxford. Apart from that, applicants must fulfill the eligibility requirements listed below:

  • Nationality: Citizen of a Rhodes eligible country such as India, Australia, Germany, Singapore, etc.
  • Education: Completed education from your home country for at least 4 years in the last 10 years.
    • For example, Indian applicants could have completed their 10/12th standard and/or UG program at an Indian university.
  • Age: Between the age group of 19 to 25 years, at the time of the scholarship application.
  • Academic Achievement: Completed or will complete the UG degree with first class.

Candidates fulfilling these eligibility requirements will be considered for the Rhodes Scholarship India, Australia, etc.

application_process.description: Eligible students who want to receive a Rhodes Scholarship to study at the University of Oxford, one of thetop-ranking universities in the UK, have to apply online. The application process for the same is mentioned below:Register and Create an account on the website of Rhodes Trust.Complete the Rhodes Scholarship Application formSubmit personal details along with the list of required documents.Submit the application package before the deadline.Student Supporting Documentation forRhodes ScholarshipRhodes Scholarship applications should be submitted along with documents listed below:Personal statement of 1000 words focusing on why an applicant deserves the scholarship.Academic Transcripts from previous Institution (English translations, if required)Letters of Recommendation(list of referees along with relevant details)Valid Indian PassportUpdated Resume (not more than 2 pages)A valid photograph of the candidate in jpg format.IELTSorTOEFLscoreNote:Submit the application along with all the supporting documents before the Rhodes Scholarship application deadline.
application_process.html_content:
Eligible students who want to receive a Rhodes Scholarship to study at the University of Oxford, one of the top-ranking universities in the UK, have to apply online. The application process for the same is mentioned below:

  • Register and Create an account on the website of Rhodes Trust.
  • Complete the Rhodes Scholarship Application form
  • Submit personal details along with the list of required documents.
  • Submit the application package before the deadline.

Student Supporting Documentation for Rhodes Scholarship

Rhodes Scholarship applications should be submitted along with documents listed below:

  • Personal statement of 1000 words focusing on why an applicant deserves the scholarship.
  • Academic Transcripts from previous Institution (English translations, if required)
  • Letters of Recommendation (list of referees along with relevant details)
  • Valid Indian Passport
  • Updated Resume (not more than 2 pages)
  • A valid photograph of the candidate in jpg format.
  • IELTS or TOEFL score

Note: Submit the application along with all the supporting documents before the Rhodes Scholarship application deadline.

selection_process.description: The Rhodes Scholarship selection committee will evaluate the scholarship application form and student supporting documents (including attemptedexams to study in the UK) of each applicant. The selections are mainly based on the interview sessions. These will take place in different parts:Part IThe panel invites shortlisted candidates for two sessions which are conducted in a single day in Delhi.Session 1: Preliminary SessionSession 2: Personal InterviewEach candidate is required to attend both sessions. The committee will shortlist candidates and invite them for the next half of the Rhodes Scholarship selection process.Part IIShortlisted candidates will be invited tosocial engagementand afinal interviewwill be conducted by the committee. After this, the committee will make the final decision.Recipients will be informed of their selection via email. However, their Rhodes Scholarship will be confirmed only upon successful admission tothe University of OxfordNote:The candidate may be interviewed by video conference or telephone if not presented in India.
selection_process.html_content:
The Rhodes Scholarship selection committee will evaluate the scholarship application form and student supporting documents (including attempted exams to study in the UK) of each applicant. The selections are mainly based on the interview sessions. These will take place in different parts:

Part I 

The panel invites shortlisted candidates for two sessions which are conducted in a single day in Delhi.

  • Session 1: Preliminary Session
  • Session 2: Personal Interview

Each candidate is required to attend both sessions. The committee will shortlist candidates and invite them for the next half of the Rhodes Scholarship selection process.

Part II

Shortlisted candidates will be invited to social engagement and a final interview will be conducted by the committee. After this, the committee will make the final decision.

Recipients will be informed of their selection via email. However, their Rhodes Scholarship will be confirmed only upon successful admission to the University of Oxford

Note: The candidate may be interviewed by video conference or telephone if not presented in India.

description: 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars is presented to international freshmen at Eastern Michigan University(EMU). The scholarship is available for international students taking admissions in the fall semester.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students must meetadmission requirements at Eastern Michigan Universityto be eligible for the scholarship. Apart from this, students must meet the eligibility requirements listed below:Must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.75.minimum SAT score of 1030 or ACT score of 20.Only undergraduate freshmen are eligible for this scholarship.Opt to live on campus for four years during undergraduate study.Afford to pay  15,225USD for the first two years of study.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students must meet admission requirements at Eastern Michigan University to be eligible for the scholarship. Apart from this, students must meet the eligibility requirements listed below:

  • Must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.75.
  • minimum SAT score of 1030 or ACT score of 20.
  • Only undergraduate freshmen are eligible for this scholarship.
  • Opt to live on campus for four years during undergraduate study.
  • Afford to pay  15,225USD for the first two years of study.

application_process.description: The university does not require to submit any external application for the 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars.All the students who have successfully completed their first and second year in anyUG program at Eastern Michigan Universityare automatically considered.
application_process.html_content:
The university does not require to submit any external application for the 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars.

All the students who have successfully completed their first and second year in any UG program at Eastern Michigan University are automatically considered.

selection_process.description: The selection for the 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars is purely based on merit. EMU will review the profiles of all students and checks whether they qualify for the scholarship.If the student has a GPA of over 2.75 and an ACT score of 20 or an SAT score of 1030, he/ she is selected for the scholarship.Selected candidates will receive a 4WARD Graduation Scholarship award email in their admit packet.Selected students will receive a financial award letter via email after the selection.Once the scholarship is granted, students have to maintain passing grades (2.00) in at least 67% of credit hours to remain eligible for renewable of the scholarship.Note:Taking repeated classes or scoring F, W, I, N, NC grades makes a student ineligible for the further continuance of the scholarship.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection for the 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars is purely based on merit. EMU will review the profiles of all students and checks whether they qualify for the scholarship.

  • If the student has a GPA of over 2.75 and an ACT score of 20 or an SAT score of 1030, he/ she is selected for the scholarship.
  • Selected candidates will receive a 4WARD Graduation Scholarship award email in their admit packet.
  • Selected students will receive a financial award letter via email after the selection.
  • Once the scholarship is granted, students have to maintain passing grades (2.00) in at least 67% of credit hours to remain eligible for renewable of the scholarship.

Note: Taking repeated classes or scoring F, W, I, N, NC grades makes a student ineligible for the further continuance of the scholarship.

grant_details.description: EMU understandshow costly it is to study in the United States,hence provide a 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars to provide financial aid to students.The scholarship covers tuition fees for the last 2 years of UG study at the university.Students taking additional terms during summer have to pay tuition for the summer term separately on their own.Students can choose a suitable billing plan to pay the tuition fee for the first two years.The 4WARD Graduation Scholarship is a four-year program. Students taking more than four years to complete their graduation have to fund studies on their own after the fourth year.Terms and Conditions regarding ScholarshipStudents can receive other scholarships while continuing with the 4WARD Graduation Scholarship.However, the 4WARD Scholarship cannot be received along with other institutional aids including the EFOS scholarship, Emerald scholarship, housing grant or an athletic scholarship.The 4WARD Scholarship can be combined with external/ and government scholarship, study loans and aids.Students may also receive an endowed or departmental award along with 4WARD if it is not intended to pay tuition fees only.For information regarding the scholarship, the student may contact :Contact email:4WARD_Scholarship@emich.eduAddress:Eastern Michigan UniversityUndergraduate AdmissionsP.O. Box 921Ypsilanti, MI 48197
grant_details.html_content:
EMU understands how costly it is to study in the United States, hence provide a 4WARD Graduation Scholarship for International Scholars to provide financial aid to students.

  • The scholarship covers tuition fees for the last 2 years of UG study at the university.
  • Students taking additional terms during summer have to pay tuition for the summer term separately on their own.
  • Students can choose a suitable billing plan to pay the tuition fee for the first two years.

  • The 4WARD Graduation Scholarship is a four-year program. Students taking more than four years to complete their graduation have to fund studies on their own after the fourth year.

Terms and Conditions regarding Scholarship

  1. Students can receive other scholarships while continuing with the 4WARD Graduation Scholarship.
  2. However, the 4WARD Scholarship cannot be received along with other institutional aids including the EFOS scholarship, Emerald scholarship, housing grant or an athletic scholarship.
  3. The 4WARD Scholarship can be combined with external/ and government scholarship, study loans and aids.
  4. Students may also receive an endowed or departmental award along with 4WARD if it is not intended to pay tuition fees only.

For information regarding the scholarship, the student may contact :

Contact email: 4WARD_Scholarship@emich.edu

The selection process and post-award administration are carried out at the institutional level by Collegedunia.

Check the List of 1200+ Partner Universities

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
An eligible candidate for Collegedunia’s $150 Scholarship is the one who

  • is a citizen or a permanent resident of India;
  • has attempted TOEFL, PTE or IELTS test and obtained a minimum score of
    • 6.0 in IELTS
    • 80 in TOEFL-iBT

  • has achieved 55%+ marks in the last academic qualification (12th / bachelors/ diploma)
  • has applied for full-time admission to an eligible program (Diploma, Bachelors or Masters)

Applications must be made to COLLEGEDUNIA’s partner institutions in the USA, Canada, Australia or UK.

application_process.html_content:
Applying for the scholarship program is simple. All an applicant has to do is get his/her college application and visa application processed via Collegedunia.

All eligible students are automatically issued a scholarship eligibility certificate after the college application process has started.

Note: All the services provided by Collegedunia are totally free of cost for the students.

Notification of Awards

The award amount of $150 will be dispersed after 3 months of the course commencement date. It will be transferred to the student’s bank account.

To receive this scholarship award, a recipient should

  • present proof of enrollment i.e College ID card or mail from official ID.
  • be enrolled in the same course and institute as selected for at the time of visa application
  • provide a genuine 100+ word review about the course and institute he/she is enrolled in. Click here for the Review Form

description:
Center for Cyber Safety and Education offers (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships to female students pursuing degrees in the field of cybersecurity or information assurance. The scholarships are applicable across the globe in Canadian Universities, US Universities, Indian Universities, Australian Universities, U.K Universities, etc.

Some of the popular and high ranking universities offering programs in cybersecurity are John Hopkins University, Iowa State University, King’s College London, Macquarie University, etc.

APPLICATIONS ARE CLOSED FOR 2025

eligibility_criteria.description: The applicant must be a high school student, undergraduate student or graduate student to be eligible for the scholarship.To qualify for the (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships, applicants have to meet the eligibility criteria mentioned below:Pursuing or planning to pursue a degree with a focus oncybersecurityor information assurance.Applicable for full-time, part-time, or online programMinimum GPA of 3.3 on a 4.0 scale (or an analogous rank based on a comparable scale).Must be attending auniversity in the USor Internationally.Note: Applicants don't need to be currently enrolled, however, no awards will be disbursed until the recipient is enrolled in a college or university.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The applicant must be a high school student, undergraduate student or graduate student to be eligible for the scholarship.

To qualify for the (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships, applicants have to meet the eligibility criteria mentioned below:

  • Pursuing or planning to pursue a degree with a focus on cybersecurity or information assurance.
    • Applicable for full-time, part-time, or online program
  • Minimum GPA of 3.3 on a 4.0 scale (or an analogous rank based on a comparable scale).
  • Must be attending a university in the US or Internationally.

Note: Applicants don't need to be currently enrolled, however, no awards will be disbursed until the recipient is enrolled in a college or university.

application_process.description: Applicants of the (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships are required to complete the application form available on the official website of the Center for Cyber Safety and Education.Along with the form, applicants must submit the necessary student supporting documentation.Student supporting DocumentsUnofficial transcripts from current (or most recent) educational institutions.One Letter of Recommendation outlining:-How long have you known the applicant and in what capacity?Skills or abilities that the applicant has which will support her in completing a degreeOther information about the applicants' consideration?Resume/CV of (maximum 3 pages)TOEFLorIELTSscore (if applicable)Essay questions detailing about:Why an applicant deserves a Center for Cyber Safety and Education Scholarship.Need the scholarship, personal and educational backgroundsGoals for an academic career and in a professional career.Hobbies or extracurricular activities.Only those applications which are complete in all respects will be forwarded to the selection committee of (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants of the (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships are required to complete the application form available on the official website of the Center for Cyber Safety and Education.

Along with the form, applicants must submit the necessary student supporting documentation.

Student supporting Documents

  • Unofficial transcripts from current (or most recent) educational institutions.
  • One Letter of Recommendation outlining:-
    • How long have you known the applicant and in what capacity?
    • Skills or abilities that the applicant has which will support her in completing a degree
    • Other information about the applicants' consideration?
  • Resume/CV of (maximum 3 pages)
  • TOEFL or IELTS score (if applicable)
  • Essay questions detailing about:
    • Why an applicant deserves a Center for Cyber Safety and Education Scholarship.
    • Need the scholarship, personal and educational backgrounds
    • Goals for an academic career and in a professional career.
    • Hobbies or extracurricular activities.

Only those applications which are complete in all respects will be forwarded to the selection committee of (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships.

selection_process.description: For the selection process of (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships,academic referencesare preferred.Applicants will be given scores by members of (ISC)² and scholarship sponsors (if applicable). Scoring of the applicants will be based upon the following criteria:Passion:-passion for the field of cybersecurity and information technologyMerit:-academic performance and extracurricular activities of studentsFinancial Need:-Applicants must demonstrate the financial need for the scholarship.Apart from this, the committee might consider the exam scores submitted tostudy abroad.
selection_process.html_content:
For the selection process of (ISC)² Women’s Cybersecurity Scholarships, academic references are preferred.

Applicants will be given scores by members of (ISC)² and scholarship sponsors (if applicable). Scoring of the applicants will be based upon the following criteria:

  • Passion:- passion for the field of cybersecurity and information technology
  • Merit:- academic performance and extracurricular activities of students
  • Financial Need:- Applicants must demonstrate the financial need for the scholarship.

Apart from this, the committee might consider the exam scores submitted to study abroad.

description:
German Chancellor Fellowship is an opportunity for selected students to work on their research projects and contribute towards the development of society and their countries. Eligible students get a chance to conduct research with a host university in Germany and execute their area of expertise.

Want to know the benefits of the German Chancellor Fellowship? Click Here.

eligibility_criteria.description: Eigibility Criteria for ApplicantsThe German Chancellor Fellowship programme finances people from any industry, as long as they have a desire towork on a self-sustaining projecttogether with a host they want in Germany. However, there are certain eligibility criteria to get selected for the fellowship. We’ve made a tally for your help here:Eligible Nationalities:India, China, Brazil, Russia, South Africa or the USA.Academic Interest:Work in a field such as politics, media, business, society, culture or administration.Academic Qualification:Undergraduate degree in a relevant academic field.Experience & Skills:Demonstration of leadership in some capacity.Language Requirements:English or/ and German language proficiency.Check:Language scores to study in Germany.Note:For the last few years, 25-30% of the applicants have received the fellowships.Eligibility for German Chancellor Fellowship HostSomeone who works in a private or public sector in Germany can help as a German chancellor fellowship host. Some other requirements for the Host are:Host institution or the advisor need to accept the fellows withtravel and accommodation facilities in Germany.A host needs to confirm that the applicant receives a recommendation letter for their application.Host needs to provide the applicant with a well-deserved position.In return, the host will become a part of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation and will be able to avail the advantages of the sponsorship even after the end of that particular project.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Eigibility Criteria for Applicants

The German Chancellor Fellowship programme finances people from any industry, as long as they have a desire to work on a self-sustaining project together with a host they want in Germany. However, there are certain eligibility criteria to get selected for the fellowship. We’ve made a tally for your help here:

  • Eligible Nationalities: India, China, Brazil, Russia, South Africa or the USA.
  • Academic Interest: Work in a field such as politics, media, business, society, culture or administration.
  • Academic Qualification: Undergraduate degree in a relevant academic field.
  • Experience & Skills: Demonstration of leadership in some capacity.
  • Language Requirements: English or/ and German language proficiency. Check: Language scores to study in Germany.

Note: For the last few years, 25-30% of the applicants have received the fellowships.

Eligibility for German Chancellor Fellowship Host

Someone who works in a private or public sector in Germany can help as a German chancellor fellowship host. Some other requirements for the Host are:

  • Host institution or the advisor need to accept the fellows with travel and accommodation facilities in Germany.
  • A host needs to confirm that the applicant receives a recommendation letter for their application.
  • Host needs to provide the applicant with a well-deserved position.
  • In return, the host will become a part of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation and will be able to avail the advantages of the sponsorship even after the end of that particular project.

application_process.description: The application timeline for the German Chancellor Fellowship isMarch 15 to October 15of every year. Candidates who establish their eligibility must apply for the fellowship within this period only. The candidate must submit the necessary documents for the application online to the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation only.Documents RequiredLetter of Motivation: In this letter, the applicant needs to describe what kind of leadership experience they have, what motivates them and what are their future plans and goals.Plan of Project: The applicant has to make a structure of the project that they have discussed with their host before applying. They will have to define the pros of their project. application_process.html_content:
The application timeline for the German Chancellor Fellowship is March 15 to October 15 of every year. Candidates who establish their eligibility must apply for the fellowship within this period only. The candidate must submit the necessary documents for the application online to the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation only.

Documents Required

  • Letter of Motivation: In this letter, the applicant needs to describe what kind of leadership experience they have, what motivates them and what are their future plans and goals. 
  • Plan of Project: The applicant has to make a structure of the project that they have discussed with their host before applying. They will have to define the pros of their project. They will also have to explain what are their plans to make a connection between their home country and Germany in the future.
  • Extensive Statement: A statement needs to be provided where the host from Germany has agreed to mentor the candidate.
  • Letter of Recommendation: At least 2 letters of recommendation are required from individuals that give clear information about their academic, personal and professional background.

Wondering where to submit documents? The online application for German Chancellor Fellowship will include where the applicants can upload the statement and recommendation letters. While applicants are required to submit the statement themselves, they must forward the link to their respective referees for recommendations. A confirmation mail is sent once all the asked documents are received by the authorities.

selection_process.description: Since the deadline for the German Chancellor Fellowship is October 15, the applications are evaluated post that. The selection process is coducted inApril(of the following year) and take place intwo rounds: Shortlisting of Candidates (based on documents) and Interview of shortlisted candidates. The details of both the rounds are mentioned below:Round I:Shortlisting takes place primarily on the basis of theiracademic merit. Other factors taken into account while selecting recipients are:Knowledge and potential to successfully complete the ongoing research project.Leadership skills and prior professional/field experiencePotential to promote connections between Germany and (applicant’s) origin country.Round II:Shortlisted candidates are invited for an interview session in their respective countries. The interview comprises a group discussion and a personal interview. While theGD roundfocuses on the general topics, thePI roundfocuses on the applicant’s personality, knowledge and approach towards their respective research projects.
selection_process.html_content:
Since the deadline for the German Chancellor Fellowship is October 15, the applications are evaluated post that. The selection process is coducted in April (of the following year) and take place in two rounds: Shortlisting of Candidates (based on documents) and Interview of shortlisted candidates. The details of both the rounds are mentioned below:

Round I:

Shortlisting takes place primarily on the basis of their academic merit. Other factors taken into account while selecting recipients are:

  • Knowledge and potential to successfully complete the ongoing research project.
  • Leadership skills and prior professional/field experience
  • Potential to promote connections between Germany and (applicant’s) origin country.

Round II:

Shortlisted candidates are invited for an interview session in their respective countries. The interview comprises a group discussion and a personal interview. While the GD round focuses on the general topics, the PI round focuses on the applicant’s personality, knowledge and approach towards their respective research projects.

grant_details.html_content:
German Chancellor Fellowship Benefits

Unlike most of the scholarships in Germany for international students, the German Chancellor Fellowship allows the applicant to visit Germany for 1 year and implement their self-developed project idea. Here’s a glance at the offerings of the project:

  • Fellowship Grant: 2,200 EUR, 2,500 EUR or 2,700 EUR per month, based on the level of career and training.
  • German Language Course: An intensive language course and funding for German courses during the fellowship.
  • Accommodation Expenses: Finances for the applicant’s stay in Germany. 
  • Family Allowance (per month): Funding for a family of up to
    • EUR 346 for spouse
    • EUR 289 for the stay of their child.
  • Europe allowance is offered if a stay is required at an institute in another European country for 1 or 2 months, if required for the success of the project they are working on. Not applicable for home visit.
  • Work Study Tour: An excellent opportunity to meet German organisations of business by taking part in a 2-week study tour through Germany.
  • Sponsorship of extensive alumni will be provided to strengthen the bond of the applicant with their host institute in Germany throughout their whole professional career.

Due to the abundance of all the resources along with working in a profitable environment, the German Chancellor Fellowship stands with glory as a boon for the bright international aspirants.

FAQs

Ques. Can I get the fellowship before the completion of Bachelor's (or equivalent) degree?

Ans: You can apply only if the date of your Graduation is before October 01 of the year of application.

Ques. I have previously spent time in Germany, can I apply for this fellowship?

Ans: Only if you have been to Germany for less than 6 months at the time of the application deadline (October 15). If you are staying in another country for a longer period of time and belong to the eligible countries.

Ques. If I have a degree in English or German at the university level, do I need to appear for the language tests?

Ans: If your expertise is documented in your certificate, then you do not have to appear for the exams.

Ques. What are the advantages of networking with German Chancellor fellows?

Ans: The advantages of creating a network with the fellows from the same year group are:

  • Participation in networking activities providing the candidate to organize small network designs with peer groups.
  • The applicant will be able to participate in joint events of personal and professional exchange of culture with their fellow applicants.
  • This will also boost their acclimatization with the German culture as well and will open the route towards working in Germany for the long term.
  • Expenses of travel and total cost of private health insurance are provided.

description:
Chancellor’s Masters Scholarships are presented to students who want to pursue their master’s studies at the University of Sussex.  Both domestic and international students at the University of Sussex are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

A separate application form must be completed on the official website of the university to be considered for the Chancellor's Masters Scholarships. The application deadline for the same is 1 August 2025.

eligibility_criteria.description: Students who wish to obtain Chancellor's Masters Scholarships must fulfill eligibility requirements given below:Must hold or achieve a First class Bachelor’s degree from one of theUK Universities.Must have applied for the full-time master’s program at the University of Sussex.However, students who will pursue the following courses are not eligible for the scholarship.Postgraduate diplomas (including CPE Common Professional Examination)Corruption, Law and Governance LLM (delivered in Qatar)Development Studies MAGlobalization, Business and Development MAGovernance, Development and Public Policy MAPower, Participation and Social Change MAPoverty and Development MAMasters degrees in Social Work (if receiving an NHS bursary)PGCE coursesEarly Years in Education MASchools Direct teaching courseAny Masters funded by the research councils (e.g. those receiving ESRC 1+3 funding)
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students who wish to obtain Chancellor's Masters Scholarships must fulfill eligibility requirements given below:

  • Must hold or achieve a First class Bachelor’s degree from one of the UK Universities.
  • Must have applied for the full-time master’s program at the University of Sussex.

However, students who will pursue the following courses are not eligible for the scholarship.

  • Postgraduate diplomas (including CPE Common Professional Examination)
  • Corruption, Law and Governance LLM (delivered in Qatar)
  • Development Studies MA
  • Globalization, Business and Development MA
  • Governance, Development and Public Policy MA
  • Power, Participation and Social Change MA
  • Poverty and Development MA
  • Masters degrees in Social Work (if receiving an NHS bursary)
  • PGCE courses
  • Early Years in Education MA
  • Schools Direct teaching course
  • Any Masters funded by the research councils (e.g. those receiving ESRC 1+3 funding)

application_process.description: Applicants must have secured haveadmission at the University of Sussexto be eligible for the scholarship. An external application form has to be completed by the applicants to secure the Chancellor's Masters Scholarships.They must apply on the official link to the University of Sussex website. Complete the application form with all required information and documents.Applications must be completed before 1 August 2025, to be considered for the scholarships.
application_process.html_content:
Applicants must have secured have admission at the University of Sussex to be eligible for the scholarship. An external application form has to be completed by the applicants to secure the Chancellor's Masters Scholarships.

They must apply on the official link to the University of Sussex website. Complete the application form with all required information and documents.

Applications must be completed before 1 August 2025, to be considered for the scholarships.

selection_process.description: The selection process for the scholarship is completely based on the fulfillment of the student’s eligibility criteria and academics.Priority will be given to those students who have not completed their post-graduation earlier.Applicants will be notified about the outcome of their scholarship application by email.Recipients of the Chancellor's Masters Scholarships will get an award of £3,000 for UK students and £5,000 for international students that can be used against tuition fees.
selection_process.html_content:
The selection process for the scholarship is completely based on the fulfillment of the student’s eligibility criteria and academics.

  • Priority will be given to those students who have not completed their post-graduation earlier.
  • Applicants will be notified about the outcome of their scholarship application by email.

Recipients of the Chancellor's Masters Scholarships will get an award of £3,000 for UK students and £5,000 for international students that can be used against tuition fees.

grant_details.description: Chancellor's Masters Scholarships are offered to students who are enrolled in theMaster's Program at the University of Sussex.The scholarship amount of £3,000 will help students in the reduction of their tuition fees. Only 100 scholarships are available, students are advised to apply at the earliest.Terms and Conditions for the Chancellor's Masters ScholarshipsStudents holding any other scholarship, cannot apply for this scholarship.Students who have studied in the UK university campus or Partner College are not eligible.Furthermore, if students have any query related to scholarship then they can simply send an email atscholarships@sussex.ac.uk
grant_details.html_content:
Chancellor's Masters Scholarships are offered to students who are enrolled in the Master's Program at the University of Sussex.

The scholarship amount of £3,000 will help students in the reduction of their tuition fees. Only 100 scholarships are available, students are advised to apply at the earliest.

Terms and Conditions for the Chancellor's Masters Scholarships

  • Students holding any other scholarship, cannot apply for this scholarship.
  • Students who have studied in the UK university campus or Partner College are not eligible.

Furthermore, if students have any query related to scholarship then they can simply send an email at scholarships@sussex.ac.uk

description:
The Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship is offered by the University of Calgary to continuing UG students.

Students must submit an external application by May 01 to be considered for the Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship.

Document Deadline: May 10,2026

eligibility_criteria.description: To be eligible for Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:Must entering 3rd/4th year of the degree at theUniversity of Calgary.Intend to pursue a vocation in the Petroleum IndustryCompletion of a minimum of 24 units of academic course work along with minimum GPA of 3.2
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:

  • Must entering 3rd/4th year of the degree at the University of Calgary. 
  • Intend to pursue a vocation in the Petroleum Industry 
  • Completion of a minimum of 24 units of academic course work along with minimum GPA of 3.2

application_process.description: Students who want to secure Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship have to apply online for the scholarship. The step-by-step process to apply for the scholarship is mentioned below :Step I: Access Student Centre in myUofC portal available at the University of Calgary Official website.Step II:In the Student Centre section, click on the "My Financials" page.Step III:Click on the Awards & Scholarships section, and click on "Apply for Undergraduate Award"s.Step IV:A pop-up window will open on the screen with a number of applications for the different scholarships. Apply for Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship.Step V:Complete all the details required and supporting documents, and submit it.Applicants must submit scholarship applications before May  01, 2026, to be considered for the selection.This award is merit and financial-based so, the financial need should be clearly demonstrated on the application.
application_process.html_content:
Students who want to secure Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship have to apply online for the scholarship. The step-by-step process to apply for the scholarship is mentioned below :

Step I: Access Student Centre in myUofC portal available at the University of Calgary Official website.

Step II: In the Student Centre section, click on the "My Financials" page.

Step III: Click on the Awards & Scholarships section, and click on "Apply for Undergraduate Award"s.

Step IV: A pop-up window will open on the screen with a number of applications for the different scholarships. Apply for Archibald Wayne Dingman Memorial Scholarship.

Step V: Complete all the details required and supporting documents, and submit it.

Applicants must submit scholarship applications before May  01, 2026, to be considered for the selection.

This award is merit and financial-based so, the financial need should be clearly demonstrated on the application.

selection_process.description: The University of Calgary grants 3 scholarships to the students on the merit-basis and their GPA in undergraduate.Applications will be reviewed by a selection panel of the University of Calgary. The selection will be based on the following factors:Academic MeritFinancial NeedAdditionally, preference will be given to those who want to pursue a vocation in the petroleum industry can also increase their chances by demonstrating or mentioning the same in their application.After evaluating students on the above-mentioned factors Archibald Waynne Dingman Memorial Scholarship is offered to three selected students.
selection_process.html_content:
The University of Calgary grants 3 scholarships to the students on the merit-basis and their GPA in undergraduate.

Applications will be reviewed by a selection panel of the University of Calgary. The selection will be based on the following factors:

  1. Academic Merit
  2. Financial Need

Additionally, preference will be given to those who want to pursue a vocation in the petroleum industry can also increase their chances by demonstrating or mentioning the same in their application.

After evaluating students on the above-mentioned factors Archibald Waynne Dingman Memorial Scholarship is offered to three selected students.

grant_details.html_content:
Archibald Waynne Dingman Memorial Scholarship is offered to meritorious students at the University of Calgary. Students entering 3rd and 4th year of UG degree are eligible.

  • A separate application form has to complete by the students.

International Students who wish to pursue higher education in Canada at the University of Calgary must visit its official website for further information.

description:
Clarendon Scholarships, awarded by the University of Oxford, is a fully-funded program that supports up to 200 graduate students from all over the world. The scholarship program covers each recipient’s tuition fees as well as living expenses and stay in the UK.

The scholarship amount varies for full-time and part-time program students. Full-time program recipients will receive at least GBP 18,000 (21.05 lakhs INR).

All successful Clarendon candidates will be contacted via email. Most offers are sent out by the end of April of each year.

eligibility_criteria.description: TheUniversity of Oxforddoes have any specific eligibility requirements for the Clarendon Scholarship. All students who apply for Oxford’s Master’s and DPhil degree in any study field are eligible to receive the scholarship.Candidate must be applying for a full-time or part-time degree program.Admission applications must be submitted before the relevant January deadline.Minimum GPA score of 3.7 out of 4.0.Oxford students who are currently studying a master’s degree at the university and plan to re-apply for DPhil are also eligible for the scholarship program.
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The University of Oxford does have any specific eligibility requirements for the Clarendon Scholarship. All students who apply for Oxford’s Master’s and DPhil degree in any study field are eligible to receive the scholarship.

  • Candidate must be applying for a full-time or part-time degree program.
  • Admission applications must be submitted before the relevant January deadline.
  • Minimum GPA score of 3.7 out of 4.0.

Oxford students who are currently studying a master’s degree at the university and plan to re-apply for DPhil are also eligible for the scholarship program.

application_process.description: Apply to your course by theDecember or January deadline, whichever is relevant to yourcourse, to be considered for a Clarendon scholarship. There is no scholarship application - all applicants to degree-bearing courses are considered.Students from all academic fields are considered for Clarendon Scholarships.
application_process.html_content:
Apply to your course by the December or January deadline, whichever is relevant to your course, to be considered for a Clarendon scholarship. There is no scholarship application - all applicants to degree-bearing courses are considered. 

Students from all academic fields are considered for Clarendon Scholarships.

selection_process.description: While selections are mainly based on the academic merit and potential of the applicants, the criteria slightly vary depending on the subject area. Applications are assessed on the following factors:Academic Score:It is essential to have a first-class honors degree or its equivalent. A GPA of 3.7 or higher on the scale of 4.0 is recommended.Future Potential and Aptitude:Review of references and research proposal helps in determining an applicant’s contribution to the field of study.Student Motivation:Applicant’s commitment towards the desired course as stated in the personal statement and evaluation of the referee reports.
selection_process.html_content:
While selections are mainly based on the academic merit and potential of the applicants, the criteria slightly vary depending on the subject area. Applications are assessed on the following factors:

  • Academic Score: It is essential to have a first-class honors degree or its equivalent. A GPA of 3.7 or higher on the scale of 4.0 is recommended.
  • Future Potential and Aptitude: Review of references and research proposal helps in determining an applicant’s contribution to the field of study.
  • Student Motivation: Applicant’s commitment towards the desired course as stated in the personal statement and evaluation of the referee reports.

grant_details.description: Clarendon Scholarships aim to reduce the financial barriers that come in the way of the students coming to Oxford for their study. Some of the benefits of Claredon Scholarships are mentioned in the following table:RewardFull-tuition feesApplicable forFull-time Master’s & DPhilAcademic SubjectsAll streamsStudents are recommended to have high academic achievements and exemplary student profile, in order to increase their chances of receiving the scholarship. The scholarship nomination decision is in the hands of the faculty of the chosen study field.
grant_details.html_content:
Clarendon Scholarships aim to reduce the financial barriers that come in the way of the students coming to Oxford for their study. Some of the benefits of Claredon Scholarships are mentioned in the following table:

Reward Full-tuition fees
Applicable for Full-time Master’s & DPhil
Academic Subjects All streams

Students are recommended to have high academic achievements and exemplary student profile, in order to increase their chances of receiving the scholarship. The scholarship nomination decision is in the hands of the faculty of the chosen study field.

scholarship_name: Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management
description:
Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management is offered to students who wish to pursue higher education in the field of statistics.

Students pursuing a master’s degree or higher degree from one of the US or Canadian universities with a concentration in applied statistics and quality management are eligible.

Up to 2 awards of $7500 are given in each of two categories:

The courses of applied statistics and quality management include theory and application in the following areas:

External application along with required documents should have been sent via post no later than May 01, 2026. Selection is based on academic achievement, participation in campus activities and LOR(S).

eligibility_criteria.description: Students who wish to secure the Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management must fulfill eligibility requirements given below:Either enrolled or are planning to take admission in masters or doctorate program in any Canadian orUS Universities.Must study in the field of statistics and quality managementMust have GPA scores of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 point scale or an equivalent score in any field of UG level.Students are considered ineligible for the scholarship if :Enrolled in online programs.Are relatives of the Governing Board or ASQ Statistics Division Council members.Previous award winners
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Students who wish to secure the Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management must fulfill eligibility requirements given below:

  • Either enrolled or are planning to take admission in masters or doctorate program in any Canadian or US Universities.
  • Must study in the field of statistics and quality management
  • Must have GPA scores of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 point scale or an equivalent score in any field of UG level.

Students are considered ineligible for the scholarship if :

  1. Enrolled in online programs.
  2. Are relatives of the Governing Board or ASQ Statistics Division Council members.
  3. Previous award winners

application_process.description: Students who want to secure the Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management have to complete the application form.Along with application form, students must submit documents listed below:CVLOR from college professors.Academic TranscriptsEssay describing the career goals, educational qualifications, and reasons for seeking the scholarship. It should not be longer than one page, minimum size 10 point type.The complete application form must be sent to the address mentioned below no later than May 01:AddressDr. Lynne B. Hare Kraft Foods,Research -East 200 DeForest Avenue East Hanover, NJ 07936-1944.Strong LOR increases the chances of selection for the scholarship. The governing Board considers it seriously while reviewing the application of students.Note:LOR should also include comments on all-round abilities of a student with special emphasis on leadership quality in the field of applied statistics and quality management and comments on the education qualification of the students.
application_process.html_content:
Students who want to secure the Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management have to complete the application form.

Along with application form, students must submit documents listed below:

  • CV
  • LOR from college professors.
  • Academic Transcripts
  • Essay describing the career goals, educational qualifications, and reasons for seeking the scholarship. It should not be longer than one page, minimum size 10 point type.

The complete application form must be sent to the address mentioned below no later than May 01:

Address

Dr. Lynne B. Hare Kraft Foods,

Research -East 200 DeForest Avenue East Hanover, NJ 07936-1944.

Strong LOR increases the chances of selection for the scholarship. The governing Board considers it seriously while reviewing the application of students.

Note: LOR should also include comments on all-round abilities of a student with special emphasis on leadership quality in the field of applied statistics and quality management and comments on the education qualification of the students.

selection_process.description: Applications of students are reviewed by the Scholarship Governing Board for the selection of students. The following factors are considered while selecting the candidates:Academic achievement, including honors courses.Career objectives of the student.Faculty recommendations.Credit is given to Industrial exposure including part-time work and internships undertaken by the student.
selection_process.html_content:
Applications of students are reviewed by the Scholarship Governing Board for the selection of students. The following factors are considered while selecting the candidates:

  • Academic achievement, including honors courses.
  • Career objectives of the student.
  • Faculty recommendations.
  • Credit is given to Industrial exposure including part-time work and internships undertaken by the student.

grant_details.description: Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management is granted by the Statistics Division of the American Society for Quality.The ASQ statistics division aims at promoting statistical thinking amongst students for quality and productivity improvement.Annually the scholarships are awarded to two meritorious students.Applications accepted January 1st to May 1st for the next academic year.
grant_details.html_content:
Ellis R. Ott Scholarship for Applied Statistics and Quality Management is granted by the Statistics Division of the American Society for Quality.

The ASQ statistics division aims at promoting statistical thinking amongst students for quality and productivity improvement.

Annually the scholarships are awarded to two meritorious students.

Applications accepted January 1st to May 1st for the next academic year.

description:
The Chevening Scholarships is an award that covers all expenses for international students pursuing a 1-year master’s degree in the UK. Fully funded by the Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), the Chevening UK Scholarship supports students from over 160 eligible countries. It is awarded to talented professionals showing leadership and exceptional performance in their respective fields.

Applications for the Chevening Scholarships was opened on 5 August 2025 and closes on 7 October 2025. The selection process includes eligibility checks, reading committee assessments, interviews, and final offers by June 2026. Applicants must meet both academic and professional eligibility criteria to be considered for the Chevening Scholarship. This includes an undergraduate degree, 2 years of work experience, and an unconditional offer from a UK university.

eligibility_criteria.description: Chevening Scholarships are provided on the conditions that you meet the following eligibility requirements:Be a citizen of a Chevening-eligible country or territory:Only applicants from countries or territories approved by Chevening such as India, Bangladesh,Canada are eligible to apply.Commit to returning to your home country for at least 2 years after your scholarship ends:This ensures that scholars use their UK-acquired knowledge and skills to contribute to their home country.Have at least 2,800 hours of work experience:Equivalent to around 2 years of full-time work, this can include full-time or part-time jobs, internships (paid or unpaid), and voluntary work, completed after undergraduate studies.Hold an undergraduate degree that qualifies you for a UK master’s programme:You must have completed your degree at least 2 years before the Chevening application deadline.Apply to 3 different eligible UK university courses:You must apply to 3 eligible master’s programs and receive an unconditional offer from at least one before the Chevening document deadline.You are not eligible to apply if:you have received any UK Government-funded scholarship, including Chevening, in the past 5 years. Also,You must not be currently or recently (within the last 2 years) employed by His Majesty’s Government, British embassies or high commissions, the British Council, UK universities, or affiliated organizations.Also checkTop Universities in UK
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Chevening Scholarships are provided on the conditions that you meet the following eligibility requirements:

  • Be a citizen of a Chevening-eligible country or territory:Only applicants from countries or territories approved by Chevening such as India, Bangladesh,Canada are eligible to apply.
  • Commit to returning to your home country for at least 2 years after your scholarship ends: This ensures that scholars use their UK-acquired knowledge and skills to contribute to their home country.
  • Have at least 2,800 hours of work experience: Equivalent to around 2 years of full-time work, this can include full-time or part-time jobs, internships (paid or unpaid), and voluntary work, completed after undergraduate studies.
  • Hold an undergraduate degree that qualifies you for a UK master’s programme:You must have completed your degree at least 2 years before the Chevening application deadline.
  • Apply to 3 different eligible UK university courses: You must apply to 3 eligible master’s programs and receive an unconditional offer from at least one before the Chevening document deadline.
  • You are not eligible to apply if: you have received any UK Government-funded scholarship, including Chevening, in the past 5 years. Also,You must not be currently or recently (within the last 2 years) employed by His Majesty’s Government, British embassies or high commissions, the British Council, UK universities, or affiliated organizations.

Also check Top Universities in UK

By end of interview period References must be uploaded by shortlisted candidates
Mid-June 2026 Final interview results announced
9 July 2026 Deadline to submit at least one unconditional UK university offer
September/October 2026 Chevening scholars begin their studies in the UK


Check Out: How to Apply to UK Universities?
