selection_process.html_content:
Once the applicants have submitted their scholarship application, it goes on for review. The applications are reviewed thoroughly and strictly. Thus, it is highly competitive. The process of selecting Chevening Scholars takes at least 8 months from the application deadline.Chevening scholars are selected based on a combination of strong leadership and networking potential, relevant work experience, high-quality references, and a compelling application. The different stages of review are:

Initial Screening: Applications are first checked for plagiarism and reviewed to ensure they meet Chevening’s basic eligibility criteria.

Reading Committee Review: Independent panels assess each application based on how well the applicant aligns with Chevening’s goals, FCDO objectives, and regional priorities.

Embassy/High Commission Interview: Shortlisted candidates are interviewed by British embassies or high commissions, which make the final selection decisions.

Chevening Scholarship Interview

Applicants will be notified for an interview if their application is shortlisted.The first, and most crucial thing to do upon receiving an invitation to interview is to book your interview slot.Before the interview, applicants must complete the following steps in the Chevening online application system:

  • Upload a scanned copy of your photo ID for identity and citizenship verification
  • Upload your undergraduate education certificate or documentation.
  • Upload 2 reference letters or have them submitted directly to your local Chevening team.
  • Failure to submit all required documents by the end of the interview period will result in disqualification, regardless of interview performance.

Reference Guide

Reference letters are a crucial part of the Chevening scholarship requirements. They must:

  • Be written in English (translations must be notarized)
  • Be addressed to the British embassy or high commission
  • Include the referee’s contact details (address, email, and phone)
  • Mention:
    • How long the referee has known the applicant
    • The capacity in which they know the applicant
    • Date of last regular contact
    • An endorsement of the applicant’s leadership, networking skills, and academic readiness

Referees can either send the letters directly to the local Chevening team or return them to the applicant for uploading.

With a clear application timeline and well-defined eligibility criteria, it remains one of the most accessible and structured international scholarships available to students from Chevening-eligible countries.
grant_details.html_content:
The Chevening Scholarship is a fully-funded, prestigious UK government scholarship that enables talented international students to pursue a one-year master’s degree at any UK university. It is designed to support future leaders, decision-makers, and influencers from Chevening-eligible countries.

This grant allows recipients to focus entirely on their academic and professional development, while experiencing the UK’s cultural diversity and building global networks. In addition to the scholarship, Chevening also offers several fellowships, all supported by the UK government and the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO).

Chevening Scholarship Benefits Summary

Particulars

Details

Applicable For

All one-year master's programs at UK universities

Eligible Candidates

International students from Chevening-eligible countries

Reward

Fully funded (tuition fee, monthly stipend, travel costs, visa, etc.)

Award Duration

1 year

Funding Body

UK Government – Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

Additional Opportunities

Access to exclusive events, workshops, and the global Chevening alumni network

The goal of this scholarship is to build lasting relationships, advance professional growth, and empower changemakers to return and contribute to their home countries.

Also Check: Study in UK

The Chevening Scholarship provides full financial support for a one-year master’s degree in the UK, along with access to a global network. With a clear application timeline and well-defined eligibility criteria, it remains one of the most accessible and structured international scholarships available to students from Chevening-eligible countries.

description:
Forte Fellowship Program intends to female students enrolled in an MBA program at an international university. This MBA Fellowship is applicable for all MBA formats- Full-time, Part-time, and Executive.

No restrictions at applying for the programs at different schools at the same time or more than once at the same school.

eligibility_criteria.description: Leadership skills in different fields such as academics, community, and creative leadership are the undeniable requirements for getting Forte Fellowships for Women.Some of the core and measurable eligibility requirements for Forte scholarship program are:Student Type:Female studentsAcademic Requirements: Minimum GPA of 3.6 (or 75%) in UG studiesExam Requirements:Exam NameMinimum RequirementsIELTS6.5PTE62GMAT697
eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Leadership skills in different fields such as academics, community, and creative leadership are the undeniable requirements for getting Forte Fellowships for Women.

Some of the core and measurable eligibility requirements for Forte scholarship program are:

  • Student Type: Female students
  • Academic Requirements: Minimum GPA of 3.6 (or 75%) in UG studies
  • Exam Requirements:
Exam Name Minimum Requirements
IELTS 6.5
PTE 62
GMAT 697

application_process.description: Applicants need not submit any external application form for Forte Fellowship. All the full-time MBA students who fulfill the Fellowship eligibility criteria will be automatically considered for the program.However, applicants must ensure that they provide the following documents at the time of admission to their chosen US, Canada,UK university.Letters of recommendationAcademic transcriptsStatement of purposeWork experienceUpdated resumeStandardized test scores
application_process.html_content:
Applicants need not submit any external application form for Forte Fellowship. All the full-time MBA students who fulfill the Fellowship eligibility criteria will be automatically considered for the program.

However, applicants must ensure that they provide the following documents at the time of admission to their chosen US, Canada, UK university.

  • Letters of recommendation
  • Academic transcripts
  • Statement of purpose
  • Work experience
  • Updated resume
  • Standardized test scores

selection_process.description: Applicants are automatically sorted out on the basis of their profiles and skills for the fellowship. Theiracademicandbehavioral qualitiesare kept in mind while selecting them for the scholarship.The Forte Fellowship selection process is conducted by each participating UK university.
selection_process.html_content:
Applicants are automatically sorted out on the basis of their profiles and skills for the fellowship. Their academic and behavioral qualities are kept in mind while selecting them for the scholarship.

The Forte Fellowship selection process is conducted by each participating UK university.

grant_details.html_content:
Forte MBA Fellowships are offered female international students enrolled in an MBA program in a university abroad. Checklist to avail this grant has been tabulated below:

Applicable for Only MBA program
Number of Participating Universities 54
Fellowship Amount £25,000 per scholarship
Eligibility GPA of 3.6+ in UG; GMAT, IELTS/PTE
Application Form No separate application
Selection Criteria Leadership skills, Academic performance

Benefits of Forte Fellowships

In addition to the benefits of the Forte Fellowship, the recipients are provided with other Forte benefits, such as

  • Free lifetime premium access pass to Forte which costs $50 per annum.
  • Exclusive access to the Forte Corporate Recruiter List.
    • Special invitations to job openings and leadership programs at Forte corporate sponsor companies.
  • Access to Forte Fellow LinkedIn group and Facebook groups offering face value over social media platforms.
  • Leadership development opportunities via the student’s role in planning their school’s Forte outreach program to UG women to integrate as many people in the community as possible.
  • Participation in the Forte MBA Women Leadership Conferences and the financial service FAST track conference.
  • Special e-introductions to Forte sponsor companies and inclusion in the Fellow resume book, which is distributed to all sponsor companies.

All these benefits are great ways to attract more and more women toward the blooming world of business and resources and for them to educate themselves without paying completely for their specified courses.
